column5: Very good ,tried some time ago...didn’t expect the slight cocoa overtones..perhaps why didn’t just die for it.....but overall a very not bad beer.
Lactic and creammy with a very clean plate and no astringency. Reminds of malted mild balls candy. Nice cocoa and espreso notes.
Pint poured at the 21st Amendment Brewpub in San Francisco, a dark black with minimal head. A very strong coffee aroma which is again in the flavour, though a little sweet. Very smooth in the mouth.

On draught. Tasted during trip to California. Black colour with a nice creamy head. little aroma of roasted malt. Great nice taste of roasted barley, coffee and ends up very lightly and some milky way. Not a bad sweet stout at all.
Black body with tan head. Aroma is medium sweet, roast, coffee. Taste is medium sweet, coffee, light roasty bitterness. Medium body.

Had on tap at the brewpub in downtown San Francisco. Dark brown to black pour with a thick, mocha colored head. Slight coffee in the aroma. Flavor has some of the same chocolate, with a bit of earthiness and good lacticity. Mouthfeel is decently thick. Overall, an above average brewpub stout.
Tap. Solid black with a brown head. Nice sweet milky stout. Some roasted character in the middle.
Black, roasty. Body is thin and slick without chewiness, texture, or heft. Hops are there only slightly in aroma but belch to fullness. Better than the texture should allow.

Black and opaque. Small tan head. Strong roasted aroma and flavor. Faint hops. Medium body. Not what I expected in a sweet stout, tastes more like a standard stout or even a dry stout. Not bad, just not what I was expecting.
Sweet and yeasty nose, with notes of prunes. Dark muddy brown body, small brownish head. Yeasty and quite sweet flavor.
Hazy dark brown with disapearing head. Sour yeast aroma. Sour bitter taste with some fruity malty aftertaste
An unclear brown beer with a disappearing brown head. The aroma is sweet with notes of caramel, alcohol, and yeast. The flavor is very sweet with primary notes of yeast.
Bottle. Hazy brown colour with a small fast dissaperein white head. Sweet fruity raisin alcoholic aroma and taste. Medium body and a sweet alcoholic finish.

[bottled, alc. 10%]. Dark brown, oily body; medium sized, mostly lasting beige head. Raisins, fruit, caramel, and plenty of dark and earthy notes and flavours. Never too sweet or cloying. Full bodied. Long bittersweet finish.

O yes! This is my type of beer. Rich and creamy as a Westy 12. Beautifully dark with a coffee coloured head. Deep and luscious coffee aroma with leather and musk. Dark tangy flavours with just enough acid sourness to prevent it becoming sweet or cloying. An absolute gem. I turned this down at the GBBF because I'd had enough and wanted to do it justice. I bought a bottle and brought it home. Boy - I'm glad I did. An absolute masterpiece! When the revolution comes, Duff will be the first against the wall!
Quite a yeasty nose, sweet caramelly start. Yeasty finish, with a lot of alcohol showing. Some appley, plummy fruit, but too sweet and too much alcohol for me. (bottle GBBF 03')

My last purchase of the GBBF, and as the festival was closing down this was the last bottle to open and share. Deep dark head--as dark as I've ever seen?--and a deep, rich, stout-like aroma. I pick up a fruity aroma as I drink it, and then get some musty flavors. Flavors of alcohol and plums come through but there is a sharp edge to it as well. Interesting and enjoyable beer. (bottle at GBBF 2003)
Dark stout like appearance in body and dark burnt foam. Sweet yeasty appley start disappearing into a charred second half. Chocolate, espresso and licorice in the finish.

Botlle conditioned. GBBF2003. Deep black brown, orange beige head and moderate condition. Strange fresh picked mushroom notes in the nose, some licorice and smokey phenols in the mouth and a nice bitter finish.

A pacific northwest style scottish ale a bit hoppier than Bert Grants Scottish Ale. Bronze amber carrying a crisp head the aroma was a subtle scotch barrel malt and hops. Excellent interplay of malt and hop in the flavor--though hops do prevail. Springy and lambent beer that is a good refreshment.

Ahhhh, the pilsener. Does it have one "e" or two? So I''m sitting at the bar at this brewpub, waiting for my wingman to get there. On at least three times over 20 minutes, I heard someone come up and ask for a budcoorsmiller Lite. When told that they brew their own beers, they would just ask for "The lightest thing you got". I mean, are they *trying* to drink bad beer? This is maybe a little above average for a brewpub pils...slightly skunky, fruity, blah finish. Not as fun as screwing your ex, especially when they''re serving the rye atout at the same time.

Bottle at Würzburger Hofbräu, Würzburg, Bavaria Saturday 9th March 2019. Pours clear warm gold with a large white head. Maltier than expected, but clean and fresh tasting. It could be more bitter and more crisp and less malty, but hey I am being overly critical, fact is a few flaws (to my tastebuds) these aside, I did enjoy it.
A decent Helles, however, not exactly outstanding from the rest. Good mid-range.
Clear yellow, short lasting whie foam head. Not too strong aroma, normal barley. Fresh sparkling beer, barley taste, good thurst quencer. (Velp 201603)
Very little nose. Nice gold color. Crisp and light, nothing amazing here but a solid light lager (lagerhell).

Bottle. Pours golden with a medium, large-bubbled, white head. Aroma is stingy light malts, grassy. Taste is lightly fruity, quite a bit of grainy malt, finishes with hops - herbal and grassy. Palate is light. Alright, not special.
Golden colour with solid head. Smell of hops and some sweetness. Starts malty with some hops. Nothing special

The beer in the glass has a strong golden yellow color and a flat, fine-pored head, and a lot of growing up CO2. Smells strong hoppy, aromatic, spicy. It starts with lots of hops, bitter well, but also some fine aroma hops are coming through. The finish is bitter hoppy, very tart and dry.
Draught at Papperla Pub, Haus der 150 Biere, Würzburg Blond color; generous head. It’s a gentle Pils with a hay touch and respectable bitterness.

Hell-würziger Antrunk, weich getreidig. Das Bier wird zunehmend herb, was aber auf geringer Intensität geschieht. Auch das Malz nimmt zu und befindet sich zum Ende auf angenehmem aber immer noch süffigem Niveau. Hopfennoten sind nur am Rande vorhanden. Abwechslungsreiches und gelungenes Lager.
Swing top bottle. Golden color. Grassy aroma with a hint of citrus. Satisfyingly grassy citric hopbitter flavor. Just a bit malty. Almost medium bdoied. Grassy hopbitter aftertaste.

column4: Triple 7 Brewpub at Main Street Station
column5: On draft at the bar. First stop on this Vegas trip. Pours orange gol with a clingy white head. Aroma is nutty, caramel citrus. Flavor follows, not as crisp and dry as most octoberfests.

column4: Triple 7 Brewpub at Main Street Station
column5: It’s was pretty sweet as the caramel was strong especially in the finish. Went down pretty easily for how sweet it was.

column4: Triple 7 Brewpub at Main Street Station
column5: 16 ounce draft at the Triple 7 Brewpub at the Main Street Station, Las Vegas, Nevada. The pour is a clear golden brown, with a smallish off white head. The aroma is light floral, nutty caramel malt, and a slight hint of grass. The taste is the nutty caramel sweetness, followed by a bit of the grass and finishing with cereal grain. The floral is present, along with herbal in the aftertaste. The palate is medium bodied, a lower carbonation level, and a dry mineral herbal finish. Clean, nice Oktoberfest.

column4: Triple 7 Brewpub at Main Street Station
Triple 7 Brewpub at Main Street Station
column5: On top of a normal roasty malt of Oktoberfests, this one has an unusual sweet aroma and citrusy start to its flavor. OK.
33 cl. bottle. A hazy golden coloured beer with a white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, straw, hops and with a bitter finish.

33cl bottle. Pours clear pale golden colour with a mid-sized white head. Aroma of mild grainy malt, hints of metallic hops. Taste of mild grainy pale malt, mild metallic hops, watery body, boring stuff!

Clear golden color with a nice white head that not last longer. Aroma is malty, notes of green apple, butter and cereal. Flavor is sweet and light bitterness. High carbonation and light bitter finish. not too bad.. :)

Bottle. Golden yellow straw colored, with a medium white head. Spicy, grainy smell with some citrus and a light metallic note. Starts light sweet and turns bitter in the end. There is not much flavor, it is watery and over carbonated. Light to medium bodied. Even if of low alcohol content, the alcohol is quite noticeable. Very light and sweet aftertaste.
Aroma: Sweet corn. Flavor: Sweet with little bitterness and a watery mouthfeel. Color: Light amber with a white head.

0,33 l bottle from CITTI Markt. ABV is 5,2%. Clear sparkling golden body with a small white head. Honey and hay on the nose. Watery texture. Quite sweet and a little bitter with papery notes. Light bodied. Clean mouth but the papery notes lingers.
Bottle 0,33l. Pours a light yellow colour and leaves a white head. Aroma is wet grass and corn. Same for taste. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle 33cl. Small white head and fizzy. Yellow color. Aroma is wet grass with some coconut. Taste is grassy as well. Nothing particular here.
Bottle from Karstadt, Bremen. Clear pale yellow with a white head. Aroma is sweet, light malty and corn. Flavor is light sweet. Dry finish. Watery. 180713
Some head, golden but also a bit artificial look.nice light nose with some sweet corn. Medium body and a bit short. light taste with a soft light sweetnes.

Bottle 0,33l. Pours a red-brown with a creamy head. The aroma has notes of butterscotch and caramel. Taste of malt, caramel, and the finish has light hints of citrus. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Clear dark brown with a small beige head. Aroma is sweet, malty, a little roasted malt and notes of chocolate. Flavor is medium sweet and light bitter. Sweet finish. 220113
Bottle @ Johns. Pours dark brown with a light brown head. Aroma little roasted malt, light coffee, light sourness. Flavor is malt, roast, little sour. Medium body, average carbonation. 220113

Bottle, 6.5%. Very dark brown/red with medium beige head. Aroma is light roasted malts, chocolate and caramel. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, caramel, little acid, medium sweet and a little bitter.
Bottle. Medium head with medium duration. Color is dark brown. Aroma and taste are roast malt, caramel and hops. Boring-
grass, amber, light brown foam, light sweetness, lightly sour, lightly bitter, light body, light watery finish.
No porter notes. Brown coloured and clear. Has an off-white head, medium duration. Aroma has sweet, fruity notes, faint spicy. Flavor is sweet, light bitter finish. Soft carbonation.

Bottle. Frothy off-white good mostly deminishing head. Dark amber colour. Moderate malty and light hoppy aroma. Fruity notes. No roast. Light biietr flavir. More fruioty notes thn roast. Not a porter. A dark amber perhaps. Watery palate. Ok beer.
33 cl bottle. Pours dark brown with a huge tan and brown head. Aroma is roasted malty and breadish. Dark malty, light metallic and chemical. Dry and roasted malty finish.
Bottle courtesy of yespr, thank you sir! Dark ruby brown, thick brown head with good retention and lacing. But its all downhill from there. An ounce of appearance is worth a pound of performance.

50 cl bottle from Landbierprd. Golden color.Medium white head. Aroma is herbs , malts and bran . Interesting flavor, with malt and herbs again. Nice one ,see you later Franconian beers. Going back again to the beer desert which is Portugal.
Clear golden colour. Quite flowery, grainy aroma. Hoppy, flowery flavour with some grassiness.

Bottle bought @ Landbierparadies. Pours tiny hazy golden with a small frothy white head that leaves some sparse trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is slightly malty, slightly floral and tiny metallic with white bread, cereal, hay, minerals, iron and lemon peal. Taste is sweet, bitter, slightly malty, slightly floral and tiny metallic. Mouthfeel is crisp, round and medium bodied. Finish is sweet and bitter with white bread, crackers, hay, minerals and lemon peal. Drinkable Pilsner! Perhaps a bit too sweet, perhaps a bit too metallic.

Bottled (from landbierparadies). Golden colour, mediumsized white fluffy head. Aroma is grainy, grassy, floral and mildly herbal notes with some slight bready notes. Flavour is rather crisp bready maltiness along with some grains, floral, grassy and earthy notes. Nice earthy bitterness in the finish.
Bottle. Golden colour with a white head. Aroma is fruit, malt, hop, grain. Flavour is sweet, fruit, malt, hop, grain, pine. Medium body. Ordinary beer.

Bottled, from Landbierparadies, Nuremberg. Clear golden, rich head. Grassy nose with a whiff of bread. Mid dry with light-medium body and firm, soft mouthfeel. Lovely meaty, bready malt. Well integrated grassy hops. Long bitter finish. Excellent pilsner!
Erfrischendes, nur leicht getreidiges Pilsner mit angenehmer Süffigkeit und ebenso mild im herben Bereich. Einfach zu trinken mit ausgewogener Perlung. Nicht schlecht.

Bottle from Landbierparadies. Pours out in a light clear golden colour with low head and medium body. Aroma of bitter hops and grass. Taste of hops, grass, citrus and grains. Bitter finish. Easy drinkable - solid and nice Pils.
Bottle. Pours golden with an off-white head. Aroma of malt, white bread, some bread crusts and hay. Flavor is sweet and malty with some fruitiness, hay and bread. Medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle. A clear, golden beer topped by a small, white head. The aroma has pale malts, some cooked vegetables and piney, peppery hops. It’s medium to full-bodied, softly carbonated. Semi-dry, with a tad much sweetness in the flavor. Nice bitterness though. Some dms in the else pleasant finish. Can’t say I’m impressed by this one, but it drinks easily and doesn’t taste bad either. 140420
Small head, soon reduced to rim over clear copper beer. Sweet, corn nose, malts, slightly parsley or herbs. Sweet-malty, faintly toasted; Light body, empty. Not very festive in my book.
Bottle. Deep golden colour with a white head. Aroma is fruit, malt, hop, caramel. Flavour is is fruit, malt, oxidation, caramel, hop, hay. Medium body. Ordinary beer.

Bottle. A clear, dark golden beer topped by a small, dense, white head. It’s lightly sweetish on the nose, with caramel hints and a nice fruityness. Pine cones and some resins too. Pleasant sweetness in the flavor, nicely balanced by the bitterness. Pine cones, resins and a pleasant fruityness too. Medium body, soft on the palate, finishing with a nice balance between malts and hops. Pretty decent this one. 140426

Bottle.Pours golden with an off-white head. Aroma of malt, fruitiness, some hay and caramel. Flavor is sweet and malty with some caramel, hay, biscuits and fruitiness. Medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle 500ml @ Geokkjer Pours clear deep golden with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel and hint of green apples. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein klares goldenes Bier mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch malzig, würzig, leicht fruchtig. Geschmack würzig, malzig, leicht bitter hopfig.

500ml bottle. Clear golden colour with average, frothy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Pale malty, minimally grainy, bready, doughy aroma. Taste is dry, grassy, flat bitter hoppy, minimally grainy, strawy. Uninspired.

Bottle 500ml. @ home. Clear medium yellow orange color with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly to fully lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, sweet malt, fruity malt, sugary. Flavour is moderate sweet and bitter with a long duration, sweet malt, sugary, hoppy, grass, malty, hay. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20131213]
Frisch herber Antrunk, etwas modrig. Deutlich herb bleibend, monoton. Wenig malzig, minimal hintergründiger Hopfen. Trinkbar. 10/8/9/8/11/8

0,5 l bottle BB: N/A Dark golden color, clear, minimal white head / fast disappearing foam. Aroma: malt, caramel, bread, herbs, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, oily feel, average carbonation,

unclear dark golden-red tint, decent off-white head, good retention, nice lacing. caramel malts, dry, diacetyls, peppery sugar, light acidity, light booze, warming grassy caramel. average carbonation - fizzy, light body, short to medium long grassy-citrusy finish.

On tap at the brewpub. Nice copper body with a thin, lasting off-white foamy head. Fait malty/hoppy aroma with brown sugar hints. Its decent malty/hoppy aroma carries caramel and herbal notes. Ends with a good bittersweet finish.

On tao at Le Bilboquet. The color is a clear amber with a thin beige head. The aroma is a bit sweet. The taste is of malt and sweet fruits, some bitterness to it but to much of a watery taste to give it any long lasting flavor.
It doesnâ€™t smell like beer. It doesnâ€™t taste like beer. It doesnâ€™t look like beer. If you carbonated water, added a splash of vodka, youâ€™d probably wind up with this.

Ha HA HA woooooo. Itâ€™s essentially just carbonated water in a golden can. Not offensive in any way, just NO TASTE at all. Having said that Iâ€™d drink it over miller lite, as the flavors in that are very offensive!

Holy lord, this is beer? Tastes almost exactly like tap water. Nothing overally offensive i guess though. There are a few NA brews that have a lot more taste then this. Probably good for bongs and shotgunnin though.
Bad beer made by a brewery desperate to make a light beer, the bad batches went into the generic cans, the OK batches were Oly gold...

In my junior year of high school, my friend stole one of his motherâ€™s beers from the fridge when we dropped by his house on lunch break. This was one of the biggest adolescent mistakes we ever made (and we made a lot). Oly Gold is about as bad as it gets. I canâ€™t believe itâ€™s still out there.
now its a light beer... ..that outta the way, its got alcohol in it so that gets points, it look ok and smells ok, tastes like watered down kinda stale olympia, but its cheap as sh.....

Medium gold colored body with a white head. The aroma is corny with some hay and a little bit of green peppers. the taste has some nasty corn and metal with some grass. A bad lager, but not the worst I have had.
Pours a light golden yellow. Aromas of minor hops, corn, grains. Flavor is light, crisp, watery with a little hop and not much else.

There is absolutely no reason to drink this other than you are a) broke b) a designated driver, or c) a broke designated driver. The hops and malt are nonexistent, and it has that "twang" of a typical N/A. Not good, even for a cheap, low-alcohol beer.
One of the worldâ€™s worst light beers. It is 3.2 wherever it is sold, thatâ€™s how they make it. And thatâ€™s 3.2 ABV, not ABW. Almost an NA beer. Tastes exactly like water.
Sweet and yeasty nose, with notes of prunes. Dark muddy brown body, small brownish head. Yeasty and quite sweet flavor.
Hazy dark brown with disapearing head. Sour yeast aroma. Sour bitter taste with some fruity malty aftertaste
An unclear brown beer with a disappearing brown head. The aroma is sweet with notes of caramel, alcohol, and yeast. The flavor is very sweet with primary notes of yeast.
Bottle. Hazy brown colour with a small fast dissaperein white head. Sweet fruity raisin alcoholic aroma and taste. Medium body and a sweet alcoholic finish.

[bottled, alc. 10%]. Dark brown, oily body; medium sized, mostly lasting beige head. Raisins, fruit, caramel, and plenty of dark and earthy notes and flavours. Never too sweet or cloying. Full bodied. Long bittersweet finish.

O yes! This is my type of beer. Rich and creamy as a Westy 12. Beautifully dark with a coffee coloured head. Deep and luscious coffee aroma with leather and musk. Dark tangy flavours with just enough acid sourness to prevent it becoming sweet or cloying. An absolute gem. I turned this down at the GBBF because I'd had enough and wanted to do it justice. I bought a bottle and brought it home. Boy - I'm glad I did. An absolute masterpiece! When the revolution comes, Duff will be the first against the wall!
Quite a yeasty nose, sweet caramelly start. Yeasty finish, with a lot of alcohol showing. Some appley, plummy fruit, but too sweet and too much alcohol for me. (bottle GBBF 03')

My last purchase of the GBBF, and as the festival was closing down this was the last bottle to open and share. Deep dark head--as dark as I've ever seen?--and a deep, rich, stout-like aroma. I pick up a fruity aroma as I drink it, and then get some musty flavors. Flavors of alcohol and plums come through but there is a sharp edge to it as well. Interesting and enjoyable beer. (bottle at GBBF 2003)
Dark stout like appearance in body and dark burnt foam. Sweet yeasty appley start disappearing into a charred second half. Chocolate, espresso and licorice in the finish.

Botlle conditioned. GBBF2003. Deep black brown, orange beige head and moderate condition. Strange fresh picked mushroom notes in the nose, some licorice and smokey phenols in the mouth and a nice bitter finish.

A pacific northwest style scottish ale a bit hoppier than Bert Grants Scottish Ale. Bronze amber carrying a crisp head the aroma was a subtle scotch barrel malt and hops. Excellent interplay of malt and hop in the flavor--though hops do prevail. Springy and lambent beer that is a good refreshment.

On tap at the Sunnyside Mcmenamins. Pours very light yellow/gold, very clear with a faint fast falling white head. Very light wheat in the aroma mixed with a subtle hop blend, nothing really stood out, and a touch of fruity yeast esters showed up for a bit. Taste was very watery and bland with veyr mild wheat, no spicing, and a light hop finish. Very mild american wheat beer.
sampled at High Street Brewing: slight wheat aroma, budweiser appearance, dry wheat and nothing else
CRYSTAL clear, what a bummer!! Tight, thin hang in there head. Dry cereal grain taste. Some faint esters and notably wheaty nose. Super clean, no cloying. good flavor, but a bad wheat.

Blonde with a crisp head and light hoppiness in te aroma. The wheat flavor is present, but clean and reserved making way for hops. A well balanced wheat--akin to an APA and one that I would appreciate more if I had enjoyed this in the summer.
Grain and bread aroma, Very nice copper, clear appearance, nice lingering lacy white head. Sweet taste with slight bitter finish. Good carbonation. Overall an above average beer for its type.
My incomplete notes only say 50 cl bottle, great.While having dinner with some friends @ home.
Beer pours out in an amber colour with a mild carbonation and steady body. Aroma is herbs, hops and barley. Taste is hops, malt, straw, herbs, flowers and fruits. Malty finish.

Bottle from IxI GetrÃ¤nkemarkt in Frankfurt. The beer has got a hazy golden-amber colour with a steady head and medium body. Aroma of hops and straw. Taste of mild hops, straw, mild fruits, basement, bread and nuts. Mild hoppy finish. Nothing special.

Itâ€™s dark amber with a creamy head. The aroma has notes of caramel, fruit and hints of nuts. The flavor has a light to moderate sweetness with notes roasted malt, caramel, nuts and fruit. The finish is slightly roasted. Pleasant.

500ml bottle bought at Great Food Hall in Pacific Place, Admiralty. Clear deep amber brown colour; Three-quarter finger head and off-white foam which fades in 40 seconds; Moderate sticky lacing with fizzy carbonation; Light aroma of malt, with caramel, light musty, dark bread, faint lemon and strong grass; Very light sweet taste of full malt, with light caramel, light molasses, dark bread, yeast, light lemon and very light grass; Light body, watery and slightly slick palate; Mouth feel is watery thin but quite malty amber lager, with some notable notes of caramel and molasses. Tasteof dark bread and yeasty. Hmmmâ€¦. Hoppiness is very grassy nose, faint lemony grassy hops in taste. Minimal bitterness, just malty dark bread finish; Fairly dry after taste, very easy to mouth. Comments: This one has the traditional dark colour of Maerzen, but other than that, its weak body which affected the maltyness, and lack of hoppiness are real downer. Feels like a malty macro Amber Lager. As a Maerzen, it doesnâ€™t work. Disappointing.

Bottle from Germany thanks to a friend: Pours a dark autumn orange topped with a short lived foam cap head. Aroma is tame and only allows for a slight whiff of caramelized malts and cereal grains. The beer drinks smooth across my palate with some heavy carbonation bubbles. As for the taste, there isnâ€™t much happening other than a medium-bodied Oktoberfest with hints of caramelized malts. The finish has a bitter taste while also leaving behind a taste of sour residue around my lips.

Serving: from bottle--purchased at AllendÃ¶rfer. Aroma: lightly malty. Appearance: average-sized, frothy, off-white, initial head with no lacing and fully diminishing longevity. Clear, dark-amber body. Taste: lightly sour, lemony initial flavor and lightly sweet finish with short duration. Palate: light body, watery texture and soft-to-lively carbonation. Overall: very good. Great taste, easy to drink. I would gladly drink this again.

Thanks to John for this one! 500 ml bottle into a pint glass. 5.2% indicated on bottle, and a 2009 best-by date. Ah well. A: Pours a darker amber color. Thereâ€™s also a lot of unattractive sediment in the pour, also. The head is a two finger white shade with a fairly bubbly yet creamy texture. S: Sweet - like a good dunkel, really. Notes of caramel, brown sugar, vanilla, banana, bubblegum, and wheat abound here. T: Interesting how Ratebeer calls it a marzen: Iâ€™d be more in tune to call it a dunkel. A sweet, caramel-forward opening is balanced somewhat by its crisp wheat finish. I even notice the slightest hint of hops - not bad for something that has to be 5 years old. Tones of musty cardboard indicate its age, though. Still, itâ€™s held up well. M: It has a decent body, with a wet lingering finish. A bit sweet and (perhaps) undercarbonated all told, but I can forgive that taking its age into consideration. O: Given how old it is, itâ€™s actually pretty good. Iâ€™d even seek out a fresh bottle, provided they exist.

Brought home from Germany. Overall, a nice Marzen. A little weak on the scent, just some faint grain, but the pour was a beauty, copper with a bubbly white head. The mouthfeel was light and crisp, and the taste held a nice caramel hint over the grain. Well done.

Bottle. Slightly hazy golden yellow colour with a relatively large quickly disappearing creamy white head, nose is yeasty and fruity with quite prominent notes of bananas and peach and some metallic hints, taste is sweet, yeasty and grainy with a tart finish, a fizzy carbonation and a slightly watery palate.

500 ml bottle. Thanks Timo A! Enjoyed on Jan 31 2019. Clear golden color with a small white head. Yeast, wheat, gasoline, malt and caramel in the aroma. Dryish malt wheaty flavor with caramel, mild rubber and mild honey. Ten in a dozen.

Keg at the Waterloo Tap, 08/02/19. Hazed golden orange with a decent offwhite cap. Nose is banana, clove, bitter sweet orange, light breads. Taste comprises grass, breads, sugars, caramel, ripe banana, clove, straw, trace of orange. Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close. Decent enough Hefe ... ticks the style boxes if a tad sweet.

Keg at Waterloo Tap. Sweet banana aroma. Some herbs. Opaque pale gold. Creamy translucent white head. Initial sweet banana syrup hit before bitterness sweeps in. Medium bodied. Thin but buoyed by soft carbonation. Long dry finish. Does what you want. Good stuff.
Aus der Flasche getrunken (HÃ¤ndlerlieferung). TrÃ¼bes Gold mit akzeptabler Blume. In der Nase dumpf hefig, im Geschmack nicht umwerfend.
Hazy golden beer with an average white head. Aroma is yeasty and malty with banana notes. Flavor is sweet and dry. Crispy carbonation. Average body.
Many thanks for this bottle to Pivnizub & MoritzF. Bottle, yellow - orange colour. Taste banana, citrus, really refreshing and light.
Ins Glas ergieÃŸt sich ein trÃ¼bes goldenes Bier mit schÃ¶ner Schaumkrone. Geruch hefig, fruchtig, leicht wÃ¼rzig. Geschmack hefig, fruchtig, leicht bananig, etwas wÃ¼rzig.
Bottle, 5.2%. Weak flowery aroma. Cloudy yellow colour. Small white head. The flavour is lemony and refreshing. Not much banana, but that fine by me.

Bottle. Pours cloudy light yellow. with small white head. Clear aroma of yeast and hops with a mild touch of banana. Bitter, hoppy onset, giving way to citric notes and a very miÃ¦d hint of banana. Sourish finish. Rather unbalanced but drinkable.

Ahhhh, the pilsener. Does it have one "e" or two? So I''m sitting at the bar at this brewpub, waiting for my wingman to get there. On at least three times over 20 minutes, I heard someone come up and ask for a budcoorsmiller Lite. When told that they brew their own beers, they would just ask for "The lightest thing you got". I mean, are they *trying* to drink bad beer? This is maybe a little above average for a brewpub pils...slightly skunky, fruity, blah finish. Not as fun as screwing your ex, especially when they''re serving the rye atout at the same time.
33 cl. bottle. A hazy golden coloured beer with a white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, straw, hops and with a bitter finish.

33cl bottle. Pours clear pale golden colour with a mid-sized white head. Aroma of mild grainy malt, hints of metallic hops. Taste of mild grainy pale malt, mild metallic hops, watery body, boring stuff!

Clear golden color with a nice white head that not last longer. Aroma is malty, notes of green apple, butter and cereal. Flavor is sweet and light bitterness. High carbonation and light bitter finish. not too bad.. :)

Bottle. Golden yellow straw colored, with a medium white head. Spicy, grainy smell with some citrus and a light metallic note. Starts light sweet and turns bitter in the end. There is not much flavor, it is watery and over carbonated. Light to medium bodied. Even if of low alcohol content, the alcohol is quite noticeable. Very light and sweet aftertaste.
Aroma: Sweet corn. Flavor: Sweet with little bitterness and a watery mouthfeel. Color: Light amber with a white head.

0,33 l bottle from CITTI Markt. ABV is 5,2%. Clear sparkling golden body with a small white head. Honey and hay on the nose. Watery texture. Quite sweet and a little bitter with papery notes. Light bodied. Clean mouth but the papery notes lingers.
Bottle 0,33l. Pours a light yellow colour and leaves a white head. Aroma is wet grass and corn. Same for taste. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle 33cl. Small white head and fizzy. Yellow color. Aroma is wet grass with some coconut. Taste is grassy as well. Nothing particular here.
Bottle from Karstadt, Bremen. Clear pale yellow with a white head. Aroma is sweet, light malty and corn. Flavor is light sweet. Dry finish. Watery. 180713
Some head, golden but also a bit artificial look.nice light nose with some sweet corn. Medium body and a bit short. light taste with a soft light sweetnes.

Bottle 0,33l. Pours a red-brown with a creamy head. The aroma has notes of butterscotch and caramel. Taste of malt, caramel, and the finish has light hints of citrus. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Clear dark brown with a small beige head. Aroma is sweet, malty, a little roasted malt and notes of chocolate. Flavor is medium sweet and light bitter. Sweet finish. 220113
Bottle @ Johns. Pours dark brown with a light brown head. Aroma little roasted malt, light coffee, light sourness. Flavor is malt, roast, little sour. Medium body, average carbonation. 220113

Bottle, 6.5%. Very dark brown/red with medium beige head. Aroma is light roasted malts, chocolate and caramel. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, caramel, little acid, medium sweet and a little bitter.
Bottle. Medium head with medium duration. Color is dark brown. Aroma and taste are roast malt, caramel and hops. Boring-
grass, amber, light brown foam, light sweetness, lightly sour, lightly bitter, light body, light watery finish.
No porter notes. Brown coloured and clear. Has an off-white head, medium duration. Aroma has sweet, fruity notes, faint spicy. Flavor is sweet, light bitter finish. Soft carbonation.

Bottle. Frothy off-white good mostly deminishing head. Dark amber colour. Moderate malty and light hoppy aroma. Fruity notes. No roast. Light biietr flavir. More fruioty notes thn roast. Not a porter. A dark amber perhaps. Watery palate. Ok beer.
33 cl bottle. Pours dark brown with a huge tan and brown head. Aroma is roasted malty and breadish. Dark malty, light metallic and chemical. Dry and roasted malty finish.
Bottle courtesy of yespr, thank you sir! Dark ruby brown, thick brown head with good retention and lacing. But its all downhill from there. An ounce of appearance is worth a pound of performance.

unclear dark golden-red tint, decent off-white head, good retention, nice lacing. caramel malts, dry, diacetyls, peppery sugar, light acidity, light booze, warming grassy caramel. average carbonation - fizzy, light body, short to medium long grassy-citrusy finish.

On tap at the brewpub. Nice copper body with a thin, lasting off-white foamy head. Fait malty/hoppy aroma with brown sugar hints. Its decent malty/hoppy aroma carries caramel and herbal notes. Ends with a good bittersweet finish.

On tao at Le Bilboquet. The color is a clear amber with a thin beige head. The aroma is a bit sweet. The taste is of malt and sweet fruits, some bitterness to it but to much of a watery taste to give it any long lasting flavor.

Aucun arriÃ¨re goÃ»t. (Rating #1901)

Hazy amber hue, with a thick beige head, caramelized malt, toffeeish accent, sweet fruity note of raisins, dates, plums, toasty malty in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a toasted malt, sweet barley malt, grainy, toffee, hint of fruitiness, leading towards a malty and lingering hops bitterness finish.
A hazy amber beer with a small beige head. The aroma is very lightly peachy. The flavor is "a lot more powerful" with some notes of caramel and citrus on a slightly sour back ground. Nothing special.

Light orange, lasting off-white head. Slightly hoppy, orangey and fruit zest flavors mostly. Decent flavors of orange, faint earthiness, good malt-hops balance. Creamy texture, watery palate, airy in nature.

Low, lightly fruity, caramel malt aroma. Clear amber-brown with a fine-bubbled cover of off-white head that lasts well and laces. Caramel malts are offset by fair bitterness. Medium-light body with fairly strong carbonation. Sampled at the brewpub with Oakes, Rastacouere and Ungstrup.
Hazy amber colour. Aroma is caramelly, slightly toasty, with hints of fruity hop. The palate is dry, fairly dusty and toasty. Straightforward rousse.

Clear copper pour with a thin creamy white head. Decent aroma and flavor of hops, malt and caramel. The body is full with a creamy texture and the carbonation is soft. Decent, honest, but not exciting.

Bottle from Chez Ben. Dark mahogany with a huge billowy khaki coloured head that lingers and leaves patchy lace. Nose is coffee, chocolate, wood, vanilla, molasses. light+ sweet milk chocolate and molasses sweetness with a medium coffee bitterness. Mouth is full and creamy with soft carbonation. 8/4/7/4-/15

On tap @Birrifugio Trastevere (Rome). Nera, densa, quasi impenetrabile, schiuma avorio media, discretamente persistente. Al naso note di caffÃ¨, cioccolato, leggera vaniglia. In bocca Ã¨ mediamente dolce leggero amaro finale, caffettosa. Corpo esile, leggermente watery, carbonazione media. Un po' timida.
Bottle from Beer Republic. Black with a brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, caramel, coffee and chocolate. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 260818
Bottled. Black body, big beige head. The aroma has milk, roasted malt. The body is smooth with a nice roasted flavor.

Tap @ Irreale, Madrid, Spain. Dark brown colour with a thick tan head. Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate, licorice. Taste is roasted malt, chocolate, toffee, licorice, nuts. Medium body, average carbonation.

Rami Rami is drinking a La Corriveau by Le Bilboquet Microbrasserie at Chmielarnia MarszaÅ‚kowska Bardzo karmelowy jak na stouta, slodki, reszta w nirmie, fajnie pijalny, troche zbozowy, plus za fajna laske na etce

Rating #2506 - 2017.07.26 - Draught @revolutionyeg 0 Beautiful dark brown pour with a fairly weak tan head with mild lacing. Aroma is chocolate, coffee, malts. Taste is oaty, thick, rich, with a hint of chocolate. Superb.

500ml bottle. Dark brown with a creamy beige head. Flavors are roasted cereals, vanilla, coffee, dark chocolate and ashes with fruity and chalky notes. Light to medium body, soft carbonation, smooth texture.
500ml bottle from from Peluso, Montreal. Tasting with Jamey. Aroma is roasted malt, some chocolate notes and metallic. Taste is slightly sweet, roasted malt. Burnt malt aftertaste. Good one.

Notes de dÃ©gustation Ã©garÃ©es, mais je me rappelle avoir Ã©tÃ© sous-impressionnÃ© par cette offrande. Manque de complexitÃ©, de saveur, de texture, bref dâ€™intÃ©rÃªt. Ce nâ€™Ã©tait pas mauvais, mais on se lassait avant dâ€™avoir bu 500 mL.
BQ2010. Pours a hazy gold body with nice head. Aroma of spice, coriander, and orange peel. Flavor is slightly subdued. Some hints of coriander, orange, and citrus in the flavor.

Tasted this beer while on Beer Quest 2010 with the guys. This was beer number 56. Pour was a hazy gold. Aroma of spices, coriander, and orange peel. Flavor is slightly weak. Some hints of all the aromas in the flavor.
Robe blonde-blanche voilÃ©e surmontÃ©e dâ€™une mousse blanche fugace. ArÃ´mes Ã¢cres du malt. Houblon de soutien. Saveurs Ã¢cres du malt, blÃ© sur. Banane en finale.

Served with a slice of lemon. An unclear dark orange beer with a small white head. The aroma is sweet with strong notes of oranges, but I also detect pink grape. The flavor is very spicy with coriander being most dominant, but also very fruity with oranges and pink grape being the most dominant notes. The end is dry.

Pale yellow, light white ring. Very estery nose, no spices used they say. Heavy banana and peeled-off wood sticks. Well developped wheat and ginger flavors, fruity and of limited complexity unfortunately. Smooth soft carbonation, the yeast dominates and procures a fading astringence. light-medium bodied.

Mild floral, fruity aroma with some cinammon spiciness. Hazy tan gold with low but lasting, creamy white head that leaves some lacing. Banana, mild clove, orange and wheat flavours are pleasantly balanced. Creamy texture with light body and gently effervescent carbonation. Sampled on tap at the brewpub with Oakes, Rastacouere and Ungstrup.

Hazy dun colour. Yeasty, sweaty aroma with strong cinnamon notes. Flavour is heavy on the ginger. A touch overcarbonated so the malts get obscured. Finish is mainly spicy. Not bad for a ginger beer. Too bad itâ€™s not a ginger beer.
Pours a hazy blonde color with a thin white head. Decent aroma and flavor of bananas and lemon. Medium body with a creamy texture and soft carbonation.

Very nice spicy and wheat flavor, couldnt smell a thing, but didnt detect bananas in aroma...even with my stuffed up sinus, this beer is enjoyable (Oct.13 â€™03) 5-4-7-3-15 Rerate Dec.1 "04 Fruity cheesy aroma. Reddish blonde with sweet almost cool-aid like taste, light malts, no bananas, watery and oily mouthfeel. 5-3-4-2-10
Great, sweet banana glaciers melting down to dry, mineral waters...The crash creates yeasty, grainy tastewaves...Somewhat of a cheap champagne and herbal cacophony arises but quickly emaciates...

On tap at the brewpub. Golden body with a thin white foamy head. Fair malty/hoppy aroma with some herbal hints. Fresh hoppy taste carries malty and bready notes. Ends with a short bitter/herbal finish. Decent micro lager.

An orange beer with no head. The aroma is very sweet malty with a slight hint of hops. The flavor is sweet with notes of caramel, giving it a slightly sticky mouthfeel, until the dry hoppy end sets in.
Clear dull straw yellow. Strawy tartish hay in the nose, very limited flavors. Low herbal hoppiness, low maltiness, slight sandy dryness. Quite watery palate with a creamy tang. Quite dull.

Clean, pale malt aroma with light fruitiness and mild herbal hops. Clear blonde body with low white head that diminishes to ring. Grainy malt flavour is lightly fruity with low finishing bitterness. Light body, creamy texture and low carbonation. Straight-forward but well-brewed, though Iâ€™d have to say this is more of a golden/blonde ale than American pale ale. Golden, bright. Slight husky pale malt aroma. Clean, fresh pale malt character. Not terribly exciting but decently produced.

on tap at brewpub. relatively clear light brown-red tint, creamy off-white head, goodretention/lacing. nuts, light pine notes, fruitiness, peppery, light booze. average to soft carbonation, medium body, medium long grapefruity finish. nice brown ale.
Keg. Light biscuity malt, slightly nutty. Sweet and tangy. Fresh hop flavours.

Draught Moose & Mountie Spectapular, Sydney. Pours a thick brown body, tan head. Sweet biscuity malts. Nice and nutty and chocolatey. Some grassy leafy hops in amongst it, with a firm bitterness to finish. Quite good!
tap at taphouse. solid and sweet malts, with a decent hoppiness to it that lingers. decent brown ale.
Tap. Great beer. Aromas of caramel, and apple. Taste is sweet, with good length. Palate is velvety, and medium bodied. Brown colour, with a frothy white head.

column5: Originally rated April 2005. Bought a six-pack of this at the "Trappe Ã  Fromage" in Gatineau, Quebec, containing five 341ml brown bottle and one Saint Arnould glass. This is really a micro, as the bottle caps are the generic you buy at the homebrew store and has that dent in it when you do it by hand. Looking forward to my first Saint Arnould experience. Pours a hazy yellow-white colour with a very white silky head, and foamy lacing. The nose is yeasty like a witbier, but nice and light. The carbonation is heavy and the taste is quite different at first, as it is very sour. The aftertaste then turns grainy and smooth. Interesting... a mixture of pale lager and witbier it seems to me. Worth a try !

column4: Microbrasserie Saint Arnould (Coop Brassicole des Laurentides)
column5: Very pale golden in colour, quickly dissipating white head, no lacing. The aroma is slightly sweet with some caramel, pale malts, cereal and apples. The flavour is very faint, very watery, some pale malts poke through, some expired fizzy apple juice, quite empty feeling. Thin mouthfeel, light body, medium carbonation. Finishes quick and watery. Nothing special with this one. 341ml bottle from La Trappe a Fromage in Gatineau, Quebec. Best before December 2006.

column4: Microbrasserie Saint Arnould (Coop Brassicole des Laurentides)
column5: Drank in a Tulip. Clear golden poor with a small white head. Very light ale like. Aromas of cassis and bread thats about it. Very light and dry finish. Creamy acid feel, Lemon zest? The hops are barely there.

Rondeur moyenne en bouche avec un pÃ©tillement moyen ainsi quâ€™une texture aux petites notes huileuses. GoÃ»t lÃ©ger-moyen amer de houblon floral aux notes citriques et rÃ©sineuses (prÃ©sent en arriÃ¨re-goÃ»t durant toute la gorgÃ©e) avec un lÃ©ger goÃ»t fruitÃ© (agrumes, traces de pÃªches sucrÃ©es) lors de lâ€™entrÃ©e en bouche suivi dâ€™un goÃ»t maltÃ© de caramel trÃ¨s doux avec des notes de pain puis en finale lâ€™amertume de houblon se fait lÃ©gÃ¨rement plus herbeuses et trÃ¨s lÃ©gÃ¨rement sÃ¨ches. Post-goÃ»t moyen-long, lÃ©ger-moyen amer de houblon floral et trÃ¨s lÃ©gÃ¨rement rÃ©sineux, avec des notes fruitÃ©es (agrumes). (Ã©tÃ© 2006)
Amber color with a short lasting white head. It has a caramel malt taste and citrus hops. It is your standard pale ale very good.
20 oz sur place. Couleur ambrÃ©e typique de son style, bon collet. Arome dâ€™houblon faible et amÃ¨re. GoÃ»t dâ€™houblon pas trop fort, arriÃ¨re goÃ»t faiblement amÃ¨re et rien de plus.

Of all the regular beer on tap at RÃ©servoir, this is the most pleasant and reliable. A solid but unspectacular pub ale. Orange-copper body with a very little white head. Typical Pale Ale, light caramel touch followed by a nice long hop bitterness after-taste. No funky spices or anything. I canâ€™t praise it for anything but I canâ€™t complain about anything either (besides the disappointingly small head). Good enough to justify a pit-stop on my way to the much superior Dieu Du Ciel.

Bright amber color, with a white head, leaving lacing, with floral hops, grassy and a piney hop nose, follows through on a medium-bodied palate with an earthy dose of hop bitterness, a display of grassy, leafy, coniferous notes, leading towards an intense lingering piney bitter finish.

Dark amber ale with a htin off white head. Nice caramel malt and nice floral hops in aroma. Crisp malt attack with decent floral hops in mouth. Medium bodied. A nice classic pale ale. On tap. summer 2005.

I think this is probably the best beer they do, but that realy isnâ€™t saying much. Clearly an atempt to make a bass replica. Pours a slightly orange, crystal clear amber with a thin offwhite head that stays solid all throughout. Carbonation is a little high but not overly so, and there are some nice laceings. Aroma is sweet toffie and lemmony hops. The mouthfeel is slightly viscous with a creamy medium thick body. The taste is mostly earth and roast nut, with a nice grassy note. Some undertones of plumb, dry pine, and a tiny bitter splash. aftertaste is a spicy bitterness, with a tiny bit of grapefruit and a splash of spruce. Not bad, but canâ€™t compare to the pale ales of varios types at the other brewpubs in this city. Cheers

Pours a clear amber color with a thin offwhite head. Aroma of shy hops. Flavor of earthy hops and caramel with a solid bitte finish. The body has a medium thickness with an oily texture and medium carbonation. Decent.
Pours a nice copper with good head and lace. Sweet caramel aroma and bready malts with some light hoppiness. Balanced towards the malt a bit, but pretty nice overall.

A charming shade of copper, with a compact head that stuck to the walls of my shaker pint. My first pint had a light, refreshing citrus hop aroma, with a herbal finish, the second one kinda smelled infected. How can that happen on the same keg? Decorous astringency, with a grapefruit aftertaste, but the middle felt a little too aqueous. Not enough malt profile for the style (and to my liking).
On tap at the brewpub. Comes a clear light amber with a small biege head. Aroma of malt and caramel. Taste is malt, caramel, dark fruit, and some hops. A bit sweet but very drinkable.

Shaker pint draft at the brewpub. Pour is a clear golden and ruby with not much of an off white head. Aroma is a touch metallic, than shows nice toasty malt, mildly sweet and herbal. Taste is the malt, honey sweet and toasty. The grass and herbal element kicks in half way and carries through to the finish. Palate is medium, coats the mouth a bit, lower carbonation.

On tap at McCoyâ€™s in KC. Pours a lightly clouded, deep red-orange-amber body with a frothy, finger-width, beige head that dissipates quickly and leaves a moderate lacing. Aroma is some bready caramels with a light toast. A light nutty and fruity hop barely creeps in here too. Flavor is a moderately sweet, light caramel and toasty toffee with a small amount of resiny, fruity bitterness. The hops come out more than the malts at the end and give this a nice, drying, light leafy bitter finish. Medium length aftertaste of lightly sweetened caramels, a hint of toasty toffee, and an even bitter fruit flavor. Medium bodied with a bit of a crisp carbonation. Overall, not as malt forward and toasty as most Oktoberfests, but tasty and balanced. The hop profile makes this somewhat different, which I found enjoyable.

Draught sample at the St Louis Park, MN location, October 8 2006. Very dark brown with just a hint of head, muddy/dirty looking....smoky, sweet, low-powered malty aroma, little to no hoppiness.....thick, sweet, a bit syrupy with tarry/burnt caramel malt dominating, the mouthfeel curiously too sticky at first but getting rather too dry and papery at the finish....like the other beers I sampled here itâ€™s the mouthfeel/finish that really undoes things.

Darker red, but still held onto some copper notes. Thin head but solid and lasting with an off white colour. The aroma was somewhat dull but held a bit of caramel, a bit of spice. The palate was a bit chewy and nice. Not sticky or creamy, or even heavy. Just a good feel in your mouth. The flavour was mostly caralmel like malt with some toast as well. The flavour is mostly sweet but still well balanced. Well done, not overly exciting but very very drinkable.
Absolutely gorgeous copper color. Otherwise an average Oktoberfest--somewhat malty, slightly sweet.

Malty aroma, lightly bready and toffeeish, with hints of hop spice (Hallertau?) and toasty barley. Medium copper-red color, with a lightly creamy, fine head. Caramel malt flavor, some brown sugar sweetness but nicely balanced by spicy hop bitterness, even some faint peppery notes at the end. Prickly finish. Good Fest style.

A very suprising offering from an average brew pub. Big beautiful biscuit like head topping off a sweet, malty, rich amber colored body. A well balanced Oktoberfest that can rival Goose Island and many other better known breweries.
Cask at GBBF 2011. Dark amber color. Sweet caramel aroma and flavor with citrusy hops and toasty-bready maltiness. Rounded and mellow.
Cask at GBBF 2011. Amber with a small white head. Sweet fruity aroma with toffee and caramel. Sweetish caramel and fruity flavour with a touch of black tea.

Cask gravity @ GBBF 2011. Pours a slightly hazy reddish amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty hoppy aroma. Fruity malty hoppy flavor with hints of citrus. Has a fruity malty hoppy bitter finish.
Cask at GBBF London august 2011.Amber beer with no head. Malty fruity aroma. Fruity flavor, berries, some hops.

3rd August 2011 GBBF. Cask. Hazy brown beer, residual off white head. Light dry palate. Semi rich malts with some toffee, tangy fruits. Dry finished. Well joined up and quite drinkable but lacks something.
Cask at GBBF. Amber body. Very smooth and rich with sweet malts. Nice perle hops.

Cask (gravity) @ GBBF 2011, Great British Beer Festival, Earls Court Exhibition Centre, London, England. Clear medium red - orange amber colour with a average, fizzy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, toasted - caramel, fruity - berry, moderate hoppy, dark ripped berries, woody, dry. Flavor is moderate to light light heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, woody hops. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft to flat. [20110803]
cask at GBBF 2011 ... dry spicy roast malt nose ... sweet toffee roast malt ... big vanilla front ... no real depth of balance.
GraviCask (GBBF2011, Wed) Deep orange, but flat. Sticky sweet aroma. Underattenuated sugary mash. Sickly, and boring as hell - no life, no verve, no crispness, no interest for me.
Cask @ GBBF, 2011. Pours amber with a small bubbly head. Berries, citrus, grain and caramel. Dry and a bit citrussy flavor. Medium bodied. Ends dry and hoppy.
Bottle - Malty orange with lots of caramel. Clear amber and a beige head. Sweet caramel and light hop bitterness. Very malty and nice.

12 oz. bottle, pours a hazy amber orange with a small off-white head. Aroma brings out bready malt, toasted caramel, and light resinous hops. Flavour is along the same lines, with toasted dry caramel, bready malt, and faded hop resins. Pretty laid back, but reasonably balanced. Itâ€™s alright.

Have had from bottle and on tap. Pours out a copper amber topped with a sand head. Nose is sweet caramel malt some bread along with a nice hop addition. Taste is more of the caramel malt sweetness and a nice crisp hop balance.

Ha! Canâ€™t recall how many times Iâ€™ve had this and yet havenâ€™t rated it til now. Colour...deep, clear amber with a corpulent off white head. Nose...pretty hoppy for an amber, with hints of biscuits and spent grain. Palate...crisp and slightly sweet, but definitely hoppy. In fact this is likely the hoppiest amber I ever had! The mid palate brims with hops and the finish is brisk and refreshing.
Bomber. Pours a copper red with an off white head and malty aroma. Taste is malty as well, with hops coming through along with caramel and bready notes into the finish.

With Z, pours an amber red color with a very flat head. Nose is sweet citrus with some caramel and toffee. Taste is a nice confluence of hops with sweet caramel vanilla malt. Full of flavo and drinks quite nicely. Finishes on the same well balanced malty hoops notes with a dry moderately abrupt ending. Nice ! Quaff Score 8 / 10

12oz bottle from a six pack that was gifted to me. Unfortunately, I always steer clear of hoppy and malt beers that have a penchant for caramel flavors. Hey, guess what, this is exactly that and I really donâ€™t like that flavor combo. Who does? Who do I give the rest of these beers.
Bottle (12oz $2) Reddish orange with thin head. Starts out malty - slightly sweet and fruity, but ends with some bitterness. Medium body.
Unassuming red that is refreshing with a clean mouthfeel. You still get a blast of hoppy goodness that belies its light aroma and slight head. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
22 July 2015, tap at Laurelwood Brewing Co in Portland airport. Reddish Amber, clear, no bubbles. Nose is mildly acidic Amber malt. Thin/med body and moderately fizzy. Toasty, acidic, copper. Ok.

Spicy, malty and rye aroma. Medium golden in color with a hint of amber. Good draft-style carbonation and head. Flavor is more sweet and light than the aroma or style would indicate initially. Light grain moving to a slightly honeyed finish, not much bitterness to be found here nor there. Boo for that. Not much going on here.

Pale golden color. Faint carbonation and head, surprisingly. Dryish malt aroma. Flavor is very bready, grainy and malty. Not a lot of sweetness here and just a little bitterness. Not too flavorful, but not offensive. I thought I detected some wheat malt a time or two, somehow.

column1: High Noon Wee Willies Kilt Lifter
column5: I was looking forward to trying this glass of Scottish-style ale, it looked really nice in the glass, all deep red, nice off-white head and promising maltiness. When I appraised the aroma, though, I knew I was not in for a treat. Aroma is faint, lightly fruity with some toffee. The malt flavor is very lightly smoky and vinous but is anything but assertive. Not much hop to speak of, either. Light and watery on the palate. Dang.
500 ml can. Bought in a carrefour in argentina. Usual lager, but with more bite
A german, golden Pilsner with white head. Aroma is malt, yeast, light raisin. Taste is bitter sweet.

0.5 l bottle from 'REWE' (Wyk), best before March 2020. Clear, golden with a medium large, frothy, almost stable, white head. Sweetish, minimally grassy-spicy aroma of grains, a touch of straw and traces of vegetables. Slightly sweet, moderately bitter, a little grassy-spicy and quite musty taste of grains, corn and traces of straw, followed by a short, moderately bitter, minimally grassy-spicy and a bit metallic finish. Thin to medium body, slightly effervescent mouthfeel, average carbonation. Far from great but still drinkable if cold enough.
Can. Straight from the can. Aroma and flavor are sweet, green peas, malt, sugar, extract. Overall: nah.

can from rema1000 valby. clear yellow, large smooth head. sweet almost wheaty aroma, some hops, style seems to be like southern german pils. flavor is more hoppy, also slightly sweet. also a somewhat brutal metallic bitterness that is not very nice. heineken, carlsberg and tuborg are better than this one, cause they lack the metallic bitter note. Also carlsberg and tuborg is more crisp and dry.
500ml can. Straight from the can. Sour, artificial hops, sweet, buttery in aroma and in taste. Nope.

Large creamy frothy white head. Good lacing. Mostly lasting. Clear sparkling yellow body. Aroma: light malt, light bread, cereal, metallic. Initial flavor: light sweet. Final flavor: very light sweet light bitter; average duration. Palate: light medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation, metallic finish. dulÃ§or maltado permeado por forte presenÃ§a metÃ¡lica no paladar, surgindo como defeito, vencimento em 11 meses, ligeiramente acima da mÃ©dia comercial brasileira, 4 s

Ã•lle on selline jook, et iga uus kord kui klaasi vÃµi pudeli suule tÃµstad, siis leiad midagi uut, sÃµltuvalt tuhandest-miljonist pisiasjast, mis hetke olukorda mÃµjutavad. Seega piirdun iga Ãµlle juures selle tekstiga.
Leicht sÃ¼ÃŸlich mit milder Perlung, dazu mit etwas Fantasie etwas Hopfen und Malz. Ganz ok.
15.05.2019. 0,5l Can. Rema 1000, Denmark. Pale golden yellow colour with white head. Grain and straw aroma. Flavours the same. Hay. Bitter and dry.
Draft pour. The beer is a clear brown with a beige head of foam. The beer has a fairly muted aroma. Taste has more roasty aspects and bitter dark chocolate. Medium body and medium carbonation.

Poured from bottle into a pint glass Appearance â€“ The beer pours a dark brown color with a one finger head of cream colored foam. The head has a good level of retention, slowly fading to leave a moderate level of lace on the sides of the glass. Smell â€“ The aroma of the beer is rather sweet with the biggest aromas being a mix of toffee and caramel. Along with these smells comes some more roasted malt smell and a nice hazelnut like smell. A little bit of chocolate is there is well, complimenting the sweet, roasted and nut nicely. Taste â€“ The taste begins with a sweeter flavor of caramel with a hint of toffee as well as a decently strong showing of a roasted malt taste. Right from the start there is a nice nutty flavor that grows stronger as the taste moves on forward. All the while the roasted tastes initially grow stronger in flavor and then end up later fading. With a little bit of earth and more caramel developing at the end, one is left with a smooth and sweet roasted nutty taste to linger on the tongue. Mouthfeel â€“ The body of the beer is on the somewhat thinner side with a carbonation level that is on the average to slightly higher side. A little thicker body and a lower carbonation level may have been slightly more appropriate for the nut and roasted flavors of the brew, but overall the feel wasnâ€™t too bad as it did make for an easy drinking feel. Overall â€“ A somewhat sweeter and nicely nutted brown ale that was rather easy drinking. Rather enjoyable overall.
Poured from 22 oz bottle. Pours a rich brown 1 finger head. Aroma malt, chocolate, coffee, subtle hops. Taste follows same way. A little more coffee than I expect from nut brown.

Bomber from the Canyon Village grocery in Yellowstone National Park. Pours ruddy dark brown with a transient beige head. Aroma is very chocolate with a hint of nuts. Med body. Flavor is chocolate with a little lightly greasy nuttiness. A very tasty brown ale that finishes nicely bitter.
A very strong nutty aroma, with a fairly strong nut flavor to the body as well. Okay, just not my style.

Aroma of roasted malts, nuts, and cola. Pours a cola brown with no head or lacing. The taste is much like the nose. Roasted malts, nuts, and grain with hints of coffee and a slightly bitter finish. Medium body with a medium carbonation. Overall, a very enjoyable and tasty beer.

Bottle - Rich coffee aroma with the slightest bit of alcohol. Rich opaque brown with a nice thin but persistent brown head. Roasted coffee, malts, tinge of bitterness and alcohol on the finish. The â€™nutâ€™ is lost on me but it is a nice dark beer, a little strong and more like a porter
On tap. Deep red with an off white head. Scent is sweet malts and nuts. Taste is earthy with caramel and chocolate.

650ml bomber bottle pours brown in color with a finger of white head that leaves some decent lacing on the glass. Aroma is mild but pleasant with roasted grains and chocolate. Taste is roasted grainy and hoppy bitterness with a chocolate malty sweetness. Light to medium body with decent carbonation. A nicely balanced brew that is recommended for a good tasting experience.
22oz bottle. Poured a deep amber, almost brown color with a small sized off white head. Aromas of roast, nuts, coffee grounds and earth. Tastes of roast, coffee, earthy, nuts, and caramel.

Nice smoked porter. This beer is all about the smoked flavor. From the very first sip to the very end the smoked flavor is there. Dark fruits with some chocolate form the body of the beer. But it is the smoked flavor that reigns over everything else. Best smoked beer for sure!

I have found this bottle, at one beer shop, at Bologna, the last year. Drinking and making an opinion about this beer, at home, at Epalinges, during the meal. The color is black, opaque, thin white and brown foam, regular carbonation for the style. In my point of view, it is a nice porter not that smocked. The taste is rather dry and mineral, a bit smocked, roasted malt, side of dark chocolate, smooth at the palate, dry hop, well balanced.

Robe trÃ¨s sombre mais pas noire, pas totalement opaque non plus, mousse faible et peu durable, brune, beaucoup de flocons de levure. Nez marquÃ© sur le fumÃ© (un peu "charcuterie", type schlenkerla), avec une pointe de cacao. Attaque fumÃ©e et subtilement torrÃ©fiÃ©e, trÃ¨s agrÃ©able, bel Ã©quilibre, avec un corps un peu crÃ©meux. LÃ©ger cÃ´tÃ© acidulÃ© sur les bords de la langue, vite masquÃ© par le crÃ©meux, la rondeur, et le fumÃ© qui s'y mÃªle profondÃ©ment. TrÃ¨s bon!
Murky brown. Aroma is cherry, a little smoke, some roast. Taste is a bit watery sweet cherry with a little nut. Medium drinkable. Not so great.
Old bottle. Chestnut brown, low offwhite head. Light oxidized roast, chocolate, rum notes, medium light body, dry, light dusty, roast, dry chocolate.

Bottle. Opaque fark brown color with off-white head. Aroma is roast, chocolate, fresh yeast. Taste is lightly oxidized, chocolate, liquorice, roast, black bread. Lightly chalky mouthfeel with natural carbonation. Alright!
0.33 bottle. Clear brown with short lasting head. Sweet malt aroma, a bit alcoholic/soy smelling. Flavor adds umami, very mild roast aroma.

Bottle: Deep amber coloured, presumably hazy, quickly collapsing loose tanned head, moderate sweet dark-malty nose with mild, but distinctive traces of wood-fire and a mild bitterness underneath; mild to moderate sweet-bitter flavour, pretty light bodied for a beer of 6.0%, but at least soft; mildly lingering bitter-sweet finish with toasty-roasty traces and hardly detectable smoky spots. Not really convincing....
SÃ¼ffiger, mild rÃ¶stig sÃ¼ÃŸer Beginn. Wenig getreidig, wÃ¤ssrig bitter, rund. Trocken, sinkende RÃ¶stigkeit, mittellanger Nachhall, monoton. 10/8/10/7//8
(fumÃ©, ~charcutâ€™, onctueuse, trÃ¨s vite > plate, fumÃ©e, pas intÃ©ressante ni rÃ©ussie (smoked : exercice pÃ©rilleux))
Found some old rating notes from TapNY 2013 that somehow never got entered. A solid IPA. Grapefruit/citrus fronted. Good other hop flavors as well.
From bottle. Aroma is citrus, grass and hops. Taste is citrus, pine and grapefruit. Hoppy and smooth. Decent mouthful. Bitter aftertaste. Overall very good ipa.
smooth, and light. Nice blend of powerful hop and maltiness. I could most likely kill a sixxer without thinking about it. Good IPA.

(draft @ Wagner Valley Brewing Company - Lodi, NY) Slightly hazy orange pour with a puffy white head. Mild hop aroma. Some citrus. Flavor is lightly hopped, not as dry as I would have thought, but has a nice citrus and juicy hop flavor. Finishes clean and lightly sweet.
Boldly hopped - very hoppy and bitter but a good drink. Bottle. Beer of the month hop lovers. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle... Poured amber orange with a thin head. Earthy, mildly hoppy with minimal bitterness. Foamy mouthfeel. Some citrus, lemon zest, bready malts. Clean finish. Sort of one dimensional.

355ml bottle from wegmans in niagara falls. deep muddy orange, almost red, with almost no head but carbonated well. its certainly unfiltered and might be bottle conditioned. deep hop resin nose, big a sweet cara malt stickiness also, muddled. the flavour has to much cara malt but is hopped well. not a bad beer, just not my kind of ipa.
Sampled at an esbls tasting. Coppery and clouded. Small foam. Nice and nig caramel and citrus aromas. Those are tasted, too. Bitterness is moderate. This is classic west coast territority. Nice.

Clear gold-orange, small off white head. Aroma a mix of citrus/grapefruit and malty grains. Medium body. Mildly bitter. Flavor is a balance of citrus-like hops and malt, Not too complex or anything but a decent IPA.

New Beer Distributors, NY 355ml ($1.25): Pours a pretty dark colour for an IPA. Aroma is caramel malt and a bit of hops. Taste is pretty much the same. The maltiness really takes things over pretty greedily. Hops are there, but the flavour is hardly stunning or anything.
Crisp and bitter, like the weather in Buffalo, NY, the day I drank this beer. Two-row and wheat malt are used.

On Tap at Brewpub Sold as Oktoberfest. Appearance :color of old gold , fine carbonation ,medium creamy top 3+ br>Nose :Soft , lightly sweet with malty feel , fruity side. Flavour/Palate : Medium light bodied , fruity base with drying alcohol. Not as smooth as one might wish for, Alcohol overexposed for such brew which is a shame.

Had it on tap at the Pearl Street Grill and Brewery, and tasted a lot like the first really good beer I tried (Yuengling), except maybe a little bit better. I was really blown away by how good this beer was, and it went well with my sirloin steak and potatoes. Everything was excellent.
Copper body, off-white head. Nose is caramel malt, slightly sour. Flavor is caramel, a bit of nut. Not much going on here.
Pretty bitter and malty. A decent Okto from an average brewery in a cold town in a great state.
Cask Handpump at the Smithfield Hotel, Manchester 01/09/2001 Amber coloured strong in alcohol and pale. Malt and wheat finish.

Cask at Charlieâ€™s Bar, Copenhagen. Hazy amber beer with a fine off-white head. Classic English bitter aroma of hop, malt and flower. Flat and rather mild flavor. Dry hoppy and light spicy with flower tones. All right but ordinary.
Cask, Dark amber color, light hoppy aroma, medium bitter dry fruity taste, medium body, bitter dry finish.
[Cask conditioned] Amber coloured. Fruity and slightly hoppy aroma. Fruity and rather malty flavour.

Cask Conditioned, at the Wenlock Arms, London. Deep amber coloured body. Thin grey vale. A comprehensive blend of malts greats you from the outset. Wide ranging with rich ripe fruit flavours. Balanced nicely by bitter length the beer drinks nicely, even if I was a tad cautious of the 4.8% ABV.

A beutiful amber beer with a good head. It has a very nice aroma of flowers and fruit and that it comes from a cask. The flavor is of a good maltblend, prickling your tongue and ending in a good bitterness. And ofcourse it has the cask feel.
Very nice. light in colour, citrus taste and smell. Easy to drink in the sun after a round of golf or along the seafront
Bottle: Pours golden with nice lasting white head, sweet orangey fruit cake aromas. Fresh clean fruity flavour, zesty. Slight bitter finish. Nice
Bottle from the brewery. Slightly milky. Not very exciting golden...dissapointing
Cask @ C4. Pours hazy Golden with a white head. Aroma citrus, bread, slight spicey. Refreshing fresh and clean slight yeast. Good stuff.
Cask. En rigtig fin Ã¸l, med masser af maltsmag, og en hel del blomsternoter fra humlen.

Pours gold from the bottle. The frothy white head slowly settles. Aroma is floral with hints of tropical fruits. Taste has a light citric tartness up front, finishes tart and mildly bitter. Very clean and very smooth. Body is fairly light but assertive enough. Refreshing. Overall, very well balanced and a pleasure to drink. If I could get this regularly I would see it being a favorite summer beer.
Regularly drunk by me. Only ever had it served from cask but I wouldn't have it any other way. Simply a superb hoppy golden ale.

On cask at the Scolt Head, Islington. Pours pale golden with a white top. Aroma: light malts, citrus, some grass. Taste: light to moderate sweet, floral, citrus & stone fruits. Light bodied with moderate carb & a gentle bitter finish. Solid enough

Cask at the Queens Head, Chelmsford. Pours golden with a small slightly creamy off-white head. Aroma of hop, citrus, malt, flowers and light biscuit. Moderate sweetness and medium bitterness. Medium body, slight oily texture, soft carbonation.

500ml bottle. Clear pale golden colour with a thin white head. Aroma: tropical fruits, malt. Taste: sweet malt, tropical/citrus fruit, peach, light bitterness. Medium body with a smooth mouthfeel, light-medium carbonation. Very easy drinking and sessionable, more flavour than most in this style and nicely balanced.

Gravity dispense at the Royal Standard, Wooburn Common, 19/01/19. Extremely dark mahogany brown with a decent beige cap formed of bubbles. Nose is bourbon biscuit, cocoa sprinkle, dark malts, toffee. Taste comprises chocolate, light spice, dried fruits, brown sugar, brown bread. Medium bodied, soft to moderate carbonation, semi drying close. Decent enough porter.

[Cask at the Royal Standard, Wooburn Common.] A flat looking cola brown pour; with an aroma of coffee and roasted malts; rather thin in the mouth with well roasted chocolate malts; and a dry, earthy, nutty finish with some warmth. Ultimately satisfying.
Cask @ The Salopian. Pours dark brown, off-white head. Aroma is chocolate, dark malts. Taste is smooth, dark malts, chocolate, light sweetness, liquorice. Nice porter.
Cask. Frothy off-white good mostly lasting head. Black colour. Moderate malty and light hoppy aroma. Moderate bitter flavor. Roast and oyster. Average moderate bitter finish. Creamy palate.

bottle at home from abm slightly plasticky, gushing, probably infected, luckily doesnt pass through into flavour which is a little meaty and savoury with toasty malt but unfortunately overly fizzy and thin.

Draught (Elm Tree, Cambridge) Lovely gently chocolatey roasty aroma. Deep ruby, small loose head. Also coffee in the aroma later. Soft palate, carbonation low. Good roasty body, but not living up to the publicity put out by the aroma. Nice burnt finish. Pretty solid porter, though, canâ€™t complain - worth it just for the experience of it under your nose.
Bottle Aroma-caramel, Appearance-brown, clear, beige foam Taste-light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, Palate-light body, thin feel, average carbonation, bitter finish Overall-disappointing

Cask @ The Wharf, Aalborg. Clear dark brown with a tiny off-white head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt and a little coffee. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and roasted moderate bitter finish. 250415

500ml bottle. Clear, ruby red glowing, dark brown colour with average to huge, fluffy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, off-white head. Dark malty aroma, slightly roasty, hints of malt lozenge, slightly floral and herbal hoppy overtones, some liquorice. Taste is roasty dark malty, dry, minimally chalky, floral hoppy overtones, subtle sweetness; light & thin.
Cask@Charlies Bar, Copenhagen - dark brow pour with a reddish hue. Aroma and taste is roasted malty, cocoa, caramel, rye, nice roasted notes throughout, very nice.

Had this beer on tap at there pub on 4/23/2003. Aroma none. Color lightly hazed gold. Taste, well not good. Starting with light body goes with a sour feel. Finish is a sour malt taste that just gets worse. This is as bad as the thing they call a Pale Ale.

Draught. Body is murky light amber. Aroma is lightly yeasty (dough), with light notes of orange peel and clove. Flavor is moderately sweet, moderately acidic. Finish is lightly sweet, lightly acidic. Light to medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation.
(draft 6/28/10). Clear gold color. Small white head. Sweet grainy aroma with light hops. Moderate grainy flavor. Avg duration. Light dry finish. Thin texture. Soft carbonation. Spare lacing.
Nice mild with a light flavor and a bit of a kick. Don't miss this brewery if you are anywhere near it! Vacation 03
Very good version of a mild. Good maltiness to it with very little hop bite.

Turbid brown lager with a thick creamy light moka head. Lightly mineral malt aroma. In mouth, a nutty malt with light German hopping, and cereal and grassy notes. So-so. On tap at brewpub Oct. 10 2008.
Pours amber. Smells of tangy malt. Taste is of caramel and roses. Great session beer.
Crisp, sharp and hoppy with a very heavy aftertaste that "grows on you" after a few sips. Quite smooth.

This had a nice malty/earthy aroma and good orange color, largish head; it went downhill from there. Very hoppy on the front and end, with somewhat interesting (though still bitter and not very malty) earthy and woodsy tones in the middle; finish is bitter indeed. Just doesn''t fit my idea of an Octoberfest, more like a dry undermalted IPA. Pass.
50 cl bottle. Pale golden color. No head. wood notes.Average carbo. Medium sweetness. Low bitterness. More like a Helles.
09-Apr-2016-0,5 L Flasche/bei Rolf mit/ von Markus. Goldgelb, klar, weisser Schaum. Aroma metallisch, getreidig. Antrunk dito.

Bottle. Clear yellow with a medium sized white head. Nose has flowers, perfume, hay, grass, lemon, dust. Flavour has flowers, dust, light perfume, hay, citrus. Medium body, soft carbonation, medium sweet and bitter. Mouthfeel is good. Long light dry hoppy finish. Somewhat subtile, but refreshing and easy to drink.
Pours a golden color, small white head, grainy nose with floral notes. Moderate bitterness.
*Old rating. Best before 06.09. Plain and grainy-neutral Pils. Neutral bitter, hints of grain, crisp but a bit flat.
Clear golden color. Aroma of grass and hay. Taste is very sweet. It much bitterness for a Pils.
Bottle bought at Landbierparadies Nuremberg. Bottle looks very simple but okay. Beer in the glass zippy, nice head. Starts mild, a bit washy, malty, light spicy. Hoppy notes a bit metallically. Okay.

#637 Eher satt golden als hellgelb. Die Blume ist leider zu schnell verschwunden. Ein leichtes Hopfen-Aroma ist vernehmbar. Im Antrunk dann eher malzig und sehr liquide; wird erst gegen Ende verhalten herber. Ich habe schon herbere Helle aus Bayern getrunken als dieses Pils, also ein gaaanz milder Vertreter dieser Brauart. Bestimmt nicht die Krone der Pilsener, aber sÃ¼ffig und daher ganz ordentlich, zumindest trinkbar! Test vom 4.2.2011, Gebinde: Glasflasche Noten: 10,9,10,9,8,9 - 9,20
Herb trockener, recht wÃ¤ssriger Beginn. SpÃ¤ter eher bitter als herb, leider bleibt die WÃ¤ssrigkeit bestehen. Gering getreidig, eindimensional. 8/6/7/5/8/6
SÃ¼ÃŸlich-getreidiger Geruch. Im Antrunk wiederum sÃ¼ÃŸlich-hopfig. Ab dann etwas dumpf, malzig-wÃ¼rzig. Etwas Ã¼bersteuerter bitterhopfiger Abgang. Geht so.Test vom 9.11.2010, Gebinde: Glasflasche

Bottle - as Drachengold. Amber coloured, mid-sized fluffy off-white head, that slowly collapses to a stable beige layer. Sweet caramel and toasted malt and distinctive herbal hops in the nose. Solid sweet-bitter flavour, medium bodied. Lingering toasty finish with a long hoppy aftertaste. Very well balanced, hoppy Bock, moreish in any case.......

bottle, thank you MoritzF! Clear brown colour, large beige head. Malty nose. Full-bodied, intensively malty but not too sweet. Shy fruity character with hints of dried fruit, e.g prunes and raisins. Spicy and aromatic hoppy finish.

(bottle) Clear, mahogany colour with a thick and dense, light-beige foamy head. Sweet, slightly toasted malty aroma with anise, a touch of caramel and lighter, subtle fruity hops in the background. Sweet flavour, full bodied with a pleasantly calm carbonation. Aromatic and moderately toasted malt-profile with spicy anise-like accents; medium-dry, malt-accented finish, rounded up with spicy and herbal hoppy notes. A rounded brew (08.X.08).
Bottle. Amber colour with a little head. Aroma of malt, caramel and sweetness. Flavour of sweet malt, caramel and ends with a alcoholic finish.
Bottle. A amber beer with a white head. The aroma is of caramel malt, the taste is sweet caramel malt, straw and alcohol. Medium body with a sweet finish.
From 50 cL bottle. Pours brown with a lacing head. Slight roasted malty sweet aroma. Sweet caramel flavoured, mild malty note. Malty finish. Good.
Bottled. A copper colored beer with a fast disappearing beige head. The aroma is of caramel and alcohol. The flavor is sweet malty with notes of caramel and alcohol.

(Bottle 50 cl) Clear, amber golden with an off-white head. Very roasted malt aroma. Quite full-bodied, very clean malt base with a distinct, sweetish roasted feel - even some overripe fruit. The bitterness is very discreet. Lovely. 290607

Bottle. Small fizzy off-white head that mostly diminished. Fair lacework. Clear flat looking body with an amber color. Aroma of bread, caramel, grain, toasted and fruity notes. Medium bodied with an average carbonation. Moderated sweet flavor, hint of bitterness. Sweet finish.
Malty, just a bit smokey aroma. Malty taste with a bit of toast, pear and hops. A Hint of licorice. On the thin side for a bock beer.

On tap @ Lucky Labrador. Clear orange pour with a white head. Buttery nose. A bit of bread and some cracker. Not much in the way of hops either, particularly for an IPA. The flavor is full of buttered bread and sweet malts. No real bitterness or hop flavor. Maybe a little orange rind. Scroll past.
Soured hop profile. Amber, medium body, regular head. Nothing amazing, but worth the drink.

Last stop in Portland during ABA Beer Tour 07. On draught as "Organic IPA" at the brewpub pours a clear golden amber brew with a fast dissolving white head. Aroma of light caramel malt, some sour apple, and flowery hops. Taste is slightly carbonated, medium bodied, a little syrupy, with a light bready with earthy hop flavors. Finish is light and smooth with a flat bitter aftertaste that lingers around for a while.
Amber with a nice lasting head, Aroma is floral with some citrus. Malty and hoppy and well balanced. Nice bitter finish.

Half pint tasted at the LL Beer Hall in Portland, OR. Cask. FLoral, almost acidic hoppiness in the nose with some metallic notes. Rather faint aroma. Transparent light copper color with a frothy whitish head. Why is this transparent?? A very English style IPA. Lots of metallic flavor with biscuity maltiness to start. Finishes with mild bitter floral hoppiness. A welcome change from the typical palate-bludgeoning hoppiness of many of the IPAs in the PNW.

Portland tap. Golden color. Aroma was weak with hops. Simple flavor, med bitterness with a highly bitter finish that lingered. Just one thanks. Dirty lines, bad batch? Very different from the other opinions.
Hazy blond colour. Light hoppy aroma. Dry and bitter. Not offering a ton of flavour variety. Just bitter hoppiness and these arenâ€™t really the hops Iâ€™d pick first for that sort of beer.
