Shaker at brew pub, 5/14/2010. Dark amber some off white head. Malt, some coffee and bread. A little thin in the mouth. Good finish with just a touch of hop bite on the tip of the tongue. Good beer for the style.
Vanilla and caramel dominate this nice offering. Carbonated. Malty. Not intensely dark or sweet, but the best Flat Branch Iâ€™ve had in awhile.

Sampler @ brewpub. It has a clear but dark burgundy brown color and comes with no head but a bit of hairline halo white around the edge. Aroma is full of sweetness. dark fruits, alcohol. At this point I figured out its a doppelbock. Taste follows suite. It was in a rather weird place, way beyond the point of what a regular doppelbock should be but not far enough into the Samiclaus territory. I feel they need to either tone it down and bring it back to normal or make the full push to the dark side.
2005 vintage on tap at the brewery. Aroma of dark malts and a little bit of smoke. Flavor is sweet malt with ripe fruits, very light smoke, and woodiness.

On tap at brewery:A grape nose like Dimetapp cough syrup which rang well into the flavor which gave that burn/itchy throat sensation you get from a grape icee-pop. Deep near black color and decent head, but whereâ€™s the complexity? The balance? come on, give me something to appreciate. The yeasts were stale and lifeless, the malts simple and hella sweet and the hops was nonfunctional. Alas, a immature, underdeveloped and lazy attempt at a style that demands respect and tradition. Flat Branch isnâ€™t serious enough for a brew of this difficulty.

Draught: The beer is a opaque brown, with some tan head. Serious malt taste and nose. I also get some fruit notes to the nose, of which cherries appear to be the most evident. The taste has some evidence of the cherries as well as a hint of roastiness. Served only in a 10oz. glass. I suspect the alchohol content is quite high, but it isn't noticeable.
Medway Beer Festival. A pleasantly malty ale with lively fruit such as strawberry. Very pleasant aroma of cherry liquor chocolate. Nice beer.
Hand pulled at the Swan and Rushes, Leicester. Brown, smooth, soft head and lacing. Metal aroma. Metally beer generally, with some sweet fruit malt through the finish. Pleasant but not amazing.
From the Bell in Nottingham, on hand pump from the Cask. Mid brown in colour. A good reliable standard bitter, an easy choice but a good choice.

Cask at Ye Olde Trip To Jerusalem, Nottingham. Almost glowing red body with a thick white head. Juicy fruit indeed, in fact make that Hubba Bubba, itâ€™s that chewy. Maltiness in the finish saves it from being that tad too sickly. Really easy drinking, real shame irâ€™s a short seasonal. More, please!
Ruby red in colour. Aromas are fruity berries - full bodied and similar to Vimto. This is a light easy drinker of a beer. Malts are fruity and moreish. One to guzzle.
Cask Conditioned at a Wetherspoons. Red amber beer with thin head. A sweet malty, autumnal fruit beer, with lasting juiciness. There are chemical notes at the finish though.
Airy head, sweet and fruity flavour from the amber beer. A very palatable beer, almost great.

column2: North Little Rock, Arkansas, United States
column5: Pours a cloudy orange red with a good head of foam and decent retention. Smells and tastes bready and grainy, definitely not overly sweet. .could use more of that, imho. Pretty ample body and carbonation. Just another average Oktoberfest.

column2: North Little Rock, Arkansas, United States
column5: Bottle: Nearly clear amber, with a creamy beige head. Lactic caramel scent. Tangy, caramel malt, slightly sour, acidic taste..... A little rough.

column2: North Little Rock, Arkansas, United States
column5: Bottle. Milk caramel malt and hay aroma. Dark amber with moderate head. Moderately sweet caramel malt, moderately sour lactic acid, and mildly bitter hay flavor. Okay body. Decent but way too acidic.

column2: North Little Rock, Arkansas, United States
column5: Bottle... Pours clear and amber with flashes of copper and a small, creamy, white head. The aroma is an eclectic assortment of maltiness, toastiness, nuttiness and fruitiness â€“ fruitcake drizzled with warm liquid toffee. Full-bodied with modest carbonation. The flavor is fairly rich and malty, but not sweet - excellent balance. In fact, this actually trends slightly bitter in the finish. Whatâ€™s not to like? Bottle courtesy of BVery!

column2: North Little Rock, Arkansas, United States
column5: Pours a copper gold color. Two finger head, okay lacing. Itâ€™s not clear, itâ€™s a little cloudy, and a little sediment floating around in there. Aroma is amazing. Itâ€™s quite malty, and a little hoppy. Quite bready. It is quite sweet smelling. It smells like a Caramello bar. Such a high caramel aroma, I want to take a bath in it.. With a nose like that you would expect the taste to follow suit. But not so fast. Iâ€™m a little disappointed in the taste. Itâ€™s very malty in taste, itâ€™s also a little hoppy. Itâ€™s bready. Itâ€™s sweet, but Iâ€™m not so much tasting the caramel I was smelling. Iâ€™m really tasting the malts. Itâ€™s very bready to the taste. Itâ€™s a little sweet, but very bready. Mouthfeel is excellent. Itâ€™s easy drinking. Itâ€™s sweet, and dry. Thereâ€™s barely any bitterness. Itâ€™s highly drinkable, and 6.1% ABV, is barely noticeable. Itâ€™s medium body at best. Maybe just a tiny bit of bitterness on the finish. Overall, this is really good. Absolutely try this one if you can find it. I wish that caramel on the nose could make it into the taste. But otherwise, itâ€™s still a fine Marzen!

column2: North Little Rock, Arkansas, United States
column5: Refrigerated 12 oz. brown bottle, BVery with the hookup, poured into an English pint glass. Slightly hazy copper with small off-white head. Aroma is light herbal hops, medium body, medium carbonation, and little small lacing. Taste is caramel malt, some slightly oxidized bread, some herbal hops, hints of dark chocolate, and slightly bitter finish. Slightly past its prime.

column2: North Little Rock, Arkansas, United States
column5: Bottle. Orange amber pour with a small white head. Toast and caramel. Fairly plain and simple. About what I expected.

column2: North Little Rock, Arkansas, United States
column5: Bottle@ trailer. Bright amber color with ivory foam. Vegetal, caramel, bready yeasty aromas. Smooth medium body. Nice toast, lightly sweet spicy caramel, bready, lagered flavors---not too bad.

column2: North Little Rock, Arkansas, United States
column5: Bottle. Clear amber color, fluffy of white head. Aroma of cereal and caramel. Taste is bittersweet caramel.

column2: North Little Rock, Arkansas, United States
column5: "Light roast and a pleasant caramel sweetness in the nose. Pretty light all-around, though. Flavor has similar attributes plus a hint of butterscotch and crisp hops in the finish. OK, but nothin special

From Aug 2008 I got this bottle in a trade with jwc215. Thanks Joe! It pours a clear copper colour with a 1 finger head of foam. There's a little bit of lacing and the head retention is average. The smell has a nice mix of citrus hops and caramel malt with the hops being more noticeable. The taste is pretty hoppy. I get some citrus and some grass and the malt is rather subdued; just a slight sweetness and breadiness right before the finish. The mouthfeel is on the thin side and kind of slick, the carbonation is on the light side, and it finishes with a mild grassy bitterness. Well, everything flavourwise seems to be on the mild side but what's there is good and it sure is drinkable enough. I could put a couple away with ease. Pretty good stuff.

This was poured into a pint glass. The appearance was a dark rugged amber color with a fingerâ€™s worth of foamy white head that dissipated at a nice pace. Slow moderate lace. The aroma takes on a blend of caramel and toffee malts to blend with some citrus bitter hops. The flavor balances nicely between the citrusy bitter hops to the sweetness of the malts. Light blended aftertaste with finish. On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium on the body with a nice sessionability about it. Low carbonation feels good, nice and low. Overall, good amber ale that I would come back to.
Bottle during RBWG. Pours a cloudy orange with large frothy white head. The aroma is strong citrus and spruce. Medium mouth, citrus and pine, good.

Aroma: Citrus (burnt orange), molasses, pine, flat Appearance: Deep, golden orange. Gorgeous, thick, creamy, coffee colored, three finger head that disappeared slowly. Taste: Citrus front-end, raisins. Palate: Flat front-end that doesnâ€™t liven up. Overall: I poured this 12 oz. bottle into a glass in which I like to drink beer. It drank as I thought this American Ale would. RateBeer member nittanytide summed it best, "Pretty one-dimensional, but a decent hoppy pale ale." #respectbeerbrethren
16 oz draft pours a dark amber color with a small white head. Aromas of sweet malt, caramel, light floral. Medium bodied, enjoyable.
Not a great beer for me. Very short experience. Almost no floral components. More flavors of cardboard than enjoyable flavors.

Poured from 12oz bottle. Hazy pumpkin coloration. Smell is caramel and faint fruit juice. Taste is dry, somewhat metallic, with pineapple at the end. Healthy carbonation, but minimal head. This beer is missing any notified hops and as a result is two dimensional. Decent.
Bottle in hotel room orlando.. Thanks John... Copper... Massive off white foam head... Soct sweet woody malt nose.. Dark roast... Light bitter roast...
Bottled. Pours a clouded brown. A bit overly malted and mild hops. Not too great really.

Pours a hazy amber with a white head. Aroma of hops and slightly toasted grain. Taste is smooth with a bit of pineapple up front that quickly dissipates as the bitterness takes over yielding a bit of coconut and tart in the finish. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at the brewpub. Orange pour with a thin white head. Muted hop aroma. Tastes are grain, sweet hops, light bitter. on the malty side.
Hazy orange with off white lacing. Very slight lemon peel on the nose. Palate has some citrus hops, and is easy-drinking but otherwise non-descript.

I liked the organic IPA they had better but this isnâ€™t bad. Pours a dark amber with a caramel and malt aroma. Some citrus comes through too. The flavor is a little sweet with the hops more subdued than you would expect. Dry finish.
Light hazy gold, big white head. Aroma of toffee, fruit, light resin. I had this on draft but the taste seems a little old and mellowed. Lots of fruity malt sweetness, mild bitter finish.
Almost clear amber color with lasting white head. Spicy, pine sap aromas with black pepper. Medium bodied. Lightly sweet grainy caramel, mild black pepper, spicy hop flavors--good

Draught@Fish Tale brewpub, Olympia Clear deep amber-copper color, steady off-white head, lace. Lemony, fruity hoppyness in the nose. Medium-bodied. Woody, piney, pine needles and rye bread in the flavor. Less hoppyness than IBUs indicate. Fish Taleâ€™s Organic IPA was quite a lot better.
Tap: Semi-cloudy color with a fizzy white head and mild spotty lacing. grassy aroma as well as some citrus. Bitter flavors, a bit tangy, musty flavor. Pretty good.

2010-06-29. Crisp dark golden yellow, too full pour is headless. Flavour is mild, light modest bitterness throughout, modest pale malt touches. Average palate is lightly carbonated. Mild grainy aroma, muted hops. not much going on. On tap at Fishbowl pub, Olympia

[3029-20100629] Tap. Mild mango fruit malt aroma. Clear, medium orange body with quick white bubbles. Astringent honeyed evergreen hops flavout. Medium-full body. Bitter, interesting to try. (@ Fishbowl Brewpub, Olympia, WA)
On tap at the fishbowl pub. Pours orange in color with a thin white head. More hops are needed to this dishwater pale ale. The finish is quick and very watery.

Gold with a frothy white head. Cereal aroma, a touch grassy. Taste is mildly sweet, with a clean and crisp bitterness to round out the finish. A hint of apple at the end. Medium body with soft carbonation. Well rounded, drifts down feathery light. Pleasant enough.
Bottle. Blonde. Maltaroma and flavor with soft floral and vegetable notes. Hint of apple. Blandish helles.

Bottle from Speciaalbierpakket. Aroma is grainy malt with mild grassy notes, hay, and some pronounced noble hops in the finish. Flavour is light to moderate sweet and moderate bitter. Body is a little below medium. Clean and nicely grainy, pretty good.

Bottle @ home. Clear golden color, decent to medium sized white head that lasts for a decent while. Aroma is hayish. Taste lightly malts, hay, lightly bitter. I don't get the "fruity and tangy" flavors the description says the beer has, but it's a very fine kolsch imo. Maybe not stylewise (I know nothing about that) but it definitely tastes fine to me.

I was brought up on Altbier which is dark. KÃ¶lsch is blond, both are top-fermented, but coming from an Altbier-region, KÃ¶lsch is off-scope by definition. So I have troubles getting over a Blond Altbier. Trying to be more objective, I experienced this beer as rather flat in taste, missing essential flavors to stand out.
Clear golden with little white head. Aroma is catfood, fish, tobacco, musty I dont even wanna know. Taste is more or less the same. Spiky. Undrinkable.
Bottle. Clear golden color with white head. Aroma is grainy, earthy, papery, dog food. Taste is the same. High carbonation. What exactly is KÃ¶lschy about this?

Flasche (50 cl) vom Tegut-GetrÃ¤nkemarkt im Kaufland Marburg-Wehrda. - Eine â€žobergÃ¤rige SpezialitÃ¤tâ€œ aus Hessen - kann das gutgehen? - Strohgelb, klar. - In der Nase etwas scharfe aber dÃ¼nne Zitrusfrucht, Mandarine, ansonsten blaÃŸ. - Antrunk mild zitrusfruchtig mit zarter SchÃ¤rfe. DÃ¼nnes helles Gerstenmalz. GewÃ¶hnlich rezent, beinahe wÃ¤ÃŸrig, trocken. Im Abgang milde aber knackige Hopfenherbe mit blassen Noten von Mandarine und Zitronenschale. - Der Altbiercharakter ist kaum ausgeprÃ¤gt; die versprochenen â€žfruchtigen, frisch-herbenâ€œ Aromen kommen von der zarten doch aromatischen Hopfung. Etwas dÃ¼nn aber Ã¼berraschend gut.
Clear yellow, white lacing foam head. Strong barley aroma, smooth drinking. Barley taste, a stronger KÃ¶lsch. Lasting aftertaste. (Fulda 201602)

Bottle @ DÃ˜E meeting. Pours clear yellow with a white head. Aroma of malt, grain, hay. Flavor is light sweet, malt, grain, grassy hops, light citrus. Thin to medium body, average carbonation, light bitter finish. 210115
Yellow body and a bit of white foam, sweet hop and grain notes on the nose. Flavour is muddy malt and chewy hops, sugar. Medium finish. Awkward but drinkable since it's served so cold.

On tap at Sailor Hagarâ€™s, pours a say golden with a small white head. Nose brings out corn, maybe a touch of honey, and grass. Flavour brings out light honey and crisp crackery malt. Served way too cold, so the flavours arenâ€™t coming out that well, not that itâ€™s very potent to begin with. Decent pils.
Draught at Sailor Hagarâ€™s The aroma is light, it reminds me some cider. Dry mouthfeel, malt and caramel flavor, maybe with a light trace of honey at the end; strong bitterness. Simple.

Pint on tap at Sailor Hagarâ€™s in North Vancouver. Beer is brewed by Howe Sound Brewing and is Howe Sound Pilsner Plunge under a sudonym. Appearance: Orangey gold and slightly opaque, with a vibrant bubbly white head that quickly recedes to a gentle ring, but leaves lots of lacing. Aroma: Not overpowering, but inviting. Subtle honey, and the kind of crisp hop aroma you can only get from a good quality pilsner. Taste: Crisp and refreshing, with subtle honey and a big hop flavour. Lots of bitterness and some tart citrus flavours from the hops. This beer shows how both a honey lager and a pilsner should be made, unlike many others in the Pacific northwest. Pilsners in the PNW tend to be a little sweet for the style, but this beer from Howe Sound only has subtle sweetness from the honey, with no other unfortunate sweetness. It is very tempered with the hops, so the overall flavour is bitter, not sweet, with the honey adding complexity and flavour rather than rich sweetness. The finish is very long and bitter, only slightly dry, with hints of honey and subtle grassiness from the Saaz hops, and is intensely rewarding. One of the nicest pilsners anywhere in the world. Mouthfeel: Medium bodied and faintly silky from the honey. Drinkability: Very moreish. Simply not possible to only have one of these exceptional pilsners.

(Draught) Pours a medium, foamy white head with a amber body. Nose of mild English malts and a touch of honey sweetner. The flavour lines-up similarly with the additional Czech Pils hoppiness and bitter finish. Somewhat average at best.

I donâ€™t know if theyâ€™ve changed the recipe since I last had this, but it seems to be improved. Pale golden, creamy white head. Pale malt aroma with some light honey underneath but also a fairly assertive Saaz aroma. Spicy flavour with a touch of breadiness. Lingering bitterness. Quite a surprise, actually.

This was always the crapper of the Hagarâ€™s lineup, but itâ€™s gone straight up macro since Howe Sound took over. Light straw colour. Grainy aroma with doughy yeast note and ultra bland hops. I doubt theyâ€™re using teutonic nor slavic varieties anymore. Probably more like Willamette or something equally flavorless, and in miniscule quantities.
Golden colour with a small head. Aroma is light honey and malts. Some hop flavour but mostly thin and sweet.
Light golden in color with a light sweet honey aroma. Mostly hop flavour with a bit of honey, poor aftertaste.
Sweet cloying flavour with a stale bitter finish. eh.......................

Bottle 16fl.oz. [ Vintage ]. Clear medium amber colour with a small to average, fizzy, virtually none lacing, fully diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, oxidide, berry - honey alike. Flavour is moderate sweet and light to moderate bitter with a long duration, tart, fruity. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20130223]

Bottle 48 cl. Courtesy of fiulijn. Pours a cloudy amber with a small off-white head. Tart honey aroma. Medium body, nutty tart and again honey accents. The tartness grows towards sour in the finish. Sort of like a dry Mead! 230213
16 fl oz bottle. Pours cloudy orange with a small off white head. Aroma is perry and citric. Sour and citric. Tart and citric. Bitter and citric finish.
Bottle at Alex. Hazy orange-red coloured with a small off-white head. Sweet and fruity aroma of caramel with oxidized notes. Fruity flavour of overriped fruits with notes of caramel. Fruity finish.
Courtesy of Anand, 6+ years old Dark brown color with almost no head. The aroma is similar to Madeira. The flavor is acidic. Well off; undrinkable.
22oz bomber-An amber body with no head and an aroma of malt and hops. Taste the same with some bitterness and a nasty funk. Not sure what they were going for but they didnâ€™t hit the mark.

Nothing great, but I do feel for those that obviously bought bottles that had been on shelves for years - much like my rating here - long tucked away and forgotten. This was never a world class ESB but was okay, caramel and fair bitterness with medium body and easy quaffability. If these people had been given better distribution they may have avoided the shame that was cast their way.

The prevailing observation amongst those who have rated Great Grains crap is, "Geez, I mustâ€™ve gotten a bad bottle." No, you didnâ€™t. Their putrid filth is JUST THAT BAD, folks. This is an ESB like Billy Joel is a punk rock legend. There is nothing here but rotten water, corn, and water buffalo turds. I think "Yellow Roseâ€™s" used tampon was drained and bottled for this.

Poured deep amber with NO head...ironically, perhaps I got a bad bottle!! HAHAHAHAHA!!!! Smells like rancid fish guts and peanuts...taste is horribly nasty with malt and sour...aftertaste is somewhat vegetable and shit like...by far this IS their worst beer...

bottle from Lumpy, Fuck you Lump for sharing this shit. smells like easter egg dye. hell it even looks like the water remnants from easter egg dye, or water paints. flavor is better than i expected, but i expected it to taste like warm cough medicine and stomach bile. this is just overly sweet vinegar, at least iâ€™m not in pain from it. I would think this is a bad bottle, but iâ€™ve had a few other beers from this brewery and i know it isnâ€™t

Draught. Body is medium brown. Aroma is moderately yeasty (cobwebs), moderately malty (dark bread, caramel), with notes of clove, banana, raisin, and brown sugar. Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation.

Big and roasty, burnt toast malt flavors. Healthy dose of rich bitterness with some warming ethyl. Chewy sweetness, followed by a biting and spikey sourness. Big alcohol is soft and rounded, hidden well behind the malt presence. Slight cardboard off-flavor, but it was very subdued. Overall, it wasn''t bad, just didn''t explode with complexity in my mouth.

Hazy golden. Aroma is much yeast with unripe green flavours and a little coriander. Taste is sweet yeasty bready body with some sour and greenish counterpoint. A bit too sour and flat in the finish. Ok.
Creamy white good mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. Moderate malty and light hoppy aroma. Moderate bitter flavor. Average light bitter finish. Oily palate.

getrunken auf der Braukunst live 2013 Ein bayrisches Weizenbier, wie man es sich wÃ¼nscht: klare fruchtige Aromen vor einem mild-malzigen KÃ¶rper. Dazu ein Schuss Hopfen, der sich zwar weit im Hintergrund hÃ¤lt, aber nicht ganz abtritt. EIn wirklich tolles Weizenbier
Hazy yellow with a nice huge white head. Malty, yeasty, sweetish, bananas, creamy, lively carbonation.

500 ml bottle. Hazy yellow, big fluffy head. Eastery notes, yeast, lemon, a bit metallic. Acidic sourness, some bitterness and minimum sweetness. Medium bodied, soft carbonated, acidic metallic finish. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught @ The Brewery. Pours Hazy dark yellow with a creamy white head. Aroma of wheat, yeast, little sweet fruit, banana. Flavor is sweet, wheat, yeast, sweet fruit, banana. Medium body, lively to very high carbonation. 150717

Bottle. Cloudy honey yellow. Brief white head. Aroma: vague esters and phenols, strange vegetable notes, perfume. Light body. Wheaty taste. Bready. Fruity. Minimal phenols. Low bitterness. Did not get it.

(Flasche) Es hat eine matte hellgelbe Farbe, ist unfiltriert mit einer weiÃŸen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist sehr hefig, sÃ¼ÃŸ mit Honig und Malz. Der Geschmack ist samtig, sÃ¼ÃŸlich mit einer Zitrusnote, Hefe und etwas warmer Heuschober. Auf der Zunge bleibt eine leicht sÃ¼ÃŸlich-sÃ¤uerliche Note zurÃ¼ck.

Drinked in bottle. At the nose mature Banana, parsley, yeast and chestnut honey. In mouth is light carbonated but very drinkable and well balanced. Notes of honey, cereals and mature Banana. A very good weizen

Draught at the brewery. Hazy, deep gold to light orange colored. AROMA- wheat, vanilla and honey, touch of bananas. FLAVOR- neutral, slightly sour and bitter, wheaty, yeasty. Medium bodied. Average weissbier.

(Flasche) Es hat eine orangene Farbe, ist trÃ¼b mit einer weiÃŸen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist sehr hefig, mit leichter Bananennote und einer leichten SÃ¼ÃŸe. Der Geschmack ist hefig, fruchtig, vllt. mit etwas Mandarine und sehr viel Karbonisierung.
Syrlig banan og frisk, som en hvedeÃ¸l plejer at smage......................
Bottle. Light hazy amber with a White head. Aroma bana yester, caramel, light spice, light grain, light fruits. Taste is very bananaish, yeasty, malts, caramel, touch of citrus.
From bottle. Pours hazy amber with a white head. Aroma of banana, lots of esters, marshmellows, candy, light spicy notes. Taste is banana, sweet, esters, light marshmellows, light yeasty and spicy,
(Bottle 24/10-2015) very large white head, slightly unclear orange, solid wheat beer. BB date 25.11.15.

bottle @ DÃ˜E. Appearance: pours cloudy amber/orange with good off-white soapy head and lacing. aroma/taste: wheat, banana, straw and some caramel hints. palette medium yeasty aroma, average carbonation, light to medium body, notable sweetness, not quite balanced by an low to average bitterness, medium duration and a watery texture. Overall: standard weizen

Draft @ Ã˜lfestival 2015. Pours a hazy golden pale orange color with a small white head. Has a fruity spicy banana aroma. Fruity wheat malty spicy banana clove flavor. Has a fruity wheat malty spicy banana finish.

Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus, 5.5%. Slightly hazy golden with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, wheat, yeast, banana and clove. Flavour is malt, fruit, yeast, medium sweet, banana, little bitter, clove and spices.

Draught @ Fermentoren, Ã…rhus. Pours slightly hazy light golden with a white head. Aroma of wheat, yeast, sweet fruit, banana. Flavor is light sweet, wheat, yeast, banana, light spice, little yougurt, light citrus. Medium body, average to lively carbonation, light sweet finish. 130215
Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Hazy golden with a lasting off-white head. Aroma is sweet, wheaty, banana and yeasty. Flavor is quite sweet and light bitter. Sweet finish. 160215

Draft at Paleo the excellent Spanish restaurant here in Orlando with not excellent beer list. I will say a lager paired quite nice with my meal though. Dark gold pour. Nose and tastes of straw, corny, some alcohol, and peppery notes. Crisp enough.

33 cl fles. Goudblond tot licht amberkleurig bier met wand klevende witte schuimkraag. Geur: licht zoet, mout, licht kruidige hop. Smaak: licht zoet, fruitig, wat kruidig, hint van abrikoos. Medium koolzuurprikkel. Wel ja, verfrissende pils.

Bottle from The Good Drinker in West Norwood, London. Warm autumn brown in colour, thin white head. Aroma - spice and malt, sweet dried fruit. Taste - more spice, full flavour, biscuit, malt, honey, trace of bitterness following. More enjoyable beer than Iâ€™d have expected from the reviews below. Nice looking bottle - no label, embossed green glass.

330ml bottle in 2016. Pale golden with a thin white head. Aroma of lager malt, metallic note and the kind of lemon scent infused into detergents. Light flavour. Not absolutely undrinkable, but definitely not worth drinking.
Quality classic pilsner with a good dose of noble hops. Super clean and crisp. D&S Dresden

Color dorado transparente con espuma fina blanquecina de retenciÃ³n media y residuo escaso. Aroma a extracto de lÃºpulo, malta dulce, minerales y notas a caramelo y maÃ­z. Sabor a cereal tostado, caramelo industrial, maÃ­z y notas minerales. Dulzor medio con amargor terroso ligero y regusto corto. Textura acuosa, cuerpo ligero y carbonataciÃ³n media. Una Imperial Pils industrial muy potable, de las mejores opciones en bares y restaurantes espaÃ±oles.

I have bought this bottle, in one Spanish shop, at PrÃ©laz, Lausanne. Tasting and judging this bottle, at home, Epalinges. To be sincere, it is not my favourite beer, too sweet, warm and heavy alcool, sugar, side of peach, malt and hop, there is definitely an unpleasant sensation at the mouth.
TrochÄ™ wzmocniony klasyczny eurolager. SÅ‚odowy, maÅ›lany, goryczka niska. Pijalny, caÅ‚kiem niezÅ‚y. Kupiony w SuperDino w El Cotillo w zestawie 4x0,33 l.
Una ligera cerveza para tomar con un picoteo. Es clara y limpia. De las mejores cervezas industriales espaÃ±olas
Dark gold clean and no off flavours had that slightly gluey alcohol kick that come with stronger lagers
Absolutely fantastic drink, very strong, but also very easy drinking. Plenty of oak aftertaste & tannins.
Tap at Stone in Helsinki. Tanni, dry apple nose. Some fruit sweetness, and a bit of acid, more tannic though and dry. Like it.

Bottle thanks to Max at Herne Hill Station from local offie (29062019) - clear golden pour with tiny head. Balance of dry and sweet cider with some light wooden accents, medium body, lingering fruity apple finish.

JasnozÅ‚ote, prawie klarowne, prawie bez piany. TrochÄ™ jabÅ‚ek i drewna w zapachu. W smaku pÃ³Å‚sÅ‚odki, jabÅ‚kowy, winogronowy, taki cydr w typie kompotu jabÅ‚kowego z nutkÄ… starego drewna, tanin. TrochÄ™ za wodnisty.

Bottles at Waitrose Basingstoke, has a body that is rarely seen with supermarket ciders. Very strong flavours and no artificial tastes. Iâ€™m a farmer boy and this does it for us all like a proper scrumpy would. Strong at 8.2% one bottle does me well in the evening to settle me right down, very drinkable but the more you drink the more you drink the less enjoyable it becomes. Yet to find a better supermarket cider.
Une bonne boisson pour les amateurs de cidre. Jâ€™ai prÃ©fÃ©rÃ© la version Ã  la pomme que celle Ã  la poire. Je vous recommande vivement de goÃ»ter !
Sample from bottle 500ml at Silja Symphony Old Port Pub 2018-08-03. BBE 02 2020. Pours clear yellow no head. Sweet apple, wood, sweet juicyness. Medium body and average carbonation.
500ml bottle. Light gold colour with tiny white head. Sweet green apple, tannins, wood barrel, light apple peel, light sour, light dry finish. Abv well hidden.
Clear yellow, minor carbonation. Drink very easy, in taste feels some spicy notes.
semi sweet, low tannic. Full body not the best depth not bad, but feels a bit unbalanced.

Hazy golden color with white head. Aroma has lemon candy, sourdough and unripe banana. Taste is soft with wheat sweetness and light floral hop notes on the finish. Medium to light body with medium carbonation. Decent for a low ABV beer.
Lo comprata per caso... Non mi sono accorto fosse light fino quasi a metÃ  birra... Poi ho pensato fosse analcolica, guardo etichetta leicht. Tutto sommato va giÃ¹. Ottima se guidi.
PÃ¥ tapp@Nordsee Bremerhavemedn. Grumlig ljus vÃ¤tska med tjockt vitt skum. HÃ¶ig doft med nedtonad skumbananarom. LÃ¤tt syrig smak. Dammig Ã¤r en kÃ¤nsla som infinner sig. Ganska intetsÃ¤gande.

500ml bottle - thanks Marduk! (5:4:5:3:10=2.7) Cloudy orange, large persistent rocky head. Sweetish wheaty aroma, something more savoury too. Taste is a bit watery, but it's 2.9%. Light wheatiness. Some metallic bitterness in the finish. Some carbonic acid in the finish.

Bottle (as konig ludwig weissbier leicht, thanks marduk). Pours hazy golden with whiteish head. Aroma is sweet, wheat, some dirtiness, maize. Flavor is sweet and bitter, wheat, watery, banana, maize. Finish is watery and wheaty. Body is watery. Overall: drinkable.

500ml bottle (thanks Viil). Hazy amber color. Huge size, thick white head, stays. Minerals, berries, jammy, sweet, wheaty in aroma. Minerals, dusty, wheaty, flour, flakey in taste. Flakes, yeasty, porridge in aftertaste. Very light and watery body with flakes in it. Sourish feel. Spicy hops somewhere in late late aftertaste. Medium carbonation. Average brew.
Bottle. Hazy orange color with white head. Aroma is wheat, a bit banana, spicy yeast. Taste is wheat, bready, bananas, quite tart. Refreshing. Ok.
Murky yellow with little white head. Aroma is musty hops and some wet basement aromas. No yeast. Taste is watery with a little bitterness. Also watery mouthfeel. Not good.

500 ml bottle at home as "KÃ¶nig Ludwig Weissbier Leicht". Hazy golden with white head, poor head retention. Aroma is yeasty, esters, banana, sweet malt and grass. Taste is bready, sweet malt, banana, grass, hay and yeast.
500ml bottle. Light hazy yellow color with white head. Malty and yeasty aroma, grainy, fruity, banana, spicy. Sweet and light bitter taste. Medium thin to oily body with soft carbonation.

This was listed at the brewpub as an amber and its a pretty big interpretation. Light malt aroma, very dark color. Lots of malt, fruity but also with a dry biscuity and chocolaty character. Nice hop bitterness in the finish which is somewhat subdued by the malt.

First tasted this at the Paisley Beer Festival in April 2004. Cask, gravity dispense. Dull black in colour with a thin tan head which quickly disappeared. Strange sickly note of parmesan cheese, long in intensity. Slick very thick oily texture in the mouth and no lacing of note. Dark malt complex gives a dusty burnt toast note which soon fades to give a strong roast coffee bean, bitter chocolate, liquorice and burnt treacle toffee in the thick mouthfeel. Earthy hops just barely detected in the very short aftertaste. Finish is smokey and dry with peat, old leather and dessicated molasses giving an impression of an oyster stout with imperial strength . Could only manage one pint of this but worth trying for the smell alone!
19th October 2007 Warning! Early amateur rating! Draft at the Brew Wharf mini beer festival. Dark beer. Treacly with mild carbonation and a fruit pudding tang. Not bitter. Dangerously drinkable!
Half pint gravity fed from the cask at the Ealing Beer Festival, poured a dark brown. A chocolate and alcoholic malty aroma. Alcohol and malrt in the mouth as well, but very pleasant.
A Sim rate (Cask at Planet Thanet): Smells very much like liquorice and alcohol. Tastes nutty, liquorice and dark chocolate.

Cask at Oxford Beer Festival 2005 (retrospectively added) This was a big session with Bob aka Billy the fish who insisted that we kick off with a pint of this. Black in colour not much of a head, some roasty malty and slightly woody aromas, taste a bit sweet but with some dark chocolate and coffee edges to it great stuff, but a pint mmhh.. maybe we were going for it a bit.
Gravity cask @ Reading Beer Festivalk 2006. Sweet. Some roast and brown sugar aromas. Not enough roastiness comes through in the flavour to counter the sweet body.

Cask conditioned - gravity dispense - Reading BF. A black coloured stout with a slight off-white coloured head. The aroma is smaller than expected but has nice roasted malts and a smoky edge. The taste is full-bodied with excellent fruits and malts and a roasted quality. Some oil and coal. Very tasty indeed.
Cask gravity at Reading BF 06. Black beer. Quite syrupy, but not horrible. Fine, syrupy, some demerrara sugar flavours.
Cask @ Reading 06: Fully smooth body. Port wine, berries and light roast. Lovely stuff. Black with a short tan head.
Gravity at Reading beer festival 2006. Flat, black. Flaky, tobacco flavour. Insistent, but not the most appealing. Some strawberry.
A very pleasant hefeweizen with notes of honey, citrus and wheat. Very smooth. Will have again if convenient, however it isnâ€™t a superstar that I would actively seek out,

Aromas of light fruit including citrus. Hazy, dull golden color with a vigorous white head. Near medium body with creamy carbonation. Very little spice, fair amount of citrus, and of course wheat. Finish is more wheat than anything else. Leaves a light tingle behind. Just donâ€™t perceive banana.

Date: 01/07/2006 Mode: Bottle Source: Leeâ€™s, Las Vegas Appearance: opaque light yellow, Aroma: sweet clove aroma, Flavor: very raspy wheat flavor, tart, lots of clove Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 4/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 8/20 Rating: 2.3/5.0 Drinkability: 6/10 Score: **/4

Bomber poured a cloudy golden yellow with a small lasting tight white head. Aromas of wheat, yeast, light citrus and a hint of banana. Palate was light bodied and crisp. Flavors of wheat, yeast, dough and light citrus with a crisp dry finish.

This bottled brew from a bottle shop poured a large sized head of foamy finely sized bubbles that was long lasting and left behind a hazy typically carbonated yellow brown colored body and a fair lacing. The aroma was malty banana apricot and fruity. The mouth feel was weakly tingly at the start and strongly tingly at the finish. The flavor contained notes of malt and yeast. A average hefe but not one that I would consider buying again.

Bottle marked 5.2% ABV. Fizzy, large white head that mostly diminished, very poor lacing, carbonated, cloudy, and a straw yellow hue. Sweet, some light banana, spicy, and clove nose. Banana was too light nosed for this style. Sweet, some acidity, light banana, spicy, and clove for the flavor. Again, too light tasting for this style. Disappointing considering this is one of my favorites beer styles. Tingly mouthfeel and medium body. Driinkable, but nothing to really rave about.
umm....Poured light golden yellow with white head. Tangy vanilla with some mild bitterness to it. could be better and not really a strong effort.
Bottled. Hazy yellow. Aroma of cranberries, vegetables and old butter. Sweetish and phenolic with mellow mouthfeel. Some butyric acid disturbs. Not good.
Sorry, Iâ€™m a serious Hefe guy. Oakes shared this one with us and I really wasnâ€™t impressed. Too much carbonation and a bland vanilla flavor. Iâ€™d pass on this and go Deutsch instead..
Pours cloudy yellow with a big white head. Aroma is citrusy and sour and a little floral. Flavor is both malty and sour at the same time. Too much carbonation and too dry.
Wet Hop: "Much too weak of an offering to be poured on the beer engine, but alas it was. Ever so slight citrus and pine with only a hint of bitterness in the weak watery finish. Booooring..."

Itâ€™s baaaack!!!! And apparently improved. Tap at The Davis Beer Shoppe. Pours light amber with a creamy white head. Aroma seems floral/citrus. Med body. It has a hop bite. Flavor is floral/citrus over caramel. that goes a bit toffee with time. Malt not so roasty as some APAs, which seems to be a good thing here. Nice.

~Pours a light golden color with small white head. ~Light hoppy scent with mild malts. ~More malty in flavor than hoppy. i dont care for the balance. ~Crisp feel, quick finish. ~Pretty weak for a pale ale. Hope are hardly recognizable.
This pale ale poured with a foamy white head. The flavor was flat and watery, with a slightly bitter finish.
who puts a pale ale on nitro, weak hop aroma, clear pale orange, light berry hoppiness, some nice maltiness, no bitterness at all, using little to no hops doesn't exactly make it an english style
Little aroma. The flowery hop flavor peaks out at you, but succumbs quickly. Average American Pale Ale at best.
(Tasting notes from Fall 2000): OK bitterness. Not well rounded and not much body.
Very deep brown/black color. Smokey roasted aroma. Very strong smokey roasted nut taste, slightly malty.

Very black beer with a small, tight head. Strong smokey presence with a bitter tinge. Just a hint of chocolate in the finish. The flavor was full of smokey, roasted nut, hops bitterness, and sweet malt tones. My only complaint was that the body was too light...almost watery feeling (not tasting though!).

Served on tap in a pint glass Appearance â€“ The beer is served a reddish amber color with one finger head of fizzy white head. The head has a great level of retention, slowly fading to leave a massive level of fizzy lace on the sides of the glass. Smell â€“ The aroma is light overall with the heaviest of the aromas being of a toasted smell along with some lighter sweet smells of a fruit nature with some cherry and apple as well as a hint of a caramel. Taste â€“ The taste begins with a rather sweet taste with it being a mix of caramel and some lighter fruits of apple and cherry. The caramel fades after the initial taste but the sweeter fruit flavors gain intensity as the taste advances, bringing an overall sweeter flavor to the brew. Right from the start there is also a toasted bready taste which takes on more and more grainy notes as the taste advances. Along with these tastes also comes some very light hop flavors of a more herbal and earthy nature. These hops remain rather light, and in the end with the mix of flavors, one is left with a rather sweet and toasted flavor to linger on the tongue. Mouthfeel â€“ The body of the brew is on the average side in terms of thickness and creaminess with a carbonation level that is rather average. Both are very nice for the style and complement well the fruit and toasted tastes well. Overall â€“ A fruity and easy drinking Oktoberfest. A nice brew overall and one to try if you get the chance.
@GABF-on tap-pours yellow with an offwhite head. Aroma is light malt-sweet. Taste is spice hops, light malt-sweet.

Tap at MBG Summer Festival. Poured orangish gold w/ an off-white head. Aroma was spicy with flora and fruity notes. Flavor was quite sweet with undertones of spices, coriander and fruits. Nothing special.
On tap at the brewpub in 9/08. Coppery orange color with nice creamy white head. Flavor was perfect balance of caramel malts, noble hops, and unknown spices. If they bottled this I would pick it up.

Sample at the brewpub: This beer is a light and clear amber/orange color with a medium thin off-white head. Thin spotty lacing. Sweet caramel and malt in the nose. On the light side for the style, with a bittersweet malt and hops flavor. The finish is sweet and short, with the hops struggling to linger. All in all this one is unremarkable.
An average fest beer. Caramel malts and nice hop presence, but overall, flavor was too syrupy sweet.

Draft at the brewery. Pours very cloudy dark gold with a very thin white head. Tastes lightly sweet, with hints of molasses, bread, and orange. Light body and low carbonation. Smells like lemon and multi grain bread.

Tap at brewery. Pours hazy amber with fizzy, off-white head. Aroma is pale and cereal malts, grassy and herb notes, along with some light fruit. Flavor is bready malts, grassy hops, light floral notes, and light fruit esters; dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

On tap at the breweryâ€™s "One night stand" event. Using oatmeal in a pale ale is a novel idea. It gives this slightly bland tasting beer a great mouthfeel and weight in the mouth. The aroma is pretty much pale malt with a hint of dingy cellar. The taste is pretty nice, albeit a bit boring, somewhat standard tasting APA, i like mine with more hop kick.

An interesting idea, I thought. Unfiltered/cloudy orange color, no strong aromas to speak of (hard to swirl around a 5oz. glass that''s full), chewy mouthfeel with a lingering bitter aftertaste. I''d like to give this another go but its damn near impossible to find - a rarely brewed beer from one of Maine''s smallest brewers.

On tap Maine Brewers Fest 2002: Hazy yellow/orange color, rich malt and oatmeal(?) aroma. Smooth full mouthfeel, rich ending and slightly bitter. An odd but not unpleasant aftertaste, most likely due to the oatmeal in it. Certainly a unique brew.
Spicy aroma. Light orange color. Cinammon spiciness that turned me off. Weak texture.

Bottle, 33cL. Home. A golden orange-yellow beer with an average white head ; short retention. Burnt caramel, grain. Light sweet, light dry refreshing, bitter note. Light to medium body, watery texture, average to soft carbonation, ephemeral caramel finish. Overall, deceiving, dull.
33cl bottle from a plant nursery. Hay and slight bread. Easy to drink. Not offensive.

Mousse blanche, couleur jaune or, arÃ´me cÃ©rÃ©ales et fruits, goÃ»t câ€™est bizarre un goÃ»t dâ€™herbe et de miel? Enfin on reconnaÃ®trait cette biÃ¨re assez facilement, Jâ€™ai apprÃ©ciÃ© lâ€™artisanat de cette bouteille.33 Cl brasserie

bottle from stepdad - thanks. clear light yellow, no head. apple juice almost calvados, faint malts, some sweetness. light peppery, corn notes, herbal, short citrusy finish. average to soft carbonation, light body - oily. drain pour.

Crazy looking 750ml bottle pours a hazy, golden yellow with a thin white head. Nose is weird, grassy, sugary, a touch of rotten fruit. Flavor is sweet, grassy, sugary, rotten tropical fruits, flowers. Finish is medium bodied. Not good.

Slightly hazy light orange-yellow pour with a thin white head. Grainy, cereal aroma wtih strong honey and nut notes. Lightly roasted cereal and honey flavor. A little nutty. Not terrible except for a slight unpleasant rotten fruit note. The bottle was way past its prime. Perhaps there was a good beer there a couple years ago.

Nice BdG nose, some cereal grains, floral hops, dusty yeast. The taste is moderately sweet, lightly bitter, lots of honey, cereal grains, light earthy hops. Decent, but I donâ€™t think this bottle is very fresh.... actually it was about 8 months past itâ€™s best by date.

Uh-oh. First gusher Iâ€™ve had in a while, not a good sign for something that is supposed to be a lager. Come to think of it, I donâ€™t ever recall having a lager that was a gusher. Pale gold with a lot of particulate haze, large head. Aroma was faintly bready with some apple fruit notes. Flavor matched. Faint hint of sourness on the finish. An odd bitter hop note as well that didnâ€™t hang with the other flavors present. This struck me as just a total miss of a beer. Flat out didnâ€™t enjoy it at all.

Bottle from Wine Specialist. Gushed a bit. Hazy gold color with a huge frothy white head. Aroma of citrus and tropical fruit. Near medium body with very frothy/lively carbonation - but itâ€™s bubbly, not sharp. Flavor is lightly malty and a tad yeasty with citrus. Rather astringent. Not super dry, just astringent. A lager that could pass for ale.

750ml bottle. Medium off-white head atop lightly hazed apple juice body. Aroma is medium sweet, orange, some yeast, lemon/straw. Taste is medium sweet, straw, lemon, lager yeast. Light-medium body, light acidity.
Almost no aroma. Golden color with minimal head. Thin palate with a hint of sweetness. Still pretty tasty for style. Tap at brewery.

On tap: The aroma consists of mild cereal notes with a hint of grass. Itâ€™s a transparent gold with a small white head that fades to a minimal film outlined by a thin ring. There is some sporadic webbing left on the sides of the glass. The flavor starts with a quick dose of of mild cereal/grain sweetness. The finish has light grass. Itâ€™s light bodied with moderate carbonation. Overall, thereâ€™s nothing offensive and nothing exciting. Itâ€™s a solid summer lawn mower beer.
On tap at Redood. Poured a yellow color with a small sized head. Grainy with some sweetness.

Pours a pale gold with a thin white head. Aroma is fruit, grass, and bread. Flavor is sweet fruit and bread. Has a nice, crisp finish. Got better as it warmed up. While it was similar to Redwoodâ€™s other lagers, I enjoyed it.
Draft - Light sweet grains. Clear gold with a decent white head. Grainy, light Skunky vegative notes. Not that great.

Tap sample. Poured clear golden color with a medium frothy white head that was mostly lasting with good lacing. Moderate balanced malt and hop aroma. Medium body with a slick texture and soft carbonation. Medium bittersweet flavor with a medium sweet finish of moderate duration. My expectations where exceeded.
On tap at the brewpub. Pours a clear yellow with a white head. Aroma of bready malt. Flavor of bready malt, straw, grainy malts. Just a plain Kolsch, not very exciting, just ok. 6/4/6/3/12 [3.1/5]
Growler from brewpub, crisp and refreshing. Very thin with no lace but overall seems like a great summertime brew.

Sample at the brewpub: Clear gold color with some rising bubbles. Thin ivory head that dissipates slowly and sticky patches of lacing. The aroma is mildly hoppy and malty. Light, clean body with sweet malt and hops flavors. Not bad overall.
Draft, on premises. Light wheaty taste, with a very pale color. Some hoppiness starts to show through toward the end. Iâ€™ll call it middlinâ€™ to good.
Nice roasted nutty scent. Reddish color, little brown coloring. Great nutty roasted malt and slight hops. Balanced. Mouth is medium and lasts. Tap

On tap: The aroma consists of light chocolate, roasted nuts, and a hint of coffee. Itâ€™s an almost transparent orangish-brown with a small off-white head that fades to a minimal film outlined by a thin ring. The flavor starts with a quick dose of of light chocolate. The finish is moderately nutty with a touch of black coffee. Itâ€™s light-medium bodied with light carbonation. Overall, this seems like a Brown Ale/Porter hybrid.
On tap at Redwood. Poured brown color with a small sized off white head. Roast dominates with some chocolate and coffee in the finish.

Sample from 66 cl. bottle. Pitch black with a bubbly, lightly tanned head. Roasted aroma with dark malts, coffee, chocolate, yeasts. Taste is sweet/roasted. Medium body with a creamy texture and a soft carbonation. Finishes dry and roasted. OK.
Bottled. A brown beer with a tan head. The aroma has notes of roasted malt and straw. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, alcohol, and roasted malt, leading to a bitter finish.

Bottled. Dark brown coloured. Unclear. Dense light brown head. Aroma. Chocolate, roast, sweetness, cocoa. spice. Flavour. Chocolate, roast, sweetness, light herbs, cocoa. Medium bodied. Ends roasted and chocolaty.
Bottle at yespr. Clear brown colored with a medium sized off-white head. Sweet and light roasted aroma of caramel and chocolate. Light roasted flavor of caramel and chocolate. Light roasted finish.
Bottle@Yesprâ€™s - dark brown verging black pour with beige head. Medium roasted malty, some caramel sweetness, nutty, medium roasted finish.
clear red, small light brownhead. aroma is caramel, dusty hops, roasted malts. flavor is roasted malts, dry, lots of caramel.
66 cl. bottle. Black with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of malt, hops, spice, fruit, roasted notes and chocolate.
Light yellow and partially cloudy with a good white head. Good banana clove character, yet light and sweet.

Draught. Body is hazy light yellow. Aroma is lightly malty (toasted grain, cookie), lightly hoppy (flowers), with notes of banana and clove. Flavor is moderately sweet, moderately acidic. Finish is lightly sweet, moderately acidic. Light to medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation.

column1: Jarre Creek Ranch Creekside Amber Ale
column5: Had this beer on 8/24/1998. Color is a good golden brown, carbonation is low and so is the head. It has a sweet malt aroma off the top of the glass. Taste is a little flat with a sweet malt flavor. It starts off with a medium body that feels a little heavier than it is because of the low carbonation. Going down itâ€™s smooth, finishing with a somewhat bland malt flavor. Its just not a good beer.

column1: Jarre Creek Ranch Creekside Amber Ale
column5: Bottle. Pours amber to mahagony with a small foamy off-white, light tan head, mostly diminishing. Aroma is caramel malt (grain, cereal, meal), yeast (sweat, dough), flowers and nutty. Mild bitterness, medium acidity, sour and tart hops, mild sweetness, caramel and nutty malt, metallic finish. Medium bodied and fizzy palate.

column1: Jarre Creek Ranch Creekside Amber Ale
column5: Medium amber color. Large to medium sized white rocky head. Aroma is malty with some hoppiness to it. A medium bodied amber. Malts are fruity and a little too sweet. Hops are a touch flowery and a touch grapefruity. Drinkable amber, a little hoppy but nice. Good full mouthfeel. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is slightly sweet.

column1: Jarre Creek Ranch Creekside Amber Ale
column5: Brown hue; frothy, off-white head. Sweet nose. Creamy, soft, mildly carbonated texture. Chalky caramel and lightly toasted Wonder bread in the sweet malts. Flowery hops; mild bitterness. Finish is sugary and flowery. The aftertaste has an odd flower stalk flavor. OK amber, but the sweetness was a bit much, and it even seemed cloying at times.

column1: Jarre Creek Ranch Creekside Amber Ale
column5: Light brown. Minimal aroma. Crystal malt with some nutty character coming through. Very mild beer. Sweet finish.

column1: Jarre Creek Ranch Creekside Amber Ale
column5: Dark amber with a sticky-sided head. Caramel aroma. Full-on caramel and maybe a light roastiness in the flavor. Fairly bittered. Decent.

column1: Jarre Creek Ranch Creekside Amber Ale
column5: Head is initially small, frothy, white, mostly lasting. Body is clear medium amber. Aroma is moderately hoppy (flowers, resin, grapefruit), lightly malty (caramel, cookie). Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly sweet, moderately acidic, moderately bitter. Medium body, velvety texture, lively carbonation, slightly metallic. Competent, if uninspiriing, American style hoppy amber ale. The bottled version is brewed by Breckenridge, and amusingly is better than most of their own line.

Draught. Body is medium amber. Aroma is lightly malty (cookie, caramel, grain), trace hops (flowers). Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter. Medium body, syrupy texture, lively carbonation.
# 97 et 431; 9/2015 et 9/2016. ChuÅ¥ovÄ› docela jednoduchÃ¡, mÃ¡lo ovocnÃ¡ (jen trochu banÃ¡n), silnÄ› kvasnicovÃ¡ pÅ¡enice.

Not a psenicne you'd expect. Very nice, banana/clove smell. Almost clear, no foam, which is odd for a weizen. The taste is pretty much your average lager with very nice taste of clove, maybe a hint of banana. The body is also low, lager-like. Very odd beer, I can't quite get it, but still I enjoyed it. A separate category of weizen.

getrunken im Sommer 2016 Auch wenn das Bier optisch nicht viel hermacht, hat es geschmacklich einiges zu bieten. Es schaut wie Spezi aus und auch der Schaum ist nicht stabil genug fÃ¼r eine schÃ¶ne Krone. LÃ¤sst man sich dadurch nicht abschrecken und nimmt einen Schluck, erinnert man sich schon manch bayrische SpezialitÃ¤t. Der wohlbekannte Bananengeschmack ist omniprÃ¤sent und fÃ¼gt sich ausgezeichnet in das Aromenspiel ein. Auch wenn es schwer zu bekommen ist, so kann ich es nur empfehlen.

Judging by the colour (amber) it should be medium body Hefeweizen, but in fact, you get very drinkable light body beer with almost not existing white head. In aroma, you have pleasant citrus (banana mainly). Good beer with no surprise but sometimes you don't need any surprise.

Bottled. Hazy golden colour, thick white durable foam. Yeasty nose with cereals and citrus. Taste of cloves, citrus zest, raw wheat and yeast. Light to medium body, fizzy carbonation, slick texture and a bit acidic finish. Not my favourite, but good.

Pivo samo o sobÄ› moc Å¡patnÃ© nebylo, ale mÃ¡ to podle mÄ› jeÅ¡tÄ› co dohÃ¡nÄ›t ve srovnÃ¡nÃ­ s nÄ›meckÃ½mi pÅ¡eniÄÃ¡ky. I tak ale oceÅˆuji snahu, jeÅ¡tÄ› je na Äem pracovat, ale Heroldy jÃ¡ rÃ¡d. :) Rozepisovat se moc nebudu, toto pivo je pro mÄ› dobÅ™e zapamatovatelnÃ©- hodnÄ› Å™Ã­dkÃ© a mÃ©nÄ› vÃ½raznÃ©.
V gozo cafe. Vona kvasinkova psenicna. Farba jemne mutna zlta. Chut kvasinkova strasne vodova nevyrazna.
Not a bad yeasty one. Banana aroma, fizzy carbonation, medium bodied. not a bad one
Bought this from a store in Prague. It's a very tasty beer! Aroma of banana, some floral, a hint of spice, nice hazy body, no head. I wish it was a little more carbonated. Overall a very good beer!

0.5l bottle. Malty aroma, yeasty notes, banana, ligh spicy notes. Hazy golden color, white head. Malty taste, yeasts, banana and spicy notes, light sour and bitter. Medium body, slick texture, soft to average carbonation and malty light sour finish. Good.
500ml Bottle - Hazy golden with a white head. Grain, banana and cloves in the aroma. Banana, nuts, lemon and a hint of toffee all feature in the refreshing if slightly sweet taste.
Ins Glas ergieÃŸt sich ein trÃ¼bes orangegelbes Bier mit schÃ¶ner Schaumkrone. Geruch hefig, malzig fruchtig. Geschmack hefig, fruchtig, leicht bananig, etwas wÃ¼rzig.

Bottle 50 cl, BBE 08/2014. Pours hazy pale copper in color with a whitish head. Aroma of ripe banana and dried fruits-in-a-box, bit of dark fruity liqour as well. Chewy mouthfeel. Notes of mashed semi-sweet banana and rubbery spicyness in taste. Quite good actually.

Itâ€™s unclear yellow golden with a huge, creamy white head. The aroma has notes of yeast, fruit and wheat. The sweet flavor has notes of yeast (fairly mild),fruit and wheat, and the finish is slightly spicy and dry. Itâ€™s nice but would be even more so with a little more bite.

Bottle, picked up in amberg. Simple but fared ok side-by-side at a tasting with many other hefeweizens. Lightly hazed golden with a lasting head; steady vanilla aroma; light caper brine flavours with quite a dry finish
Bottled,Pours hazy Golden with a lasting puffy white head..Aroma of,yeast and ripe bananas with a dry,yeast,sweet,grainy flavor..Decent..
Pours a deep hazy gold color with a soft full white head. Aroma is clove and bananas. Taste of bananas with spices.
Bottle from mein-biershop.de. Hazy yellow color with medium white long lasting head. Banana, citrus, clove in aroma. Taste, almost the same. Quite dry finish. Drinkable beer.

500 ml bottle. From mein-biershop.de. Cloudy golden colour with small to average size creamy white head. Caramel, Digestive biscuits, grain, wheat and some sweetness in aroma. Flavour is wheat, biscuit, wheat and mild sweetness. Decent.

Bottle. Golden, cloudy, average to large and mostly diminishing head. Moderate, malty â€“ lightly wheaty and sweetish aroma, fruitiness and banana, some yeast. Body is light to medium, malty â€“ lightly wheaty and sweetish flavor, some fruitiness and light banana with faint spiciness. Finish is short to average, malty â€“ lightly wheaty and lightly sweetish, faint fruitiness and light banana. Lightly sweetish and quite light-bodied weizen. OK but not nothing special.

Bottle shared on the train from Nuremberg to Freising during day 3 of the Bamberg Jolly of January 2015. Pours perfectly clear lemon yellow with a white foam head. Meh, a little acrid, with faint tang, cereal. Light bodied with average carbonation. Faintly astringent on the finish, some cereal, paper. Not great.

Pours pale golden, with a white medium-sized head. Aroma has floral and herbal notes. Taste is crispy with notes of hay and citrus, combined with light maltiness. Very delicious and refreshing thirst-quencher. (0,5 l bottle, best before 12. Aug 2014)

Bamberg jolly day 3 26/01/2014. Bottle shared on the train. Light hazed, yellow coloured pour with a fine white head. Aroma is wet grassy hops, and some lager yeast notes. Flavour is good, grassy and lemony hops and a nice crisp dry finish.

Day 3 of the post Xmas Bamberg Jolly, bottle from Rewe Bamberg shared on the train from Nuremberg to Freising, 26/01/14. Clear pale golden with a moderate white head that retains well. Nose is light florals, earthy tones, faint caramel, lemon zest, a little thin. Taste carries light chemical notes, bread dough, citrus jus, grassy. Medium bodied, soft carbonation. So so pils.

26th January 2014 Bamberg Bash Day 3. Train swig. Light haze on this pale gold beer, good white head. Palate is light, airy and dry. Nice lemony.sherbet with a little dry lactose underneath. Light dry finish. Nice lemon!

How: Bottle. Where: On a train during the Bamberg Jolly 2014. Appearance: Golden colour with a white head. Aroma: Sweet malt, grain, hay. Body: Medium body and carbonation. Flavour: Malt, grass, grain, bread.
Ins Glas ergieÃŸt sich ein goldgelbes Pils mit schÃ¶ner Schaumkrone. Geruch herb, grasig, leicht getreidig. Geschmack startet bitter hopfig, grasig.
Yellow/golden beer with a decent offwhite head. Malty plastic aroma, caramel, fruity, hay, citrus, grapes. Malty fruity flavor, hay, caramel, citrus, papery notes.
Golden, clear, relatively large bubbles. Medium body, light hopping with maltiness, well-structured and "clean" - a typical Bavarian Helles. Date: November 4, 2013.

Itâ€™s golden with a white head. The aroma has notes of malt, grain, light flower, bread and straw. The flavor has a light sweetness and notes of bread, grain, flower and straw, and the finish is fairly dry. Itâ€™s really pleasant.
Bottle from Max - pours nutbrown with a nice head. Flat carbo, some dark malts, medium sweet. Some hop-hints. Quite Zoigl-like for a bottled beer. Okay.

Bottle on the train during day 2 of the Bamberg Jolly - January 2014. Pours clearish gold with a white foam head. Sugary malts dominate in this one, with cereal as well, and a little bitter straw. Light bodied with average carbonation. Sweet on the finish, with more pale bread, minimal hops. OK overall.

Bottle consumed in Nov. 2012, best by Feb. 2013: Rusty golden. Scattered white foam. Muted nose of orangey fruitiness, pumpernickel bread, overripe plum, graham cracker. Fairly tea-like and candyish, as well. Soft, foamy prickles of carbonation. Sweetly malty with ensuing breadcrust and earthy bitterness. Earthy/woody licorice hoppiness mirrors the earthy malt, though an overripe plum fruitiness sneaks in and contributes a limpness and negates much of the brightness. Dusty yeast notes waver in and out amid the sweet cakey malt. Finishes softly with good balance between the bitter-chocolate-kissed dark bread and nutty malt. You kind of have to reach for things here as thereâ€™s not a whole lot going on, but it could be much worse. Pretty quiet and dull.

Day 2 of the Bamberg Jolly 25/01/2014. Bootle shared on train. Clouded yellow orange coloured pour with a lasting white head. Aroma is lemoney hop and cereal malts, some butter. Flavour is grassy, orange, lemon hop, cereal and a tough of brett maybe?Slightly sweet, medium thin palate. ok not great

Bottle 500ml (MBS) Slightly hazy amber color, good white head, some lace. Nose has quite strong buttery, diacetylic smell. Light to medium-bodied. Suprisingly flavor has only tiny amounts of butterness. It is grassy hoppy, nicely malty leading to decent bitterness in the finish. Also some sweetier fruity flavors. Aroma is offput but flavor is good.

Day 2 of the post Xmas Bamberg Jolly, bottle from Toom Amberg shared on the train from Erlangen to Bamberg, 25/01/14. Hazed orange with a big old off white head. Nose is bready malts, tarte fruit tang, bitter orange, straw, light toffee, faint apricot notes. Taste comprises mandarin, bitter fruits, bitter orange, straw. Medium bodied, soft carbonation, semi dry close. Decent enough offering.
25th January 2014 Bamberg Bash Day 2. Train swig. Hazy amber beer, small white head. Palate is dry and crisp. Bretty malt, light caramel, more brett. Dried fruits and a little peel. Crisp dry finish.

How: Bottle. Where: On a train during the Bamberg Jolly 2014. Appearance: Amber colour with an off-white head. Aroma: Sweet malt, bread, caramel. Body: Medium body and carbonation. Flavour: Caramel, sugar, malt.
Ins Glas ergieÃŸt sich ein leicht trÃ¼bes Bier mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch hopfig, grasig, getreidig. Geschmack leicht herb, getreidig, minimal wÃ¼rzig.

Bottle on a train during Jolly to Bamberg 2014. Golden beer with a decent offwhite head. Hazelnut aroma, caramel, bready notes, fruity, grassy, some grapes and biscuits. Malty nutty flavor, caramel, roasted, hay, floral notes, some brown sugar.

"Freudenberger Hefe-Weizen", Flasche aus dem Freudenberger Mixpaket vom Biershop Bayern. - Hell goldbraun, trÃ¼b; schÃ¶ner fester Schaum. - In der Nase frische Hefe Ã¼ber aromatischem Weizenmalz mit eleganter SÃ¼ÃŸe, Vanille, gedÃ¤mpfte weiche Zitrusfrucht. - Antrunk mild hefig-weizenmalzig mit feiner VanillesÃ¼ÃŸe und gut abgeschmeckter, zart fruchtiger SÃ¤ure, leicht unreife Banane, Birne. Milder rezent, spritzig. Im Abgang angenehme Zitrusfrucht ohne nennenswerte Herbe. - SÃ¼ffiges Hefeweizen von elegant fruchtig-sÃ¼ÃŸer Malzigkeit, bei dem die sortentypisch sparsame Hopfung kaum negativ auffÃ¤llt. (1.8.2019.)
*Old rating. Best before 09.05.11. SchÃ¶nes weiches, fruchtiges Bier. Hefig-bananig, nicht zu sÃ¼ÃŸ, rund und lecker.
Ins Glas ergieÃŸt sich ein trÃ¼bes goldenes Bier mit schÃ¶ner Schaumkrone. Geruch hefig, fruchtig, bananig. Geschmack hefig, bananig fruchtig, minimal wÃ¼rzig.
Pours hazy yellow with a creamy white head and lacings. Sweet banana, caramel, bread and wheat.

Itâ€™s unclear golden with a huge, white head. The aroma has notes of yeast, banana and wheat. The sweet flavor has the same notes - and itâ€™s easy to drink and well balanced. The finish is slightly spicy!

500 ml bottle. From bierzwerg.de. Cloudy pale yellow golden colour with average size fluffy white head. Fruits, citrus, yeast and mild hops in aroma. Flavour is wheat, yeast, fruits, some sweetness and mild hops. Fizzy. Very fresh.
50cl bottle. BBE 07/2012. Poured hazy orange with a soapy looking white head. Aroma has banana, wheat, yeast and light herbal notes. Flavor has sweet banana and wheat. Light body. Average.
Bottle from Bierzwerg, shared with a friend. After bottle was opened it pours down foam to the floor, something wrong with the bottle? Aroma is rotten, still flavor is yeast, wheat. Still drinkable.

(bottle) pours a murky deep golden colour with some floaties and a creamy white head. aroma of grain and light clove, slightly grassy, with a hint of nutmeg and vanilla. flavour is mostly the same, subtly spicy, with lots of mellow wheat, vanilla and a hint of cheesecake. medium-bodied with lively carbonation.

Im Geruch hefefruchtig mit etwas Apfel. Antrunk hefig, marginal sÃ¼ÃŸlich. Mitte birnig, und startende Trockenheit. Insgesamt lÃ¤ÃŸt das Bier bis hierhin aber die Entschlossenheit vermissen. Abgangs hefetrocken und leicht sauer. Eher schwÃ¤cheres Weizenbier.Test vom 18.1.2011, Gebinde: Glasflasche

L: -pours a clear straw golden with a medium,foamy,white head -medium carbonation visible S: -sweet,grassy,earthy,vegetables T: -sweet upfront,grassy,spicy -the taste fades fast F: -medium carbonation -light to medium body O: Sweeter than most other german Pilseners. While that makes this stand out, i just don't enjoy that sweetness in a Pilsener.
29-06-18 // 330ml bottle. Clear golden. Clean pils, mild grassy hop bitterness on top of some grains.

0.33l swing top. Clear golden with a big white head. Grains, corn, blue grapes, grass, grapefruit, light floral touches, Noticeable alcohol. Medium bitterness, medium honey sweetness, medium sourness. Medium carbonation, finish is sour and bitter. At 4.8% this is surprisingly strong-tasting, but the pronounced sourness really brings it down a notch.

resin, floral, grass, spruce, citrus, herbs, light sweetness, medium sweetness, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, medium bitterness, very bitter, lightly sour, medium sourness, heavily sour, light body, medium body, full body,
Fles 33cl thuis. Fris, helder, weinig uitgesproken . (11-2012).------------.
i got it right from the brewer the taste was smooth very good drink if fresh!
Draught at Grunewoche. Gold with a medium white head. Aroma of malt. Flavour is hoppy malt, tangy bitter, lemon on a long dry bitter.

Vom FaÃŸ auf dem 21. Berliner Bierfestival, 4.8.2017 (Festivalbier 2017). - Goldgelb, klar, schÃ¶ne Schaumringe. - Blasse Nase mit schlanker Zitronenschale. - Antrunk schlank mit schmaler Zitronenschalenherbe und zartem hellen Malz in perfekter Balance. Durchschnittlich rezent. Im Abgang eher schmalspurige Pilsherbe, ganz schwache ranzige ZÃ¼ge (wurde etwa Hopfenextrakt eingesetzt?). Der etwas schroffe Nachtrunk beeintrÃ¤chtigt den guten Eindruck. - Nichts Aufregendes aber ein schÃ¶n gearbeitetes, klassisches norddeutsches Pilsner.
Frontm Costo. In Teku glass. After dinner. Verty correct. Clean profile, with refreshing grassy notes pretty well adjusted and an adequately malty body
Malzig, hopfiger Antrunk der schnell ins WÃ¤ssrige Ã¼bergeht. Feine Hopfennoten im Abgang.
A good brew but was too understated in every category for the style. Not very complex at all, and only moderately malty.
Hazy amber. Thin white head. Toasty and lightly sweet with a prevalent Munich malt base. No real peat smokiness or earthiness. Not very clean either. Quite the disapointment.

column1: Stone Coast Deep Powder Oatmeal Stout
column5: Dark Brown to black with a medium head and lasting lace. Slightly smokey coffee like aroma. Slightly sweet malt flavor with a slightly smokey coffee like finish. heavy bodied yet relatively smooth.

column1: Stone Coast Deep Powder Oatmeal Stout
column5: Opaque. Thick tan head. Rich and roasted. Slightly light bodied. Smooth and a touch lactic in the finish. Quite a good version.

on tap on the premises. unclear medium dark brown pour with a nice light beige cap offering some retention and lacing. sweet coffee, charred roastiness, blue and black "fresh" grapes,Â lots of them, obnoxious grape sweetness combined with wort; faint herbs and grass, fruity yeast action - not really english. moderate carbonation, light body - very oily; sweet fruity finish. bad sweet grapey porter - still one of their "best" offerings..
From a grrowler. half a finger head, dark reddish brown. that smells pretty good! very toasty, gobs of marshmallow. the flavor...very thin, oily, light, coffee and hazelnut.

Poured into a nonic pint glass, the appearance was a pure black color with a fingerâ€™s worth of white foamy head. Light stringy lace. The aroma breathed a super nice blend between roasty coffee beans to cocoa nibs. Adds a touch of sweet smoke. The flavor, once again, blends all of the previously mentioned aromas to a wonderful blissful taste. Subtle blended aftertaste with a quick sweet finish. On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium on the body with a fair sessionability about it. Roastiness does hit my tongue in a nice porter-like semi-smooth sort of way. Good carbonation. Overall, very nicely done porter that I would have again.

Growler. Thx Alex. Pours dark brown with low to no beige head. Aroma is of vanilla, roasted malt. Taste is of vanilla, roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, very slight bitterness. Palate: Medium body. Low carbonation. Overall: Lots of vanilla, decent.

5 oz. taster @ R.I. Brewfest 2 Feb 2013. Fantastic nose of chocolate, vanilla and coffee. It had thick tan head that laced the plastic cup, which is impressive. The flavor is wonderful. Vanilla and coffee throughout the sip with a nice chocolate malt backbone. A very faint hop in in there as well. I went up for seconds of this porter. Itâ€™s been awhile since I had a porter that is this tasty. It could be classified as a coffee stout. Well crafted.
(sample at the 2012 Boston Beer Summit Winter Jubilee) black with tan head. Roast malt, slightly sweet molasses.

tap at the brewpub - Pours very dark brown with a small tan head. It has an aroma of roasted malt with chocolate notes. The flavor is dark roast malt with chocolate. Itâ€™s a medium bodied, flavorful, solid brew with soft carbonation and a lingering roast mocha finish. Well done! Thereâ€™s an interesting range of ratings here. Either our tastes vary really widely or the quality does.
@NH Brewers Fest-on tap-pours a thin rich light brown head and mahogany color. Aroma is soft roasty/molasses-dark malt. Taste is sweet roasty/molasses-dark malt, secondary earthy hops. Dry finish.

I had just finished a Sam adams Cream stout by the fireside, when I went up to the brewpub to try this I was very disappointed under fermented and seemingly pushed out for consumption with little regard to quality.

Dark, almost black porter with a small light creamy head and good lacing. Smells like a cappucino with german malt beer. Tastes of coffee and chocolate with a bitersweet aftertaste. Pretty good porter, but a little thick for my tastes.

On tap at Atlantic Bar Harbor. It poured a golden color with a white head. The aroma was of wheat, ginger, hops and malts. The taste was similar to the aroma with more wheat, ginger, hops, malts with medium carbonation and a nice smooth aftertaste. Not bad.
Draft flight at Atlantic Brewing in Bar Harbour, Maine. Cloudy gold color with a small white head. Decent wheat base but waaay to much ginger taste for my liking. Pass.
On tap at the brewery. Comes golden brown with an average beige head. Aroma and taste of ginger, malt, and wheat. Not a fan of ginger in beer.
Nice medium slightly cloudy amber. The wheat and ginger flavor our subtle. This is not my favorite style but I kind of like this beer.
Light, drinkable, & not over the top ginger. Pretty nice for the summer but nothing special. Decent pour & aroma. Not bad!
Bottle. Toffee malt and ginger aroma. Hazy amber with small head. Sweet ginger and very light toffee malt flavor. Decent.

Bottle: Cloudy/dirty gold with a creamy white head. Strong ginger aroma.....light vanilla, wheat. Ginger and wheat malt taste. Sweet and carbonated.. Ok for what itâ€™s advertised, itâ€™s definitely ginger-riffic......but itâ€™s also a little cloying.
bottle, just a plain lifeless pale ale. Nothing wrong with it, a little grainy. Was just hoping to taste some ginger and i didnâ€™t. Oh well.

Pours a slightly orangey dark amber with a thin off-white head that is gone quickly. Nose is slightly skunky and reminiscent of the back room of the store I worked at as a teen, where we kept empties. Taste is balanced. Not too sweet. Not particularly hoppy. Ginger comes through in the aftertaste. Medium body. Lively carbonation. Not bad, but not as gingery as I had hoped and not good enough to keep me coming back. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hmmm, polarized on this one. Pours a nice orange with a white head, and smells very good, with ginger and lemon. Taste starts of nice, with lots of ginger, but then ends with this weird sweetness that is off putting. Had on tap at the brewery.
12oz bottle. Poured an amberish color with an off white head. Stale hops and grainy.

Reviewed from notes. This was poured into a pint glass. The appearance was a hazy burnt orange color with less than a one finger white foamy head that dissipated within less than a half minute. There was some light stringy lacing. The smell had some burnt caramel malts kind of coming through in a toasty sort of way. The taste was somewhat sweet and toasty. On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium on the body with a fairly decent sessionability about it. However, there seems to be a bit to be desired to show some kind of meat to this thing. Overall, I say this was a one off for me. I most likely wouldnâ€™t have this again.
Not a very memorable beer. Hops tasted flat, almost stale. Touch of sweetness was ok, but overall flat.

12oz screwtop bottle. Pours copper with very little head. Sweet malt and butter flavors. Pretty average stuff. Drank this while up in Carrabassett Valey assuming it was a local beer only to find it was another shipyard brew in disguise.

12oz into a pint from their variety pack. Pours a deep orange amber, head is medium and lingers somewhat, taste is malty first, then a nice rise of the hops that mellow out quite quickly. This is a mellow pale ale, without the hop bite that I perfer, but to each their own. there is a tangy interplay between the malts and the hops but in the end it seems well balanced and tasty. An easy drinker, perfect for the summer, but good for any time really. Not exceptional, but certainlty not a faker.
Bottle. I grabbed a 6er of this in Portland ME. This is just not an interesting or worthwhile beer.

Another in the series of old beers from my parents' basement. Tickers gotta tick. This beer is definitely past it's prime. It's just a malty mess now. No hops left at all. Pours a golden orange color with no head. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
from beer on the wall beer of the month. Pours copper with very little head. This beer is lightly sweet and malty, very buttery with a small bit of hoppiness!!

Bottle. Light malt and orange aroma. Clear fizzy orange with a small off-white head. Watery grainy malt flavor... like a slightly better than average macro lager. Light carbonated body with a dry finish.

Bottle. Orange, cherry and hay malt aroma. Golden yellow color with small head. Sweet corn/barley malt flavor with hint of hay to finish. First ale Iâ€™ve ever had that tastes like a cheap lager (that wasnâ€™t a cream ale).

From old tasting notes. Brewed by Hellenic Breweries in Kiparissi, Fthiotis, Greece. Bright honey gold color. Brief white head. Light sweet malt aroma. Extremely light malt flavor. Mild dry hop finish.

Poured from a 12 OZ bottle into a pint glass at the World of Beer in Columbia, SC. The appearance is a clear light gold color with a small white head. The aroma is sweet grains. The taste is grains and possibly corn. An average beer.
12 oz. bottle. Clear straw color with a short-lived white head. Aroma is malty and sweet. Taste is malt, corn, and grass. Mildly sweet finish.

Pint pour from bottle of fairly crisp straw golden with a full dissipating white head. Nose is sweetened dry malts and corn notes. Not too exciting on the flavor either, but it is a tick. Sorta one dimensional pale lager-ish with typical basic crisp malts and faint, minimal hop character.
12 oz bottle. Poured a clear straw yellow color with a razor thin white head and awful head retention. Taste of cheap grain, corn, and grass. This beer sucks
Aromas of toast, flowers, and cereal. Slightly hazy orange gold, no head. Subtle initial malt sweetness, subtle earthy hops. Light bodied, pretty clean.
Pours a clear golden with white head. Cereal grains on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes clean.
Average, but bland pale lager. Pale golden in color with minimal head, cereal taste and aroma. run of the mill, had to wash down some Greek food in Chicago.
Pours a clear gold with a short white head. The aroma has yeasty bread and light malt notes. It has some apple and malt notes up front and a slightly sweet finish. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Fix 1864 Spezial has a medium, white head and a clear, yellow, clear, bubbly appearance, with lots of streaming bubbles and no lacing. The aroma is of rather rank, cheap, sweet grain, and the flavor is similar, with grain husk and off-tasting sweetness. Mouthfeel is light and watery, and Fix 1864 Spezial finishes semi-dry and mostly unpleasant, but one can drink it. Overall, this is another cheap, scam-type beer that alleges to be something that it is not. One doubts that the real Fix of Greece tastes anything like this bum. Avoid. RJT

column1: River City Death by Pumpkin Ale
column5: On tap. Off white-hazy dark amber. A-caramel, pumpkin spice, medium malt. T-follows. Towards medium body.

column1: River City Death by Pumpkin Ale
column5: On tap at the brewpub. Comes brownish gold with a small biege head. Aroma of pumpkin, spice, and brandy. Taste is similar. Something off here.

column1: River City Death by Pumpkin Ale
column5: Aging in Brandy barrels really throws this beer off kilter. Light body and very light pumpkin spice flavors are nearly soured by the barrel aging. Needs lots of work.

column1: River City Death by Pumpkin Ale
column5: Tap at brewpub. Pours an average iced tea brown with an aroma of floral plastic pumpkin. Flavor is flat, brackish malt and rose with a bitter medicinal finish. Lousy mouthfeel. Pumpkin? Artificial pumpkin, sure, but not a real one. Avoid.

column1: River City Death by Pumpkin Ale
column5: Name: Death by Pumpkin Date: February 24, 2009 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub Appearance: hazy copper, fine beige head, streaks of lace Aroma: sweet caramel and pulpy pumpkin aroma, nice spicyness Flavor: rich pumpkin flavor, sweet caramel malt back up the pumpkin, light spices Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 7/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 13/20 Rating: 3.3/5.0 Drinkability: 7/10 Score: **+/4

column1: River City Death by Pumpkin Ale
column5: Orange amber with small head. Light pumpkin, nutmeg and cinnamon aromas - pumpkin pie. Notable pumpkin flavor with some sweet malt and pumpkin pie spiciness. Generally sweet profile that starts OK and becomes cloying. I'm not a huge fan of pumpkin beers, and this is no exception to that - however I'd say its among the best of the pumpkin beers I've tried (read: drinkable).

Fin duft av rosin og krydder. Lite skum. Fin gyllen brun farge. God smak av rosin, krydder og noe ubestemmelig. Et godt Ã¸l som har hatt godt av Ã¥ stÃ¥ lenge. Drukket 1.Aug. 2013, best fÃ¸r. 11.Jul. 2007.
