33cl Flasche. Hellbraunes Bier mit viel Schaum. SÃ¼sse RÃ¶stnoten. Toffee Geschmack.
Mooie robijnrode kleur met flinke schuimkraag. Zeer zoet aroma en in de mond ook redelijk zoet. Vind hem beter dan het origineel.
Badhuis Amsterdam (met Koelie). Bakkie zoete bruine suiker. Backlog from 2014/12/13.

As Winter, bottle 33cl. Clear amber brown, large foamy beige head, half-way lasting, good lacing; aroma is roasted malts, fruity, light caramel; taste is medium sweet and bitter, toffee, light red fruit; medium body, watery to oily texture, soft carbonation, aftertaste is bittersweet, roasty, spicy notes; ok strong ale, despite its name I donâ€™t consider this as a winter beer .
Flaske (fra Belgisk Bryg) delt ombord pÃ¥ Fridtjofen, RBHD-treff aug-15: rÃ¸dlig rav med fint skum. Kandissukker og rÃ¸de bÃ¦r bÃ¥de i aroma og smak. Mild humlebitterhet. Rund munnfylde.

Disig dyp orasjebrun farge med et tynt lysebrunt skum. Fruktig, sviske, kandissukker og karamell med gode belgiske gjÃ¦rtoner blant duftene. SÃ¸tt. Medium kropp. Delt 0,33 l flaske pÃ¥ RBHD-samling pÃ¥ Fridtjoffen, august 2015.
Shared bottle at RB/HD on board Fridtjofen 23.08.15. Clear copper. Off-white head. Caramel, dark candy sugar, acteton and hops in aroma. And in taste. Also berries, particularly in aftertaste.

18-May-12 (750-ml bottle) This beer is surprisingly sweet, right from the first sip, with flavors of brown sugar and cinnamon. It's very malty and caramely, but even more fruity, with ripe, red apple, raisin, date, and fig dominating. The dried fruits, sugars, and sweet, caramely malts are just as apparent in the nose too. Full bodied, partially from sugar, with moderate carbonation and a somewhat cloying mouthfeel after awhile. Hazy, ruddy, dark-amber body is capped by nearly an inch of bubbly, light-tan head that fizzes away fairly rapidly. Overall, though quite tasty, the sweetness really becomes overbearing after several sips, so it's a tough beer to consume in one sitting, and since it's a 750-ml bottle, it's a chore I'm having difficulty completing.
Zonder meer een aanrader. Pittig bruin bier, stevige smaak van goed gebrande mout, bijna houtskool. Toch zacht en niet te pittig. Lekker.
33 cl Bottle - Nicely brewed dark, rather ordinary beer with a soft bitterness to it.
Colore ambra, schiuma sottile. Aroma di caramello e miele. Molto dolce la bevuta, con il miele che si avverte in un contesto di dolcezza generale. Carbonazione media. Niente male nello stile.

Robe brune, belle mousse crÃ©meuse. Nez fruitÃ©e, banane mÃ»re, chocolat au lait, cafÃ©, malt torrÃ©fiÃ©. Bouche Ã  lâ€™attaque fruitÃ©e, de la finesse, du fruit et de lâ€™Ã©lÃ©gance avec une belle finale Ã©quilibrÃ©e. Une biÃ¨re forte agrÃ©able.
Drunk from 33cl bottle bought from beer discovery club. Enjoyable dark beer. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Forrygende god Ã¸l. Den har en rigtig god fylde, og en lang og intens eftersmag. Det er en meget kompleks smag, jeg synes lige umiddelbart der er svÃ¦r at sÃ¦tte direkte navne pÃ¥ hvilke smagindtryk man fÃ¥r, men det er mange. BÃ¸r drikkes alene hvor det gode selvskab er Ã¸llen.

Bottle. Gusher, that pours a big yet rapidly fading white head, over a unclear, red-brown beer. Smell is sharp malts, bit bitter. taste is sharp, bitter, metallic and yeasty. Somewhat spiced. I also get aromatic dark maltyness towards the aftertaste, with a strong sweet undertone.

Bottle shared at getting to the kâ€™s tasting thanks to kermis. Hazy reddish brown with small beige head. Lots of caramel, raisins, figs, light old coffee, toffee, burnt grains. Medium sweet with roasted bitter finish. Medium bodied. Ok.

Bottle shared at the Get Kermis to 8k tasting. Pours very hazy brown with a medium cream head. Aroma of toffee, sweet malt, light herbs, plastercine, light floral notes and caramel. Flavour is over moderate sweet and light moderate bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.
Angenehm malziger Geruch mit Anklang von Sirup und dunklen Beeren. Der Geschmack ist etwas enttÃ¤uschend, aber solide mit etwas schokoladigem Abgang und leichtem Sirupgeschmack.

Bottle. Pours an orange-copper body with a small fluffy white head and airy lace. The aroma has plenty of bread but also sweet raisins, perhaps some figs, yeast, cookies, and perfume. The flavour has some rye bread in addition to fruity hop bitterness and rich dark/toasty malts - caramel and such. Pretty good.

Bottled. Aroma of roasted malts and light herbal. Dark brown color, beige head, good lace. Sourish start, roasted malts, light caramel, light herbal, sparkling and bitter - especially in the long lasting finish.

Bottle Hazy, deep amber-brown body. Nice frothy, off-white big head. Aroma of hops (grass - flowers), malts (nuts), white wine, perfume, apples as in apple cider. Quite complex. Flavour is int he beginning lightly bitter, lighlty sweey. In the end moderately bitter, lightly sour. Has some of the fruitiness of a flemish sour ale. Good balance, but not extraordinary due to a somewhat flat mouthfeel.

(Bottle 75 cl) Beautiful dark brown with a pronounced reddish glow - presumably filtered. Creamy, light brown head, which never completely vanishes but remains afloat on top of the beer. Lightly tart and metallic nose. Dry, lightly roasted malt, with pronounced tart undertones and a dry, lightly bitter finish. Vinous with a rather light body. Reminds me of the old style I believe is called "Vlaams bruin". Unusual but very delicate. 080605

Dark chocolate brown with a big, persistent head which reminds of whipped cream. Rotten cherry and heavy perfume in the aroma, some tea leaves also, with just a touch of vinegar. Cocoa flavour with raisins and/or fruit jam; a bit earthy, too. Like warm chocolate drink on the tongue.

Chocolately toffee aromas with some sour vinegar - like the nose! Murky dark brown color and a low lathery head. Pale taosted malt body with some cocoa. Metallic end with a drying effect. Medium body and an OK balance, though a little odd and not so convincing overall.
Yeasty aroma and flavor with some orange. Just a bit sweet, even syrupy. Spices, says the label, but I can only find some curacao. Disappointing.
Nice amber brown coor. Soft carbonation. Malt nose, nutty and piney too. Kind of thin body. Malty taste, torfy too. Fizzy, earhty, bitter with a hoppy copper finish.
Brown cloured with a reddish shine. Rather malty and fruity. Dry finish. Very good for being only 5.5%ABV.

Draft at the brewpub. Black in color with a retained tan head. Aroma is loads of coffee, roasty ashy notes, some bitter cocoa. Flavor is nice, coffee really prominent, dry and fairly bitter, just a touch of sweetness. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Solid offering.
Pours a jet black with moderate lace and average carbonation. Aroma of roasted coffee and nuts. Taste of chocolate and coffee. Solid stout.
Pours an opaque brownish black on tap with fluffy tan head that leaves great lace. Aroma of sweet chocolate and light roast. Taste follows, creamy lactose notes. Very nice seasonal.
Tap. Pours clear black, large creamy tab head, very long lasting, nice lacing. Aroma is roasty, cocoa, coffee, some ashtray. Flavor is light plus sweet, medium bitter, roasty, tasty. Medium body.
Coffee and chocolate in nose and flavor. Nitro like carbonation and very dry stout type of finish. Makes a great breakfast stout.
Draft: Poured a pitch black with light brown head. Aroma is rich malts and chocolate. Sweet mix hits the palate head on with malts and chocolate.

On tap. A: Opaque black with a thin cappuccino head. Lacing. N: Huge bittersweet cocoa and coffee. Some vanilla and substantial smoke. T: Bittersweet. M: Medium body with a creamy carbonation. Alcohol is well-hidden. O: Solid stout. Big cocoa makes me happy.
On tap at the brewpub. Aroma: roasty, with hints of coffee. Taste/Palate: starts sweet and creamy, and finishes dry, creamy, and astringent.

Had on tap at the SE Brewpub. Aroma is roasty and malty with hints of coffee. Flavor is a great match of roasty and burnt flavors and has a ever so slight sweetness to it. Overall this is a great beer, very balanced and easy drinking.

On tap at Laurelwood PDX, pours black with a large tan head. Aroma birds out dry coffee and roasted malt. Flavour is similar, with very dry coffee and roast. Fairly bland, but creamy palate. Decent stout.

This bottle is coming from la Goutte d'Or, at Paris. Drinking and enjoying this bottle at home, during this winter, at Epalinges. It was a good surprise for this beer coming from Africa. It is not a revolution but it is a rather good amber beer, classical, malty, side of toffee, bready, a bit watery, some hop for lager. The carbonation is average, brown body, clear, normal carbonation, thin and white foam.

Bottle @ The Mansfield, New York, courtesy of Trapped, huge Thanks Tunga! Pours dark amber with a creamy offwhite head, light lacings. Aroma of malt, caramel, little sugar, light wood. Flavor is rather sweet, malty, caramel, hay, sugar. Medium body, average carbonation, light sweet finish. 270418
Bottle. Pours clear rusty brown with small foamy light beige head, malt aroma, adequate carbonation, medium bitter caramel malt taste, thin, smooth body, long medium bitter finish. Not bad at all.
Bottle in LomÃ©, Togo. Quite surprised by this African brew, it really different than what you find around here usually. Brown, tobacco like taste, quite good for the region

From old tasting notes. Labeled as "Ngoma Awooya Special Malt Liquor". Clear mahogany brown color. Big bubbly tan head. Light toasty malt aroma. Toasted malt flavor lacks complexity and body. Bitter, but unbalanced.

Butelka 0,66l dziÄ™ki Lagerman wypite w Polsce. Kolor bursztynowy, niezbyt klarowne. Aromat kawowy,chmiel wyczuwalny i karmel.Smak delikatny karmelowy z owocami cytrusowymi, przyjemne.Nagazowanie Å›rednie.Jedno z lepszych piw afrykaÅ„skich o wyrazistym aromacie i smaku.

Kolor - brÄ…zowo-herbaciany, klarowny. Piana - lekko brudna, wysoka, trwaÅ‚a. Zapach - lekki karmel. Smak - lekka nuta karmelowa, lekko podpalane, Å›rednia sÅ‚odycz, kapka chmielu, lekka goryczka. Poprawne, gÅ‚adko wchodzi.

650ml bottle [not only taking the effort of carrying this one all the way from Ouagadougou to BI, altogether another bountiful donation made by Aziz - thank you very much!]. Clear, chestnut colour with average, thick, frothy, fairly lasting, moderately lacing, off-white to beige head. Grainy, strawy, muggy aroma, hints of wet straw and rabbit droppings, a very backgroundish nuttily touch. Taste is nuttily malty, slightly strawy, some caramel malty sweetness, a touch of malt lozenge, some malt spiciness. Very "natural" aroma, OK taste.

My Togo beer of choice. Amber like the the hair of the girl that got away, smooth like the surface of a crystal clear lake on a windless day Has won two international awards in the last 40 years (6.2% Al. Cont.) (550 f CFA - 66cl)

66cl bottle. Light brown colour with a nice beige head. The nose is slightly alcohol together with smooth malt. The beer starts smooth, light and nice. Brown - like the colour, hints of hazelnuts, nice roasted malts, not too sweet. Very fresh and easy to drink. The aftertaste is smooth, malty, fresh. It tastes a bit like the 6.2%, but still light and smooth. Nice brew from Africa! 10/12/10/10

Reddish-amber color with a large but fast dissipating white head. Tart raspberry, hop aroma with a mild malt undertone. Flavor is initial malt, quickly giving way to an underripe raspberry and bitter hoppy taste. Long sour/bitter finish. I've had other ales from this brewpub that are much better - wish I'd taseted it before buying the growler...

A dirty golden color to this one which also provides a moderately nice amount of head. Smells straight up like rasberries and the flavor follows right along with some in and out hints of maltiness. I have had many better than thou.

this one was darker in color than i had expected, it looked almost just like their pale ale. the head was the different part, very rocky head with a hint of purple in it. the aroma had the tartness of raspberries. the flavor started sweet malty but then ran right into the sweet fruitiness and then the bitterness of the fruit. left a bitter fruity flavor lingering in my mouth.

First tasted this at the Renfrew Beer Festival in September 1997. Cask, handpump dispense. Clear amber in colour with a thin white head. Dusty hops in the short floral aroma. Thin mouthfeel and poor lacing. Pale malts give a juicy citric bite of grapefruit and lemon peel. Dusty hop resins give a dry bitterness to the short aftertaste. Finish is again bitter and dry. An ok session IPA but better examples out there.
Cask Stillage at the Union Bar, Barnsley 17/08/2002 Golden amber coloured and very fruity. Some dryness in the hoppy finish.

A fairly straightforward pale amber coloured best bitter. Crisp, clean and noticeably bitter. Lemony citrus in the flavour. Refreshing. Nothing particularly out of the ordinary, but a pretty good supping ale. I could certainly sink a few of these. Cask (handpump), Cats Back, Wandsworth, February 2005.

Aug, 2003: Cask, Queens head, Chelmsford. Soapy floral lemon aroma. Hoppy taste - lots of interesting citric twists, though body and finish merge together in an indistinguishable mess. Hoppy, but lack of malt body results in lack of interest and control. [2.8] Feb, 2004: The Great Wenlock Meet Up. Slight orange flavour. Not much going on. [2.8] Feb, 2005: Cats Back, Wandsworth. Delightful fresh and hoppy. Lingering hop finish. A spanking good ale. [3.6]
Slightly hazy copper, lasting white head. Quite a hoppy aroma. Clean malts balanced with a nice citric hoppy finish. Medium bodied. Nice.
Sulfury nose. Flatish. Warm round, but thin malt body. Twinge of hops. Clean palate. Respectible, but not much character.
Cask Conditioned, at the Wenlock Arms, London. Very english - ahm as an IPA ;) Light nose, butterscotch taste. Not much going on here, decent but nothing special
Like a hoppier bitter. Lots of citrusy bitter hops, with a decent malty front and middle, but the emphasis is more on the hops, nice and bitter (Cask- Queens Head, Chelmsford).

Yellow color, though not blond. Good burst of hops, perfume aroma, citric bite. Nice UK IPA--this one was really attempt to brew an IPA, though it isn't a complete success. (cask at Queen's Head pub, Chelmsford)

Cask Conditioned, at the Wenlock Arms, Back to the programme. Good all round beer golden, no head. Nice malt and hop. The notes begin to fade as I have a drink with the band. 5 of 7. Re-rate (WA) 10/10/03.Quite clearly I was mad when first rated this because this beer was outselling 'bitter & twisted' tonight. Myself assisting with four pints of my own, 2 assists. Quite simply this hoppy feast was on fire tonight. Big and forward.

Bottle picked up from the brewery tap/shop a couple of weeks ago and consumed at home Thursday 27th December 2018 whilst making homemade pizza. Pours warm gold with a slim white head. A little syrupy mouthfeel, some bitterness, malty with some cooked banana. Soft mouthfeel, fruity. Good beer. A7 A4 T7 P4 Ov14 3.6

From old notes: Cask @ Booze on the Ouse fest, St. Ives, 2000. Copper color. Aroma: quite fruity with warming alcohol and aromatic hops. Flavor was strong, but not very sweet, maybe more like an old ale. Delicate bitter finish. Better with every sip.
Cask @ Chelmsford Beer Festival. Nice head with good duration. Color is dark amber. Aroma and taste are fruits, caramel, malt and hops. Sweet and bitter finish.

Cask @ Chelmsford Beer & Cider Festival. Clear amber with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, fruity and light hoppy. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Sweet and moderate bitter finish. 150218

Bottle. Deep amber in colour. Fruity (citrus-orange, berries). Hoppy (grassy & earthy hops). Caramel malty base. Alcohol quite noticeable. Initially sweet fruity, but then dominated by bitter hops through to the finish. Did not like it. Not for me. (2008)

Hand pull cask at the Olde Sun, St Neots. Light golden brown, slightly cloudy. A reasonable amount of natural carbonation leaves an off-white ring of head around the beer. Light aroma of cereal, tangerine peel and white grape. I expected it to taste sweeter. Instead it is dominated by a somewhat harsh bitter-sour with citrus overtones.body is medium to thick. Flatter mouthfeel than the appearance would suggest. Good but surprisingly little character for the ABV.

Appearance: Cloudy dark orange golden color with a fine thick white head. Ok lacing. Aroma: Malty, some spices, mild citric and fruity. Palate: Medium + body. Slightly sweet and an ok bitterness. Average to soft carbonation. Taste: Fruity, some spices, citric and banana . Overall impression: Tasty and fine sipper. Personal stats: Bottle from Beers of Europe. At last the final English county!

Appearance: Fizzy, golden amber, slightly hazy it seems. Short-lived off-white head. Aroma: Fruit, light malts. Taste: Malt, fruit, slight sweetness. Warming, then slight alcohol. Simple. Bought: Beers of Europe, 500 ml, Â£3.69 Info: 13/6-2015, 81/300M, BB: 31/8-2015

Bottle shared at a tasting at Dancing Camel Florentin. Thanks Grumbo. Hazy amber, white ring. Sweet malty aroma with some burnt fruit, sweet and malty taste, then soft bitterness. Soft carbonation, medium body, some honey finish.

At a tasting, thanks, no head, lightish hazy orange color, aroma of lemon popsicle, banana and paper, fruity flavor with hint of bread, and maybe tobbaco, strong bitterness, a bit of alcohol, just a touch too sweet but still easy to drink though not too interesting.

Cask conditioned, gravity dispense. Orange gold colour with a spicy gingery aroma. Body is more restrained with malt and fruit mixing with a muted ginger note. Sweet finish with subtle ginger hint that suddenly leaves a pleasant tingle when you swallow.
Bottle @ Cotteridge Wines. Clear golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, fruity and light hoppy - grass. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 270717
Bottle @ Cotteridge Wines, Birmingham. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are grass, malt, fruits, hops and has a nice bitter finish.

Bottle from Tamworth BF. Pours hazy yellow amber with big white head. Aroma of grass, a little malt and maybe a touch of dung. Flavour is straw, citrus fruits and a good malt finish. A little lively. Decent bitter

Bottle - thin clear yellow / amber. Thick white head which maintains throughout with medium carbonation. Strong fruity aroma, good mouthfeel. Fruity taste comes through with slight sharp bitter finish. Nice beer - enjoyed.

Appearance: Clear amber color with a finger thick white that leaves a fine lacing. Aroma: Caramel malty, light hoppy and fruity. Palate: Medium body. Slightly sweet and a fine bitterness. Average carbonation. Taste: Well balanced and nice malty, fruity and mild hoppy. Overall impression: I do personally prefer Bitter from a bottle. A lot more fresh because a bit higher carbonation. This one was a perfect example. Sadly they did not have it on tap at my visit. So I could not compare. Personal stats: Bottle @ source

Cask,Swan & Rushes, Leicester. Hazy golden with a thin foam. Aromas are caramel with bready yeast and oranges. Lemon rind with light fliral and honey notes. Flavours are ceteal grain wirh caramel and mellow lemon. Yeasty with bitter lemon on the finish. Pretty good.

Cask at the Anchor,Digbeth.Poured a golden amber colour with minimal white head.Very light aroma,malt with slight hop hint.Malt flavour with a little fruit.Easy drinking session ale with a dry finish.

Cask at the Anchor, Birmingham. Poured a clear amber with a thin bubbly white head. The aroma is weak malty. The flavour is smooth, chewy and uber malty with some fruit and a nice smooth bitterness on the palate and into the aftertaste.
Golden ale, very small head. Bitter characteristics if a style is required but slightly hoppy and pale in character.

Bottle (bottle conditioned) from Stirchley Wines & Spirits, Pershore Road, Birmingham. This may have been classed as a bitter but Iâ€™d say it is more of a golden ale. Pours a clear amber with sediment. Nice head with a decent lifespan. Faint, citrus aroma with some fruity hops. Poor mouthfeel - too fizzy for my tastes and more in line with a pale lager. Taste is initially bitter but soon gives way to sweetness and a huge shot of citrus. Decent session/barbeque ale but not at all memorable.

Cask at The Moon Under Water (JDW), Watford in 2013. Clear mid golden with a thin white head. Aroma of raisins, citrus peal and malt. More citrussy and hoppy in the flavour, but the linger was a little unbalanced.

27/9/2018. Cask at the St.Albans Beer & Cider Festival 2018. Pours pale gold with a small off-white head. Aroma of citrus, caramel, cream, malt and vanilla. Medium sweetness, light to moderate bitterness. Moderate body, slight oily texture, very soft carbonation. Easy drinking, decent brew.
Cask at cloisters. Pours clear golden, nose is grassy, floral, orange, taste is sweet, light citrus, hay, dry.

Cask at The Holy Inadequate, Etruria. A clear golden colour with a medium white head. Aroma of pale malts, some apple, slight yeast, subtle herbs and a little butter. Taste of pale malts, grain, some butter, slight apple and subtle floral hops. Light bodied but a watery texture. A dry, grainy finish with subtle floral hop bitterness. Not a fan of this. Quite dry with grainy, buttery flavours around very subtle hop tones.
Easy drinker on cask at the cemetery Rochdale. Hints of citrus a little watery nice easy drinking golden ale not as nice as the spotland gold that was also available. Rerated pint at red lion
Cask at the Twelve Tellers, Preston. Pours pale gold with a thick white head. Aromas of orange barley water. Taste is light sweet, thin finish.

Cask @ Bear and Billet, Chester [270115] Light blonde, clear, thin white head Aroma of soft fruits, soft cereal malts, dull nose, no hops Taste of light malt, touch of dry zest, bit of yeast, soft minerals Palate - Light body, fairly bitter. Finish is just very dry bitter, dry, dry, dry Overall - Plain stuff. Just lots of dryness. It least it does what it says on the tin.
Pint at the Victoria, Lincoln. Very pale yellow gold, with a white head. Aroma was almost nothing, just light hops. Taste is a touch sharpe, with citrus hops.
Cask black bull liversidge. Golden ok white head lacing. Light citrus aroma. Taste is light citrus malts light hops. Medium body. Ok at best.
Cask in the Shepherdâ€™s Rest, Sowerby Bridge. Pours golden with a white head. A nice enough citrusy blonde ale. Floral and caramel notes too. Alright.

Darkest brown with a tan foamy head. It looks really good. Insanely sugary. Like candy floss. Plenty caramel malt with a dusty sensation. Comes across like a sweet malted milk drink. It's fruity too. Such a sweet finish with surprisingly decent medium body. Moderate carbonation. So sweet it's crazy. Easy drinking though.
So delicious, beautiful tin , I wish they sold this in Holland I always have it in Scotland

July 2018 - Cheap-looking 500ml can picked up in Keith and consumed there also. As 'Younger of Alloa Sweetheart Stout', 2%. Darkest brown or black with a red hue, big dense pillowy brown head. Aroma is earthy, quite airy, bourbon biscuit, rusted metal. Body is frothy with soft carbonation. Taste is quite sweet, flat cola, watery and sugary with no bitterness. It has a relatively pleasant flavour I suppose but it doesn't taste like beer. Just very very sweet. I think they 'hopped' this with sugar but I can see why this beer hasn't died a death - the sweetness might appeal to some. (4-4-5-3-10=2.6)

Sweet hear stout as has been mentioned does not try to be anything but just that! Not a day to day choice but when it's hot and you've been throwing bales, nothing sparks you up like a can of sweet heart!

Just what it claims to be .a SWEET stout low alcohol stout. .its only 2 %. Doesnt wish or try to be anything else....good for a chug or to mix in a sweet black and tan. Dunno where the "its too sweet " or "too low in alcohol"comes from...drink and enjoy it. tan head that dissipates with a wee bit of malty sweetness. not bad for 2% in my opinion

.5 L can retrieved from Scotland and served in an Ayinger glass. Dark brown body is opaque in the glass. The overly fizzy head is short lived. Poor, unappealing aroma. The flavor is better but overly sweet. Exceptionally thin body. Overall: poor but drinkable and only 2% ABV.
Can from Tesco, Corby. Very sweet for a stout, and so much so that thereâ€™s very little â€™stoutâ€™ about it. Dark clear brown with no head.

Can @ the grill, Aberdeen. Pours deep ruby brown with thin lacing ofbeige head. Fairly sweet and well carbonated it with notes of cola and red berry. Reminds me of some of the eastern Europe low alcohol porters. Chilled so not much on the nose and finishes fairly brief.
Can. Dark brown red colour. Small head. Roasty sugar, Caramel, Sugar, Sugar, Sugar and.... Sugar. Not what I did expect from a stout. Way to sweet. But not terrible.

0.5L can. Deep red color, small amount of tan head. Burnt sugar nose, honey, biscuits, hint of metal. And then on to the taste: Sweet, sweet, ultra sweet. Not easy to pick out the flavors, but tiny hints of spice and metal are coming through the massive wall of sugar. Watery, thin mouthfeel, low carbonation. Probably one of the worst beers Iâ€™ve tried.
sweet buttery/barley taste. good red/orange colour.fruity taste. no bitterness

Nicely light brown foam. The aroma has some smoke in it. The taste is rich and good. It tastes slightly smoky with good notes of licorice. Of course, it also has the expected malty flavor that provides great the sweetness, which also belongs to a dark traditinal ale. A slightly watery aftertaste with slight hint of alcohol, even though it is only 1.9%. Actually a pretty good Traditional ale.

Bottle. Pours very dark brown with thick tanned head. Dark, but not strong, malty flavour with a note of yeast and grain. A very sweet taste of malt with a bready finish. Too sweet for me. I didnâ€™t finish the bottle.

Bottle at home - shared with a bread. Clear dark dark brown - offwhite head. Roasted, dark bread, ryebread, sweetness, light brown sugar, syrup, burned malts, licorice, light wooden, cereal, light bitter burned malty notes.

The head is ok and the body black. It smells sweet-malty. The taste is malzig, a bit sugar, liquorice, sweet-fruity and a bit sticky on the tongue. A drinkable and very cheap beer from Denmark! 12/10/11/11/11/11

Bottle from Scandinavian shop in Brussels. Black soda body with tan head. Nose is sweet and malty and pungent. Taste is terribly sweet and syrupy. Very medicinal. Couldnâ€™t bare to take a second taste. Really, really putrid. Arghhhh..

Bottle @ DÃ˜E Meeting. Pours black with a tan head. Aroma of sweet hard roasted malt, sugar, brown sugar. Taste is very sweet with malt, nuts, brown sugar, sugar. Thin body, soft carbonation. Sticky sweet, in short awfull. 161111
Clear dark brown with an off-white head. Aroma is very sweet malty and dark sugary. Flavor is very sweet. Very sweet finish. Sticky and watery. Oh, did I mention very sweet? 161111
JuleÃ¸l Netto.... mÃ¸rk brun lille skumkrone,, fÃ¸les let kvalmende,, brÃ¦ndt vanilie....gÃ¥r nok til risengrÃ¸den....
330 cl flaske. Sort krop met stort varigt beige hoved. GennemtrÃ¦ngende sÃ¸d og kvalm aroma. Aroma og smag af brÃ¦ndt malt og sukker. SÃ¸d klÃ¦bende eftersmag. DK-B-5,85

Dark with a persistent tanned head. The aroma muffled, but spicy christmassy with caramel, cinnamon, cardamum but with a bad earthy note thats a bit unpleasant. Sweet sugary flavor with syrup, burned caramel and christmas spices and a note of wood. Quite good for this kind of beer, if it werent for this earthy note.
red/amber in colour with nice spritzy head. huge malty nose. bitter taste with sweet tropical taste coming through at end of palate
MÃ¡la Project, NYC bottle: pours clear gold with white head. Aroma is grain, rice and sugar. Taste is light hops and tons of sugar. Cloying sweetness.
330ml bottle (International Food Store, Cambridge) (4:2:4:2:7=1.9) Bland sweet lager aroma. Pale tight ehad. Taste is blandish sweet corny lager. Metallicish bitterness in the finish. Cleanish-ish.

Bottled 330ml ("Tsingtao 1903", KCM Mikkola, ABV 5.0 %) Pale yellow colour, small white head, bubbles. Skunky, corn aroma. Light-bodied. Crisp. Pale malty, corn, grass, skunkyness. Industrial, not too fresh, crap.

0.33 l bottle from K-Citymarket Ruoholahti, Helsinki as Tsingtao 1903 with ABV 5%. Golden, clear, bubbly, big head. Rice adjunct makes this a bit too sweet for my taste. Maybe it would be OK with spicy food.
16 ounce can bought in Guangzhou supermarket. Light yellow amber color and some ok cold lager taste.
330ml bottle (International Food Store, Cambridge). Pale yellow color. Small size, white head, stays. Sweet, malty, glue, shit in aroma. Very sweet, sugary, malty, papery in taste. Typical macro.
une pils bien peu originale, trÃ¨s trÃ¨s lÃ©gÃ¨re, pour boire quand il fait vraiment chaud...
500 ML. - The taste was good. I can actually tell it is the tastiest Tsingtao beer. You should try.
66cl bottle purchased @ Tang frÃ¨res. Lager assez surprenante qui s'avÃ¨re agrÃ©able.

330ml bottle. Clear golden colour with a one finger white head dissipating immediately. Aroma: not much here, light grains and hops. Taste: light malty grainy, light hops, slightly sweet malt finish. Light body, average carbonation. Inoffensive but rather bland, really nothing to talk about.
Pours gold with a nice white head. Aromas of light hops and a minor hint of citrus. Balanced for sure, it keep a firm and complex moutthfeel through the finish. Nice job.
Pours a super clear pale yellow. Faint toast aroma, some DMS, hints of floral hops. Flavor is a clean toast malt, some graininess, slight tannins and mild sweetness. Drinkable, no doubt.
Tap. Pours a clear yellow. Not much aroma. Some bready. Flavor is candy and some light hop bitterness. Ok for chugging

tap @ TBBC. pours clear golden, thin white head. aroma and taste, pine hops, grainy mouthfeel, some lemon peel, light biter finish with hints of grains/malts adding for a well balanced Bohemian. Nice for the style, doesnâ€™t retain the hoppy characteristics of the pilsener which is what makes me like the Bohemian style better. Dry palate

Visiting Florida for the week and found this on draught. Appearance is hazy gold with minimal head. Floral hops and sweet malts come through in the aroma, and then much stronger in the flavor, along with some graininess. Very nicely balanced and quite enjoyable.

Tap. Pours a clear golden with a small white head that fades to a ring and leaves some lacing. Aroma of pilsner malt and spicy floral Saaz hops. Taste is the same as aroma. Medium mouthfeel that finishes clean and crisp with a moderate amount of bitterness. Simple but very good..

On tap @ brewery. Pours a watery looking clear gold with decent enough bright white head. The aroma is very light with vague sweetness and a faint floral hop note. The taste starts sweet and malty from lightly roasted malts. Then the floral hops grow in strength and mix with the sweetness. This mixture seems to create an almost soapy flavor. The hops gradually become more and more bitter toward the finish. I still sense a slight soapiness into the after taste. It may just be the malt and hop combination creating this flavor on my palate. As more and more ounces are consumed a nice malty flavor starts to shine through and tipping the balance of sweet malts and hops away from that bit of soapiness I sensed.

Hazy gold with a small white head. Flavor is not overpowering, but nicely balanced between the grassy Saaz hops and a sweet, fruity maltiness. Very refreshing on a hot September afternoon. My glass disappeared quickly!

Draught. Golden body, small off white head that fades quickly, no lacing. Aroma is very muted, can get some malts, hops and grains and thatâ€™s about it. Flavor is better, citrus, malts and cereal grains. Light to medium bodied, nice carbonation. Finish is somewhat bland, bitter and medium length.

Draft... Clear yellow lager with a small, creamy, white head. Excellent retention. Earthy, leathery aroma with a generous ration of pale grains. Stylistic brew that leans well toward the bitter side of balance with a nice hop bite. Medium-bodied and creamy with lively carbonation. Lengthy, crisp, bitter finish.

Tap from wood fired pizza in Tampa. Dark brown pour and nutty nose. Thick good head. Smooth taste and good undertones of nuts, Carmel and fruit. I don't taste much animal semen in there. ---Rated via my mouth
30vk bottle shared with kermis. Decent white head. Clear golden pour. Not a bad pils especially for the price.
This is a fairly bland beer. Slightly biscuity, malty taste. Unpleasant aftertaste.
Draught at the brewery. Reddish brown color, beige head. Dry hoppy taste with some sweetness, caramel, herbs, citrus. Good deal of bitterness in finish. Unconvential, but good ale.
Tap at brewpub. Nice brown pour with a thick tan head. Aroma of chocolate and roasted grain. Taste is smooth chocolate malt and some roasted grain. Good brown ale.
Had on tap at the brewpub. Aroma and flavor smell of coffee and dark malts, a bit much with chocolate as well for the style. Not bad, though.
Pours medium brown with a nice full head. Nice hints of nuts and malt that show off a deeper roast in the mid palate. It finished nice and well rounded.

Deep brown coloured body with a thinnish tan head. Aroma of nuts (of course), caramel, toffee and malt. Medium-bodied; Strong nuts in the flavours, apricots, spice and a bit of malt dash the beer. Aftertaste shows some sweetness, but mainly the bitterness of the nuts. Overall, not a good beer - the worst of the lot for me. I sampled this beer on draught at Tampa Bay Brewing Companyâ€™s Brewpub in Tampa (Ybor City), Florida on 10 November 2007.

Cask @ TBBC. Pours deep amber, with thick beige head. Aroma is hoppy and grainy. Taste is grainy with some spices and malts, light hoppy aftertaste with some sweet honey? Some nice toffee/coffee roastiness. The cask gives the beer some extra resinous and light fruity (apple) note.
on tap-pours an off white head and amber color. Aroma is medium malt, earthy. Taste is medium malt, earthy hops. Mild carbonation. 3.0

column1: Tampa Bay Bloody Good Pale Ale
column5: Bitter smell. Citric acid overplays a bit of a grainy character. Copper color. Pretty good.

On tap at Tampa Bay Brewing, pours a cloudy dark orange with a small white head. Aroma brings out earthy and caramel malt, with resinous hops, and a touch of toffee. Flavour is intense, with a mouth assault of resinous hops and caramel malt. For something so intense, itâ€™s not abrasive or harsh at all. Good stuff.

Pine. Candy sugar. Caramel. Clear copper. Off white thick foamy head. Great retention. Leaves a coating on the glass. Smooth and sweet. Caramel. A hint of earth. A hint of pine. Hard candy. Very nice. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft to taster at Tampa Bay brewing at 10.2%. Pours a clear dark golden color with a small off white head. The aroma and flavor have sweet malts, caramel, herbal notes, some moderate fruit character, alcohol, decent enough.
Cloudy red with an off white foam. Malt nose and only hints of caramel. Good body and alcohol balance.

Pours cloudy orange-amber with a substantial off white head. Aroma is sweet & slightly muted grains. Taste is hop forward with some syrupy sweetness up front. The hops take over after that with a not-quite-citrus fruit quality and stark bitterrrrness that goes to a lengthy finish. Definitely an American style barley wine.

On tap @ Tampa Bay Brewing. Copper in color with a thin ring of white foam. Sort of on the boozy side and, of course, quite sweet. Plenty of caramel, brown sugar, and toffee. Big time gold raisin fruitiness, too. Maybe a hint of cotton candy? Light floral and woody/herbal hops. Not a winner for me.
Draught at brewery. A bit of a boozy pour. Sweet with caramel and brown sugar. Orange body.

Draft at the original Tampa location. Clear ruby color with tiny head retention. Aroma is candied dark fruits, thicker caramel and a hop I canâ€™t really place my finger on. The body is medium and the best from the sampler so far. The flavor has a huge amount of candied fruits. Sugar coated grapefruit, raisins, plums, with a mild floral type hop. Nicely done.

Sample at the brewpub. Dark amber color with a thin white head that recedes quickly. Spotty lacing. Aroma of malt, caramel and fruity hops. Full-bodied with flavors of caramel malt, ripe fruit and earthy hops. The finish is syrupy with a grainy malt and fruit aftertaste. Decent overall.
Clear copper pour with no head. Aroma is non existent. Taste is dark fruit and Brown sugar. Syrupy.

column1: Tampa Bay Red Eye (Redeye) Amber Ale
column5: RÃ¶tlich kupfer im Glas, relativ trockener KÃ¶rper, deutliche bittere, nicht schlecht

column1: Tampa Bay Red Eye (Redeye) Amber Ale
column5: Draft. Pours red, off white head. Faint malty aroma of caramel and floral. Taste is medium high sweet. Medium body finishes sweet with a hint of hops.

column1: Tampa Bay Red Eye (Redeye) Amber Ale
column5: On tap @ Tampa Bay Brewing. Dark amber colored beer with white foam. Pretty typical amber ale...not sure what I expected. Sweet caramel, toast, toffee, and fruity esters. A light citrus and floral hop character, at least...but perhaps a little bit too much in the dried out flowers/perfume department. Maybe a touch herbal, too. Light bitterness and a whole lot of malty, sugary sweetness.

column1: Tampa Bay Red Eye (Redeye) Amber Ale
column5: Flight at the brewery. Clear Amber. Caramel malt aroma. The taste adds earthy hops. Slight dark character, toast, bread crust. Perfectly paired with a Cuban sandwich. Very nice. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

column1: Tampa Bay Red Eye (Redeye) Amber Ale
column5: Draft at the original Tampa location. Yes, the color is Amber with a light lasting head. Aroma is toasted malt, light toffee and a weak fruit hop. The flavor is exactly as you would expect it to be. ( just like the aroma, no deviation) body is light and dare I say watery. Well I will say it because it is watery. Very light hop or malt profile, meh

column1: Tampa Bay Red Eye (Redeye) Amber Ale
column5: Okay, so it smells like cheese, Parmesan cheese... Itâ€™s weird but I dig it. Like a hearty beer. Oddly good. Flavor is rich and fairly dark, pretty roasted but with a biscuity finish. I thought it was gonna be dry but itâ€™s not at all. Itâ€™s really decent and full body for an amber. I dig it.

column1: Tampa Bay Red Eye (Redeye) Amber Ale
column5: Sample at the brewpub. Pours a clear orange-amber color with a medium thin off-white head that dissipates quickly to an outer ring. Spotty lacing. Aroma of malt, caramel and slight hops. Light-bodied with flavors of pale malt, caramel and grassy hops. The finish is sweet with a short malty aftertaste. Slightly above average overall.

column1: Tampa Bay Red Eye (Redeye) Amber Ale
column5: Aroma of malt and grain, great looking reddish brown colour with a creamy off white head. Sweet malt taste with a creamy feel and a hint of malt in the finish.

column1: Tampa Bay Red Eye (Redeye) Amber Ale
column5: Nice clear amber pour with minimal heâ€™d. Aroma is non existent. Taste is a surprise after the aroma. Nice malt and hop balance. Roasted, sweet and bitter

column1: Tampa Bay Red Eye (Redeye) Amber Ale
column5: Boring pour, faint aroma, & not much flavor going on. Not really a fan!
Draugh at the brewery on January 25, 2014. Black color, light brown head. Sweet, spicy taste. Roasted aftertaste. Medium mouthfeel, medium bitterness. Sweet scent.
Another inaccurate one. Had it at the brewpub but was very good. NIce and creamy shape but proper Stout features.
smooth with apparent alcohol. licorice and a long finish there is some rye like component. with a low aroma this brew has some coffee and a nice brown head.

reminds me of a pirate ship .. . deep roast, nice solid bitterness .. . medium mouth feel .. . the abv shines through a bit .. feels a touch out of whack .. . i liked this well enough .. . . letâ€™s stick to regular monopoly. the game is crazy enough as it is; how can an iron be a landlord?
Draught at the brewery. Dark color, brown head. Strong taste with liquorice, chocolate, coffee and long lasting burnt finish. Excellent stout.
Dark black in color, clear with a thin tan head. Dark malts, chocolate and coffee flavors and aromas. Tasty and dry finish this was a very good Stout.
On tap at TBBC, poured a dark black color with a tan head, aromas of malt, molasses, and coffee. Tastes like the aroma with a nice dry finish.
From an old tasting note. @ the brewery - sampler. Palate is thin and crisp. Bitter chocolate, musty, smoke, nutty. Roasty burnt malts. Pretty good.
Draft @ Brewpub: Dark black color, tan head. Thin body and impact. Light roast and thin body for an imperial stout. Bitter tail. Very light aroma, almost like itâ€™s on nitro.
Draft. A black beer with a light tan head. Scent of malts and a hint of molasses. Taste is roasted coffee with a smooth light bitterness. Dry finish.

on tap on the premises. hazy very light golden with a small white cap offering some retention and lacing. acidulated wheat, peppery of course, nice citrus, no curacao per se, few herbal notes, clean yeast - no phenolic esters. loose carbonation - slightly lacking; light body - watery; relatively dry peppery-citrusy finish. mode than decent wit as orange/coriander combo seems m.i.a., lol.

DÃ©gustÃ©e en fÃ»t sur place. De couleur dorÃ©e laiteuse et voilÃ©e. Nez de levures fruitÃ©es (trÃ¨s citronnÃ©) lÃ©ger de blÃ© et dâ€™Ã©pices (coriandre) avec des traces de houblon herbeux. Post-goÃ»t court-moyen, composÃ© dâ€™un lÃ©ger goÃ»t de levures fruitÃ©es (zeste dâ€™agrumes) et de blÃ©. (printemps 2006)

On tap at Reservoir. Served with a slice of lime which was rather nice actually. Pours a lightly hazed gold with a medium sized white head. Soft musky wheat on the nose, a light bit of yeast. After I chewed up the lime wedge I was ready to go on this. A touch of lemony grain. Better than the pils in terms of drinkabality, soft musk and wheat into the finish. Pleasant enough.

En fÃ»t. Verre de 12 oz directement Ã  la brasserie. ArÃ´me: TrÃ¨s lÃ©gÃ¨re odeur dâ€™agrumes. Apparence: La couleur est blonde-blanchÃ¢tre voilÃ©e. PrÃ©sence dâ€™un mince col mousseux et dâ€™une fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: LÃ©ger goÃ»t de cÃ©rÃ©ales et de lime. DurÃ©e moyenne de lâ€™arriÃ¨re goÃ»t. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture lÃ©gÃ¨rement minÃ©rale. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. LÃ©gÃ¨re prÃ©sence dâ€™agrumes en arriÃ¨re goÃ»t. (Rating #3976)

From tap at the brewpub. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is fruity and slight citrusy. Mild yeasty, lemonish and citric. Bitter, citric and mild sweet flavoured. Bitter, phenolic and light grassy. Dry and bitter finish.
Draft: pours a hazy yellow color with a thin white head, wheaty aroma, citrus taste. Nice and clean.
Draught at the brewpub. Rough and citric aroma, not so clean. Cloudy very pale yellow colour. Good creamy stable white head. The flavour is nicely citric, lemony. OK mouthfeel.

On tap at the brewpub. !st off they put a lime slice in the beer.......why oh why? Anyways. Aroma of wet grass, and hay. SOme VERY light citric notes (probably from the lime wedge) The flavor was sour, and off putting. Not very enjoyable.

Draft... Hazy, very light yellow ale with a small, creamy, white head. The nose is mostly nondescript... very mild yeast and citrus. Soapy, lightly sweet flavor with very mild citrus (lemon) tanginess. Medium-bodied with a creamy mouthfeel and lively carbonation. Finishes crisp, but grainy as well.

Cloudy yellow body topped by a long lasting white-head. Generic witbier. Wheat and cirtrus aroma, wheat and citrus taste. Very watery body but after all, the place is called the Reservoir!!!. They must have changed the recipe because I seem to remember a bit more complexity (coriander and other spices). The pint I had was very boring and generic, the type of bland beer one could expect from a place like Les 3 Brasseurs. Iâ€™ll wait a few months and give it another try. Draft at brewpub.

DÃ©gustÃ©e en fÃ»t sur place. De couleur ambrÃ©e-orange et voilÃ©e. Nez fruitÃ© sucrÃ© ( lÃ©ger de pÃªche, notes de melon et dâ€™agrumes), lÃ©ger de malt du genre caramel doux, lÃ©ger de blÃ© avec quelques notes de houblon floral. Moyenne-mince en bouche, moyennement pÃ©tillante et avec une texture aux notes crÃ©meuses. GoÃ»t fruitÃ© (agrumes, notes de pÃªches, dâ€™abricots et de melon) lors de lâ€™entrÃ©e en bouche suivi dâ€™un goÃ»t de malt (caramel doux, notes de bonbon) et dâ€™un lÃ©ger goÃ»t de blÃ© puis en finale lâ€™On retrouve des petites notes amÃ¨res de houblon floral. Post-goÃ»t moyen, trÃ¨s lÃ©gÃ¨rement amer de houblon floral avec un petit goÃ»t de blÃ© et quelques notes fruitÃ©es (orange, pÃªche). (Ã©tÃ© 2006)

Orangish pour with medium whitish head. Lots of citrus on the nose, orange and tangering primarily. Smells like Trident Orange MInt gum. Citrus is dominant, with some sweet malt, very little if any hop presence. A session beer for the new drinker.

Pint on tap at the brewpub. Yeasty aroma with some mild astringent sourness present as well. Some light citrus, orange hops are also detected in the nose. Moderate-mostly hazy orangey body with a frothy, off-yellowish head and nice lacing. Sweet, smooth malty start. Cheewy, caramelly middle with plenty of malts present. Light citric orange and spiced, dry hops to finish. A very drinkable beer, which seems to be more of a lightly hopped pale ale than a wheat to me. A great session brew.

Draft... Murky, deep amber ale with a small, frothy, off-white head. Fruity, spicy aroma. Fruity flavor with mild sweetness and light bitterness. Notes of citrus, pear, apple and banana. Medium-bodied and creamy with adequate carbonation. Finishes very lightly bitter, spicy and dry. Another thin offering not brewed to style. Mediocre at best even with style not being a consideration.

Dark amber orange with a small white head. Yeasty tart citrus aroma. Flavour is similarly yeasty, with grainy oddly fruity notes and a hint of cheap orange flavoured candy. Notes of sweet lemon. Average palate. Alternates between quite pleasant and a touch bizarre.

Cloudy orange body with a little head that quickly turns into a ring. Not much aromaâ€¦ not much taste either. Some wheat, a little bit caramel and a whole lot of water. Could have used some hops. Very watery. I understand the brewpub rent must be expensive at this prime location near the trendy St-Laurent street in Montreal, but do they really have to water-down the beer?!?!? Refreshing thatâ€™s for sure, but tasty? Draft at brewpub.
Je lâ€™ai trouver un peu amÃ¨re, un peu de goÃ»t de blÃ©, correctio, trop! Avec un trÃ¨s petit goÃ»t de caramel. Passable.

The beer at this pub is a black mack on the great brewpub name of out city. The amber wheat, a favorite among regulars Iâ€™m told, is no exception. Pours a cloudy lightly carbonated drab coper, thin white head that forms a tiny island of sludgy foam that floats till the glass is empty. The nose is slightly bubble gum and salt water, but itâ€™s very light. The mouthfeel is milky and overly wet. Taste is dominated by green wheat and bubblegum, some sour milk, and little else. Aftertaste is creamy toffie. All this and they served it to me in a shaker. Feh.

(Draught) Half-pint ($4) purchased at the Reservoir Brewpub on November 4, 2005. Pours a thin, white, foamy and quick dissipating head with a cloudy orange body. No nose. Milky, past-due sour cream. Butterscotch finish. God awful... FYI: Reservoir = Montrealâ€™s Black Sheep Brewpub. Poor quality. Poor service.

Opaque and amber, with only a ring of lace circling my glass. Aroma is quite wheaty, with a witbier yeastiness, but it also had acidic twang that Iâ€™m fairly certain was an infection of some kind. Iâ€™m pretty sure the brewer here isnâ€™t messing with Brett, at least not purposefully. Soggy wheaties and bread, with a hint of spice that reminds me of Coup de Grisou, a local buckwheat hefe made by Cheval Blanc. However the infection showed up again in the taste, and was again a little too light. I know this type of Beer isnâ€™t supposed to be too round in the mouth, but this one just had something lacking.

column4: Le Cheval Blanc - Brasseur Artisan & Bar
column5: A strangely wet earth odor leads to extremely dry beets basking around a vinegary spine...A poignant, cherry red skin also emanates this precious marinated beet smell...Have you ever inhaled a dry lotus leaf?...

Bouteille 500ml. Jaune et voilÃ©e. Nez de blÃ©, lÃ©ger de levures fruitÃ©es (citron et trÃ¨s lÃ©gÃ¨res notes de bananes) avec un lÃ©ger souffle Ã©picÃ©. GoÃ»t de levures fruitÃ©es aux faibles notes acides (lÃ©gÃ¨rement citronnÃ©, traces de pÃªche) et aux petites notes Ã©picÃ©es lors de lâ€™entrÃ©e en bouche suivi dâ€™un moyen goÃ»t de blÃ© et dâ€™une lÃ©gÃ¨re amertume de houblon herbeux en finale. Post-goÃ»t moyen, composÃ© dâ€™un lÃ©ger goÃ»t de blÃ© et de dâ€™agrumes avec des notes amÃ¨res de houblon herbeux.
hazy light yellow with a nice white head, some retention and lacing. light wheat and malt nose. light citrus and some tartness. lively, light body, decent but bland herbal-citrusy finish.

Bu au Oktoberfest des QuÃ©bÃ©cois 07 (fut). Blonde blanchie mi-brumeuse, petit collet. Arome faible de malte fruitÃ© peu impressionnant et peu de blÃ©. GoÃ»t de blÃ© aqueux, trÃ¨s peu fruitÃ©. En bref, trÃ¨s peu de substances!

Brown bottle, 500 ml; eye: golden with yellowish reflections, hazy, slight effervescence, white head that disappears rapidly and leave a little ring around the glass; nose: smells are not that pronounced, yeast (bread), spices, caramel, apple; mouth : starts all fizzy, spices, caramel, madera, pepper, finale where bitterness and alcohol appear, mildly sweet and bitter, medium body but somewhat watery texture; overall: special FRANÃ‡AIS Bouteille brune, 500 ml; oeil : dorÃ©e avec des reflets jaunÃ¢tres, lÃ©gÃ¨rement voilÃ©e, lÃ©gÃ¨re effervescence, mousse blanche qui tombe rapidement; nez : odeurs peu prononcÃ©es, levure (pain), Ã©pices, caramel, pomme; bouche : commence toute pÃ©tillante, Ã©pices, caramel, madÃ¨re, poivre, finale oÃ¹ lâ€™amertume et lâ€™alcool apparaissent, moyennement sucrÃ©e et amÃ¨re, corps moyen mais texture aqueuse; en rÃ©sumÃ© : spÃ©ciale

341ml bottle. Cloudy blond with a head that is gone before you halfway done, unless youâ€™re very thirsty. Does not have that banana-fruity aroma that I expect from a weizen. Instead I got this spicy acid citrus grapefruit taste. This beer, like half the people I know is below average.

bottle. Hazy yellow-golden colour with a small white head and lace. Aroma is predominately pepper and clove with emphasis on yeast...there is also light notes of lemon. Flavour has a reasonable amount of fruit but itâ€™s mostly spices. Quenching body with a dry finish. Not a whole lot going on and nothing to get excited about but itâ€™s a decent simple weizen.

Sampled on-tap at Vices & Versa Appearance: Honeycomb yellow, clowdy, with a thick frothy head that held itâ€™s own for a while. Smell: I was expecting a lot more banana. I found it amongst the grainy aroma, but I really, really had to look. Taste: You can taste the wheat up front, than a mix of bitterness and acidity, and the finish is malty sweet. Not a bad Weizen, but not a great one either.

Chubby 1/2 liter crown top bottle from the Joannette Metro in Montreal. This put a cloudy light gold beer with a nice frothy meringue cap in my weizen glass. Lightly carbonated no yeast dregs in the bottle...this is not bottle conditioned heffe. Interesting nose: light pineapple notes mixed with sweet jelly fruit gums....peppery on the tongue light body...sweetish...acidic with banana-peach notes and dry finish from the wheat...light bready aftertaste...this is very good rendition of heffe weiss. Iâ€™ll look for it on tap this summer in Montreal.

Tap at Vices et Versa. Called Blanche, but VV confirmed it was the Weizen. Hazy blonde with a thick white head. Fresh wheat with light spices and grass. Sweet malt and vanilla fudge, ith a good bitterness and creamy mouthfeel. Good.
Bottled. Hazy pale orange, brief creamy head. Pineapple and winegum aroma. Sweet and fairly malty with flowery finish. Solid and a tad unusual.
Surpised to see this is out of production. Tried it recently on tap in Quebec. Not quite as fresh or tasty as the ephemere apple, but its very tasty. Mild and fruity. Effervescent.

Drought at International Great Beer Expo (Meadowlands). Hazy yellow with white foamy small head, fruity aroma, high carbonation, sweet fruity taste, longish finish. Strange discrepancy between the aroma and taste. Did not enjoy it very much.

750mL Bottle in Montreal. Pours a light hazy yellow colour, fairly thick white foam. Aroma and taste is sweet, apricots and peaches. Great belgian character as well, presence of yeast, wheat, coriander, mild clove. Delicieux.

Bouteille 341ml. De couleur dorÃ©e et voilÃ©e. Nez fruitÃ© (pÃªches naturelles, traces de poires et dâ€™abricots), lÃ©ger de levures fruitÃ©es (notes dâ€™agrumes, traces de pommes) avec des notes de blÃ© ainsi que des traces dâ€™Ã©pices (poivre) et de houblon herbeux. Mince-moyenne en bouche avec un pÃ©tillement moyen-Ã©levÃ© ainsi quâ€™une texture aux notes sirupeuses fruitÃ©es. GoÃ»t fruitÃ© sucrÃ© aux faibles traces acides (pÃªches, lÃ©ger dâ€™abricots) avec un lÃ©ger goÃ»t de levures fruitÃ©es (agrumes, notes de pommes) ainsi que des traces Ã©picÃ©es (poivre) lors de lâ€™entrÃ©e en bouche auquel se rajoute des traces de blÃ©, de pain et de houblon herbeux. Post-goÃ»t moyen, composÃ© dâ€™un lÃ©ger goÃ»t fruitÃ© (pelures dâ€™abricots) avec des notes herbeuses

Originally rated in 2007. Man, I have not seen this one for many years. I use to buy it all the time. I think they made it for fall season. It also came in a tester pack with all the other EphemÃ¨re brews. Had a great peach nose and taste. Was cloudy and light orange colour with a white head. I wish they would bring this one back.
not a huge fan of this one decent peach nose and flavour but a tad too sweet refreshing should have had in the summer decent tartness so as not to over do the peach
Overly sweet, overly carbonated, overly artificial. Not a good combination for me. Three hours later, and Iâ€™m still burping fake peach syrup.

Bottle shared with HogTownHarry. Pours a very cloudy yellow with an average size diminishing white head. Aroma of unsweetened peaches, yeast, some sugar and spices. Flavour follows the aroma and is quite mild and watery -- itâ€™s a little dissapointing. Light bodied. Itâ€™s enjoyable enough but nothing Iâ€™d go out of my way to get again.

Bottle (750ml). Shared with blankboy, his bottle. Poured very cloudy light orange-yellow with a diminishing white head. Aroma of cling peaches, pears, apple juice, yeast and a hint of Blanche de Chambly. Taste is pretty bland - lightly of peach, it diminishes quickly. Mouthfeel is lightly acidic, watery and flat - smells nice, not much flavour.
Un arome de pÃ¨che lÃ©gÃ©, sa saveur de fruit est plus prÃ©sante que Pomme et Framboise, mais mois que Camberge. Une assÃ© bonne biÃ¨re de fruit.

OLD NOTES DEC 10, 2004 Light citrusy hops and malt nose, pours golden with foamy white head. Light malt body with a bit of hoppiness. Apparently this is suppose to be a wheat beer? Nothing outstanding at all really.

1st year this came out it was a great beer but from thn on it went down hill tastes like water from the derwent river give it a miss its not a wheat beer more a golden lager not impressed by the local drop

To me this displayed none of the charaacterisitics that I associate with a wheat beer, but I enjoyed it nonetheless. Poured crystal clear amber gold with a nice head that flattened into a lacy ring for the duration. I found no citrus or fruit characters at all in the aroma, only wet vegetation and malt. The palate is a nicely rounded light malt, slightly sweet, with grassy hops a pleasantly noticable presence. A great summer golden ale, but not a wheat beer in my books.

Bottled. Straw colur, clear, near no head. Grapefruity cascade hop aroma. Sweet and orangey with rounded mouthfeel and light wheat malt character. The hope contribute more to aroma than bitterness. I find this beer pretty pleasant, and well balanced as far as summer beers go.

Lightweight seasonal wheat beer. It pours a light lemon colour with a fleeting head. Very fizzy-looking. Odd, uninviting nose with some sour uric notes. A light, effervescent champagne-like body that ultimately feels insubstantial. Some citric notes and barely-there hoppiness. Essentially characterless, with none of the flavour and body of a good European wheat beer. One of the weaker links in the â€™Four Seasonsâ€™ range. (2003, bottle)

Tasted from the bottle. Poured a crystal clear, pale straw body with big odd bubbles that failed to form a head ( had minimal lacing ). No aroma, like trying to scent aroma from an Evian bottle! Light bodied inside, slightly acrid sour notes, citric cordial flavours and orange & lemon peel hints on the palate. Not at all a wheat beer and let alone flavoursome, nothing more than another forgettable macro-brewed â€™Aussieâ€™ beer!!!

Bottle: Clear light gold with a foamy white head. Cittrussy and grassy aroma, some melon and background malts (faint though). Hop dominant flavour but a little weak. Also very noticable sulphur flavours in the beginning. Soft carbonation and light bitterness. Nice enough, but bland (summer seems to mean bland in Australian beer language).
Clear, light and fruity. Small head no lacing, long bitterness. No noticeable aroma. Very cold though. Too thirsty for it to warm up.

A very nice light wheat beer that is perfectly suited to a hot Australian afternoon. The hops aroma is crisp and refreshing, as is the light taste of wheat. When itâ€™s 40Â° outside and the beerâ€™s 4Â°, itâ€™s perfect.

I can only assume that what this brewery is trying to tell me is that in summer people like to drink beer that has no flavour. Boring as hell, but without fault. Slight sweetness is the only distinguising feature. Drinkable yes, interesting hell no.
Tap at the Brea location. Crystal clear light amber pour. Small white head. Bready and roasted malt. Light somewhat syrupy palate. Just okay.
4 feb 2012, tap at Taps. Amber, clear some steady bubbles. Med/thin body and mildly fizzy. bubble gum and wheat bread on the nose. Bready/toast ale. Pretty nice. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at the brewpub. Pours with a clear, deep golden body with a small white head and good lace. Aromas are bready, toasty, light hops and a touch of esters (otherwise quite clean). Flavors are bready, light fruit, tea and caramel. Grainy, bready, toasty. Lively bubbles. Medium dry finish.

A: The pour is a light brown color with a thin layer of white foam. S: The nose doesnâ€™t have too much going on. The caramel and toasted biscuit malt aromas are pretty much the extent of things. T: The flavor was similarly one-dimensional. Mostly toasted and caramel malts with perhaps a touch of spicy hops. There really wasnâ€™t much to this beer, unfortunately. M: The body is medium with a slightly creaminess to the feel on the tongue. D: This is a rather bland and one-dimensional beer that just didnâ€™t do much for me. While it wasnâ€™t bad, it didnâ€™t make me want to go back for more.
copper brown with a fizzy white head. Malty cereal grain and earthy vanilla aroma and taste with an almost tangy finish.
growler shared by alexanderj. amber pour. aroma is caramel malt, some richer malt, and pit fruit. flavor is the same; rich fruity malt and caramel malt as well.

Bottle; orange-amber in color with a huge off white head. Aroma of nuts, caramel, soap and flowers. Flavor was a bit unexpected. Pretty dry; earthy and nutty. A bit on the hoppy side for the style. Nice palate. Very drinkable, albeit a bit strange. Malty with a bit of floral/soapy finish. A pretty solid beer.

One of my other favorite beers at Taps. I happened to try the cask conditioned the night I was there and stuck with the Alt the entire night. Fantastic aroma and great malt flavor. The color and consistency were perfect! The dry finish also made the beer an excellent dinner companion.
(Draft) Pours a clear deep amber body with a white head. Aroma of caramel and malt. Sweet mlat flavor with a hint of hops.
Copper colored pour with a thick off white head. Very dry finish on this one. Saaz I believe was written all over this one.
Tap at GABF. Pours a yellow gold with medium white head leaving spotty lacing. The aroma is yeast, wheat, biscuit. Medium body, wheat, earth malt, yeast, light finish, good.
December 15, 2015 - on tap at Irvine location. Clear yellow pour with limited head. Aroma and taste of a cream ale.

Draught at the brewpub in Brea, California. Clear pale yellow/golden beer with a small white head. Malty bready aroma, caramel, some fruity hops. Malty caramel flavor, fruity, bready, some hops. Kinda thin.
Just a kind of fizzy yellow beer with minimal light malts. Slight sour pucker but mostly just a usuall yellow brew.

Pours a straw yellow color with a small fruit and malt flavor. Taste is smooth with a light creaminess that coats the tongue. A smooth, slight sweetness to this beer. Overall decent and easy drinking.

Pour on tap at the brewery, clear golden pour with white head, aroma brought notes of grain, bread, biscuit into a bit of slight grass, touch of corn, earthy notes with a hint of yeast. Taste was a mix of grass, earth, bread into some grain, slight corn into a bit of yeast, touch of dough, finishing dry, clean.
Great tasting, not bitter at all, smooth and light, favorite beer at taps at the moment.
Tap at the Brea location. Clear light yellow pour with a white frothy head. Corn and cereal grains. Sweet. Not really my style.

Draught @ Taps Fish House and Brewery, Brea, CA Pours clear pale yellow with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, grass and herbal. Taste is light sweet and light bitter. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.

On tap at Taps. Pours clear pale yellow with a small white head. Aroma of some corn, herbal notes and malt. Flavor is sweet and fruity with some malt and some bitterness. Medium body, average carbonation.
Draft. Pours golden amber with a white head. Nice mild pumpkin spice, a little sweetness, and some cinnamon. Solid.
Tap at GABF. Pours a clear orange gold with medium off white head that lasts. The aroma is cinnamon, clove, pumpkin seed. Thin body, nutmeg, cinnamon, pumpkin, nice spice finish, very good.

Draught at the brewpub in Brea, California. Clear deep golden/copper beer with a decent offwhite head. Malty caramel aroma, pumpkin, spicy, bready, some fruity hops. Malty pumpkin flavor, caramel, bready, spicy, toffee, some fruits. Decent beer.
Strong pumpkin spiced aroma. More subtle pumpkin character in the taste with a sour edge going down (not sure why). Notes: GABF â€™13
Spices are one note and the beer lacks body. Tastes overwhelmingly like ginger and cinnamon. I prefer a creamier pumpkin beer.
Draft at GABF. Pours cloudy orange with white head. Nose and taste of clove, pumpkin, pie crust, nutmeg, cinnamon and spice. Medium body.

Tap at Haven Pasadena. Pours a clear golden with good, white foam. Nose is puppy breath, iodine, seaweed. Taste is intense nutmeg/cinnamon/clove medley. Palate is too dusty, almost like a spoonful of cinnamon.
Decent, on tap at Library Ale House, Santa Monica, tis the season for pumpkins but nothing crazy

Yes, pumpkin pie in a glass! Clear amber color with ivory sheen. Nice all spice, nutmeg, clove, cinnamon, pumpkin aromas. Medium body. Good mix of all spice, fall spice flavors with a caramel, pumpkin sweet base brew--very tasty
Orange pour with tiny head. Aroma is spicy nutmeg and cinnamon. Taste is very nice pumpkin flavors lots of nutmeg comes through. Really solid brew.
Draft. Amber beer with a cream colored head. Grapefruit aroma. Grapefruit and light pine flavor. Medium bodied. Nice bitterness. Grapefruit and light pine lingers.
Bottle shared by the Hangar 24 crew. Poured a cloudy orangish color. Aroma was floral, grassy, and hops. Taste was hops with small bitterness. Medium pallet. Very enjoyable and easy to drink.

A: The pour is amber/dark copper in color with a white head which leaves some mild lacing on the glass. S: The nose is about right on for a pale ale. The nose has a lot of citrus and resinous pine hops. The nose is very comparable to their IPA, actually. T: While the nose gave off a very hop forward aroma, the flavor was a slight step back. The hops are still there, but the caramel and slightly toasty, biscuity malt really comes through as well. M: The body is medium with the carbonation being a bit on the lower side. D: Overall, this was like a pale ale should be: an easy drinking and refreshing beer. Not the best beer on the tap list, but a solid enough choice.
On cask Poured a amber-orange color with a white head. Citrus, earth, pine and caramel; great nose. Floral as well. Nice earthy and hoppy flavor. Some citrus, flowers and caramel. Above average beer.

Cask at the brew pub. Hazy gold/straw color with a big creamy white head. Great hop aroma, lots of grapefruit, very pungent, but in a good way. Flavor was much the same, more grapefruit, very silky and smooth. Very well done.

Pours amber brown with thin white head. Aroma is mellow and nice balance of hops and malt. Flavor is similar: nice hops and aftertaste of subtle carmel malt. Nothing really amazing, but a good beer, none the less. A decent pale ale (i think Stoneâ€™s Pale Ale is better).
ON tap at brewery. Clear yellow with a creamy white head. Citrus and pine aroma. Crisp citrus and malty taste with very little bitterness.
Poured golden amber. Small head. Floral and citrus aromas. Hops upfront. Pretty floral with balanced caramel malts backing it up. A very drinkable session APA.
On tap poured a slightly hazy pale/red color with a small head. Nice hop aroma and a good balance of bitterness and carmel malt sweetness. Overall a good American Pale, but maybe a little more hops.
Most excellent Pale Ale..golden copper like a B.U. plder penny penny.perfect white head very nice white lace aroma hung on for ever. Perfect balance of hops. Excellent palate
Draft. Pours hazed gold with a white head. Yeasty, a little lemon and banana, some spice, and mild sweetness. Solid.

Draught at the brewpub in Brea, California. Hazy golden beer with a decent offwhite head. Malty caramel aroma, bready, citrus, banana, some floral notes. Malty banana flavor, grapes, caramel, wheat, spicy notes. Decent hefe.
Tap at the Brea location. Pale yellow pour - looks flat. Nice banana, clove, and wheat aroma and taste. Pretty decent.

Draught @ Taps Fish House and Brewery, Brea, CA Pours cloudy golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, wheat, banana and clove. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a long wheat and banana finish. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.

On tap at Taps. Pours cloudy yellow with a white head. Aroma of banana, cloves , wheat and some citrus. Flavor is sweety and fruity with some cloves, banana, hint of toffee and some citrus. Medium body, average carbonation.

On tap at the Brea location. A hazy yellow to golden beer with a white head. Banana, some cloves and a citrus touch in the aroma. Sweet banana flavor with some cloves and bitterness. A little citrus note too. Long finish. A quite decent wheat beer. 130812
Gold pour and a white head lead to a very typical wheat. Banana, gum, cloves, wheat. Nothing special but a clean and well executed beer.

Draft @ the Brea location. Pours a hazy golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity wheat malty banana aroma. Sweetish wheat malty spicy banana flavor. has a sweetish wheat malty spicy banana finish.

Tap at the Brea location. Thanks to FlacoAlto for sharing. Low haze golden. Small foam. Nose is estery, heavy pear juice. Taste is pear juice, all pear with small banana. Palate is medicinal, clovey, a bit papery.

Tap in Corona. Rating #25. Dense dark yellow, super thick looking and very cloudy with a nice white head. Sweet citrus and banana, spicy with a nice clove background. Sweet banana flavor, lemon and a nice little spice to it. (2179)

A: The pour is a dark brown color with ruby red highlights when held up to the light. A fingerâ€™s worth of off-white head. S: The nose is on the sweet side with chocolate, oatmeal, and caramel malts. A bit of roast and coffee to go along with it. T: A pretty decent flavor, but not overly impressive. Chocolate, mild coffee, mild roast, and a hint of bitterness. Like most of the other beers Taps has, very sweet. M: The body is medium with a smooth carbonation. Not quite as silky as oatmeal beers tend to be. D: This is a good beer, but itâ€™s not mind blowing. I wish it was a little more interesting and had more intense flavors.

On tap at the brewpub. I rated this as a brown ale, because it fits better as a brown ale in my mind than a stout. Pours a really light colored brown for a stout (about 18 SRM!), with a small tan head. Aroma is oats, grainy, woodsy, earthy, brown sugar and very light roast. Taste is a typical brown ale (not stout), brown sugar, grainy, earthy, caramel, and VERY light roast. Medium to high carbonation.

Sampled on tap at Taps on 7/10/2010 from a 2 oz sampler. This oatmeal stout pours a dark amber color from the tap. Small sized white foamy head. The aroma is chocolate, roasty malt and a touch of vanilla. A medium to light bodied Oatmeal Stout. The malts are chocolate and nutty. The hops are herbal and earthy. Nice balance. There is just a hint of chocolate throughout the beer, kind of a nice effect. I was kind of expecting an oatmeal stout to be a little thicker bodied. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is slightly bitter.

On tap at TAPS fish house and brewery. Comes out ice cold...pours a deep black with a thin head. Nose is strong of soy sauce, licorice, malts, oats, and sewer. Taste is soy sauce, roasted malt, oatmeal. Mouth is very dry and thin...not bad, not great...however, I wonâ€™t be ordering this again.
Reddish brown with a creamy tan head. Sweet malty aroma with mild chocolate and lactos notes.
Tap at the Corona location. Deep dark mahogony, almost black with a tan head. Very mild aroma, clean and roasty. Very smooth, creamy mouthfeel, light roastiness, very drinkable. Good stuff.

ON cask at Taps; I am surprised all these beers donâ€™t have more ratings. Color was pretty nice; a darkish, red tinted brown. Aroma of caramel, oats, vanilla, lactic sweetness, wood and cocoa. Flavor had a good amount of sweetness, oats, caramel, cocoa and vanilla. Not too strong of roasted presnce. Good for the style.

Date: 12/03/2006 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub clear dark red, wispy tan head, creamy body, roasted and chocolate aroma, rich chocolate flavor, light bitterness, Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 7/10; Palate: 8/10; Overall: 13/20 Rating: 3.4/5.0 Drinkability: 8/10 Score: **+/4

Poured a lightly hazed black color with a very tan head. The aroma had mild notes of ash and roast with a hint of chocolate. The flavor was of roasted malt and mild cola notes. Fruity toward the back and a dry finish.
I had this on draft at Tapsâ€™ brewpub. It pours jet black with a thin tan head. The flavor is dry, roasty with hints of oats. Very smooth and tasty.

24-Apr-14 (12-oz bottle: Obtained in trade with goldtwins, thanks Larry!) This beer pours a black body with a thin, tan head that settles to a razor thin ring. The nose is roasty and malty, with dark chocolate, dried dark fruit, dark toast, earthy wood, and tobacco, aromas that really make me look forward to the first sip. On the palate, the flavors of dark chocolate, cacao nib, tobacco, grilled meat, medium-dark toast, and woodsy earth are all quite prominent, and there's a hint of tart cherry way in the background. The beer is medium-full in weight, generally dry with medium carbonation and a touch of acidity. Overall, this is really delicious. It's picked up some wonderful flavors from the cellaring that I always find so appealing. Very enjoyable.

Tap at the brewery. Attractive black pour. Cocoa, molasses, prominent hops that pull in the direction of black IPA. Feels and tastes a bit thin to be out of short pants and on the big boyâ€™s playground.

STOUT--IMPERIAL STOUT?--12 OZ. BOTTLE 1999--8.50% ABV. (4.75 / 5.0) Dark black color. Initial spicy chocolate notes evolve into spicy rich smooth body with subtle cream flavor. Sampled 9/6/1999. 2003--6.00% ABV. (4.25 / 5.0) Lacy espresso head. Opaque jet black flecked big dark sediment color. Roasted floral hop front. Creamy smooth rich burnt sweet cocoa toffee fruit estery mild coffee body. Rich coffee earthy hot hop end. Sampled 4/21/2004.

I forgot about this one in cellar and now i know why it poured black with a tan head and had a little coffee finish but besides that it really did nothing for me with flavor or taste and was a little thin.CHEERS!

Draft at the brewpub. Black with a positively gigantic, dense, creamy head that you could float away on. Big buttery nose. Wow, you really canâ€™t smell anything else but diacetyl. Rich, grainy, creamy body. Butter bomb all the way. Pretty much wrecked, and thatâ€™s too bad, because the appearance and what you can get of the recipe show lots of potential. Nice spicy hop finish.

The beer poured an almost opaque black with ruby highlights and a small creamy tan head. The aroma was tart with roasted coffee notes. The flavor was roasty but tart and very dry on the bitter finish.

Date: 05/16/2007 Mode: Bottle Source: Tasting black, wispy beige head, sweet licorice and roasted aroma with a hint of ripe fruit, a bit thin, sweet roasted malt flavor, slightly tart soured milk character, lots of roasted bitterness in the finish, Aroma: 7/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 11/20 Rating: 3/5.0 Drinkability: 7/10 Score: **/4
Pours a deep black color is brown head. Aroma is malty, and diacetyl. Flavor is malty, roasty, and a buttery diacetyl finish.
Dark and handsome. Tastey however a flat, syrupy taste. It is thin bodied with a thick mouith like a stout should. smokey, chocolate sits very pleasantly. Smells like a porter... high octane

On tap at brewery. Was a dark, dark pour. Nice head - very creamy. Faint hints of chocolate and coffee, but not overwhelming. A very nice mouthfeel - full, but not heavy. A little on the sweet side - could use a bit more bitterness. Overall, a very likable brew.

(Draught at Chez Moeder Lambic Fontainas, Brussels, 20 Oct 2018) Black colour with creamy, beige head. Malty, roasted nose with notes of chocolate, milky coffee and roasted nuts. Malty, roasted taste with dark chocolate, coffee, nuts, a touch of smoke and a balanced cacao bitterness. Medium body, with a slight sweetness. Really well balanced, smooth and tasty porter. Very nice.
Cask @ Moeder Lambic Fontaines, Brussels. Pours black with a small creamy head and lacings. Roasted malts and ashes. Some dark fruit. Smooth and soft. Roasted bitter finish.

19/09/2018 - draught @Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Black with nice beige head. Dark malts, roasted, dark chocolate and coffee in the nose. Taste is dark malts, roast, coffee, bit ashy, dark chocolate, bit hops, bitter roast ashy ending. Solid!

Bottiglia. Sentori di orzo tostato, caffÃ¨, cioccolato e affumicato vanno a dare soddisfazione al naso. L'olfatto viene stimolato in maniera molto elevata ed elegante, permanendo in maniera pregevole. Il cappello di schiuma color marrone castagno ha una buona tenuta e la persistenza Ã¨ lunga. La grandezza delle bollicine Ã¨ a grana fine, come al piano inferiore, dove il colore Ã¨ come l'inchiostro nero. Il corpo Ã¨ strutturato non pesante ed articolato. Il dolce Ã¨ medio in equilibrio con l'amaro medio. La forza gustativa Ã¨ elevata. La continuitÃ  gustativa Ã¨ buona. Il gusto Ã¨ piacevolissimo. Le sensazioni boccali finali risultano lunghe e di "buona birra". Il retrogusto Ã¨ intenso. Al gusto vengono donati toni di miele, caffÃ¨, liquirizia, nocciola, frutta secca, luppolo, agrumi ed affumicato.

AromÄƒ uÈ™oarÄƒ de malÈ› uÈ™or prÄƒjit, pÃ¢ine neagrÄƒ puÈ›in prÄƒjitÄƒ, acrealÄƒ specificÄƒ berilor negre (malÈ› prÄƒjit Ã®nÄƒcrit), uÈ™oarÄƒ afumÄƒturÄƒ pe fundal. Gust plÄƒcut, iniÈ›ial cu puÈ›inÄƒ dulceaÈ›Äƒ, apoi brusc uÈ™oara amÄƒrealÄƒ de malÈ› prÄƒjit, ceva fructe negre È™i puÈ›inÄƒ cafea. BunÄƒ È™i uÈ™or de bÄƒut. Un porter foarte bine fÄƒcut.

Very dark brown almost black colour with a small tan head. Aroma of dark chocolate and roasted malts, hint of coffee. Taste of bitter dark chocolate and coffee, some hops in the finish. Smooth and drinkable.
Porter di alto livello, nera con bellissima schiuma marrone. Aroma che spacca di malto tostato e caffÃ¨. Buona anche al palato per i malto tostato e una discreta secchezza.

Keg at Scurreria Beer and Bagel. Genoa. Opaque dark black coloured pour with a a lasting creamy light tan head. Aroma is sweet woody chocolate malts, tangy dark cherry , milky, earthy roast, hints of coconut. Flavour is composed milky chocolate roast, tangy dark fruits, woody, vanilla. Palate is rounded, medium sweet, milky, lowish carbonation. Little grain tannin in the finish
Alla spina. Classica porter cremosa e lattiginosa con note caffettose e di cacao amaro. Corpo lieve, vellutata, pannosa. Piacevole ma non il mio stile.

Draught @ Lambiczoon, Milan. Pours black with a tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, roasted, some slight burned toast, licorice, dark chocolate. Flavor is rich malts, coffee, expresso, toast, light bitter licorice, dark chocolate. Medium body, soft to average carbonation, dry and light bitter finish. 121215

Light blond color. Very nice hop aroma, citrus fruits, orange flowers, spices. Good mouth sensation, good balance of bitterness and swetness. Good body, nice malt, some sweetness, little corky (pleasant note).

column1: St. Poloise La Cervoise des Sept VallÃ©es
column5: Bottle@Home. Malty aroma with a hint of honey. Amber colour, small beige head, good lace. Sweet, lots of honey but the cheap one that is used by bakers, light bitter. Cloying, flat. Quite annoying.

column1: St. Poloise La Cervoise des Sept VallÃ©es
column5: 25cl bottle at Craigâ€™s house. Translucent golden colour. Not too gassy, but not too good either.

column1: St. Poloise La Cervoise des Sept VallÃ©es
column5: Bottle at home... Felt i had to Given Stephen a French beer since he lives there ... oh and i didnt want it all... amber ... bubbly white head ... soft grassy ... flowery violet nose ... sweet grassy hop ... no real character ... again some floralness ... quite honnyish

column1: St. Poloise La Cervoise des Sept VallÃ©es
column5: New edition? Mentions 6.1% ABV Huge, putty, just off-white ehad over well-carbonated metallic-chromate yellow beer. Fruity and light-spicy nose, a bit jam-like; hayish, nice, sweetish smell. Bitter-metallic and a honey finish, but not very balanced, rather sudden break, just a bit peppery. After some time, reverting to more sweetness, vaguely honeyish. Quite slick, no long aftertaste to enjoy; medium bodied. Nice nose, but the rest is less super.

column1: St. Poloise La Cervoise des Sept VallÃ©es
