column5: I got a 16oz glass of this that poured a cloudy amber orange color with a nice off-white head. The aroma was that of a cherry wheat scent. The taste was mild with a cherry and wheat taste delivering a slightly sweet tone. Was ok but could really use some more cherry flavor here. A decent fruit/wheat beer but there are better ones on the market.

column1: Flossmoor Station Chessie Cherry Wheat Ale
column5: On draft at Flossmoor, poured a muddy light pink color, aromas of wheat and light cherry. Flavors are wheat, and light tart cherries. Nice, light, crisp, and refreshing.

column1: Flossmoor Station Chessie Cherry Wheat Ale
column5: On tap at the brewpub, pours a hazy amber/orange with a thin white head, the aroma is slightly of cherry and yeast, the flavor has an artificial cherry like front end with a finish of yeast and wheat, really not all that enjoyable.

column1: Flossmoor Station Chessie Cherry Wheat Ale
column5: Draught at Flossmoor Station - brewpub. Cloudy amber - white head. Cherry, bubblegum, wheaty, light flowery, sweetness, light yeasty, tartness, too sweet.

column1: Flossmoor Station Chessie Cherry Wheat Ale
column5: Sampled at the brewpub. A funky fruity appearance that is almost like a bloody Mary. Lots of thick lacing. The nose is cherries. That is also what is tasted. It is fairly dry with very slight bitterness. This is very east to drink and a nice summer beer.

column1: Flossmoor Station Roundhouse Raspberry Wheat Ale
column5: Fruity and light. A red to amber pour with a thin and slightly off-white head. Aroma is sweet. Flavor of raspberry with a slight synthetic feel.

column1: Flossmoor Station Roundhouse Raspberry Wheat Ale
column5: Sampled at the brewpub. It poured a lightly hazy golden color with a white head. The aroma was of raspberry, some wheat and floral notes. The taste was of raspberry, some tart wheat, light citrus and a touch of bitterness. Not my style, but was enjoyable.

column1: Flossmoor Station Roundhouse Raspberry Wheat Ale
column5: On tap at the brew pub. Poura an ugly dark copper that looks like it had purple dye dumped in the middle, just looks generic. Good retention and lacing...The aroma is really nice raspberries, not generic at all, almost as good and real as a framboise lambic in terms of representing the true smell of a raspberry. The fruit is further balanced by some really nice wheat aromas...The taste sadly is a huge letdown those nice raspberries turn here into some generic and stale and reminds of another crappy stawberry beer that just canâ€™t be done right. too sweet, generic, with a weird aftertaste. A poor fruit wheat beer thatâ€™s not worth trying.

column1: Flossmoor Station Roundhouse Raspberry Wheat Ale
column5: This one was just amazing. I tried a sample before my meal and ended up ordering an imperial pint afterwards. The aroma is of raspberry, sweet, slightly tart, citrus. The color is a wonderful dark ruby red haze. Raspberry taste, tart, and slightly sweet. Raspberry is definitely tasted in this beer. Nice clean aftertaste. Will be ordering again. I bet this brew pairs great with a cheesecake.

column1: Flossmoor Station Roundhouse Raspberry Wheat Ale
column5: Sample at the brewpub. This brew is a hazy purple-amber color with a medium ivory white head that recedes to a film. Thick rings of lacing on the glass. Aroma of raspberries and grainy malt. Light to medium body with flavors of tart raspberry, sweet malt and wheat. The finish is fruity with a slightly sour aftertaste. Pretty standard fruit beer overall.

column1: Flossmoor Station Roundhouse Raspberry Wheat Ale
column5: On tap at Flossmoor Station pre-DLD. Pours deep hazy red with a small off-white/pink head. Aroma is raspberries, wheat, and grain. Decent, better than the cherry wheat beer here. Flavor has a nice fresh raspberry note, along with some medicinal cough syrup. A little wheat as well. Not too sweet, unlike the cherry wheat. Medium body. A little watery on the palate, but not terrible. A pretty average fruit beer overall. Nothing too exciting, but drinkable and not too offensive at least.

column1: Flossmoor Station Roundhouse Raspberry Wheat Ale
column5: On tap at Flossmoor. Pours a hazy crimson brown with a medium sized white head. Smells of raspberry puree, sweet and syrupy. Sweet and with some wheat, a bit empty and one dimensional, sort of like someone dumped some jam in there. Cloying finish.

column1: Flossmoor Station Roundhouse Raspberry Wheat Ale
column5: Draft @ Flossmoor Station, Flossmoor, IL. Pours a reddish color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity fresh raspberry aroma. Fruity raspberry flavor with some hints of caramel. Has a sweetish wheat malty raspberry finish.

column1: Flossmoor Station Roundhouse Raspberry Wheat Ale
column5: Tap at Flossmoor. Must have been in the mood - this tasted fantastic on this day. Slightly hazy dark orange/red pour, white head. Sour raspberry nose, great raspberry flavor, not too much, easy drinking.

column1: Flossmoor Station Roundhouse Raspberry Wheat Ale
column5: Tight nose. Sour fruits and hints of malt. Flavor is sour raspberries and thats about it. Mouthfeel is tart and medium weight with a medium length finish. Meh.

column1: Great Dane Belgium Special Pale Ale
column5: Belgian Pale Ale offered at the downtown brewpub in Sept. 2012--might not be the same as the "special pale ale" of 2010? Sharp hop finish. Hazy yellow with a substantial clinging head. Like an English saison--which is to say, not really a saison but what the English tend to brew when they brew a Belgian saison. Heavy on spice, vegetal notes. Didnâ€™t care for it, but some might. (on tap at brewpub)

column1: Great Dane Belgium Special Pale Ale
column5: Pour is a cloudy gold with a average white head. Aroms is fruity with some yeast and spice. Flavor is again kinda fruit to start out then comes some yeast and hops. The new thing in brewing must be a Belgian IPA or pale ale. There is not much variance from one brewer to the next. All are tasty and fruity but this only takes away from the hops.

column1: Great Dane Belgium Special Pale Ale
column5: Hazy, glowing golden orange with a large white head, leaves a sticky lacing at least for a while. Aroma has good travel, lots of yeasty must and citrus zest. Flavor similar, yeasty, plenty of orange peel and cinnamon. Flawed by a bit of cardboard, especially in my initial impression. This faded. Palate is dry and very lively with carbonation

column1: Great Dane Belgium Special Pale Ale
column5: draft at great dane. pours a hazy yellow with a small cream head. spicy, dough, pear yeast aromas. flavor has a slight grassy hop bitterness, drinkable, but not overly impressive.

column1: Great Dane Belgium Special Pale Ale
column5: On tap at the downtown brewpub. Consumed on 8-7-09. Pint pour. Listed as "Great Dane Belgian Pale Ale." Considering that it was on tap in the summer, it should not be listed as a winter seasonal. Subtle, surprisingly hoppy-dry aroma features apricot scent. Pours a hazy, pale orange. Good, solid, drinkable brew. Not over the top, but quite pleasant. Apricot flavor. Hops are surprisingly noticeable, especially in the finish. Very drinkable. Lively in the palate. I like it! Itâ€™s basically a good American Pale Ale with a light Belgian twist.

column1: Great Dane Belgium Special Pale Ale
column5: On tap at the downtown Dane. I kick myself everytime I go here. I know someday i will stop visiting the super pretentious, unfriendly downtown location. Pours a dull hazed over amber colour with a huge-ass head. Wicked soft hops, barely detectable on the nose, more orange then anything. Taste was really creamy with a mild hop finish. Such a difference between the American and Belgian Pale Ales. Not sure I liked it that much.

column1: Great Dane Belgium Special Pale Ale
column5: On draught at the Great Dane Hillsdale location. Pours a semi-hazy golden colored brew with a thin off-white head that has some nice retention and spotty lacing. Aroma of golden grain malt, some Belgian yeast, orange zest, cloves and field straw. Taste is medium bodied, with flavors of golden grain malt, some citrus zest, lemon and a touch of clove. Finish is slightly overly carbonated, metallic and a dry herbal aftertaste.

column1: Great Dane Belgium Special Pale Ale
column5: &#40Draught 8/8/08&#41 Pours a hazy yellow body with an average off-white head. Aroma of floral, citrus, spoiled veggies, and grass. Flavor of hops &#40citrus, grass&#41, pepper, biscuit, spoiled, and Belgian yeast with a somewhat grainy mouthfeel and dry finish. 5/3/5/2/9 &#40Draught 8/7/09&#41 Pours a cloudy golden body with a small white head. Aroma of citrus, yeast, and grass. Flavor of orange, Belgian yeast, grass, banana, and pepper. 7/3/7/4/14

column1: Great Dane Belgium Special Pale Ale
column5: On tap at the brewpub downtown. Pours a clear yellow gold with a thin white head. Medium to strong notes of yeast, citrus, spice, and lemon in the nose. Light malt lemon flavors with a touch of grain. Highly carbonated with a herbal finish. Slightly watery and not too enjoyable.

column1: Great Dane Belgium Special Pale Ale
column5: Draft at Great Dane (downtown). Poured a hazy light orange color with a white head. Some lace was left behind on the glass at the end. There were whiffs of orange marmalade, clove, and hay, and while pleasant, the aroma was subdued overall. I really had to get my nose in the glass. Light bodied, dry, and a little tart. Pale malt and lemon dominated the flavor with an odd papery note emerging at the end.

Amber pour with a slight off white head. Minimal lacing. Aroma of cinnamon, nutmeg, and sweet malt. Taste is moderately sweet with a weak body and an oily light carbonated finish. Not spicy enough or full enough for the type of pumpkin beers that I like
On tap at Great Dane downtown. Amber with a thin white head. Aroma of nutmeg, cinnamon, mace and pumpkin. Taste is spicy but not quite there with nutmeg, cinnamon, caramel and pumpkin.
9th October 2008. GABF. Clear brown beer. Refreshing and crisp. Full on fruity flavour. Dry finish, very flavoursome!
Just add whipped cream and you have pumpkin pie! Pumpkin pie color, aroma and taste. Not overpowering. Nicely done.

A nice beer overall, nice bright pumpkin flavors. Vibrant semi-clear orange colour wih a small white head. Aroma is faint of nutmeg and baked pumpkin. Flavors are decent, a little weak at times on the spice otherwise a generous amount of pumpkin keeps this beer alive adn well.

Sampled on draught at the downtown Madison, Wisconsin brewpub. Pours a clear golden copper amber brew with a decent off-white head that quickly dissipates to thing off-white head and leaves behind some spotty lacing. Aroma of light caramel and golden grain malt, some nutmeg and just a hint of pumpkin. Taste is light to medium bodied, some carbonation with flavors of golden grain and caramel malt, a hint of pumpkin and nutmeg. Finish is slightly watery with a slowly disappearing nutmeg and spice aftertaste.

An amber/orange brew with a minimal head. Nice pie aroma (cinnamon and allspice) that is followed up on the tongue, some pumpkin also. Enough oil on the tongue to allow it to linger. Spices help too, of course. A fine pumpkin, better than in some previous years IMO, when it has had a bit of detergent flavor. 2006 is a winner.

On tap at the Madison brewpub. Poured a clear medium-golden with a light white dusting. Home-cooked aroma of pumpkin pie filling, brown sugar, nutmeg, and cinnamon... somewhat subdued, but quite pleasant. Flavor really followed the aroma well, with a short finish of pumpkin pie with a wheaty crust. Light-bodied on the palate (but not to the point of being watery), and quite smooth. Good pumpkin ale, but a little spice-heavy.

Aroma of nutmeg, pumpkin pie spice and cinnamon. Aroma is all smaice with just a tiny hint of malt. Clear golden-orange with a thin, non-existant head. Sweet, pumpkin flavor with a fruity yeast character, is that a hint of grassy hops? Maybe,...probaby not. Increadibly thin and watery. I like pumpkin ales, but this one just didnâ€™t do it for me.

Iâ€™m a afan of a good pumpkin ale, but after living on the Lakefront Pumpkin the last couple of weeks, this brew just doesnâ€™t measure up. Not a bad beer, but itâ€™s almost like comparing pumpkin pie made with real pumpkins vs canned pumpkins. he Dane entery is the canned pumpkin.

500ml bottle, from BeersOfEurope. 5.7%. Murky tan/orange colour with a head that quickly went awol. Quite citric lemony aroma with some confected bubblegum notes. Palate is also lemony, but sweetish too. Fairly fruity but doesnâ€™t have much estery banana character. Mouthfeel is prickly, but thin, with sharp edges on the finish. Having looked at my notes for the regular version, I have to say that this seemed rather similar. I suppose I expected something a bit more from a "special" winter version, so it ended up seeming rather lightweight and lacking in presence. Palatable enough but not really what I was expecting.

Bottle (which says 5.7%). Cloudy gold colour with 1cm white head. Wheaty aroma with some banana and citrus. Same for the taste; nicely balanced, nice medium bodied mouthfeel, quite highly carbonated. Good Hefe-Weissbier, like it.

Cloudy gold with an off-white large head. Aromas are wheat, sweet malts and citrus with some banana. Flavours are sweet wheat, sugar, lemon and not as much banana and spices as expected. Like the Erdinger Schneeweisse this winter weisse is inferior to the regular version.
Hazy orange color - huge rocky head. Intense banana and vanilla nose - and of course taste - as always. Kind of weak though. Average.

Very cloudy, dirty orange appearance. Huge head. Banana and vanilla tone amidst a bread-like wheat body. A little pepper in the aftertaste. Luscious body and thick-ish. Great balance. Nice hefeweizen.

Pretty standard aroma: Banana and vanilla mainly. Pours a cloudy orange-amber with a big fluffy head - good looking. Too light in taste and body for a winterbeer - its a pretty ordinary weizen, maybe a tad more spicy than usual. Slight estery aftertaste.
Creamy head. Herbal bitter flavor. Pineapple, just a hint of cinnamon. Pretty well balanced beer.
cloudy orange colour, big head and a nice lace, deep corn aroma with notes of banana and a hint of undefined spices, light citrusy, sweet and very smooth with a dry wheat aftertaste

i was pretty excited to find this today. i thought it must be something special for christmas. but it really only seemed like a slightly lighter version of the original. it''s pretty early for festive beer so i expected it at least to taste very fresh but it didn''t have the usual full aroma and flavour of the original. oh well, who wants to drink wheat beer in winter anyway?
Bottle from kappldav. Many thanks! Clear dark brown colour, beige foam. Nose of caramel, light roasted malts, some dried plums. Easy drinkable, thin body.
Dark brown with a medium off-white head. Aroma is roasted malt, cocoa amd liqurice. Taste is malt, toasted bread and coffee

Bottle 50cl. Poured into a lager glass. Clear dark chestnut brown, tall frothy tan head, diminishing slowly, fair lacing; shy aroma of toasted malts, brown sugar, licorice; taste is medium sweet and light bitter, light malty, licorice, average duration, mild sweetbitter aftertaste, light chcolate and earthy notes; medium body, watery texture, soft carbonation; not completely convincing but all in all decent.
0,5 l Flasche. Aroma: RÃ¶staromen, Maggi. Erscheinung: Schwarzes Bier, cremefarbener Schaum. Geschmack: Typisch Schwarzbier. Nachgeschmack: WÃ¤ssrig. Gesamt: MittelmÃ¤ÃŸiges Schwarzbier.
bottle, thanks kappldav123! Brown with a mid-sized off-white head. Malty start, grainy, very shy hints of coffee, some caramel. Not too dry, not very black, rather boring but quite ok.

0,5 l bottle from kappldav123. Thanks a lot! Dark red brown in the glass. More than one finger beige head. Some musty malt on the nose. Taste starts malty, also some sweetness. No real deepness. Sweetness, and cardboard toasted malt. Higher carbonated than expected. Can not really convince.
Rating from 2005. Leicht sÃ¼ÃŸlich und angenehm lakritzig, aber zu wenig malzig fÃ¼r ein gutes Schwarzbier. Zu flach. --> 11
Ins Glas ergieÃŸt sich ein schwarzes Bier mit ordentlicher Schaumkrone. Geruch rÃ¶stmalzig, erdig, leicht wÃ¼rzig. Geschmack rÃ¶stmalzig, leichte Kaffe Aromen, erdig, trocken malzig, leicht sÃ¼ÃŸ.
Bottle: Brown color, brown head. Light caramelic nose. Flavor is malty, light grainy, light caramelic, light hints of toffee. Light bitter, roasty finish.
Black with a creamy off white head. Yeasty and dark fruit aroma with Taste is quite sweet with butter.

50 cl bottle @ hotel room, LÃ¼bbenau. BBE 01/2020 Aroma has roasted malt and metal. Flavour has metallic tones, some roasted malt and licorice. Also diacetyl, butter and cardboard. Not good, too much off-flavours here.

50 cl bottle @ apartment, Brauerei Babben, LÃ¼bbenau. Pours dark copper color with a large off-white head. Aroma is malty with some artificial sweetener tones, subtle cocoa and dark fruit notes with hints of hops. Flavor is bitter malty and quite sweet, some faint caramel and syrup tones. Not good. 5323
18-04-19 // tap at Freiberger Schankhaus Clear but very dark brown. Beige head. Roasted malts. Coffee. Dry. Minimal fruits. Good.
Clear, dark brown with huge slightly beige head. Malty, little roasted malts, hints of nuts, light metal, overall a bit disappointing.

Dark brown, almost black, with a cappuccino-colored creamy head. Taste starts off malty, followed by a gentle bitterness that combines to a savory composition. To some extent. A little watery inbetween. Drinkable.
Typical clean and crisp german dark beer. The roast is noticeably subdued in this one. Making it more of a warm weather schwarz. Boerbose Dresden
Frisch vom GÃ¤hn beim Italiener in Adlershof getrunken. Ein normales Schwarzbier hÃ¤lt, etwas wÃ¤ssrig.
Tap at Freiberger Schlankhaus Dresden. No aroma at all. Taste a bit sweet, roasted sugar, some grain coffee.
At Internationales Berliner Bierfestival 2016. Dark amber with a medium head. Aroma and taste of light roasted malt, caramel, some fruit and light metal.
From tap. Dark brown colour with a small beige head. Aroma and flavour of malt, caramel, nuts and roasred notes.
Cleat golden colour, little white head. Malty, sweetish, some straw, medium carbonation, low bitterness.
A nice dortmunder, dark yellow color, a bit more maltiness and alcohol strength than a pale lager. Clean and well brewed to style. Netto Dresden

Flasche als Freiberger Exportbier. Helles gold-gelb, etwas KohlensÃ¤ure, normaler Schaum, klar. Im Geschmack wie Aroma nichts besonderes, etwas Hopfen, etwas MalzsÃ¼ÃŸe, wenig bitter. WÃ¼rziger Abgang.
Butelka 50 cl,barwa sÅ‚omkowa klarowna,piana drobna biaÅ‚a szybko znika.W smaku zdecydowanie sÅ‚odowe z ziemistym finiszem zdecydowanie gorsze od pilsa.

L: -pours a clear golden with a medium to big,foamy,white head -medium carbonation visible S: -lemon,green apple,vanilla,honey -fairly subtle overall T: -lemon,grainy,earthy,honey,spicy F: -medium carbonation -light to medium body O: A standard German Export Lager. Fairly decent overall.
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are grass, straw, malt, flowersand hops. Nice bitter finish.
Bottle from Kaufland, Magdeburg. Clear yellow with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and hay. Flavor is medium sweet and light bitter. Dry and light bitter finish. 030616

Pours gold from the bottle. Very little malt in the aroma; a light hoppy twang is noticeable but generally the aroma is very restrained. The crown is soapy and sudsy in appearance, and rapidly fades. Medium bodied and well carbonated.Taste is lightly sweet, but has a raw and uneven note to it. Something here did not appeal to me, although I would struggle to define it. It has a monotone, almost peppery bitterness with a hint of resin in the finish. Not something I would buy again.
0,5 l bottle golden, clear, frothy, white foam, bread, cereal, herbs, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, oily feel, average carbonation,
Color clear dark yellow with medium white head. Aroma malt, grain, flowers, grass. Taste malt, flowers, grass.
A well made amber ale. Pours deep brown. Aromas of toffee, malt, brown sugar, and some hops. Tastes malty, sweet, with some hops, crispness, and caramel at the finish.

Light malty character and decent amount of hops aroma, hint of caramel. Deep copper brown with small, thin, lacing head. Soft, low carb, medium watery body. Not too sweet, with big hops character. A tad salty. Pleasant bitter, nutty after and finish. Clean and refreshing. Not spectacular, but a decent offering.
Pours a copper color with off white thick head. Toasted malt aroma and taste. Clean with a light buttery texture. Notes: bottle from Bavaria, Oct â€˜18
0,5 l Dose. Goldenes, leicht trÃ¼bes Bier. Riecht und schmeckt deutlich malzig. KÃ¶nnte das gleiche Bier wie das Memminger Gold MÃ¤rzen sein.
50cl bottle. A clear dark amber beer with a mid-sized beige head. Aroma of caramelish malt, red malt, some nuts and spicy hops. Taste of mild spicy hops, caramelish malt, nuts, moderate bitterness.
Pours clear amber with a thin white head. Taste is malt, fruit, some sweetness, and a very distant bitterness in the palate. Quite drinkable.

spruce, citrus, herbs, cereal, hay, bread, caramel, roasty, toast, earthy, leather, barnyard, dough, leaves, alcohol, banana, bubblegum, butterscotch, pale, golden, amber, orange, red, clear, hazy, cloudy, sparkling, rocky head, frothy, minimal head,
Bottle. Pours copper with a white head. Aroma of fruity, hay, marzipan, sugary, light toaster. Sugary sweet, sugary, dust.
Bocken varer lige til pÃ¥ske. Dark golden with a lasting white head. Malty aroma with toffee and biscuit and a herbal touch. Sweetish malty flavour with herbal hops and a metallic touch
Bottle @ Dolles Bockstival - Bocken varer lige til pÃ¥ske, 5000 Odense C. Pours clear copper with a white head. Straw, grains and bread. Short bitter finish. Clean.
Beer #12 from Kalea Beer Advent Calendar. Pours a golden colour. Taste is qyite clean and slughtly herbal. Would make a decent session beer
Can from the Kalea advent calendar 2017. Clear gold colour lasting white head. Some spicy hop. Some ok syrupy malt. Some white pepper hop. I liked it. Good spicy hop finsh.
Beer with yellow color, fuzzy aspect, soft carbonized, soft bitterness, low foam, (drunk a 40cl draft beer with PG at Theaterplatz markt, Weimar, DE #776)(#84 DE)(#2 Thuringia).
Bottle from Kaufland, Jena. Light hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and moderate hoppy - straw. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 150216
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are sweet malt, grass, straw and hops. Sweet and light bitter finish.
Klares goldenes Bier mit einer ordentlichen weiÃŸen schaumkrone. Geruch getreidig malzig, mild hopfig. Geschmack mild hopfig, getreidig malzig, uninteressant.
Herb bitterer, eher trockener Antrunk. Kaum vorhandene WÃ¼rzigkeit, dafÃ¼r steigt die Bitterkeit an, wenig hopfig. Einfaches aber rundes Pils. 8/8/9/8/8/8
* Old rating. 0,33l bottle, best before 20.03.02. Leicht sÃ¼ÃŸliches Pils. Nicht zu herb, sÃ¼ÃŸlich-getreidiger Nachgeschmack. Nett.
Many thanks for this bottle to kappldav123. Pale golden with small head. Slightly grassy with hint of sweetness and hops in the finish.

Bottle 33 cl from JUM. Crackling blonde with a fine and compact head. Soft malted aromas with hints of hop and citric. Lively taste, soft and bitter, slight and crispy hop that is release at progressively.

#728 Hellgelbes Pils mit reichlich Schaum, der sich schnell verabschiedet. Das Aroma ist allenfalls etwas grasig. Im Antrunk dann sehr dÃ¼nn und geschmacklich kommt der Hopfen schwach rÃ¼ber. Erinnert mich an manch andere Mainstream-Pilsener: Nicht schlecht, aber auch nicht wirklich gut! Test vom 9.1.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche Noten: 10,8,9,9,9,9 - 8,95
Transferring my data before I used to rate at Ratebeer. Iâ€™ll add a more detailed description as I drink it again, I promise.

On tap at the Pint. Has a golden color with some carbonation and very little head. Smell is of light hops. Taste is lightly malted, pretty crisp, and a light hop finish. Overall it was pretty good, but nothing out of the ordinary.
Decent lightish lager with some Bitter characteristics, rather fruity and with a decent body; but overall dull and with little to no aroma. It got much better after this one..
Starts out on the sour side, but sweetens and becomes very lemony-butterscotchy as it warms. Very yeasty.

Bottle from Table and Vine. Dark reddish brown with lasting ring and some lace. Woody boozy roasted caramel aroma. Sweet roasted caramel and ashy wood with some fruit and brown sugar. Roasted nutty woody bitterness with linering ashy smoke. Medium-full body, low carbo. Excellent interpretation of the style. Way underrated. Iâ€™ll bet there a dozens of cherry-cough-syrup Scotch ales rated higher than this.
22oz bottle. Pours a dark reddish brown with a thick creamy tan head. Fairly average scotch ale. Sweet malty flavors with a hint of smoke. Not bad, not great.

22 oz. bottle shared by shareanevada (notes from 2010). Pours a clear copper brown color with a small beige head. The aroma and flavor had sweet malts, some smoky, mild peat notes, light dark fruits with some earthy bitterness. The flavor was a bit watered down tasting.

On tap at the brewery. Pours deep brown with a lacy head. Aroma of roasted, chocolate, and lightly smoked malts plus some floral hops. Flavor the same with a nice amount of malts/hops. Average texture. A pretty good Scotch ale.

22 oz. directly from the brew pub. Deep ruby color with no head or lacing. Nose is smoky peat with dark fruit and light chocolate. Lots of smokiness in the flavor with a light smoked meat flavor. Sweet malt comes up toward the finish. The smoke and sweetness complaints each other well. Medium in body. Itâ€™s ok.
Bottled. Poured brown. Smallish head. Smoky peaty aromas. Some malty tastes. It was ok.

On tap at the brewpub. Iâ€™m not sure how this Scotch Ale accumulated so much bitterness, but I found it off-putting. The smokiness was unnoticeable. Malt structure, otherwise, was quite good, but I couldnâ€™t get past a terse, harsh bitterness that was very up front.

At table and vine beer tasting, smoky, they used peated malts straight from Scotland and it shows. Awesome character added to a complex intricate scotch ale. The best beer at the beer tasting hands down. Great job!

The aroma consists of caramel and toffee, with an essence of smokiness. The beer pours a dark brown, but its consistency and lack of lacing leads to a watery appearance. The flavor is dominated by the astringency of ethyl alcohol. A slight smokiness is noticeable, along with notes of roasted malts, but the jejune nature of the ale makes it overall uninteresting.

Bottle. Poured a clear dark reddiish brown color with a moderate frothy brown head that mostly lasted with excellent lacing. Moderate to heavy toasted malt and earthy hop aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth texture and flat carbonation. Medium to heavy toasted sweet flavor with a medium to heavy bittersweet finish of moderate duration. Solid complex drinkable brew.

From Oct 2008 I got this bottle in a trade with Yamar18. Thanks Kevin! Big pop on opening the 22oz bottle but no gushing. Big 3 finger head of foam with good sticky lacing and dark brown with reddish hues in colour. The smell...well..it doesn't smell like the typical English Brown Ale. I'm getting a lot of citrus and not much else. What is going on here? The taste is all citrus but not bitter...it definitely leans heavily toward the sour side and everything else that could be there is overwhelmed. Weird. I love sour beers but, frankly, not in Brown Ales. I also get some notes of pepper and a slight malty taste that just pops in once in a while and disappears as quickly as it showed up. I don't think I held on to this bottle longer than I should but maybe I did. Mouthfeel is light, carbonation is medium. Nice combo but this brew is difficult to drink for me. I can't recommend it as it is.
Taster at brewpub. Pours dark brown with a khaki head. Leaves some lacing in the glass. Very malty and sweet on the nose and tongue. Finished clean.
TrÃ¨s ordinaire. Je nâ€™ai pas terminÃ© la bouteille et la personne avec qui je lâ€™ai partagÃ©e nâ€™a pas terminÃ© son verre. DÃ©cente sans plus.
Just ok. Head fades nearly immediately. Pretty bland taste. Lots of malt and not much else.
A decent example of an American Brown Ale of which there are very few. Low IBU is sufficient to balance the mild malt sweetness. Taste does not linger into the next sip.
Bottle. Pours brown with tan head. Nose/taste of toasted nuts, caramel malt, grass and lightly soured bread. medium body.

22 ounce bottle. Not a bad brown ale for a chilly and dark autumn afternoon. While brown ales are not among my favorite types of beer, this one is a commendable representation of the category. Nice dark color, white frothy head, and a malty finish. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Included as part of a sampler at the restaurant. I found most of the beers here to be very well done. And the food was great too. Canâ€™t go wrong with anything at this place.
Nothin wrong with this one. A bit muted and boring. Taste is bready malty and medium sweet with a smooth crisp finish. Easy drinking and not a bad time.
Dare I say this is undercarbonated? Pours with no head. Sweet, heavy in body. Nice toasty malt flavor, but cant get over how sweet it is.
2008 bottle..Pour is dark black with a light tan head..Nose is oxidation, spice, chocolate, spice...Taste is oxidation, chocolate, brownie, musty,

Vintage 2010, Bottle #31 A half inch of mocha foam falls quickly over this black ale. There remains a ring of said foam. No lace. Smells of leather, anise, molasses, alcohol and some hints of apple. Iâ€™m happy with this. I would suspect this to taste like a toned down aged Nightstalker. Sweet with bitter bite. Thereâ€™s a hop presence to this still and reminds me of some of the hop profiles in some ABAâ€™s. I like it as itâ€™s a little spicy and a little meaty. Theres a certain nitrite flavor to this beer. Some dark malts, hint of blackstrap and some graham as well. Medium on heavy with low carb. i would argue a little more carb would go a long way to help open this beer up. Alcohol is not notable on the flavor. I liked this beer. I think, based on reviews, I would enjoy this beer with another year, or at least an â€™09 as the reviews on the â€™09 are pretty stellar. Serving type: bottle 01-19-2012

22 oz. bottle 2012 vintage. Black liquid with fleeting tan head. Aroma is a burst of chocolate, coffee, and roasted malt. The flavor is more of the same with coffee, chocolate and roasted malt. Still has noticeable alcohol notes which really shocked me after nearly 12 months of cellar. I guess it should have sat another year? Maybe I built this up in my mind because it wasnâ€™t mind blowing in the flavor department. Good and drinkable but nothing that I have to run to Western MA to get again.
On tap at ACBF 6/1/2013 Fruity roasty caramel toffee butterscotch mess. This has been an elusive brew for me I finally got to try it and I feel a little let down.
Black pour, small brown head. Very pruny aroma, strong. Soy sauce notes perhaps? Hmm. Flavor like prune juice and chocolate. Chewy mouthfeel. Yum.

Sample, brown bottle, 12 ounces, 2009, bottle 282, from and with Luc BourbonniÃ¨re (merci!). savoured on October 18 2012; eye: black, opaque, dark brown head, average lacing; nose: molasses, roasted barley, dark chocolate, slight coffee, light burnt barley; mouth: molasses, roasted barley, dark chocolate, slight coffee, light burnt barley, soy sauce, ink, dry finale in roasted barley with presence of pleasant acridness, full body, not much carbonation, astringency, harsh; overall: quite fine FRANÃ‡AIS Ã‰chantillon, bouteille brune, 12 onces, 2009, bouteille 282, de et avec Luc BourbonniÃ¨re (merci!), savourÃ©e le 18 octobre 2012; Å“il : noire, opaque, mousse brun foncÃ©, dentelle moyenne; nez : mÃ©lasse, orge torrÃ©fiÃ©e, chocolat noir, trÃ¨s lÃ©ger cafÃ©, lÃ©ger orge brÃ»lÃ©e; bouche : mÃ©lasse, orge torrÃ©fiÃ©e, chocolat noir, trÃ¨s lÃ©ger cafÃ©, lÃ©ger orge brÃ»lÃ©e, sauce soya, encre, finale sÃ¨che en orge torrÃ©fiÃ©e avec prÃ©sence dâ€™Ã¢cretÃ© agrÃ©able, corsÃ©e, peu carbonatÃ©e, astringence, texture rugueuse; en rÃ©sumÃ© : bien bon

This bottled brew from a bottle shop poured a large sized head of foamy light brown colored bubbles that were mostly lasting and left behind a semi-opaque dark ruby red brown colored body and a thick foamy lacing. . The mouth feel was weakly tingly at the start and at the finish mild roasted malt aftertaste. The flavor contained notes of roasted malt and dark malt. A decent one that I would consider drinking again.

2009 vintage: A deep dark stout with a thick dark brown head. In aroma, a musty bitter chocolate with molasses and coffee grinds. In mouth, a rich and complex bitter chocolate, soy sauce, molasses, burned bitterness, alcohol warmth, very nice. Shared with GRM, Oct. 2012.

Vintage 2009 Bottle #135 The beer is a near black shade, with a finger of tan head that generates some decent lacing upon the glass. The aroma is enticing, with some nice chocolate notes and a healthy roast presence. The flavor is not quite as enjoyable as the aroma would indicate. There is a dark fruit presence to accompany the roasted malt and dark chocolate flavors. The beer is medium bodied, with alcohol presence fairly tame. A decent brew that I would have again, but not a top-notch RIS. Serving type: bottle Reviewed on: 02-12-2011

2008 bottle thanks to lushawn. Pour is deep vinous black with almost no head. Aroma is full of deep dark fruits, light roasted malt, faint vanilla, and faint tobacco. Flavor is full of more deep dark fruit with hints of roasted malt and faint coffee. Very brandy-like with only a tiny amount of carbonation. Very little oxidation. Great stuff.

Smell is a maltier pilsner but light on pilsnery-ness... couldn't rate appearance in bottle...taste is smooth and malty for a pilsner...much more mouthfeel than expected...light on complexity but bold and flavorful for the style. Had in hotel room in Orlando with megan
Ipanema Restaurant, NYC bottle: pours golden wjth a white head. Aroma is light sugary bread. Taste is light simple, lightly sweet lager. Is what it is.
Uma pilsen leve e refrescante, mas sem deixar sabor aguado. Muito parecida com a Original.
330 ml bottle. pours golden with white head. nose is of fermented apple juice. taste is of sweet juice and some hops. typical pale lager.
Poured from a 12 OZ bottle into a pint glass at the World of Beer. Clear golden color with a small white head. The taste has a grain and corn flavor.
Very balanced, yummy to drink, a premium premium beer. Perhaps it is the pure water of the amazon, the noble ingredients reported and the German technique, an excellent draft beer.
Great beer, with a soft palate and very pleasant. Very easy to drink and very beautiful packaging.

CERPA's traditional beer in a 600 ml bottle. Alongside the Draft Beer process, it's recognized as a unique product, especially in ParÃ¡, where it dominates 40% of the market and outsells all other brands. This leading position is due to the quality of the product, its proximity to the consumers, our efficient logistics and the competitive price of the beer ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
ColoraÃ§Ã£o palha,espuma tÃªnue,aroma praticamente nulo,no sabor um pouquinho de malte,e Ã© sÃ³. Pensar que a alguns anos era uma marca cultuada.
Golden color, clear liquid and minimal head. Light malty aroma. Palate - refreshing and balanced. Not bad for a pale lager.
Black with a brown head. Sweet aroma of bread, brown sugar and roasted malts. The flavour is very sweet, almost cloying, but still itâ€™s a pretty decent HvidtÃ¸l.
brown sugar,black, cloudy, brown foam light,light sweetness, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, need more sweetness

Dark brown with a red hue and a nice head. The aroma is sweet and malty and the flavour is sweet with notes of roasted malt, hints of rye bread and a very weak touch of licorice. Itâ€™s an OK hvidtÃ¸l!
Bottle. Brown colour with a brown head. Aroma and flavour of malt, caramel and sugar.
Bottle. Nice head with medium duration. Color is dark ruby. Aroma is pleasant sweet malt. Taste is sweet malt and is a quite watery.
Dark brown with off beige head.Sweet with taste of sirup and malt light rosted aroma less bitter then many others HvidtÃ¸l.

33 cL bottle. Pours dark brown with a red hue and creamy light brown head. Dry and slight roasted malt aroma. Flavour has some sweetness but is more dry malty than other hvidt oel brews. Slight watery finish.
Bottle. Dark brown colour with medium creamy light brown mostly diminishing head. Weak aroma. Very sweet flavor. Watery palate.
Bottle. Deep dark brown colour with an average lasting puffy head. Quite a sweet aroma of roasted malt. Very sweet flavour with roasted malts and caramel.
Bottle, 1.8%. Quite sweet flavour, but not overly so. Slightly burnt malt flavour. Nice, soft carbonation. Actually quite drinkable.
Seems weaker than the Maribo Let Pilsner. Quite weak aroma of some malt and hops, which appear in the flavour though more waterish.

(Bottle 33 cl) Pale golden with a wee, tiny head. Vague hints of malt with a decent hoppy finish. Very, very similar to Maribos "Let pilsner" - and I still wonder why the brewery makes two almost equal beers. 240100
This beer does''nt belong on a "froskostbord" (lunch table) but in the toilet.
Light colour with decent head. No aroma. It has a slight taste of corn or rice. The aftertaste is metallic. I poured it in the toilet.
[Vintage 1997] Brown color with a beige head. The taste is very sweet light malty flavour. Kind of watery.

[Vintage 1997 - limited edition - sampled March 2004] Pours dark red with yeast particle (maybe the age) and no head. The aroma is sour and slightly sweet with notes of caramel. The flavor sweet caramel.
Vintage 1997 - Limited Edition. Dark beer with lots of yeast. Aroma of dark malt, chocolate and toffee. Extremely sweet and watery malty flavor. Over the top?
Primeur 1997 Limited Edition. 4%ABV. Nice looking brown colour. Sweet and malty aroma with notes of raisins. Sweet and mature flavour. Very thin finish.
Sweet and malty aroma. Brown coloured beer. not much head. Taste is malty, sweet and sticky. Not so good.
Clear orange brown color, short dying head. Sweet caramel malty aroma, bit skunky. Sweet taste, bit sour. Sticky palate.
Peacharoma. Sweet, very fruity taste with peach, orange and milk chocolate. Slight hopbitter finish. Just a hint of sourness. Sweet and sticky beer.
An OK beer from these guys. Nothing too offensive but not very interesting. Serving: Tap

On tap at the BP. Almost clear amber with red tint and small beige head. Citrus hop aroma with caramel sweetness, slightly tropical, not bad. Citrus flavor as well with sweeter caramel malt, slight pine bitterness, weird aftertaste, like grain and resin combined. Medium to loght body that is a little watery. Its nive but kind of throws me off at the same time.

Pours, obviously, amber with a little head. Smell is toasted sweet malt. Weak caramel flavor with a bit of hops at the end. Mouthfeel is a bit thin. Nothing incredible, but pretty comparable to (maybe even better than) Fat Tire.
Pour is clear reddish amber with a dense tan head...smell is toasty malty sweet...nice caramel flavor with a faintly flavorful hoppy finish...
On tap at the Flatlanders Brew Pub. Poured a medium amber color with a small sized off white head. Aromas of caramel, some citrus and floral. Tastes follow suit.

Poured a light-medium golden with a short, creamy cap of off-white head.. thorough lacing as it descended. In the aroma, sweet caramel and candy jump right out.. floral and citrus hoppage accents.. came off a bit too sweet. Flavor found a sweet caramel and toffee base with bitter pine and citrus at the edges.. not bad. Light-bodied with very good balance between the sweetness and the mild bitterness.

Bright copper in color with very little head that reduces quickly to a hairline of halo. Light adversities and a touch of vinegar to an aroma that is predominantly malted. Well-balanced flavor, starting sweet and finishing with a Continental hop bitterness. Sessionable. Growlerable. On tap at Flatlanders Restaurant & Brewery, Lincolnshire, IL 60069

Draught at the brewpub. Light amber in colour. Clear. Subtle malty caramel aroma with some hops in the background. Soft mouthfeel with a gentle malty texture. Some toffee-like notes. Finishes nutty with a little hops.

(02.12.06) On tap at Flatlanderâ€™s brewpub, Lincolnshire, IL. Clear light orange hued ale having a small white head. Soft carbonation. Faint malt aroma. Light-to-medium bodied ale that starts dry with light malt sweetness and toffee flavor. Finishes dry and clean with tiny hop bitterness and a pleasant nutty/corn fade. A good drinkable ale.

Clear bronze in color with a nice foamy and creamy head. Aroma explains the rendition a la English style: some hay, chicken feed, wood chips, moth balls and cedar clothes chests. Slick entry. Caramel sweetening overrides other flavor contributors. A little dash of caramelized and roasted pecans. Simple, but easy going and fairly enjoyable.
bread, leather, floral, golden, hazy, minimal head, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, creamy, average carbonation, bitter, Herbal yeasty and not as malty as aspected.
Bottle at Yesprâ€™s - Thanks. Cloudy brown - white head. Soapy, herbal, messy, coffee, berries, light chocolate, smokey, ryebread, spicy, caramel.

Bootle at yespr. Hazy orange coloured with a medium sized off-white head. Fruity aroma of caramel, hay and dark chocolate. Fruity flavour of caramel and dark chocolate with notes of spices and hops. Spicy finish.

Bottled. An unclear dark brown beer with a lazing tan head. The aroma has notes of fruit, malt, and caramel. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, fruits, and caramel, leading to a dry bitter finish. Thanks yespr for sharing.
shared by yespr an jorgen. cloudy brown, smooth white head. mild slightly fruity aroma. flavor is slightly fruity, fruit peel, malts. fruit peel is faint.

Bottle 33 cl. Courtesy of yespr. Pours a cloudy opaque amber with a dense off-white head. Sweet pumpernickel and vanilla in the nose. Medium body, very soft mouthfeel, nuts, pumpernickel, sweet roast and some brown sugars. Very subtle bitterness. 290911

33 cL bottle. Pours hazy dark brown with a huge off-white head. Aroma is spiced and dry breadish malty. Sweet breadish and light spiced malty. Toasted breadish and light caramelish. Roasted and medium dry finish.
Bottle. Amber colour with a beige head. aroma is fruit, yeast, caramel. Flavour is fruit, yeast, mature apple, malt, hop, caramel. Medium body. OK beer.

33cl Bottle from De Bierkoning. Clear dark reddish brown colour, frothy off white head. Aroma of dark fruits, light roasted malts, chocolate. Flavour is sweet, malty, chocolate, sweet dark fruits, light bitter roast, nice malty bitter finish, a bit flowery. Medium bodied, slick. Good bock.

21st March 2011 Bottle from Bier Koning. Cloudy brown beer. Good sized Ivory head. Light and semi crisp palate. Crisp fresh malt with a mild undertone of coffee and marmite. Well joined up. Fresh and minerally.
zÅ‚ote, z piana drobnÄ… i Å›rednioÄ™cherzykowÄ…, utrzymujÄ…cÄ… siÄ™. Aromat sÅ‚odowy i tyle. DMS. W smaku tak samo. Badziew
Bottle sample at a tasting at troubles' place. Thanks troubles. Clear golden. Grainy, bread, some corn, sweetish, oxidation, bitter finish, alcohol hint.
At Dror's place, pours yellow with a small head, aroma of grain, caramel, toffee, flavor of caramel, corn, medium bodied

ABV = 5.8%. 2018 version. BB 19.07.2019. Poured a crystal clear gold with a rapidly diminishing white open foam head that laced poorly. Carbonation very low, lively and coarse. Aroma moderately strong of pale malts. Taste moderately strong of pale malts with a slight sweetness. Light body. More of a festbier than a marzen. Disappointing.

Sampled from 0.5 l bottle from local 'trinkgut', best before June 2019. Clear, golden with a medium large, frothy, almost stable, white head. Sweetish, musty and just a little grassy aroma of grains and traces of straw. Moderately sweet, slightly malty, moderately bitter, a little grassy taste of grains, light vanilla and hints of straw, followed by a short, moderately bitter, slightly metallic finish. Thin to medium body, slightly effervescent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Hardly enjoyable.

Bottle from an Edeka supermarket in Berlin. Pours deep-ish gold with a white foam and a dry-grassy and golden corny-malty nose - this is a Festbier, not a MÃ¤rzen. Chewy and moderately dry-bitter, but lacking depth.
Bottle: Great X-mas beer, malty, hearty and tasty. Food Pairing: Turkey, dessert.
Fles 50cl thuis. Wat malten, licht zoet, balans redelijk. (12-2016).-------.

caramel, bread, hay, cereal, roasty, resin, floral, spruce, citrus, herbs, light body, medium body, full body, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness, lightly sour, lightly bitter, light sweetness,

C'est ce qu'on appelle se faire avoir (pour rester poli) .. sinon se faire baiser. BiÃ¨re bue sous son alias â€™Osterbierâ€™ avec une Ã©tiquette montrant un lapin. BiÃ¨re blonde trÃ¨s traditionnelle et sans chichi. AgrÃ©able Ã  boire pour se refraichir.
0,5l Flasche. Goldgelbes Bier, dÃ¼nner Schaum. Es riecht leicht fruchtig und nach Honig. Getreidiger Honiggeschmack. Recht schaal.

Flasche 0,5l ("Winter-Traum"): KrÃ¤ftiges Gold, glasklar, krÃ¤ftiger mittelporiger Schaum; in der Nase krÃ¤ftig, malzig, angenehme sÃ¼ÃŸe WÃ¼rze, Karamell, Getreide; im KÃ¶rper sÃ¼ÃŸe Malzigkeit, leichte WÃ¼rze, cremig, deutliche KohlensÃ¤ure, leichte frische Hopfennoten; angenehmer mild-wÃ¼rziger Nachgang
Bottle at home. Pours clear golden with a thin short-lived white head. Aromas of cereal, sugar. Taste is sweet, faint sweet finish.
Taste is smooth caramel malt, with little else. Bitterness is minimal. Decent enough.

(Postbrauerei Weihnachtsbier) Bottle 500 ml at home, as Postbrauerei Winter Traum. Served into a glass tankard, ABV 5.5% Deep golden yellow colour on the body, clear, with one finger of white head, kind of frothy, but with okay retention, leaving minimal lacing on the glass. Not much on the aroma, some malts and old grass. Taste is not anything special either, malts, bread, old dried grass, moderate sweet. Medium body, average carbonation. Easy to drink and to forget.

Geen sterke geur. Zit eruit als een normale pils. Schuim erg snel weg. Zoet met een beetje fruit. Nasmaak helaas niet fris en een beetje muf. Het Heineken effekt. Of het nu Osterbier of weinachtsbier noemt. Daar heeft het te weinig karakter voor.
Clear golden, small white head. Grainy, grassy aroma. Taste is malty with suptle hops. Medium, crisp carb, short finish.

Bottle. Pours clear golden with small white head. Clear aroma of hops, malt, and yeast. Sweetish, estery and malty flavour, with regular hoppy notes. Rough aftertaste with notes of yeast. Drinkable but nothing special.
Bottle a golden yellow colored beer with a white head aroma malts citrus and hops flavor malts spicy water and hops
On tap at Iron Hill Hersey. Clear copper with very little head. Aroma is vanilla, medium body, lower carbonation, and little lacing. Taste is pumpkin and vanilla.

Can: &nbsp Vibrant fireweed honey sort of color, thin wispy off-white head, little lacing, very light carbonation. &nbsp Moderately spiced, cinnamon and nutmeg, along with some brown sugar and a smidgen of clove. &nbsp Similar on the tongue. &nbsp Not as much body as I would have liked, seems to be a bit spicier than more, but not by much, and would be better off to have a little more body. &nbsp Falls off a little quick, but I think that's the body that doesn't stick too much. &nbsp Tiz clean though.

16 ounce can. Orange copper color. Small creamy beige head. Toasted caramel malt nose with hints of cinnamon, allspice and cloves. Flavor is tangy malt, caramel, pumpkin, honey and spice. Smooth and flavorful with moderate spices make this rather enjoyable as pumpkin brews go.

On tap at the Media PA location. Pours light copper with exceptional clarity and a white head with limited retention. Little lacing. Mild aroma with light slicing. The flavor reveals more, but still conservative.spicing and hints of baked bread and cooked squash. Nice, mild and spicy lingering aftertaste.

Sampled on draft at the Media location this beer poured an orange amber color with a medium sized foamy white head that left minimal lacing. The aroma was dryish with cinnamon and nutmeg notes. The flavor was strong cinnamon, nutmeg and a bit of yeast. Medium length finish. Medium body. Ok

On tap at the brewery. Pours a clear orange amber with a thin white head. Sweet pumpkin and cinnamon on the nose. Medium bodied, sweet with a bit of spice and a bit of bitterness. Sweet fruity yeast on the finish, with more pumpkin and more spices.
On tap at WC. A refreshing pumpkin ale done up nicely. Hints of cinnamon and roasted malt. Spicy but mellowed down into a surprisingly smooth pumpkin.
Bright copper color with a quickly fading head. Aroma of cinnamon and cloves. Sweet with a dry, spicy finish. Good pumpkin but lacking some flavor.
Draft. A fine ale, but pales in comparison to the best of the breed, eg. Pumking. Relatively thin on flavor and mouthfeel. Very slightly sweet. Clean finish.
on tap at Maple Shade - a good version of a typical pumpkin ale. Not over the top with the spices like a lot of pumpkin beers can get. Tasty.

(Bottle 50 cl) Golden pilsener with a fine, creamy head. Malty body, but the main focus is the hops - Hallertauer - arenâ€™t they usually aromatic? Well, what you get here is one hoppy beer as the labels "Klassisch Herb" shouldâ€™ve warned me. 271200

Slightly darker color than most pilsners, but not really any more flavorful or smooth. Non-hoppy but still bitter taste at the end ruins any balance. Malt is not totally bland (more flavor than say a Bud or MGD) but is certainly not interesting.

Draught @ Ginger Man (10/25/19). Hazy dark amber with large creamy light beige head, very faint doughy aroma, high carbonation, medium bitter light caramel taste, dusty mouthfeel, thin body, long finish. Not very exciting.

22 ounce bomber bottle at sisâ€™s Smells sweet and some hops. Orange in color and hazy. Small white head. Very flavorful with the hops. Medium bodied in some light pine aftertastes. Very nice beer. Cheers!
Pours hazy amber with a two finger, light tan head. Aroma is floral and caramel. Taste is caramel, moving to light hops. Finish is light hops.

16 oz via can at Madison Square Garden. Mild aroma of bread, toasted malt, light citrus and light leafy hops. Similar flavor, adding mild to moderate sweetness and light bitterness. Light to medium body with soft carbonation, a thin feel and a smooth finish. OK.

Pours a hazy amber with a medium white head......aroma of hickory nut hulls, sourdough bread......taste is an old time malt forward British pale without the bitterness and with flavor time hop restraint. A nice bodied ale with a bread intro, slight sweetness with a very faint citrus taste and finishing with a lingering plum. Solid in an old school way.

A session with a little heft. aromas of malt, vinegar and leather. Yellow with a tinge of amber, standard white head. Flavors of cherry, salt and caramel, a good tang. balanced finish. review 5 of 7 of MA-NH trip, all but 1 bout at an excellent liquor store in Stoneham MA.
Draught at Burlington pool place maybe. Deep orange in color some citrus decent and ok

Brune voilÃ©e surmontÃ©e d'un micro col crÃ©meux. Nez lÃ©ger de fruits sÃ©chÃ©s et de noix. Au goÃ»t: malt, caramel brulÃ©, pain et noix grillÃ©es. Un peu fort en bouche sur le coup, mais s'estompe vite avec une fin aqueuse. Correcte.

Malts, caramel and herbs in nose. Pours amber with white head. Taste is medium sweet with malts, caramel and herbs. Low bitter finish, average carbo. Overall not really exciting, on tap at Sunset Grille, Stowe VT.
Poured a hazy amber. About a finger width head. Smelled earthy and bready. Medium bodied and hoppy with a lingering bitterness. Flavor also had notes of indistinct dark fruit.
Pours dark ruby amber with ruby notes and a white head. Aroma is light caramel and rye. Taste is light caramel, moving to roast and rye. Finish is rye. A good Irish red.
12 oz can. Pours an amber with an of-white tight bubble head. Malt and citrus scents. Astringent flavors of malt and leather with hops edges. Low carbonation. Quite drinkable.

12 ounce can. Copper red color. Frothy tan head. Tangy toasted malt nose. Sweet toasted malt flavor upfront hints at red berries and caramel. Thin bodied, but flavorful. Earthy, nutty notes in middle. Sweet, sticky malt finish.
Pours reddish amber with a thick white head. Aroma of malt with earthy notes. Taste is light and watery with deep malt influences. Juniper on the palate, sweet malt dominates. Not bad.

From Dec 2007 I got this bottle in a trade with Wasatch. Thanks John! This beer pours from 12oz bottle a clear deep amber with a good 2 finger head of foam and lots of sticky lacing. The smell is of roasted and caramel malt and is nice on the nose.I can also smell just a touch of hops. The taste is very nice. Roasted malt and good caramel sweetness offset by a nice mild hop bite in the background make for a very tasty, smooth, and easy drinking Red Ale. Oh, there's a touch of chocolate(?) in the flavour that I wasn't anticipating. Very nice indeed. It has a medium mouthfeel and the carbonation is also medium. This certainly isn't your run of the mill example of the style! Very good stuff!

Poured into a mug, the appearance was a ruddy burnt amber color with a fingerâ€™s worth of off white foamy head. Sly messy lace. The aroma had some grassy hops, nice caramel malt base, some bready/biscuity sweetness. Sly earthiness. The flavor melds the earthiness to the grassy hops. Malt base is there to balance sweetly. Rugged malt aftertaste. Semi-dry malty finish. On the palate, good session, nice feel, not too sticky on my tongue. Good carbonation. Overall, nice Irish red ale, willing to have again.
Drank at Cooperâ€™s Seafood House in Scranton, PA. Pours a beautiful red color with nice lacing head. A bit of a hoppy aroma for a red ale, but great on flavor.

Pours transparent chestnut brown body with reddish hue. Thin white head subsides fairly quickly. Appearance resembles flat root beer. Malty, nutty, caramel aromas. Medium body with sweet malts and an underlying fruitiness come through in the taste. Crisp finish with a touch of pepper.

375ml bottle. Deep mahogany in colour with a thin off-white head, light lacing. Aroma of caramel malts, brown sugar, christmas cake with a bit of cherries as well. Flavour is lightly sweet, caramel malts, a bit burnt, lightly bitter. Sweet mouthfeel, medium/light body, moderate carbonation. Finishes fairly quick, a little thin. Basic.
Great flavor, very mellow. Very little if any aftertaste. Creamy Irish red.
Cask Handpump at the Star Inn, Huddersfield 26/07/2003 Golden coloured slightly cloudy with acidic taste. Slightly dry finish.
(Hand Pump) A glorious straw coloured beer, with a creamy white head. Citrus within the fresh clean aroma. Very smooth taste thet resolves to a lemon-citrus finish. An excellent beer to my taste.
Sampled cask conditioned at Oliver Twist, Stockholm, Sweden. Pale yellow. Soapy orangey aroma. Flowery with a hoppy twist but a sticky sweet finish with notes of honey.
Sampled cask conditioned at Akkurat, Stockholm, Sweden. Very dark brown. Very dry and roasty with licorice and coffee flavour. Medium bodied with long salty finsih. Outrageously moreish.

One of the beers the late brewery Facon, which was situated close to the language barrier between Flanders and Wallonia, used to make for Wallonian commissioners. Vintage tasted at 8 years of age, from a 75 cl bottle. Coarse, loose, off-white head, pale brownish peach blond colour, hazy. Spicy yeastiness in the nose along with restrained fruit, dried orange peel, peach, apple, ginger, wine vinegar, whisky, but all very subdued. Neutral onset with lightly sweetish touch, some dried fruits, pretty strong carbonation, soft and grainy basis, yeasty and spicy, thin and somewhat watery finish (I assume the hops had desintegrated a bit already). Still very drinkable but clearly not a beer which aged well - so anyone still possessing a bottle today, better use it for cooking or something...

Bottle 75cl @ Cnudde Tasting.. Alc. 6.2%. Clear light to medium yellow color with a small to average, frothy, fair lacing, fully diminishing, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, toasted, grain, bread, light hoppy, citrus, pepper, light to moderate yeasty, vegetables, spicey. Flavor is moderate sweet, light light acidic, and moderate bitter with a average duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft to lively. (290308)

(Bottle 75 cl) Courtesy of fonefan - thanks for this rare gem. Clear golden with a dense, white head. Aroma of fruit and a little yeast. Medium body rich in sweet malts, spices and fruit. Rather dry finish. 290308

The Fonefan/Brugmansia Cnudde tasting. Warm golden with a creamy head. The aroma has notes of straw, malt, yeast and light citrus. The mouthfeel is fizzy. The flavour has notes of caramel, straw, yeast and hints of boiled vegetables and light citrus. Thanks Fonefan/Brugmansia!
Clear golden with medium white head. Sweet fruity and yeasty aroma with flower and faint honey notes. Sweet flavor with yeasty and fruity notes. Light peach note. Ends sweet.
Slightley hazy golden with a small white head. Bread, hay, and fruit in the aroma. sweet and malty flavour with some yeast. Dry alcohol finish.

75 cL bottle@fonefan/Brugmansiaâ€™s Cnudde tasting. Pours clear and golden yellow with a white head. Mild spiced and pilsner malty/hoppy aroma. Flavour is mild sweet and light spiced. Mellow yeasty note into the finish. Nice lingering light fruity.

(Bottled, brewed by Huyghe) Hazy golden with a smallish, very lacy head. Slightly buttery, pilsener-hoppy aroma. Fruity, slightly sour flavor with pale malts and a hint of licorice. Light to medium-bodied palate with quite low carbonation. Easy listening...
Hazy copper color. Has aged (at least 3 years) without suffering too much; but it seems to be a simple one, quite dry mouthfeel, a bit spicy and woody, maybe too short final.
A bit darker blond beer with a big somewhat creamy white head. It has a light toffee and yeast aroma. Mild sweet tast, a bit flat but okish.
Dullish tan, doesn't look great. On the nose, it's kind of honeyish like old oxidized malt. Thinnish, sweet, oxidized and bland. Just no.
A small taste (bottle) @ The Belgian Embassy. Pours cloudy golden with a high head. Aroma is sweet malts with yeast. Flavor is sweet malts, yeast, hops. Good, basic belge.
A cloudy golden beer, medium full body with an average carbonation, fruity aroma and a long aftertaste. Drinking temperature around 8 degrees celcius, consumed at home.

Pours hazy yellow/golden with a lasting, foamy, white head. The aroma contains fruits (orange), hops, spices and yeast. It tastes medium fruity sweet and light hoppy bitter with a yeasty, bit dry finish. Medium body, slick texture, fizzy carbonation. Totally inoffensive but good in its own way.
Robe blonde, fine mousse crÃ©meuse. Nez houblon, malt, farine, trÃ¨s simple. Bouche banale, courte, milieu de bouche aqueux, finale courte. BiÃ¨re sans intÃ©rÃªt.

F: big, snow-white, poor to average retention. C: deep gold, hazy. A: malt, orange, herbal, fruity, yeast, apple. T: malt, orange peels, fruity, peach, a bit spicy, light soapy, yeasty, white sugar, medium body, medium carbonation, nothing special but drinkable and not bad, 33cl bottle from Carrefour market â€“ St. Michel @ Etterbeek, Brussels.

33 cl bottle @ home. Pale yellow colour with an orange shine, and a lasting white head. Sweet and yeasty aroma, full of carbonation. Taste is bitter with some sourness, and the palate is a bit watery.
Bottle of 33cl, in a Trappist glass; from the fridge. A refreshing golden ale, with nice aroma and subtle taste of hops. Refreshing, but nothing else to say about it.

Bottle. Pours clear blonde, Ok to small whtie head. Smell is sweet,malty but also got some different characters I donâ€™t really recognize. Taste is intense, yet elegant yeastyness with fruity aspects ( not overripe fruit ) a fine fruity hoparoma as well that pairs nothing less than perfectly with the rather aromatic yeast. Light level of bitterness, yet the bitterness is there. Lovely in balance. Even though tripels will never be my favorite beerstyle, this one deffinately is worthy of being called very good !

Bottle at home. Pours a deep golden colour with a white head that soon disappears. Very slight aroma of orangey hop. Taste is sweet to start, then slightly bitter. Slight citrus taste, thin finish. OK at best.

column2: Atlantic City, New Jersey, United States
column5: Pours flat, opaque orange, with no head at all. I donâ€™t know if this bottle is bad, or if itâ€™s brewed that way. Bourbon aging, honey and alcohol are very evident in the aroma, along with little of the spiciness. Starts with a sweet bite. A little spicy, but fruity, alcohol, and barrel aging are overpowering. The spiciness and bourbon give it a complexity, but not in an interesting way. The more i drank, the more I got a dirty apple peel taste. If I ever doubted what the word ""cloying"" meant, I donâ€™t anymore.

column2: Atlantic City, New Jersey, United States
column5: this kinda sucks, it reminds me of my childhood. it smells like a shoe store and tastes like and old boot full of apples beer and god knows what. thick and cloying and rough.

column2: Atlantic City, New Jersey, United States
column5: Grand Cru 10th Anniversary-750ml bottle@Joeâ€™s NYC Gathering that I brought courtesy of Timâ€“pours a disappearing white head with copper color. Aroma is very sweet medium malt-toffee, dark fruit-plum, alcohol. Taste is very sweet medium malt-toffee, dark fruit-plum, alcohol. Nice, a bit oversweet.

column2: Atlantic City, New Jersey, United States
column5: Deep garnet-orange beer. Thin head. Aroma is very sweet and chewy. Honey and toasted almonds and barley. A touch of treacly honeyish sweetness. Peachy and tropical but way underattenuated. Sticky and sugary. Itâ€™s not good, but Iâ€™ve had worse.

column2: Atlantic City, New Jersey, United States
column5: Bottle at JoeMcPheeâ€™s. Pours a amber body with an off white head. A/F very bozzy, with a sweet malty sugar backbone. Some ginger spice. Not for me.

column2: Atlantic City, New Jersey, United States
column5: Bottle: Headless copper beer. Sweet nose with lots of honey and diacetyl. Slick alcoholic feel. Very sweet with honey, ginger cookie and candi-sugar. Too sweet.

column2: Atlantic City, New Jersey, United States
column5: My understanding of Grand Cru means best. Iâ€™ve been to Tun Tavern and although the beers are close to solid, this beer shouldnâ€™t be in the same room with anything named Grand. The apple flavor dominates followed with Belgian sugar.

column2: Atlantic City, New Jersey, United States
column5: 1/2 gallon growler. Radiant yellowed copper. Small, dense off white head. Specks of carbonation. Honeyed aroma, toasty malts, pineapple syrup and a touch of juniper. Rich, smooth and faintly carbonated with a layered fruity, honeyed sweetness melding with a toasty malt base and Belgian yeast overlay. Medium thick body. Rich sweetness, even ice cold. Mild spiciness lingers in the aftertaste, with a soft, savory edge. Hint of cherry, atop the dominant Munich malt base, late. Finishes lighter in body but not in flavor with a surge of spicy alcohol and fruity sweetness. A very respectable, and downright quaffable, version.

column2: Atlantic City, New Jersey, United States
column5: Crimson in color with a dissapearing thin, almost soapy looking off-white head. Aromas of candy sugar and pepper. Strong peppery flavors and some fruity characteristics as well. One of Tun''s more complex brews, Bravo!
0.3 l bottle from Spar, Odense... Clear orange color, like apple juice... Horrible hop and barley aroma like medicin... Untasteful odd flavor with an aftertaste of vinegar... Boring ending...

Bottle. Pours clear golden with a frothy small white head. Aroma is corn, cooked vegetables, flowers, toffee and grain. Taste is light bitter, sweet and a tad sour. Body is light, texture is watery, carbonation is moderate. Finishes fruity. Not the worst Harboe out there.

330 ml bottle, probably from NETTO. ABV is 4.4%. Golden colour, moderate to low white head. Weak aroma, some sweetish notes, a little dust. Medium sweet and "neutral" flavour, unoffensive for a Harboe beer, but certainly not much to delight you either

0,33 l green bottle kindly shared by Sigmund. ABV is 4,4%. Clear golden body with a short lived white head. Meaty notes and light malts on the nose. Light body. Watery mouth. Flatish. Gentle sweetness and bitterness. Papery overnotes.
Bottle. Pours a pale yellow with a small white head short duration. Aroma and taste with hops and malt. Watery and thin.
Bottle 330ml @ home Pours clear golden with a small white head. Aroma has notes of malt and grain. Taste is light sweet and light bitter. Body is light, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.
Bottle. Clear yellow with medium white head. Flavour is malt, dry, sweet, slightly bitter and watery.
Bottle. Golden colour with a white head. Aroma is fruit, malt. Flavour is fruit, malt, grain. Thin body. Thin beer.

bottle bbf 27.04.09 tasted 2-2-09. clear yellow, large thick white head (surprising) sweetish macro pislener aroma, corn, some hops. flavor is real weak and faint. iâ€™ve had zero alc. beers taste way stronger. faint corn sweetness, sligt bitterness from hops. it is not bad as some discount beers, but instead it is severely diluted. it actually tastes like a nonalc. beer.
I donâ€™t know why I sampled this beer. Maybe I got it for free, but the notes were watery metal, sweetmalt and almost with an lookthrough appearance. Forgetable!

Got this ultimate whale and a few other ticks from Crossovert. Thanks Mike! This is oxidized and sweet but not hideous considering its advanced age. It lacks bitterness and is fairly smooth... for a malt liquor that is many years old at this point. I guess we can call this a small victory for quality control in larger breweries.
40. BB 2013. It is oxidized but smooth, still not a pleasurable malt whale experience. Iâ€™m all for them bringing this back though.

Boom! Big ass 40 of this bull shit. I must say, 5-6% malt liquors arenâ€™t my favorite and this is no exception. Brown paper bag in appearance as suggested. Corny, sweet, almost cloying. Not really my thing, seemed stale as well. Thatâ€™s what I get for trading with BA guys I guess (just kidding ralph)

From the 40 oz bottle. Nice crack on the twist cap. Oh come on RB reviewers, it is not THAT bad. It pours pale yellow with fizzy carbonation. The aroma is decently malted but not corny or grainy like so many of its counterparts. The body is thin. The taste does have a corn and rice note to it but it is also lightly hopped to end crisp and clean. It was not great but it was not horrible at all.

The Lindsay Lohan of beers: Really nice can but when you open the mouth out pours filth and bile. Strongest metallic taste Iâ€™ve ever experienced in a liquid. Color is better than most crap beers but thatâ€™s where my complements end. Smells bad, head lasts about 1.2 seconds, churns in your belly like lukewarm moonshine. Maybe I got a bad batch but I wonâ€™t be venturing into this wasteland again to find out. Go elsewhere for your American swill my friends.
Pretty easy sippin malt liquor.Reminds me of King Cobra.Nothing special but nothing offensive about it either.

light corn aroma, appearance is standard urine. flavor is low on â€™corn-sludgeâ€™ quotient and somewhat crisp and drinkable. no outright noticeable QC/infection problems besides heavy handed use of adjuncts.
can. i loved the plain cardboard case it came in. its cheap and will get you drunk, which is about the only thing its good for.
i love black label i get 24 for 11.99 at my local package store of choice good price for a good beer in fact it taste better than miller,bud,and coors

Oh, gawd. Ugh. Ick. Worse than death. I gave this a shot, thinking, for some reason, that it might be an ok but not great low budget brew. Little did I know who actually makes it. It doesnâ€™t even say on the outside of the 12-pack box. It only says on the cans themselves. Anyway... DId I say "oh, gawd" already? This crap really actually honestly is the worst "beer" Iâ€™ve ever tried. It is terrible in every way that you can imagine beer being terrible, and a few more you canâ€™t. I would rather drink Steel Reserve or Olde English or Evil Eye, etc... They all taste only slightly better, but at least they wait until the next morning to give you a hangover. Honestly this swill is TOXIC. Yes ok, technically, ethanol is poisonous. But if you disregard ethanol and just consider the rest of what is in this... concoction, seriously it is POISONOUS. If you want a very decent and non-poisonous beer thatâ€™s easy on your budget, try Huber Bock. You will not find another beer that tastes even half as good, and is not filled with aldehydes, for the same price as Huber Bock. Trust me, it is the ultimate budget beer. (P.S. - I took a chance on this Black Label crap because the store did not carry my beloved Huber. I wish I could have this day back. I would gladly just skip the beer entirely.)

Modest head and clear dark gold body. Smells of wet cardboard, some people might like sucking on cardboard but Iâ€™ve always found it a little tedious. Flavour is heavy cloying sugar with vague malt hints. Like wow, a boring lager is hard to mess up but this is a mess. Malt liquor flavours should not be jumping into my head but there they are.... there. they. are.
473 ml can. At the Timo A's Maritimes Tasting. Clear deep golden color with a tiny white head. Malt and some alcohol in the aroma. The flavor is metal, dryness and malt.

473 ml can @ Timo Aâ€™s Maritimes Tasting. Pours a clear golden color with a small head. Aroma is clove and grain, some faint buttery tones, grassy hops. Flavor is slick grassy, grainy, some very distant peach notes, bread. Not good. 3312
47,3 cl can @ Timo Aâ€™s Maritimes Tasting. Thanks! Aroma has buttery malt, cereal and menthol. Flavour has cereal, starchy tones, some biscuits and menthol. Sweet, starchy and bulky, not good.

January 21, 2014 - with blankboy, jercraigs & mabel - 473ml can. Gold - oily looking refractive and clear, smallish bubbly white head. Yep - "premium" lager aroma - some alcohol, oily grain, apple and grass. Taste is simple honey â€™n heather - solid, clean. Average body, chewy, decent carbonation, finishes quick and dry. Not bad!

Bright dark straw, almost gold color, with some powerful activity. White 2 finger head with good retention that last for 5 to 10 minutes, with a nice amount of legs. Aromas of sweet grains and burnt sugar with a faint floral and lemony feel. Flavors of zesty citrus, roasted malt, faint caramel, floral and herbal spices. A little grassy and quite floral. Nice sweetness and great sharpness. Slick medium body with super prickly carbonation. Light and short finish, ending with a sugary roasted malt feel, faint noble spices, and hint of lemon lingering on the tongue. Overall a very good quality craft. Good flavors and very refreshing, while the carbonation is a little excessive. Good balance but feels a little light. At last, a good lager! No adjunct feel, the way a real lager should always taste.

Can purchased at the brewpub. Nice dark golden colour with a thin white head that sticks around. Aroma is on the sweet side - sugary cereal grain with hint of corn, although the can indicates itâ€™s an all-malt beer. A slight herbal note to indicate there are some hops, but sweetness dominates. The flavour has a bit more balance to it - still too sweet and grainy for my personal taste, but a hit of herbal and grassy hops in the finish. Sticky on the palate. All in all - average, and not especially "Premium".
Pours a dark golden. Aromas of corn and toasted grain. Similar flavours with some sweetness and nice bitterness. Decent for a pale lager.

Clear yellow, slightly orange body, lots of bubbles, fizzy white head. Very sweet grain aroma. Taste is also far to the sweet side. Not hop balance noticeable. Still is has flavour and is pleasant enough.
473 ml can from NB Liquor. Pours a golden orange colour with a small white head. Aroma is light malt, grain. Taste is pretty much the same + grass. Mediocre beer.

Draught. Pours opaque black with a medium, creamy tan head, long retention with excellent lacing. Aroma is heavy roast and chocolate malt with earthy and woody hops, leather and prunes. Flavor is heavy roast and chocolate malt with light earthy and woody hops and bitterness, leather and prunes with a dry finish. Full body and medium carbonation.
Nera, oleosa, mediamente schiumosa. Tostata, caffettosa e cioccolatosa, di corpo medio. Una stout piacevole.

Almost black bodied with stable bubbly kaki head. Cereal, wholewheat bread, milk chocolate and cheese. Bit itâ€™s the taste that really reveals the lactic, even buttery character. Thin body, okay carbonation. Really too buttery, I hope this isnâ€™t as intended. (From Eataly Torino)
Spina @ Brew Pub Troll. Nera con schiuma marroncina persistente. Molta liquirizia, finale tostato amaro. Buon corpo e poca carbonatura.
Clear mahogany with a tiny beige head. Sweet aroma with roasted malt, caramel and coffee hints. Sweet flavour with roasted malt, watery coffee and toffee. Sweet finish.

Bottle 50 cl. RBESG Rome 2010. Pours an opaque dark brown with an orange hue and a beige head. Aroma of hard roasted malt and a whiff of butter. Medium body, hard roasted - but not burned - malt and a little licorice and vanilla. The finish is mellow and subdued with a very discreet bitterness. 070610

Bottle 500ml. Clear medium to dark brown color with a average, frothy, good - fair lacing, mostly diminishing, light beige head. Aroma is moderate malty, roasted, light coffee and chocolate, toffee notes. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and light to moderate bitter with a average to long duration, thin coffee. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20100607]

50 cL bottle. Pours dark brown to black with a small tan head. Aroma is dark roasted malt, light breadish. Dark roasted malt, liqourice and dark breadish. Mild acidic touch. Lingering dark malty and liqourice flavours into the far finish.

Bottled. A black beer with a thin brown head. The aroma has notes of malt, caramel, and roasted malt. The flavor is very sweet with notes of roasted malt lending it an acidic edge, combined with a bit of licorice, leading to a roasted finish. Raw.
375ml bottle (OPP, HBF2010) 6 Dusty aroma 4 Very dark brown small head 7 Roasty coffee taste 4 Full bodied, smooth and roasty 14 Didnâ€™t have enough, want more!
Draft sampler pours Amber with a off white head. Aroma of malts, citrus and some pine. Taste is malts and citrus.

tap at Dash In - Pours copper colored with a mild malt aroma that has a touch of caramel. The flavor is led by caramel malt. Itâ€™s moderately bitter with citrus, especially in the finish. Lingers pleasantly. Good.
Draft: Slightly red, copper with a small, off-white head. Mild, soft tea aroma. Caramel, tea....leafy/herbal hop flavor. Nice.

2/21/2011: NABC Beakâ€™s Best "American Bitter & Soul Liniment"... Aroma: Lovely citrus (grapefruit and lemon) hoppiness thatâ€™s not over-done; hint of toffee malt. Appearance: Amber color with a slight chill haze; dense white to off-white crown that lasts; good lacing. Flavor: Toasted malt and toffee; dainty floral notes; mild hoppiness and bitterness - soft grapefruit and bitter orange. Palate: Body is medium; calm and smooth mouthfeel. Overall: Very nicely done. Draught sample (5.3% ABV; 31-34 IBU) at New Albanian Brewing Company in New Albany, IN. Rating #43 for this beer.

On tap at the brewpub. Pours a clear light brown with a thick white head. Aroma of toasted, caramel malts. Flavor of toasted malts, light fruits, and peppery spices and earthy hops in the finish. Solid bitter, very drinkable. 7/4/8/4/14 (3.7/5)
Draft to sampler at the brewhouse. Looks decent; a transparent copperish brown with white lacing. Smells solid; bitter hops. Tastes like it smells with an average mouthfeel. Decent and easy to drink.
Light hoppy notes. Pours amber with tints of red and very little head. I dont get much smell of it. Slightly heavy on the finish, but a great start.
Draft. Amber pour with a thin off white top. Scent is sweet and citrus. Taste is sweet malts, toffee and citrus.
Draft. Clear amber with a wispy foam tan head. Caramel and floral hop aroma. Caramel, bitter, bready, earthy.

Date: January 30, 2012 Mode: Draft Source: Tomlinson Tap Room Description: Orangish brown pour with minimal head. Decent bitter that is balanced with the hops and malt, but aroma and taste were too muted for me.
Fairly heavy and sweet like most TwoRows beers. Another variation on their similar tasting dark brews. I will take it on $1 pint night with no problems. Goes well with crawfish.

A step up from their other "bocks". This beer is like a typical "amber" beer that you would find in an american brewpub. Nothing too special, just a malty flavor with an aftertaste that sticks for a minute or so....bleh.

Amber, clear, slight hop spice. Better than the Penalty Bock and the Belair Bock, but this place really should quit trying to make bocks. Not much to this except some nice maltiness toward the finish.

RERATE: Small, weak head, weak aroma. However, better than I remember it from last time. Dark amber-brown color, very strong tasting, almost a hint of alcohol. Slioght fruitiness, Overall better than some of their other beers.

On tap at New Albanian, pours a deep dark brown with a reddish tinge and a small beige head. Aroma brings out English malt, light burnt notes, and toasted crusty bread. Flavour is along the same lines, with burnt crusty bread and English malt. Not exactly true to style, but at least itâ€™s rather assertive. Decent.

Draft at the brewpub. Black in colour with moderate carbonation. Aromas of mild coffee, stone fruit, and pale malt. Flavors of light roast coffee, dark chocolate, and yellow plum. Cleansing mineral finish. Decent amount of body considering the alcohol level.
Backlog entry. A nice and well rounded beer. Close to style and as expected.

on tap @ New Albanian / New Albany IN --- Clear dark r4uby brown, beige head cover, dots of lace. Taste is dark malt with light caramel. Light carbonation is added on the swallow, then light hops in a finish that slowly slides back to caramel. This is a good all-night brew.

Another long time want. Nailed it. Pours a dark, dark brown to black with a voluminous huge froth of mocha head that settles to leave a wall of tight lacing.
