Ocena wystawiona w ramach czeskiego panelu degustacyjnego browaru papi w czerwiecu 2019
Clear golden color, quickly disappearing white head, good carbonation. Grassy, malty aroma, sweet malty, bready, herbal flavour. Bittersweet quickly disappearing finish, thin body.
Frothy white head, golden colour Aroma of grass, green apples and bananas Sweet, bitter finish Medium body, medium carbonation

Tnx Adam & Reka! Bottled, golden colour, a bit hazy with huge firm head. Lasting lacing, Malty nose. Aroma is grass, hops. Flavour is sweet malts and bread.Full bodied with heavy malts with bitter finish. Excellent!

Ein Bier, das zwar gut vollmundig ist, aber im Bezug auf die Aromen etwas langweilig. Es mag als Helles durchgehen, aber das Premium-Segment hat die Brauerei selbst schon einem anderen Produkt vorbehalten. Kein schlechtes Bier, aber auch kein groÃŸer Wurf.

Foam is very nice and have a good aroma of hops and caramel. Most of caramel taste, but also it has a little off-flavors of the alcohol and a relatively gentle and continuous hop bitterness. It is easy to drink and good, but lacking in my opinion both richness and depth.

Bottle. Amber, small beige head. Aroma is malty and grainy notes. Flavour is caramel malty, slightly nutty, with a metallic, rather harsh finish. not exactly sophisticated, but what to exoect from a beer with three E-aditives?

50cl Brown bottle, best before 27th Nov 2008, drank 17th Feb 2009, almost three months overdue. Nice front label, a Golden Steam Train on a black background with golden stars or snow flakes above. I poured the beer into a Hoegaarden Grand Cru tulip glass (twice). A Pale Euro lager it is not. This is a deep, dark amber coloured lager, with a real red tint to it. The white head consisting of fairly large bubbles soon fell away to a collar and wisp covering. Initial aroma of yeast before the pour, but once out of the bottle there was very little to test my senses on the smell front. gets my normal lager odourless score of 3. Dry, with some malty/molasses sweetness trying to even the dryness up, but failing to do so. The body is typical cheap lager, meaning thin and watery with no force of character or personality. The 6% alcohol does come through, but I think a headache would follow if anyone had more than two of these.

50 cl bottle at home. ABV is 6%. Clear chestnut body with a tan colored foamy head thick as my little finger. The head recedes and leaves excellent lacing. Toasted caramel notes in the aroma and som faint hints of dried fruits. Medium body. Quite bitter from beginning to end and caramel sweetness on top. A little too carbonated, yet also smooth. A little papery and metallic.OK, but I probably wonâ€™t buy it again.
No head at all, strange looking - golden. light malty nose. ligtht body and not so long. Caramel and malt.

Bottle 50 cl, courtesy of Irina. Pours clear deep red amber with a rich beige head leaving lace. Aroma is malty, bready, hoppy and hay. Flavor is fruity, dry, bitter and malty. Crispy mouthfeel. Finishes watery, malty and bitter.
Bottle, pours clear amber with with head, aroma is malt, grain....and the flavor is caramel, grain, fresh.....
Clear amber with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet malty and caramel. Flavor is medium sweet and light bitter. Light bitter finish. 021109
Bottle @ Home. Pours golden with a creamy white head. Aroma of malt, grain, light hops. Taste is malt, grain, caramel, light hops. Medium body, light carbonation. Drinkable, but boring. 150511

Big offwhite head. Red body with strong carbonation. Vague earthy metallic aroma with fruity notes. Dry-sweetish earthy dusty perfumy aroma with raisiny fruity notes. Harshish mouthfeel. Mid-bodied. Dryish perfumy fruity earthy aftertaste with cocos and oil notes. Decent, but far from great. A bit artificial. (0.5l bottle, gift from Louise.)

Sin duda unas de las peores cervezas de chile, no tiene otras palabras mas que asquerosa , fuerte olor a alcohol en la lata horrible sabor a metalico que parese que estas chupando una moneda.
Bottle at bar. Golden color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, malts, a bit of hops and grass. Bitter finish with citrus, malts, a bit of hops and grass. Okay bulk lager.

(Draught) Pours a clear yellow body with a small white head. Aroma of grain, florals, and light citrus zest. Flavor of sweet corn, metal, earth, and grain with a watery mouthfeel.

Dorado intenso transparente, baja espuma sin retenciÃ³n. CartÃ³n, papel, oxidado, sulfuro de hidrÃ³geno, malta nula, lÃºpulo nulo. En boca umami, oxidado, malta maltosa baja, lÃºpulo nulo. Not extremely bad. Good economic beer, good for summer. Easy to buy almost everywhere in Chile
Yellow, fizzy, low in malt and hops, watery beer. It is fine for a hot weather.

pint on tap, pours a medium golden copper small head and not so much for lacing.. aroma of herbal pine, grapefruit citrus not to strong..taste was nice, not an overwhelming hop kick up front but a good balance for a pub ipa.. overall itâ€™s very drinkable and a nice ipa, but it doesnâ€™t match up to my favs like hopdevil or stone, just not hoppy enough although it was sure nice to have an ipa on tap in a local place which you just donâ€™t get in to many places..
A great IPA. Really canâ€™t go wrong here. I wouldnâ€™t put it into the â€™amazingâ€™ category, but itâ€™s everything you would want when you are looking for a solid IPA. Love JJâ€™s.

This is much like the Garden State IPA but it is aged in a cask. It is amber coloured with a off white large head. It is served about room temperature and light on the carbonation. The flavor is of hops and a little woodsy. Overall this is a good beer better then the normal GS IPA but still not as good as the Imperial. Earlier Rating: 5/27/2008 Total Score: 3.4 This isnâ€™t as good as the other IPA that JJâ€™s offers nor is it as good as the IPA on cask, but that being said this is a good beer. Tastes of hops and malt. Very small white head.

sampled and had a pint at the brewery. This was the best of the lot during my visit. Almost clear light amber/orange in color. Aroma was on the weak side for an IPA- some subtle citrus and floral but not a good start. The taste was better however, with some leafy citrus and a moderate warrior hop bitterness. pretty clean...I like more assertive IPAâ€™s, but this one was enjoyable enough.

Clear orange beer whose large off-white foam is fed by a healthy carbonation. Leafy and floral cascades show rather subtly in the nose, so do the caramel malts. Initially rather sweet, fruity and gently citrusy, but it grows a firm bitterness after a few sips. The whole thing bathes in a partly sloppy and earthy maltiness that could use an extra bit of freshness though. It does not come across as a very bright IPA, but I must still declare it one of my favourite tries at J.J. Bitting.

On tap at the pub, it was served with a nice head and kept good lacing as it went down in my glass. Nice dark copper coloring and citrus-like aroma. More malty than bitter, this was enjoyable enough to order a second pint. Well made and drinkable, this is middle of the road IPA that is obviously geared towards a wide variety of patrons, not just hopheads.

Tap. This is a pretty decent well made regular IPA. Deep copper pour with a nice tight sticky white head and good lace. Citrus hop aroma blended with a slight herbal and spiciness especially in the flavor and bitterness. Lightly malty all the way through which lets the hops come through. Easy drinking and refreshing IPA. Well made.

Draft at brewpub. Pours amber with off-white head. Mild citrus hop aroma. Malt flavor of caramel with some toastiness. Finish has a clean fruity hop bitterness. No lingering bitterness or resiny texture. Just a clean easy to drink IPA that pairs well with food.

on tap-pours a creamy, retaining offwhite head that laces with copper color. Aroma is hops. Taste is crisp medium hops, balanced with secondary malt, then sweet and citrus. Middle of style & very well done.

Crystal clear amber body with off-white head that leaves nice lacing. Aroma is medium sweet, herbal/grapefruit, caramel. Taste is medium sweet, caramel, herbal/grapefruit. Light-medium body with carbonation befitting a cask beer (though it was not a cask version). One of the mildest hop character for an IPA that I have ever had. That being said, it was ok in its own right.
Nasty, horrible, very sour flavors, not good on the palate, very bitter but not in the good-bitter kinda way
Bottle (Old Notes)-Pours golden with a decent head. Aroma of corn, sweetness, hops, and malt. Taste of the same with a bit more hops. This light bodied brew was not bad.

I tasted Australian recently when travelling in India. Deep, golden colour. Creamy,white,head. Good lace and head retention. Aroma is malty,with noticeable hop balanced in. Smooth, creamy, mouthfeel.Great malty flavor and loads of hops. Spicy hops all over but malt lingers forever. A great pilsner!
sparkling and inviting, grapefruit and lychee aroma as well as a hint of baking soda. reasonably bitter with a hint of stewed apples, good stuff

This is a full amber with a head that sticks to the glass. At first, I thought there was something odd in the aroma. The longer I drank the beer the more I realized that it was just the American grapefruit hops this beer is laced with. Iâ€™m not used to that hop profile in a lager and often American hops clash with the lager flavors, but this worked. This is an interesting lager thatâ€™s hopped like an average APA.
Very excellent offering of the California common style beers, this definitely ranks right up there with some of the CA styles that Anchor brews
650ml bottle. Pours a clear deep gold Aroma is grian tartness nad papery. Flavor is papery, spice, tart, bittersweet, bad stuff.

Eye: nice golden color, clean and brillant, the head is standard for a lager beer. Nouse: smooth cereal aroma, with a little touch of green vegetables! alcohol is in the deep. Tonge: fresh and good body, with a little notes of caramel, the alcohol is always present. Mi fisrt Sri Lanka Beer!
Decent enough for a lager, but a little weak tasting. Not bad if you are eating overwhelmingly hot Indian food; itâ€™ll wash down curry like nobodyâ€™s business.
Deep golden colour with fluffy white head. Aroma of hops and flowers. Clean slightly malty taste. Refreshing on a hot day. Smooth creamy palate, clean aftertaste. Good lager beer from India.
Too hoppy for my liking in the pilsener category, golden color, nice soft white lacy head, the hoppiness was way too over-powering
A liter at a time, every 30 minutes or so, gets you feeling good. Ein Prosit, ein Prosit Der GemÃ¼tlichkeit Ein Prosit, ein Prosit Der GemÃ¼tlichkeit. OANS! ZWOA! DREI! G'SUFFA!

Malty with a carmely flavor. There's a biscuity vibe as others have stated and maybe nutty. The mouth feel is thin, but truthfully I don't care because this pleasant to drink. When I think of Octoberfest, this is the beer I think they would be serving. One can just enjoy the atmosphere of the festival with your friends and family. The beer isn't spectacular as there's not a lot flavors going on, but it's really drinkable and on a hot day, I'd reach for this for sure. I think my dad would classify this a lawnmower beer and he'd be right. Definitely, I'd buy this again. If you want just an easy drinking beer, I think you may have found it.
Dark amber pour with thin lace. Brown sugar and crackling oat nose. Sweet caramel and hop flavor. Sweet nutty palate

Grabbed sixer from grocer surprised never had prior. Bright clear copper coloration. Nose is biscuits and light fruit. Tastes of toast, nutty, caramel, malt, some peppery notes, hint of honey and fruit. Tasty stuff not sure if changes year to year but I like it.
Una rossa leggera, poco gassata. Câ€™Ã¨ la nota amara, che arriva dopo la nota dolce. Molto interessante, una bella scoperta.
An amber beer style. This full bodied beer with its rich malt flavor, dark toffee note and underlying fruitiness has a masterful hop balance.
Tap at Drink Baar, Tallinn. Color is clear orange with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Sweetness, biscuits, some grain, some bread and malts. Some honeyish sweetness.
Sono un amante di questa tipologia di birre. Corposa al punto giusto, gradazione alcolica perfetta (5,8%). Sapore ottimo. Gran birra
Amber brown, small tan head. Sweet malt aroma. Slightly sticky mouthfeel. Sweet malt, some dry not bitter hop balance. Pretty good, some better ones are around.

At Frankford Hall, dark golden color with a medium head. Notes are caramel malt, dark fruit, pepper, grass, cracker, and nuts. Earthy and not overly sweet for the style but the body is a little light for the style. Still a decent Marzen

8/5/2018. Keg at the Half Moon, Darlington. Pours fizzy pale gold with a lasting white head. Aroma of citrus, hay, straw, hop and boiled sweets. Medium plus sweetness, light bitterness. Light body, oily and watery texture, average carbonation. Fruity, artificial, sweet, fizzy finish. Not a fan.

Draught at the Half Moon, Darlington. Gold amber colour, white foam head and grainy aroma. Taste is pale malt, grains, wet hay with some grassy and earthy bitterness. Light bodied, medium bodied, dry earthy light bitter finish. OK pale lager.

Crisp and clean. Light malts with a watery mouthfeel. It is pale lager and it tastes like a pale lager. Better than the average affair in UK pubs. Very good in the summer and thirst quenching. I am not even sure it is available outside the north east of England and frankly my mates who still live there question if it is still made ( this was a memory review heh) .

Canâ€™t believe I found this on here. Not going to be a very useful rating as I drank most of these warm or through a bottle-bong when i was 17. Canâ€™t remember it tasting of much but it was very cheap.

past the best by date for sure, but still tasted ok, although slight hints of cardboard came through, but this was still refreshing. mild carbonation for a pale lager, but the bottle says premium later. not much going on though. easily forgettable probably deserving of its low ratings.
Bottled. Hazy yellow colour, minor white bubbly head. Fruitish aroma with caramelly notes. A bit watery, but caramelly and malty flavour. Not that special.
First time around the aftertaste isnâ€™t all that great. After youâ€™ve got past the first can though youâ€™ll be hooked.
Soft carbonation in a golden, headless drink... a sweet grassy aroma... malty sweet taste... watery... hardwater finish... sucks. World Market, Orland Park, IL
Bottled, pasteurised. Pale insipid, highly carbonated. Malty sweet eurofiz, perfumey, but predominantly tinny. Poor quality.
Golden body, darker than an American lager. Medium head. SLightly sweet aroma. Light caramel notes in the flavor, some sweet notes as well. Not terribly complex, a bit of a metallic finish.
Solid black lager. Pours cola black with a small white top. Aroma is light toasted malt and bready notes. Taste is much the same, nothing untoward just a solid lager that is easily enjoyed.
Growler from BC $8 Wednesday! Barely translucent brown with nice tan head. Malt aroma. A bit malty sweet, roasty, some bitterness. Generally clean and although dryness lingers.

Draft at the brewery, 7/4/16. Dark brownish pour. Light, malty aroma and flavor. Feels a little thin, but okay overall. Not a terrible beer or anything, itâ€™s okay, but overall, this is a pretty forgettable example of the style.
Dark brown rimming beige head; little to no aroma; flava is roasty bready malty; feels light medium decent foamy fizz; finishes dry roasty
Pours a dark brown color. Whitish head. Aromas of roasted coffee and nuts. Taste is slightly toasty and slightly sweet. By far the best on tap tonight.
At barley creek on tap smooth black lager. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured into a nonic at 50 degrees Full review at http://lownobudgetreviews.wordpress.com/2013/05/07/barley-creek-brewing-company-tannersville-pa-navigator-angler-and-antler/ (Ryanâ€™s Reviews) ANGLER is a great example of a lager that actually maintains some pretty deep and interestingly complex flavor profiles, even though it is a lagerâ€¦ and that impressed me immensely! ANGLER pours a deep near-black brown with a creamy light tan head that dissipates pretty quickly and leaves nearly no lacing, but this is to be expected with a lager. The scent rising out of the nonic is all coffee and roasted malt, big smoky scents without smelling like a smoked beer, a lot more depth to it than I was anticipating from this lager. Taking that first taste, I think: this is a lager I could actuallyâ€¦ like. It has some of the flavors youâ€™d expect from what Iâ€™m smelling â€“ coffee, roasty, deep flavors akin somewhat with a stout â€“ yet it also has that dry crispness I expect from a lager, and a very mild hoppiness on the exit, just enough to remind you that there are some hops in the beer. The lagering process has made the flavor profile a lot more one-dimensional than it would be if it were an ale, which is not necessarily a bad thing; not everyone is into big flavors and not everyone will appreciate the complexities of a Russian Imperial Stout. ANGLER would be a great stepping-stone for someone working their way out of AAL and into better beers, darker beers. ANGLER looks thick, until you hold it up to the light and see how thin it really is. The beer is meager and zesty in its body; while from across the room it looks like a stout, drinking ANGLER makes its lager heritage extremely obvious. That lager body makes ANGLER a very easily drinkable beer.
Pours a burnt sienaish brown. Lovely malty sweetness on the nose. Nice smooth taste with just that hint of indeterminate sweetness. The finish is a bit bitter but not yet mouth-puckeringly so.

From bottle. Roasty aroma to this with lots of chocolate malt, coffee, and roasted barley. Rich nose, very fragrant and pleasant. Dark brown-black clear with thin off-white head. Medium watery body with heavy carbonation. Starts sweet with roasted barley, chocolate and light coffee. Nutty and sweet with dry tangy finish and light chalky after. A little acidity from some over carbonation, but a nice schwarzbier.

Sampled on draught at the brewery in Tannersville. A normal shwarz with nothing too distinguishing other then a metallic nose that I didnâ€™t particularly enjoy. Dark black colour, thin beige head. Taste has some licorice, and spinach. Wierd.
Again, another nodding head beer that tastes exactly like 3 other of their beers. Most closely the Grog. Chocolate malts and smokek bacon flavor. thin mouth feel.

Pretty dark, not as opaque as some. Light roasty coffee aroma, somewhat bland some stinky notes. Pruney, light creosote, mouthy a bit too sweet for the style and malty. Falls off towards a stout. Pistachio and clean finish. A little fuddled, but drinkable.
Average porter, basically black in color, nice lacy dark tan head, lots of roasted malty flavors, a bit of a dry aftertaste

This is a re-rate. I had it on tap at Bitting. It pours a cloudy golden with some white head, and lacing. The aroma was some hops, bread, and grass. The taste is hoppier than I remember with light hints of citrus and grain. Itâ€™s pretty smooth with nice bitterness. This batch was much better than previous versions.
Draft at the source. Clear yellow color. Aroma of peppery hay. Taste is similar.

Tap. Pours clear gold with a small, fizzy white head, short retention with light lacing. Aroma is Pils malt and light, spicy hops. Flavor is malt and hop balanced with a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.
Draft. Pours cloudy gold. Nose and taste of spicy hops, sweet malt and cereal grain. Sweeter than most pilsners. Tasty.

Pours a slightly cloudy straw color with no head. Aroma is of some light grass and some sweet almost corn-like malt. Taste is of some light sticky.grain malt notes, and a light touch of some grass hops. Not much going on here.....
Draft at the brewpub. Simplistic and bad. Golden body with a small white head. Aroma of sweet corn and vegetables, artificial sugar. Flavor is bland....grains and maybe corn. Weak.
Medium straw gold pour with white head and lace. Light malt aroma and hints of corn. Medium to light malt flavor and no paper or corn flavor++. Good carbonation and mouthfeel. Pretty damn nice pils

Good sized frothy bright white head of fine bubbles. Light carbonation. Light malts, lemon and some spicy hops in the aroma. Color is a very pale yellow with good clarity. Soft biscuity malts up front and then some spicy hops late swallow. Just a little though. Some lemon and cereal grains intertwined with the other flavors as well. Finishes a bit pasty with some spicy lemon. A pretty good pilsner.
Yellowy color with low carbonation. Flavor was grassy, and it didnâ€™t have the aroma or crispness that I expect from the style. Didnâ€™t impress, sorry.
Pretty solid, although I would probably go with another one of JJâ€™s offerings if I was in town. Unimaginative pils.

Vintage bottle , best by 2004. Pours clear blonde, head fades in a second. big visual carbonation ( think of a lager ) Smell is apples, bit sour even, and some sweetness. Taste is sharp. A oxidized subtaste, over a sour, and I mean this in a very good way, apple-like maltyness. I expected a drainpour, but got what probably is the best aged blond beer to date ( accept sours of course ) ! I donâ€™t get why itâ€™s still so good, but the light oxidation, apple character-like sourness combo, really works. Even though this beer probably tasted way dofferent back in the day, itâ€™s nothing short of awesome today!
Not much to say about this one. It was just simply boring. Must be why it was discontinued by Deca.
Cloudy dark golden colour. Bready aroma. Flavour is also bready and seems a little oxidized.

A hazy orange beer with a huge white head. The aroma has strong notes of citrus and dust, while the flavor is sweet with notes of yeast, spices, citrus, as well as some dust - which I believe is from the hops.

Bottled: Golden coloured. Unclear. Dense beige head. Sweet, yeasty, fruity aroma with a dash of alcohol to spice up the nose. Flavour is spiced and has some fruity accents. Is quite thin and a bit over the top. Smooth and creamy mouthfeel. Quite nice.

(Bottle 25 cl) Steen and I found this in a dusty box at the stockroom, when we visited Deca last July. (Deca is a bit of a peculiar mix between a microbrewery and liquorstore) This is quite a few years old and is no longer produced. However, itâ€™s quite lively in the glass, with a tall living head on top of an onrange-golden beer with sediments in the bottle. Smells a bit sour and unpleasant. The flavor however is primarily bitter on a quite light body. 250904

Caramel and vinous "chardonnay" aroma. and flavor. Sherry flavor coming up. Fruity (apple) and bitter aftertaste. This beer is in fact a bit too old, but the flavor is OK and the lacing is satisfying.
Pale grapefruit color, grapefruit flavors and some bandage and basement sour aromas. Thin body but not badly so, refreshingly tart. Delicious.
Pineapple and light lemon aroma. Golden color before the yeast pours in. White head, good lace. Neutral flavors, some spices (pepper, cinnamon?), little thin. Long lasting bitter finish.

Clear blond beer with a medium head. Slightly sour, yeasty and rubber wheel aroma. Bitter taste with a dry bitter aftertaste. There is nothing more than bitterness to the taste which makes a bit flat.

0.5 l bottle from the brewery, best before December 2018. Minimally hazy, pale golden with a thin, dense, stable, white head. Sweetish, slightly grassy-spicy and a bit fruity aroma of grains, fresh grass and some citrus. Moderately sweet, slightly bitter, moderately grassy-spicy and a bit fruity taste of grains, fresh grass and some citrus, followed by a short, moderately bitter, slightly grassy-spicy and a bit dry finish. Thin to medium body, smooth and slightly effervescent mouthfeel, average carbonation. Very fresh, smooth and pleasant Lager, nice!

Flasche - Ã–ko-Bier - SchÃ¶ne gelb-goldene Farbe, trÃ¼b, cremige Schaumkrone. KÃ¶rper mittel, Geschmacklich leider etwas langweilig. Leicht sÃ¼ÃŸlich, ein wenig SÃ¤ure kommt auch durch. Heu, Malz. Kaum bitterer Abgang. Naja.
Pours a clear medium yellow with a white head. The smell is bread, delicate grain and grassy hops. The taste is sweet grain, grass ending crisp and dry. Light+ body with fine, soft carbonation.

Bottle from a local drink market in Werl, Northrhine-Westphalia, Germany! Pours pale yellow with flat white head. Smell has sweet grain and hay. Starts floral hoppy, slight herbal with some grass and hay. Finish is very grassy with hay and some herbal notes.
Irgendwie hatte ich etwas knackiges erwartet, dabei endet dies hier im Zucker und etwas Heu. Trikbar mit ein wenig Mais und Suesse zum Schluss. Ganz ok.

Pours out of the bottle in a hazy golden-amber colour with low head and medium body. Aroma of straw and hops. Taste of hops, straw, nuts, basement, flowers and wild herbs. Nice one yet nothing special.
TrÃ¼bes goldenes Bier mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch malzig, getreidig, blumig. Geschmack malzig, leicht fruchtig, grasig.

ehr vollmundig sÃ¼ffig, Antrunk neutral-hefig. Hauptteil frisch-muffig-leicht herb. Nachgeschmack muffig-herb, hefig, interessant. Test vom 16.4.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche Noten: 12,9,12,9,12,9 - 9,90

Bottled 500ml flip-top (BZ, BB 04/2013) Slightly hazy golden color, small white head. Dusty-yeasty aroma, grainy. Medium-bodied. Low carbonation. Grainy, sweetish-fruity maltyness. Light bitterness. Typical organic vibe in this beer. And it doesnâ€™t add points.

Bottle. Light golden, hazy, small to average and fully diminishing head. Moderate malty lightly sweetish aroma, light bread and light hoppyness. Body is medium, malty and lightly sweetish flavor, light bread with light herbal hoppyness. Finish is average, malty - lightly grainy and dryish with light herbal hoppyness. OK dryish kellerbier - nothing special, though.
Not Phillipsâ€™ best offering - not even their best stout. Coffee, dark chocolates and malts are all present but this one doesnâ€™t stand out.

341mL bottle, pour a dark brown with a small beige head. Aroma of coffee, light roast, not much else. Flavour of very light roasted coffee, light roasted and some metallic notes. Very light-bodied and watery - maybe the most watered down stout Iâ€™ve ever head, if you can even call this a stout. Pretty piss poor.

Looks great, but looks can be deceiving. When you read the label, youâ€™re expecting something exceptional. Not quite. Coffee and chocolate is there, but if you really, really, really love stout, this one, unfortunately, is a little bit week
Lagerboys should like this thin, flavoured stout. Nice roasty coffee malt aroma and taste, some chocolate too. Nice and light, not overpowering. Good desert beer.

Pours black in the glass but when held up to the light is actually dark brown. Small head disappears before the first sip. Hint of hops in the aroma. Not getting a lot of roasted malt in the flavor, there is some coffee. Not bad but I like more robust stouts, this is very mild.
Bottle from trade. Pours a dark brown with a thin off white head. Aroma is weak coffee aroma with off almost sour notes. Flavour has a nice coffee malt with bitter chocolate, a bit thin. Okay.

Poured a with thick, creamy head. VERY dark appearance, almost couldnâ€™t see any light through the glass. Not much aroma at first, but after drinking half the glass, there was a hint of coffee. Tast was okay, with traces of chocolate.

Smells like industrial coffee grounds and freshly brewed coffee, and the taste is equally as Folgers. Balanced with a good bittersweet aftertaste of roasted malt and coffee. Suffers from some thinness in body, but itâ€™s pretty drinkable.

Bottle shared with HogTownHarry, blankboy & jerc - courtesy of blankboy. Dark brown with a huge mocha head. Aroma of stale malt with a faint hint of coffee. Thin body. Bland flavour of weak, sour, watery coffee. As the others have noted, we hope to try the more recent, supposedly better version sometime, but for now, itâ€™s a thumbs down from us.

Bottle (650ml) shared with HogTownHarry, GregClow & jerc -- my bottle courtesy of CapFlu. Pours a very dark brown, almost black, with a large mostly-lasting foamy tan head. Decent lacing. Mediocre aroma of lightly roasted malt and not much else. Watery flavour of roasted malt and coffee. Light to medium bodied. Bland, watery and dull -- very disappointing. Iâ€™ve heard thereâ€™s a new, much better batch of this available, if thatâ€™s the case I will have to revisit and rerate it as I know Phillips is capable of much better then this.

Bottle. Gold with a white head that's soon a cm. Nice cracker and biscuit aroma matched with less convincing notes - some cardboard with the floral and spices. Lightish bodied and clean with crackery malt, the slightest touch of richness and firm, spicy bitterness. Finish makes up for the cheapish aroma. OK.

Golden coloured. Medium dense and formation foam. Smells like a traditional pilsner or a strong lager. Really light on mouth, high bitterness on aftertaste considering its style. Medium drikability. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Golden coloured. Medium dense and formation foam. Smells like a traditional pilsner or a strong lager. Really light on mouth, high bitterness on aftertaste considering its style. Medium drikability.

0,5l Flasche. Gelbes klares Bier mut weissem Schaum. Grasig wÃ¼rziger Geruch. Frisch im Antrunk. Dann etwas flach. Getreidig herber Abgang.

Mein Dank gilt WillemsUrenkel fÃ¼r dieses Bier. Geruch getreidig mit leichter WÃ¼rze. Antrunk sÃ¼ÃŸlich, Getreide. Mitte weiterhin sÃ¼ÃŸlich, mild-getreidig. Abgang etwas Brot, Malz und moderat bitter. Ok.
Bottle from Keller Meister, Lincoln. Golden colour with a big white head. Sweet corn aroma with fruit. Taste light sweet.
Das Bier hat eine klare goldene Farbe und eine groÃŸe feinporige weiÃŸe Schaumkrone. Geruch ist wÃ¼rzig hopfig, sehr malzig. Geschmack floral hopfig, wÃ¼rzig malzig, dezent bitter.

Amarela clara, lÃ­mpida. Espuma abundante de mÃ©dia duraÃ§Ã£o. Aroma de malte, ligeiramente floral. Sabor equilibrado, tendendo para o amargo, com toques florais, de mel e uma leve nota cÃ­trica. Retrogosto amargo com final Ã¡cido.

column2: North Woodstock, New Hampshire, United States
column5: From a growler from the brewery. Medium amber-orange pour with a modest head. English toasted toffee malt character and "grassy forest along the river" hops. Sweet. The body is medium and smooth. The taste has a lovely toasted toffee and mild hop finish. Little to no bitterness but generally sweet to the end.

column2: North Woodstock, New Hampshire, United States
column5: darker orange. 1 finger head. smells like graham cracker, caramel. Taste is honey, more english bitterness. light vanilla, cream soda. interesting.

column2: North Woodstock, New Hampshire, United States
column5: Draft at brewpub. Multiple tastings. I have had everything they have to offer as we come here often for dinner while in the area. As with their food, the beer is OK but nothing spectacular. In fact, most of their beers are in my opinion, sub-par. This one was just OK.

column2: North Woodstock, New Hampshire, United States
column5: Light amber in color with a small white head. Aroma of mild floral hops.fruit and butter. Flavor is buttery,bready malt and moderately bitter with floral hop character.

column2: North Woodstock, New Hampshire, United States
column5: Pour is nice dark amber, small but creamy white head. Flavor is pretty typical EPA, but maybe a bit creamier than average.

column1: Moat Mountain Iron Mike Pale Ale
column2: North Conway, New Hampshire, United States
column4: Moat Mountain Smoke House & Brewing Company
column5: Can from mon pere: pours gold with a white head. Aroma is light pine, slight malty bread, light citrus. Light bitterness. Marginal resin. Super olde school.

column1: Moat Mountain Iron Mike Pale Ale
column2: North Conway, New Hampshire, United States
column4: Moat Mountain Smoke House & Brewing Company
column5: Cask (gravity) @ GBBF 2016, [ Great British Beer Festival 2016 ], London Olympia, Hammersmith Road, London, England W14 8UX. [ As Moat Mountain Iron Mike Pale Ale ]. Clear medium orange colour with a small to average, frothy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, fruity malt, sweet malt, moderate hoppy, orange - citrus, orange, resin. Flavor is moderate sweet and bitter with a long duration, resin, caramel, orange, sweet malt. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is flat. [20160809] 6-3-7-3-13

column1: Moat Mountain Iron Mike Pale Ale
column2: North Conway, New Hampshire, United States
column4: Moat Mountain Smoke House & Brewing Company
column5: Draft at Moat Mountain Smoke House & Brewing Co in N Conway, NH. Clear medium gold color with a tiny white head. Fair lacing. Lightly hopped for an APA. Okay.

column1: Moat Mountain Iron Mike Pale Ale
column2: North Conway, New Hampshire, United States
column4: Moat Mountain Smoke House & Brewing Company
column5: Cask gravity @ GBBF 2016. Pours a slightly hazy golden pale amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty citrus hoppy aroma. Fruity malty citrus hoppy flavor. Has a fruity malty citrus hoppy finish.

column1: Moat Mountain Iron Mike Pale Ale
column2: North Conway, New Hampshire, United States
column4: Moat Mountain Smoke House & Brewing Company
column5: From tap. Pours clear and golden orange with a small white head. Aroma is citrusy and crisp hoppy. Bitter, citrusy and slight grassy. Bitter and fruity far finish.

column1: Moat Mountain Iron Mike Pale Ale
column2: North Conway, New Hampshire, United States
column4: Moat Mountain Smoke House & Brewing Company
column5: Almost frozen from a poundre can. Drank right fromt eh can. Cold as ice. Barely any co2. Bitter initial impact like an IPA. Slight hop perfume nose. Yes, in the end this is almost an IPA if it is not one form the start.

column1: Moat Mountain Iron Mike Pale Ale
column2: North Conway, New Hampshire, United States
column4: Moat Mountain Smoke House & Brewing Company
column5: Canned 11/5/16, drunk 12/5/16. Clear, drab brass with a medium-sized white head showing moderate to moderately-low retention. Fruity and fairly aromatically hoppy in the nose, with a West Coast tilt that adds moderate pine and strong grapefruit, though it doesnâ€™t get resinous/sour. Malts are sparse and remain in the background, adding typical biscuit and very light hints of caramel. Clean, no alcohol noted. Well-carbonated with a moderately malty, well-attenuated texture with notes of honey and light caramel. Leafy, coniferous, green hops begin with light pine and lemon and slowly move to a stronger grapefruit flavor. Fairly crisp finish helps disperse some of the hops acids and overall it remains quite drinkable and clean.

column1: Moat Mountain Iron Mike Pale Ale
column2: North Conway, New Hampshire, United States
column4: Moat Mountain Smoke House & Brewing Company
column5: Backlog from GBBF 2016, big grapefruit nose, then hoppy but too sweet for my liking.

column1: Moat Mountain Iron Mike Pale Ale
column2: North Conway, New Hampshire, United States
column4: Moat Mountain Smoke House & Brewing Company
column5: Cask at GBBF â€™16, day one, 09/08/16 - 3,000th unique brewry rating on RB. Clear golden orange with a moderate off white head. Nose is jammy citrcs, light dank hop exhaust, grapefruit, melon. Taste comprises skunky hop tang, pissy citric shreds, straw, grapefruit. Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close peppered with dank hop bitterness. Solid APA.

column1: Moat Mountain Iron Mike Pale Ale
column2: North Conway, New Hampshire, United States
column4: Moat Mountain Smoke House & Brewing Company
column5: August 2016 - Cask at GBBF 2016 as â€™Moat Mountain Iron Mikeâ€™. Dark golden, clear, still, small foamy white head. Aroma is sherbety, lemon, grapefruit. Body is smooth with soft carbonation. Taste is grapefruit, toffee, pithy citrus, lemon notes, dry finish. Quite good. (3.5)

column2: North Conway, New Hampshire, United States
column4: Moat Mountain Smoke House & Brewing Company
column5: Optisch dunkles Kupfer, in Nase und Trunk malzig, anfangs leicht rÃ¶stig, Karamell, guter Durchschnitt.

column2: North Conway, New Hampshire, United States
column4: Moat Mountain Smoke House & Brewing Company
column5: Bottle. Pours dark brown with a short white head. Aroma of caramel, brown sugar and some faint nuttiness. Flavor of toasted malts, caramel, brown sugar and toasted nuts.

column2: North Conway, New Hampshire, United States
column4: Moat Mountain Smoke House & Brewing Company
column5: Local beer for me and a very good one. A really malty, chewy beer that has a nice smooth flavor. Not sure how far its availability goes, but get one if you can find it.

column2: North Conway, New Hampshire, United States
column4: Moat Mountain Smoke House & Brewing Company
column5: Pours clear dark amber with full head. Aroma is brown sugar and dried fruit. Taste is caramel, plum, warming to a light roast. Finish is very smooth. An enjoyable, drinkable brown ale.

column2: North Conway, New Hampshire, United States
column4: Moat Mountain Smoke House & Brewing Company
column5: Pours brown-red with white head. A caramel malt aroma. A sweet malt taste with brown sugar and some chocolate. A lingering sweet caramel malt and chocolate afteraste.

column2: North Conway, New Hampshire, United States
column4: Moat Mountain Smoke House & Brewing Company
column5: Draft at Moat Mountain Smoke House & Brewing Co in N Conway, NH. Clear dark amber color; Lighter color than most brown ales. No head or lacing. Thin mouthfeel for the style. Flavor is more like a rauchbier than a brown. Smoky, smooth and clean. Good. Maybe they gave me the wrong beer but I like it.

column2: North Conway, New Hampshire, United States
column4: Moat Mountain Smoke House & Brewing Company
column5: Draft at vignola. Pours brown with a white head. Leaves some lacing in the glass. Solid caramel notes on the nose and tongue with a slight nutty note. Finished clean. Solid enough.

column2: North Conway, New Hampshire, United States
column4: Moat Mountain Smoke House & Brewing Company
column5: From tap. Pours hazy brown with a small off white head. Aroma is toasted malty. Light caramelish and breadish. Sweet, dark malty. Toasted malty. Caramelish sweet and slight fruity finish.

column2: North Conway, New Hampshire, United States
column4: Moat Mountain Smoke House & Brewing Company
column5: Nearly clear brown or with a lasting beige skim. Aroma is malty, slightly nutty with faint hints of cooked sugar. Flavor is similar, surprised itâ€™s not marketed as a nut brown. Lots of hazelnut, filbert. A little watery and finished a tad astringent, but quite enjoyable all around.

column2: North Conway, New Hampshire, United States
column4: Moat Mountain Smoke House & Brewing Company
column5: Nice creamy head and rich brown color. Smooth full taste. Great in a warm pub on a cold night. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

column2: North Conway, New Hampshire, United States
column4: Moat Mountain Smoke House & Brewing Company
column5: Pours black with small, beige head. Aroma is coffee and caramel. Taste is chocolate and toffee, warming to coffee and roast. Finish is smooth roast. Not incredibly complex, just a good, straight ahead stout.

column2: North Conway, New Hampshire, United States
column4: Moat Mountain Smoke House & Brewing Company
column5: Taster pour at Powder Keg Beer and Chili Festival. Appearance is opaque black with finger-width light brown, rocky foam head, lacing. Aroma is strong, rich roasted malts with a hint of dark chocolate. Taste is roasted malts like the aroma. Palate is medium-to-full bodied with thick texture, soft carbonation and bittersweet finish as taste, bordering on ash. Overall, a good straightforward roasted malt stout without additional nuance.

column2: North Conway, New Hampshire, United States
column4: Moat Mountain Smoke House & Brewing Company
column5: Draft at Moat Mountain Smoke House & Brewing Co in N Conway, NH. Pitch black with a beige head. No lacing. Super dark roasted malt and smoky flavor. Almost burnt. Thin mouthfeel for the style.

column2: North Conway, New Hampshire, United States
column4: Moat Mountain Smoke House & Brewing Company
column5: From tap. Pours pitch black with a small tan head. Aroma is roasted malty. Dry, roasted and slight breadish. Dry, bitter and roasted finish.

column2: North Conway, New Hampshire, United States
column4: Moat Mountain Smoke House & Brewing Company
column5: On tap @ Moat Mountain. Black in color with a khaki head. Typical roast, licorice, and a touch of ash. Light in body and carbonation. Some bitterness and earthiness. Pretty minimal sweetness here. Has a sort of acidic, carbonic finish to it. Not really a fan.

column2: North Conway, New Hampshire, United States
column4: Moat Mountain Smoke House & Brewing Company
column5: On draft at the Smokehouse in North Conway. Nice, robust stout and a good finale on their taster paddle. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

column2: North Conway, New Hampshire, United States
column4: Moat Mountain Smoke House & Brewing Company
column5: Pours black with minimal head. Aroma is sweet chocolate. Flavor has chocolate and sweet alcohol.

column2: North Conway, New Hampshire, United States
column4: Moat Mountain Smoke House & Brewing Company
column5: Tap at the brewery. Pours opaque black with a medium, frothy beige head, medium retention with good lacing. Aroma is roast and chocolate malt with earthy hops, dates and prunes with coffee notes. Flavor is dark malt dominant, light hops and medium bitterness with dark fruits and a dry finish. Full body and medium carbonation.

column2: North Conway, New Hampshire, United States
column4: Moat Mountain Smoke House & Brewing Company
column5: On tap at the brewpub. Very dark walnut brown. Husky roast aroma, some coffee. Flavours of coffee, chocolate liqueur, light plummy sweetness, dry finish. Quite enjoyable.

column2: North Conway, New Hampshire, United States
column4: Moat Mountain Smoke House & Brewing Company
column5: On tap at ACBF 6/1/2013 Roasty chocolate aroma and flavor with sweet caramel and a creamy smooth mouthfeel. Nice brew.

column2: North Conway, New Hampshire, United States
column4: Moat Mountain Smoke House & Brewing Company
column5: on tap-pours a white ring and yellow color. Aroma is floral/some spice, light malt. Taste is earthysome spice, light malt/grain. OK effervescence.

column2: North Conway, New Hampshire, United States
column4: Moat Mountain Smoke House & Brewing Company
column5: Draught at the North Conway restaurant. The appearance, aroma and flavour showed a very strong malt profile that overpowered the bitterness more than it should. Okay, but not a great pils. Really missing that clean, crisp taste and finish.

column2: North Conway, New Hampshire, United States
column4: Moat Mountain Smoke House & Brewing Company
column5: Golden in color with a small white head. nice floral hop aroma with mild grainy malt. Grainy,bready maly taste, assertively bitter and hoppy. Dry finish,very clean.

column2: North Conway, New Hampshire, United States
column4: Moat Mountain Smoke House & Brewing Company
column5: Light peppery, citrus hops, happily crispy...Simple, effective hay in a tasty refreshing body...The kind of beer that might lead barflies on to tastier worlds...

column2: North Conway, New Hampshire, United States
column4: Moat Mountain Smoke House & Brewing Company
column5: My first pilsner. nice golden color. not too familair with the style. It seemed more sweet than hoppy. not sure if thats a style atribute.

I was a bit disappointed with this beer. I may had too high of expectations as I was hoping for an Arrogant Bastard or a Wailing Wench. Appearance: Served a dark brown color mostly opaque with a bit of a cloudy gritty look to it. Smell: Slightly sour apple and brown sugar aroma. Taste: *VERY* very sweet! borderline cloying. Granny smith, Werthers Originals candies, and caramel candies are swirled in the extremely malty thick sticky taste. There is only a hint of muted sour / bitter in the finish. Big sweet taste but not balanced and not what I was expecting from an American Strong Ale. Mouthfeel: Thick and sticky. Like a Wee Heavy style beer. This is not bad, I like a thick heavy beer but not what I was expecting from the style. Drinkability: I am sorry to say that even one pint glass was a bit much to get through. Pleasant taste but *extremely* heavy. Hope this is helpful. Cheers!

Drat Pours a clear brown with a small tan head. Aroma is of sweet malts of carmel and hints of coffee. Taste is very light for the look of it. Has a sweeet overtone and a decent blend. High alcohol content is hidden well. Has a cool finish which is difficult to describe but is good. This was my favorite at the brew pub.

On tap at the brewery. Pours a rich brown color with a thick tan head. Initial flavor is malty, however, a few seconds later comes a wash of sweetness with a definite alcohol presence. I understand there is a 2 pint maximum at the brewery on this one, which I think is smart. A very enjoyable beer

on tap at bcbc, a sweet malty nose, caramel tones, some spices. body was a deep brown color with white lacing. flavor was rich with malts, caramel flavor with hints of chocolates. there is an odd tangy bite to the end of this, almost like an ipa tang but coming from a full body beer, it was odd. a very good brew, the abv doesnt make an impression, which made it very easy to drop down a pint or two after the sampler was gone.

This beer is very malty and it reminds me of port, except with less alcohol. Because it has 8% alcohol, they wonâ€™t sell it outside of the tap. That is a shame because it is very well balanced, a great beer for cold winter nights and it has a nice finish to it. But I donâ€™t blame Trip one bit for not wanting kids in our area to have this in a keggar. I detect shades of caramel and apple in this beer but its not overly sweet. This beer is the reason I keep going to Barley Creek.
Tap at the pub. Poured brown with a good tan head. Strong it right. Strong malt flavor and aroma, followed by strong hop aroma and flavor. Finished smooth. Excellent.

Very strong malt flavor, and well hidden alcohol. Dark amber in color with a good head and good lacing. Very hoppy and malty. Barley Creek is a gorgeous brewpub in a gorgeous location, with great food and great beers.
I very much enjoyed this beer. Very dark in appearance with a nice white head. Stop by the brewpub and have this one on tap.
Had this at the 2003 GABF. Smells somewhat of hops but mostly roasted malt. Appearance is dark brown almost black. Flavor is mostly dark chocolate/coffee but weak and thin.
tap - brown red with decent head. rather thin and non-distinctive. I could not discern the cascade hops which I usually detect w/o problem.

column2: North Conway, New Hampshire, United States
column4: Moat Mountain Smoke House & Brewing Company
column5: On tap at The American Craft Beer Fest Yesterday. Fruity bready aroma and flavor, not horrible but boring.

column2: North Conway, New Hampshire, United States
column4: Moat Mountain Smoke House & Brewing Company
column5: My 1st Vienna, so I donâ€™t have anything to compare it to. No aroma. Light body, smooth with a light toastiness and a pleasantly light hop finish. Donâ€™t know if I care to get more brews of this style. Kind of boring. Not much else to say on this one.

column2: North Conway, New Hampshire, United States
column4: Moat Mountain Smoke House & Brewing Company
column5: No aroma. Light body, smooth with a light toastiness and a pleasantly light hop finish. Vienna style lager that is slightly better than most I drink.

column2: North Conway, New Hampshire, United States
column4: Moat Mountain Smoke House & Brewing Company
column5: Included as part of a sampler. I find Moat offerings to be just average but I seem to keep coming back for more. Another visit, another sampler. Still so so but fresh beer is always good so Iâ€™m sure Iâ€™ll be back again.

column2: North Conway, New Hampshire, United States
column4: Moat Mountain Smoke House & Brewing Company
column5: On tap at brewpub. Appearance : Clear pale amber wit no head. Aroma : nice malt with some fruits. Light caramel, light roasted. Light toffee. Taste : Nice malt with light caramel. Light butterscotch. Overall : Nice citrusy nose and taste. Enjoyable brown sugar and caramel. Nose is nicely fresh and fruity.

column2: North Conway, New Hampshire, United States
column4: Moat Mountain Smoke House & Brewing Company
column5: Pours bright gold dark gold into a Sam glass. Bright white head with excellent retention recedes to coat surface. Nutty toasted caramel aromas. Soft with sweet caramel and honey from front to back. Lasting doughy finish.

column2: North Conway, New Hampshire, United States
column4: Moat Mountain Smoke House & Brewing Company
column5: Pours gold with a white head. Smells of saaz hops, some dry maly, spicy. Tastes spicy and peppery with a dry malty finish.

column2: North Conway, New Hampshire, United States
column4: Moat Mountain Smoke House & Brewing Company
column5: In short: A clean and crisp well malted golden lager perfectly balanced by a generous but smooth hop profile. Superior session golden lager. How: Tap at brewpub The look: Clear dark golden body topped by an off-white ring of foam In long: Nose has a good amount noble leafy hops and some candy. The attack is some crisp candy/caramel/toffee. The leafy hops quickly take over a kick the sweetness away but without providing much bitterness or dryness sensation. This bear is clean, crisp and more clean and crisp. This is far from the rustic unfiltered Viennas that are served in Vienna Country &#40Czech Republic&#41 but I can really appreciate this beer as a superior dark lager session beer. Best beer Iâ€™ve had from this brewpub. Named after a place where people gather up to listen to a grown-up that doesnâ€™t have sex &#40except for occasional pedophilia&#41 tell them to worship a long-hair jobless dude who transformed water into wine &#40exact vintage unkown&#41. Then these people call me weird.

column2: North Conway, New Hampshire, United States
column4: Moat Mountain Smoke House & Brewing Company
column5: En fÃ»t. Pinte dÃ©gustÃ©e Ã  la brasserie. ArÃ´me: Odeur de caramel avec une pointe de cÃ©rÃ©ales grillÃ©es. Apparence: La couleur est ambrÃ©e. PrÃ©sence dâ€™un mince col mousseux et dâ€™une fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: GoÃ»t de caramel lÃ©gÃ¨rement fruitÃ©. DurÃ©e moyenne de lâ€™arriÃ¨re goÃ»t. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture huileuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. PrÃ©sence de caramel en arriÃ¨re goÃ»t. (Rating #1712).

column2: North Conway, New Hampshire, United States
column4: Moat Mountain Smoke House & Brewing Company
column5: on tap at the brewpub. Clear amber in color with a small off white head. Aroma of light toasted grain, a small amount of floral and caramel. Taste is dry and clean, with touches of toasted malt and a light balancing hop bitterness. Not exciting, but a well craft lager based upon being very clean and crisp.
Too mellow, like a hippie. Yellow. No detectable nose or taste. Unimpressed with this Phillips offering; itâ€™s no wonder they put this one permanently to rest.
Amber color. Sour apples and oranges dominate the nose. The palate is sour with apples and cinnamon playing a background role, however the body is a little watered down. The finish is malty and sour.

Never a fan of big name brews, the Pale Ale was probably the first style I tried when I dove into the world of craft beer and for several years, was one of the staples on my lists of favorite drinks. Although my palette has since matured and my fondness for this style waned, I will still fall back to it once in a while when I spot something different. According to literature on the bottle, it's claim states "brewed with the finest organic micromalted Canadian barley, organic hops, pure water, and our signature yeast." Recent discussions of Organic beers spiked my curiosity on Phillips Brewing Company's "Organic Pale Ale." Unfortuantely, much like its Maple Cream Ale reviewed previously, this too, really lacks any hearty personality or redeeming characteristics to make it an enjoyable brew. Sold in standard 650ml brown bottles, a quick shake of the bottle reveals considerable large chunky sediment specs, but not like that of Belgian yeast elements, this one presents more a speckled appearance, similar to that of partical board and wood chips. On the pour, it presents a fairly large rocky head, which disapates quickly to reveal a very think surface froth, considerable lacing and a small tight collar. Visually, the beer is VERY pale in color and more closely resembles a lager or pilsener than that of a Pale Ale. Aroma wise, it presents a very minute amount of hops and a mellow malt blend on the nose. But doesn't present any sigificant bouquet to enjoy. The same holds true on the palette, with everything being severely muted and accented with a calming malt effect. Aftertaste is very short lived revealing little more than a mild malt effect after a few seconds. Brewed dated as September 2002.

Soft sweet toasty nose - caramel and bread as well. Golden amber pour with no head. Caramel and toasted bread in the flavors. A little chewier than the filtered version, dry with some yeasty notes too. Clean finish.

Had this on tap at a tiny beer festival in Vancouver, about 8 years back. I remember tasting it and being blown away by the resemblance of this beer to true Bavarian treats. Fresh grain aroma and flavor through and through. Itâ€™s so good I can still taste it all these years later :-) Wish there were a brewery like this in my hometown. It won indisputably at that festival too!
Very nice amber color and even better unfiltered. Brewed by German immigrants who take great pride in their product. A visit to their brew pub in Oroville, WA is recommended.
Light amber with off white head. Good light malt nose. Malt flavor throughout with clean finish. Have only had this at festivals, will have to visit one day.
Cloudy golden color. Some head with little lacing. Barn yard/horse blanket nose and taste. The peach has almost completely disappeared from the flavor. Chalky texture and dry finish.

Another great brew from Timat Bitter End. Poured in a snifter. Peach in color. Light light yellow pinkish orangeish hue. Nose is incredibly sharp. This was my first Lambic so my palate was really overwhelmed by the sourness. I couldnâ€™t make much else out. The peach honestly wasnâ€™t noticeable, but Iâ€™m certain it was in there. Aftertaste is nice and dry. GREAT BREW Grat

Hay and rye bread malt (M); barnyard and leather yeast (H); peaches and sour white grapes. Deep peach body is slightly hazy with nice carbonation. Moderately sweet, moderately acidic flavor becomes a moderately acidic, moderately sour finish. Medium body, watery/oily texture, lively carbonation. The bottom line is: I could easily mistake this for a Cantillon brew...simply beautiful.

Hazy yellow, like a weizen, only little carbonation. Not peachy--a hint in the aroma, then nothing else. Lovely sourness and restrained tingle on tongue. More boldly "Cantillon-esque" than other American lambics--a worthy contribution, though not without its faults.

Clear yellowish appearance. This was similar to their "Lip Burner Lam-Beak", except it didn''t have as much of the pungent vinegar aroma. A bit less tart as well, still somewhat sour. The peach flavoring is only slight and it comes out toward the end. This might be a good "gateway" for me to finally start appreciating lambics.
Amber and orange pour with white head. Aroma hints of cherry. Taste is apple and sweet and sour cherry.

Draft at Triumph. Pours amber with a bit of white head. Head does not linger long. Too much sweetness, no distinguishable flavors or traits. Caramel malts are about the only thing I picked up on here. No carbonation or balancing bitterness.
Drought. Vanilla aroma, creamy light beige head hazy copper color fruity taste slightly sour abrupt finish with berry aftertaste. Not bad bui not great either.
Draft. Pours an amber body with a thin white lacing. Apple tones, slick and tart with some fresh tart apples. Caramel and apple warming. I hated it.

Tap at Philly. Pours a very light appley amber copper with a decent foamy off white head. Aroma is nice cider, fresh pressed apples, light caramel malt, and some green apple skin. Flavor is zesty apple, tart acidity running through the middle to cut the sweetness of both the apple and the light crystal malts. Ok blend of cider and ale. Fairly smooth and easy to drink.
Tap at Philly location. Pours golden orange with a bright white ring. Nose is sweet, taste is appely, spicy drinkable ok.

This is one of those beers that takes a couple of samples to rate accurately. Aroma is like sour apples with a malt sweetness. Pours a nice amber with a good head. Flavor is tart apples with some beer i9n there somewhere. The more I drank the better I liked it. Finishes quite sour and dry.
on tap-pours a quickly dissipating white head with copper/orange color. Aroma is sweetness, fruity. Taste is apple cider, sweet, faint malt&hops. OK carbonation. Good cider/OK beer.

Pours golden with white head. Aroma is mostly apple cider. Light refreshing mouthfeel. It is supposed to be a half ale and half cider blend, but the cider really dominates here, and I am not a cider drinker.

Very light amberish gold, creamy white head. Soft nose of apple and hints of vinegar. Flavor is lightly tart and appley throughout. Light bodied, soft carbonation, dry, fruity finish. Easy drinkin for a warm summer day, but truly not my thing here...
From old tasting notes. Clear green gold color. Thick white head. Faint sweet pop-like aroma. Somewhat dry bitter hop flavor throughout. Flavor becomes increasingly dry and somewhat astringent.
Korniges Ceralienflavour mit viel Wasser und kÃ¼nstlich-pelzigem Abgang sucht Biertrinker mit KalorienbewuÃŸtsein; ich passÃ©.
Pale yellow body, small but nice head ( a diet!). Minimal hoppy perfume and corn aroma.Thin body, some hoppy taste, little papery. Donâ€™t forget, this is a diet!!!
Bottled(330ml). â€“Yellow coloured, small white airy head, weak corn nose. Dry unpleasant taste of cereals and grain. Hardly drinkable though it was very cold beer on very hot day.
Bottle. Frothy fair white fully deminishing head. Yellow colour. Ligth hoppy aroma, almost nothing. Bad ugly harsh bitter flavor. Short finish. Really an ugly beer.
Bottle. light yellow colour with virtually no head. Aroma and flavour of hops and malts. Boring, boring.
Bottled. Pale golden. Loads of honey in aroma. Pure bee honey. Very dry and a bit papery, also a ittle harsh. Light bodied. No bitterness.

(Bottle 33 cl) Aparently Holsten invented the diet-pils for diabetics - what a pathetic claim to fame... Apparently the secret is to let the brew ferment longer, thereby leaving no residual sugars. The beer is pale golden with a limited head. Expectedly dry without much bitterness. An unusual deal. 021199
Bottle. Yellow colour with no head. Sweet malty aroma and thin taste. Light body and a watery light dry finish. Glad iÂ´m not on a diat.
Very pale golden colour. Small white head. Grainy nose. This reminds me of any american standard....Very light bodied, grainy tasting, nothing special, very nasty...
I liked this beer very much when I lived in Leipzig. Nice to drink on a cold day particularly. However, it is beer that grows on you and maybe the first taste is not so wonderful to some palates.
It smells sweet, malty, a bit alcoholic. The taste is darkamlty, malty, a bit bitter. In the aftertaste a bit more bitter. OK 9/9/9/10/9/9
Golden clear beer with a tanned head. Sweet malty aroma and flavor with grassy hoppt notes.

Sorry for the german rating, but this is a lousy rating from my "newbie" time (2007-2009), and itâ€™s not worth of being translated. I just added it for the statistics, and to complete my backlog! Ins Glas ergieÃŸt sich ein amberfarbenes Bier. Die Krone ist halbhoch, flacht aber sehr schnell ab. Der Geruch ist malzig wÃ¼rzig, der Antrunk erfolgt stramm malzig und stark wÃ¼rzig, eine leichte SÃ¼ÃŸmalznote tut sich hinzu. Der Abgang ist wiederum sehr stark und langgezogen wÃ¼rzig, die Mitte wird minimal alkoholisch.

Der wÃ¼rzig-sÃ¼ÃŸe Antrunk erscheint mild, aber keinesfalls wÃ¤ssrig. Zum Mittelteil wird das Bier wÃ¼rziger und krÃ¤ftiger und ist nun weder besonders mild noch besonders wÃ¼rzig. Hier wird das Bier etwas herber, was im Nachgeschmack schnell stÃ¤rker wird und dazu fÃ¼hrt, dass andere Aromen zum Teil darunter begraben werden. Im Nachgeschmack abermals wÃ¼rziger und deutlich herb. Test vom 27.11.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche Noten: 10,10,10,11,8,10 - 10,05

Bottle from Kappldav123, thanks! I remember enjoying this bock from tap in 1993 or so in the brewery. And now? Pale amber color. Malty, slightly buttery aroma with a hint of toffee. Malty flavor, alcoholic and sweet, with hints of toffee. Bready somewhat flowery finish..

Bottled. A golden beer with a white head. The aroma has notes of malt and fruit as well as lighter notes of bread and caramel. The flavor is sweet with notes of caramel, bread, and malt, leading to a lightly bitter and rather sweet finish, where the alcohol comes out and tickles the palate. Thanks yespr for sharing.

Bottle 50cl. Clear light orange color with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, roasted notes. Flavor is moderate sweet and bitter with a average to long duration, flavor is has a peppery finish. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. (220808)
(Bottle 50 cl) Courtesy of yespr. Clear golden with an off-white head. Clean and malty aroma. Good solid clean malt base. Dry and lightly hoppy finish. A clean and straight Bock. 220808

Bottle, shared by yespr. It pours a clear, golden body with a small white head. Burnt plastic like aroma with cooked vegetables. Malty aromas too, and a little fruityness. The flavor is much the same, with the unwanted burnt plastic and notes of cooked vegetables. Pale malt and some fruityness too. The finish has some bitterness added to the initial flavors. Medium to full body. Not a very pleasant bock. (080822)

Malziger und mittelwÃ¼rziger Antrunk. Im Mittelteil rÃ¶stiger, die WÃ¼rze weicht etwas, das Bier wird weicher, es kommt eine leichte Herbe hinzu. Im Hintergrund ist das Bier dagegen milder, wie Erzengel bereits erkannt hat fehlt es etwas am KÃ¶rper. Im Abgang etwas hopfiger, gleichzeitig auch bitterer werdend. Das Bier bleibt dabei im GroÃŸen und Ganzen weich und ist so sehr sÃ¼ffig. Durchaus ein leckeres Bier! Danke an kappldav123 fÃ¼r das Bier. Test vom 26.2.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche Noten: 12,11,11,12,9,11 - 11,15
The bottle looks good, the beer in the glass also. Starts spicy and dry, very zippy. Well balanced, spicy finish, very drinkable. Good festbier!

Deep clear gold; good white fine head, leaving fine lace. Piney nose, rich malts, mostly light but some Caramalt too it would seem. And a bit of the drains. Dry, bready taste - not specifically dark German bread, rather fresh, white bread. Alcohol very obvious for rather middled ABV, also in the taste, giving it a grain-spirit character. Fleetingly bitter impression. Dry, alcoholburn; medium bodied. Aftertaste is again liqueurish; sweet & alcohol. A beer that overshoots its ABV and category by far. Very difficult one to classify - or to appreciate fully.
Bottled. Golden with an ok head. Sourish aroma with some maltiness. A papery mouthfeel with some bitterness.
Bottled. Golden. Soapy flavour but there is some maltiness at least. Just slightly bitter.

Bottled. Light orange golden colour. Fine, sudsy, white head that dissipates to just remnants. Cheep corn syrup aroma. Medium to low bitterness and medium length on the palate. Didn't really detect the spicyness romoured to be in this one.

i thought this would taste something inbetween the pils and the bock and they were both drinkable but this wasnÂ´t. maybe i was supposed to let it mature until christmas day but in my mad rush to taste every beer brewed in leipzig that wasnÂ´t going to happen

The Christmas ale in this commissioned series, and though it is apparently claimed that this is brewed to an original recipe, it was just an alias of Affligem NoÃ«l when it was first launched in 2003. Bronze coloured beer with off-white, thick and frothy head, sweetish with spicy notes (coriander), caramelly malts, sourish accent, candi syrup touch, some warming alcohol in the finish. Easily the best of the Florivals - but still not convinced this is an original recipe nowadays!

Sehr voller, sÃ¼ÃŸer Duft - aber irgendwie komisch, erinnert an Curry. Der Antrunk ist sÃ¼ffig-sÃ¼ÃŸ. Im Hauptteil macht sich ein klebstoffartiger Geschmack breit, ziemlich unangenehm (schmeckt wie Uhu riecht). Im Nachgeschmack wird das Ganze etwas hefig-mild, der komische Geschmack verfliegt ziemlich schnell. Auf der Zunge bleibt eine muffig-sÃ¼ÃŸliche Malznote zurÃ¼ck. Ein sehr sehr merkwÃ¼rdiges und schon ziemlich ekliges Bier. Es ist sehr komplex, aber hat was von flÃ¼ssigem Klebstoff... 4/7/7/4

Bottle Pours dark brown Rather small white head Sweet smell Good carbo Dark malts , sweetness ( natural sweetness ) , some xhocolate , some malts . Nice , but nothing to seek out. Nice to try nevertheless

#731 Dunkelbraun und leicht trÃ¼b im Glas. Der cremige Schaum ist leicht brÃ¤unlich. SchÃ¶nes aleartiges Aroma nach rÃ¶stigem Malz. Im Antrunk dann hefig-malzig. Kaum sÃ¤uerlich, eher trockene TÃ¶ne, die bitter enden. Leider ist die Alkoholnote stetig vorhanden und drÃ¼ckt auf die SÃ¼ffigkeit. Weniger Alk wÃ¤re hier zweifelsohne mehr gewesen. Die Flasche selbst ist mir zu kitschig geraten, aber noch akzeptabel fÃ¼r die kalte Jahreszeit. Insgesamt kein wirklich gelungenes Weihnachtsbier! Test vom 20.10.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche Noten: 9,10,8,9,8,9 - 8,95

Dunkel-trÃ¼bes Bier mit hefig-fruchtigem Geruch, wobei sich auch die 9% zu Worte melden. Sehr malziger Geschmack mit Ananas-Aromen; Lack-artig. Es folgt ein alkohollastiger Abgang; kratzig. Etwas liebloses Bier, hauptsÃ¤chlich malzig und schwer. Der hohe Alkoholgehalt ist sehr dominant. Nicht der Renner.Test vom 28.11.2006, Gebinde: Glasflasche

Malzig-herber Geruch. Prickelnder, schwer malziger Antrunk, der durch den Alkoholeinfluss sehr schwer wirkt. Auch im Mittelteil bleibt das Bier schwerfÃ¤llig, der Alkoholeinfluss ist deutlich erkennbar. Eine herb-saure Note mischt sich hier ein, wirkt aber unpassend neben dem schwerfÃ¤lligen Aroma. Im Nachgeschmack wird ads Bier etwas saurer, die Malzigkeit trockener. Kein Highlight! Test vom 24.9.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche Noten: 8,9,7,8,9,8 - 8,05
33cl bottle. Pours amber with a thick beige head. Dried dates and figs on the nose, sweet and slightly bready. Full bodied, malty and spicey with a hoppy faintly peppery aftertaste.
Bottle bought at Delhaize in Dalhem, Belgium. A nice brown body with beige head. Sweet and spicy. Syrupy with dark flavours of berries and honey. Very nice for the holidays.
33cl, from Delhaize Gent, complex brew, not balanced, cloudy, small head, nice Winter brew
Bottle bought at Delhaize in Dalhem, Belgium. A nice brown body with beige head. Sweet and spicy. Syrupy with dark flavours of berries and honey. Very nice for the holidays.

A Christmas beer for the "cool" ice beer generation - oh my God! Well, it''s probably not exactly an ice beer, just the average bland lager with just a little more flavour to pretend it''s a "Xmas" beer. Pathetic! The ice beer generation will probably stick to ice beer or pils for Christmas anyhow, so why bother? 0,5 liter can in white and silver, commercial description in English only, even though the beer is sold primarily (or solely?) in Norway. Wow - cooool! - (can''t believe there are assholes who actually think so!) Low head, golden colour, just a faint trace of spice (cardamom?) in the flavour. Aftertaste is weak but not foul, at least they have had the decency to add some hops to the stuff.
on tap-pours a white ring for a head and copper color. Aroma is medium malt-some sweet, fruity. Taste is medium malt-caramel/peat/chocolate, some earthy/copper hops.
GABF. Pours a flat yellow. Aroma doesnâ€™t exist. Flavor is a club soda with alcohol. Palate is water. Yuck.
Clear brown. Toasty, whiskey aroma. Peppery. bready flavor. Smooth aftertaste, but ultimately kind of bland.
Poured amber with a slight head. Again, these beers have little aroma and this one has none. Light on the malt, light on the hops, very light on flavor. Disappointing.
This dark beer has a great stout Aroma thick full flavor and strong. Well done. Enjoyed it a lot ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Mellow Roasted flavors, and a full bodied mouthfeel. This could stand to be a little more assertive, though. Very little aftertaste.

column4: Granville Island Brewing (Six Pints - Molson Coors)
column5: I really like this beer and have added it to my top listed beers. Nice thick rich full taste with a sweet honey aftertaste. You can only have a few of these before the sweetness becomes too much.

column4: Granville Island Brewing (Six Pints - Molson Coors)
column5: Bought a few cases when I moved to Vancouver. Almost no head, several bottles were almost flat. Tasted better than most GIB brews, but thatâ€™s not saying much. Odd aftertaste, almost like licorice and cloves.

column4: Granville Island Brewing (Six Pints - Molson Coors)
column5: Another seasonal release from Granville Island, I really like this beer. The colour is a dark, ruby red with an off-white head. The aroma and taste are both quite good, with a slight sweetness imparted by the cherries at the end, without being syrupy.

column4: Granville Island Brewing (Six Pints - Molson Coors)
column5: Strong clove, cinnamon, and nutmeg as well as ginger in the spicy aroma. Deep red, bing cherry or garnet color. Some cherry in the aroma too. Enters clean but bursts with spicy flavors. Reminiscent of some tripels. The mouthfeel could be a lot smoother. Some sour notes in the rich and fruity aftertaste. Warming and a little like brandy. This beer has changed in different vintages. The 2003 was exceptional, and I give extra points because that incarnation of the Christmas Ale was memorable.

column4: Granville Island Brewing (Six Pints - Molson Coors)
column5: On opening and pour:a beautiful dark cherry colour with a small tan/red hued head.the smell is malt and plums. On taste: you would never know this beer is 8% Starts sweet and sherry like,but quicky goâ€™es to christmas cake and plum.The cherrys come out in the middle and finish,this beer is not,but,almost too sweet.Just enough hops to kill the sweetness. Good body and nice to drink,a real fine beer from granville island

column4: Granville Island Brewing (Six Pints - Molson Coors)
column5: A spicy cranberry nutmeg nose and nice balanced hop and malt sweet/spicy taste and a clean spicy finish, very much reminds me of Christmas.

column4: Granville Island Brewing (Six Pints - Molson Coors)
column5: 2003 edition Dark copper red colour with very little light pink head that rapidly disappears. Aroma of dark malt, molasses, and cherries. Very strong malt flavour up front, with a slight taste of cherries on the finish. Feels very rich in the mouth, but finish is cloyingly sweet. Okay for warming up after being out in the cold, but Iâ€™ve definately had better. I was expecting more cherry character.

column4: Granville Island Brewing (Six Pints - Molson Coors)
column5: 03 bottle:Dark ruby red,large light pink head.Cherry cider & light alcohol nose.Sweet malt and cherry flavor with Belgian yeasty overtones and light alcohol heat.

column4: Granville Island Brewing (Six Pints - Molson Coors)
column5: excellent aroma and flavour. good and christmasy; came with a nice glass too!

column4: Granville Island Brewing (Six Pints - Molson Coors)
column5: 2002: Dark amber in color with a nice head. Tons of spice aroma -nutmeg, cloves, and orange. Reminds of a holiday ham. Not too sweet though. Malt character limiting. A decent offering. 2003: Had his one at a holiday party (not the best tasting environment). Seemed a lot different (better) from the 2002. Sweet, malty, hints of tart cherries and belgian yeast all mixed-up.
(Can 50 cl) Quite fully golden beer with a handsome, tall head. Malty, slightly sweet with a decent body. Not a bad lager really. 190303
Golden colour. Small white head. Unclean vegetable aroma. Flavour of corn, malt and brocoli. Bland finish. Why do Pripps brew this?. Oh. Pripps makes crappy beers.
Canned. Golden coloured with brief head. Corn flake aroma. Sweet and unclean with notes of vegetables. Brrr...
Golden colour. Medium head. Grainy aroma with just a hint of hops. Thin, watery, unbalanced flavour. Late, unpleasant, sour bitterness.

Bottled 330ml (from Kirkenes) Clear amber colour, small off-white head. Caramel, a bit metallic maltyness in the nose. Light to medium-bodied. Caramel but not so sweet more on a bit metallic and nutty malty side. Some bitterness. Ordinary Scandinavian industrial Xmas beer. Tolerable.
0,33l bottle from Joker, Skibotn. Pours clear chestnut with a low head. Aroma is sweet malts. Flavor is sweet nutty malts. Drinkable.
Bottle 33 cl. Amber clear with a minimal white head. Aroma of malt with light hops and caramel sense. Bitter taste with a short malt END.

(Flasche) Es hat eine hellbraune bis bernsteinerne Farbe, ist filtriert mit einer fast weiÃŸen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma hat was von zartbitter, Trockenpflaume und Kernseife. Der Geschmack ist schlank, minimal alkoholisch, dumpf mit Zartbitter.
Flaske pÃ¥ Ã˜lhallen pÃ¥ juleÃ¸lansering. Aroma malt, noe krydder. Utseende klar gylden med hvitt skum. Smak som en pils med noe krydder. Kjedelige greier med lite julestemning.

First beer of 2016, Äakujem AniÄka. Pours in clear copper body with low white-off head. Aroma has high caramel nutty malty character, no hop aroma present, little bit iron-like notes in the background. Taste has medium to high caramel malty sweetness with high bitterness kick right after, earthy, clean fermentation profile. Palate leans towards the sweetness. Body is medium, little bit slick with high carbonation.

Light amber with a white head - Malt and some hops in the aroma - Malt body with some hints of caramel and there is olso some hops in the back with some bitterness - The malts goes into the finish - This was ok
Fonefan 201214. Deep golden colour with an off-white head. Aroma is fruit, malt, caramel, butter. Flavour is fruit, malt, hop, caramel, toffee, grass. Medium body. Ordinary beer.

Bottle 330ml. [ As Mack Julespesial ]. Clear medium amber to orange color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting to diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, bread, caramel, spicy notes. Flavour is moderate sweet with a average duration, caramel, bread, spicy notes. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20141220]

Bottle. Medium high fluffy and lasting white head. Clear good looking dark amber body. Malt dominated aroma with a mild shot of spices. Highly carbonated dry malt hops caramel fruity flavor with a short finish.
Slight fruity (strawberry) aroma. Only a hint of smokiness, fruit flavors (pear, strawberry). Bland and disappointing beer, the promised whiskey malt flavor lacks almost completely.
Cloudy amber, tall off-white head. Nose: toast, caramel, banana, light clove, dried fruit. Similar taste. Very light body. Quite pleasant but too thin on palate.

50 cl. bottle @ home, served in a teku glass. Due date: 13/11/2018. Aroma: not very intense aromas of spices, toasted malts, fruits. Very subtle hints of banana and dark dried fruits like prunes and raisins. Appearance: dark gold to brown color with off-white to beige head made of tiny to small sized bubbles. Very high head thickness with high to very high retention and low Brussels' lacing. Medium haziness. Taste: low to medium sweetness, low bitterness, low sourness. Not very intense flavors of toasted malts, fruits, dark dried fruits. Very subtle hints of caramel and banana. Quite well balanced but lacking flavors and aromas. Palate: low to medium body, watery texture, high carbonation, not very long slightly sweet finish with low to medium sweetness and the same aforementioned flavors. Alcohol is not noticeable (no alcohol sweetness, no mouth or throat warming). Astringency. Overall: good appearance, not very intense aromas nor flavors: toasted malts, fruits and hints of dark dried fruits. Flavors and aromas are too weak. It would be much better with more powerful flavors, less watery texture and a little more body. Not the best representation of the style.

Color marrÃ³n embarrado, perfecta espuma con excelente retenciÃ³n. Aroma y gusto en la misma linea, trigo tostado, caramelo y plÃ¡tano. Cuerpo denso. En la linea del estilo, no aporta mucho mÃ¡s, es gustosa, si eres fan del estilo es una mÃ¡s, si se te hacen pesadas las cervezas de trigo compartela porque es medio litro con cuchillo y tenedor.
Botella 0,5l Color marron,espuma espectacular,fina, alta,blanca,resistente.Aroma cereales,trigo,especias,platano,frutal.Sabor cereales,especias,platano,frutal,acidez ligero,un toque de amargor
Botella @Hipercor, Oviedo. 02/09/17 BD: 19/10/18. B Color Ã¡mbar oscuro, corona de espuma blanca, aromas tostados y caramelo, sabor caramelo con notas dulces, cuerpo sedoso, dulzor excesivo.
Pours a medium caramel brown with an off white head the disapates quickly. Nice aroma of light caramel and malts. Decent flavor and very enjoyable and refreshing but nothing special.

500 MML bottle tasted on the 08/03/2017. Light hazy brown colour with a medium to huge beige foamy head. Aroma of grains, lots of yeast and some banana. Taste is yeast with some caramel and medium bread finish. Light watery finish. Next one please!
espuma excesiva,demasiadas proteÃ­nas? color en lÃ­nea de una Daniel el aroma de papilla de frutas y alguna especial el sabor algo empalagoso aunque bien carbonatada
Botella de 50cl de Hipercor. Cobrizo oscuro y leve aroma a plÃ¡tano. Poco cuerpo, como aguada. Final poco amargo. Una cerveza aburrida
Aromas leve a plÃ¡tano y torrefacto Buen aspecto con espuma leve En boca plÃ¡tano y torrefacto suave ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0.3 l on tap at â€™Celonaâ€™. Clear, dark brownish amber with a medium large, frothy, slowly diminishing, off-white head. Sweetish, malty and quite fruity aroma of caramel, dried fruits and some nuts. Sweetish-malty, quite fruity and a little roasty taste of caramel, dried fruits, nuts and a touch of chocolate, followed by a short, moderately bitter, a little roasty and slightly metallic finish. Medium body, slightly effervescent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Not bad!
On tap at La cervecita. Copper colour with white head. Malt, caramel aroma. Sweet, malt, caramel taste, slightly bitter. Medium body.

On tap in Sauerland. Hotel Schweinsberg. Nice dark brownish colour with a firm beige head. Malty aroma with caramellised sugar. Sweet,bready taste with slight bitterness. Quite nice. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This is the worst altbeer Iâ€™ve tasted ever. The beer had an acid streak which is totally against the altbeer style.
