Pours brown with virtually no head. Aroma is rich malts with toffee and prunes. Flavor is estery with fruits and mild smoky character. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark brown pour, white head. Nice light body with a crisp sweet brown sugar flavor. Could have a few of these.
Chocolate-heavy brown, English and semisweet, but also light and watery, without much of a finish. Yeasty fade with the slightest of hoppy bitterness. Skippable.

Pours chocolate brown with a fair amount of light brown foam. The aroma is caramel and a little bit of spice and grassy hops. The flavor is caramel up front, and closes with a very mellow, slightly sweet malt. Not terrible, not life changing.
Golden hue. Bitter start which moves more sour towards the halfway mark. Around a medium carbonation, accentuates the following sour taste leaving a warmth behind. Fine for the price.

Bottle at Beerdock Leek. Pours a clear golden colour with a medium white head. Aroma of grain, some bready malt, honey, a hint of veg and subtle floral hops. Taste of grain, bready malts, slight honey, a hint of veg and subtle grassy, floral hops. Medium bodied and moderate carbonation. A soft, dry, grassy, floral hop bitterness in the finish. Isnâ€™t a festive beer, but for a strong German lager, itâ€™s ok. Hoppy.

A strong smell of bread, cookies and malt. The small white fizzy head disappears fast, the body is pale orange. A strong malty taste, light sweet. The body is medium strong, a little bit oily with a soft carbonation.

Bottle. Archer Road Beer Stop, Sheffield. Pin bright gold. Frothy, lasting, white head. Nose is a bit metallic with some damp grain and leafy hop. Taste is grainy sweet. Not much else, really. Decent mouthfeel. A little oily. Dries a little on the finish. Ok at best.

Bottle. Gold clear with head and lace. Grassy aroma with a hint of crackery malts and herbs and spice. Medium sweet honey crackery malts with grassy cereal and fairly spicy finish. Medium light body fine carbo lingering spice. Pretty standard plus some extra spice. Nothign wrong with it, but nothing special.
Vielen Dank an Martin fÃ¼r diese Flasche! The beer starts smooth and fresh. A bit grainy with not too much depth. Round and easy to drink with grainy hints in the aftertaste.
Ins Glas ergieÃŸt sich ein goldgelbes Bier mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch malzig wÃ¼rzig, Geschmack angenehm malzig wÃ¼rzig mit ganz minimaler Bitterkeit.

0,5 l bottle. BB 24. Apr 13 Another boring Xmas Beer. caramel, bread, cereal, citrus, leaves, golden, clear, frothy, white foam, medium sweetness, medium sourness, medium body, oily feel, average carbonation,
Pours yellow with a thin white head. Smells of caramel and light citrus. Tastes of caramel and earthy with a hint of bitterness.

1) 2010. Bottle, Beers of Advent day 23. Bright fizzing gold with a low white head. Smells like an unwashed dog, with background coinage, envelope and some salvaging hay and honey. Taste is a mixed bag with notes of hay, cooked vegetables and alcohol, leading to a cream and honey linger. Some metal and unpleasant, back of the throat bitterness in the aftertaste. Not convincing.535312 2) 2017. Brilliant slick necked lager gold. Aroma of grass and shrub sap, honey, cherry blossom. Thick sweet and nuanced with sap, honey, macaroons and retronasal buttered white toast. Solid fragranced lager. 737314
Dark brown to black with a nice tan head. Aroma of roast, chocolate, and oats. Moderate roast in the flavor profile is accompanied by sweet oats and chocolate. Seemed a little too carbonated.

Pitch black pour with a wispy tan head. This brew has that acidic tang that some of the November Bells have. Otherwise nice roasted malt profile with some bitterness.Medium/thin body.Not alot to it to tell you the truth.

column1: Sperber BrÃ¤u Herzog Christian August Weisse
column5: 500ml Bottle - Hazy golden with a white head. Banana, lemon and bubblegum in the aroma. Tangy and sweet taste with foam bananas, lemon and a hint of fudge.

column1: Sperber BrÃ¤u Herzog Christian August Weisse
column5: The taste is ok, but could be better. Nice color. Nothing else worth mentioning.

column1: Sperber BrÃ¤u Herzog Christian August Weisse
column5: Ins Glas ergieÃŸt sich ein trÃ¼bes goldenes Bier mit schÃ¶ner Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr hefig fruchtig, bananig, wÃ¼rzig. Geschmack stark hefig fruchtig, minimale WÃ¼rze.

column1: Sperber BrÃ¤u Herzog Christian August Weisse
column5: Itâ€™s unclear dark golden with a huge, creamy head. The aroma has notes of yeast, fruit, light banana and wheat and a very light hint of alcohol. The sweet flavor has notes of yeast, fruits, light banana, wheat and a touch of alcohol, and the finish is slightly spicy. Not as powerful as I think a Weizen Bock should be in body and flavor!

column1: Sperber BrÃ¤u Herzog Christian August Weisse
column5: 50cl bierpost. Typical banana-clove brick of a Weizenbock that could have turned out more drinkable if not for that cloying aspartam sweetness. Pleasant notes of bubblegum and citrus dragged down by soggy, tired wheat. Another example of the style that tells you: this will be your last (if tackling those 50cl alone) without delivering the matching full flavour finale.

column1: Sperber BrÃ¤u Herzog Christian August Weisse
column5: Bottle from Mein-Biershop.de. Hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, wheaty, yeasty and fruity. Flavor is medium sweet and light bitter. Dry and light bitter finish with a little warming alcohol. 100513

column1: Sperber BrÃ¤u Herzog Christian August Weisse
column5: Bottled 500ml (MBS, BB 07/2012) Hazy orange-yellow color, small white head. Sticky glueish aroma, overriped Granny Smith apple. Medium-bodied, active carbonation. Flavor is also green apple fruity mixed with more standard banana flavors. Short finish. A bit strange. Maybe because it is probably 11 months old bottle?

column1: Sperber BrÃ¤u Herzog Christian August Weisse
column5: 500 ml bottle. Pours a hazy yellow colour with a white head. Aroma of strong citrusy fruits, sweet honey and wheat. Flavour of strong citrusy fruits again, honey, wheat, banana and caramel. Medium bodied, thick mouthfeel and soft carbonation. Warming alcohol finish with strong fruitiness. Tasty.

column1: Sperber BrÃ¤u Herzog Christian August Weisse
column5: 500ml bottle. Hazy orangey-golden colour with huge creamy white head. Fruity and yeasty aroma with a cautious spicy note. Smooth palate, sweet taste finds a citrus complement. Doesnâ€™t exhaust the full potential of the style.

column1: Sperber BrÃ¤u Herzog Christian August Weisse
column5: Bottle from mein-biershop.de. Hazy orange golden color with huge stable white head towering over my glass. Aroma of wheat, banana, caramel, yeast. Taste, banana, wheat, yeast, lemon, light bitterness in background. Dry bittersweet finish. Good Weizenbock.

Bottle 33cl. @home poured into a pilsner glass. Clear pale golden, fair frothy white head, good retention; aroma sweet malts, grainy, vegetables, hay; taste medium sweet and bitter, malty, grainy, bit metallic, peppery notes; grainy sweetbitter aftertaste, paper, lingering peppery notes; medium body, oily texture; almost decent pilsner.
33cl bottle. Pours clear golden colour with a small good lasting white head. Aroma of mild metallic hops, straw. Taste of mild hops, straw, pale malt, soft bitterness in the aftertaste!
Pours a clear golden color with a fine white head. Caramel malty, herbal hoppy and wort-ish malty aroma and flavor. M
0,5l Flasche. Hellgelbes Pils mit kleiner Schaumkrone. Riecht leicht malzig, im Geschmack auch leicht malzig, angenehm gehopft.
* Old rating, 0,5l crown-top bottle, best before 08.07.10. Deutlich herber und trockener als das BÃ¼gel-Pils. Auch nicht sonderlich tief gehend, aber deutlich herber.

Bottle: Clear,pale golden to golden, small to medium-sized stable loose white head; simple papery-bitter nose with a subtle sweetish maltiness in the background; relatively dry bitter flavour, light bodied; lingering dry bitter finish. Boring, one-dimensional north-german Pilsener......
bottle, courtesy of pivnizub. Clear pale golden colour, mid-sized head. Hoppy nose. Shy malty background with hints of resiny-herbal hops.

Bottled 50cl. Courtesy of pivnizub. It pours a yellow beer with a nicely remaining white head. Reminiscence of honey throughout. DMS in the nose. Hayish malt profile. Good lacework. Subdued bitterness. Thanks a lot pivnizub!
Bottle. Pale golden, heavily carbonated, big white head. Citric and light sour hay aroma. Lightbodied, watery on the palate. Cookie-malt, low pH, herbal faltering hops, dry finish, hayish aftertaste.

(bottle) Clear, pale golden colour with a dense medium-sized foamy white head. The aroma is a bit anonymous: slightly sweet pale malty and shy biscuity nose with a tinge of herbal hops. Bitter-sweet flavour, light to medium bodied with a moderate carbonation. Dry (almost completely fermented/hochvergoren) pale malt character with subtle grainy spots and present herbal hops; moderately bitter hoppy, slightly chalky finish. Clean and decent German Pils. 28.I.10

Orange golden with big white head; aroma is banana, soft phenolic, a little grainy; taste is very fruity, medium sweet and slightly tart, banana, gentle grainy, lingering sweet finish; creamy texture with medium to high carbonation

Very nice rich lather. Light aroma of malt and classic aroma of grain or bread. Good malty flavor with a little more richness than expected for the type. It is perhaps due to the applied spelled malt, well it tastes anyway. A little taste of light rye bread can be suggested until a marked fruit flavors leading to a gentle hop bitterness. It is a little atypical wheat beer, but quite surprising and tasty for the type.
pour cloudy and pale with a fine White head light banana aroma, taste light sweet light bitter, average carbonation, light to medium bodied. soft bitter finish
Bottle, as Ã˜kologisk dansk Ã˜L Hvede. Hazy golden pour with a generous head. Bananas, spices, yeast, grains and some vanilla.
Good looking weiisbier with good aroma, but doesn't taste of that much. But overall a recommendable beer.

Bottle, 33 cl: Clody yellow beer with a frothy but fast disappearing white head. Sweeet fruity light malty aroma, that hasnâ€™t really got the the fruity esters found you would expect from a German Hefe. The taste is much too sweet, syrupy-sweet, not very wheaty. This beer does no harm, I just wish it would do something good, but itâ€™s too simple and too soft, in texture as in carbonation, even to be considered as a plain thirstquencher.

[9/27/11] Mahleket Hanikot Shotrim â€™11 tour. Bottle at 1000fryd in Aalborg. 5%. Hazy golden with a big white head. Aroma of wheat, yeast, spices and some citrus notes. Sweetish spicy flavor with some fruitiness and yeast. Light-bodied with lively carbonation.
Hazy orange color with small head. Aroma is sweet.Good weissbier flavor with banana notes. Good summer beer.
Bottle. Ecological. Haze yellow. Faint floral dough aromas. Fresh crisp citrus flavours. A little sour finish. God summerbrew.

Cloudy orange yellow with a big lasting white head. Aroma is sweet, light wheaty, banana, yeasty and light cloves. Flavor is rather sweet and light acidic. Sweet finish. Soft and smooth. Too sweet and too much banana. Lacks balance. 200211
Commissioned for De Hopduvel in Ghent, with off-white, thick, sticky head and peach blonde colour, misty. Fruity, malt sweet taste, yeasty, rather bland and boring, mild hoppy finish.

Bottle. Unclear medium orange color with a large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is light malty, toasted, tart fruity, moderate yeasty, notes of sour milk - butter. Flavor is moderate sweet and bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium to light, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. (100408)

Bottle, bought @ Hopduvel. Hazy, darkgolden to orange color with large, foamy head. Aroma fuits, yeast; malts. Medium body. Taste fruits, sweet; alcoholic, regular tripel taste, malts, bitterness, little spice. Good tripel.

Rather aged sample Fully hazy, U.F.O.-ridden, greey-orange beer, overly carbonated with a very small, dirty-yellow head. Sweet-sourish, pickles, nettles or other unwanted greenery. Very nutty, sweet-old overoxydized malt notes. Despite the vociferous carbonation, the spirit of the beer is gone. A beer that didnâ€™t stand up to its age. If I find it fresh again, it will mean a new rating. But I fear this is getting characteristic for VS beers...

(Bottled, from De Hopduvel shop, "New recipe") Hazy, orange-amber color with a very large, foamy and quite tight head. Yeasty pear-vanilla aroma with honeyish malt and hints of cardboard. Neutral, honey-fruity flavor with a smooth, sweetish finish. Some alcohol present, yet quite tolerable for the ABV. Medium-bodied, slightly foamy but balanced palate. Very drinkable. A good example of a quality tripel with the right balance, but without the complexity to make it stand out from the crowd.
Yeasty vanilla nose, pale creal orange color, low lathery head. Orangy malt, corriander and apricots. Peppery end. Fizzy and tingly texture. Very sweet.
Very light orange color, small disappering head. Ripe banana and yeast nose. Medium sweet banana taste - maybe slightly an bitter orange touch. Very fizzy carbonation - crisp.

Dirty golden-blond beer, hazy and with a very creamy off white head. Aroma is fruit and reminds me to the yeasty pancake dough. It has touche of sweet ripe pears and butter cake. There are a view traces of soft spices but no bitterness of hops. The taste is very much like the smell. It is also very fruity, Silght sour dough like, sweet malty, and milk beady. In the afthertaste there is a faint bitter accent that brings a little crisp to the fruitcake like softness.

(Bottle 33 cl) Hazy, dark golden beer with a huge, frothy head and lots of carbonation. Fresh, fruity nose and lots of malt in the flavour. Light sweetness and a limited bitterness. Not at all a bad brew - this is nice. 040798
Spicy, light citrus malty aroma. Golden color, large white head, good lace. Lots of bubbles, little spicy, sweet, citrus, heavy alcohol presence. Short burning finish. Great Triple.

Geproefd tijdens Brugs Bierfestival editie 2009. Helder blond, met kleinere witte kraag. Aroma: moutig, tikje fruit, lichtjes kruidig. Licht tot bijna medium body. Smaak: zoetje, moutig, en kleinere hopbitterheid.

September 5, 2015. On tap at Moeder Lambic Original. Deep golden with a medium sized white head. Aroma is sweet grainy, some apricots, lemon and almond. Taste is light sweet with fruity citrus notes, peach and bread, very light bitterness with light spicy and grassy notes, light dry finish. Medium bodied, soft to average carbonation.
Bottle 33cl / Botella 33cl. @ Cerveceria Internacional, Sevilla, EspaÃ±a. A: Hazy golden / Dorado turbio. T/S: Yeast, malt, fruity / Levadura, malta, afrutado.
Botella de 33 cl de el c. Ingles tomada por ultima vez en junio de 2001. con fecha de cons pref para 07-11-2002. Belga algo flojilla sin muchos recuerdos de interÃ©s. Cuerpo medio de 6 vol. Regular.

A cloudy, brownish-orange pour with a white head. The slightly sour aroma has a fruity quality. The medium body has a sharp, somewhat oily texture with lively carbonation. The taste is tart with a dry finish.

Bottle. Hazy, light gold body. below a fizzy, white head, slowly diminishing. Aroma of lemon. toasted grain, flowers, borwn sugar and slight viengary aroma. The flavor is moderately sweet and lightly bitter. It finishes lightly sweet and moderately bitter and lightly to moderaely acidic. Tart. Thin to medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation. The aroma is better than the flavor which is watery bitterness, but there is not a lot to draw attention to itself in either. Still, not a drain pour. Just OK.

Rotten Apple tasting. Gold with a white head. A light and fruity aroma with some malt. Flavor is sweet fruit with a pleasant spice. A nice soft zest. This is so easy to drink and feels smooth in the mouth. Enjoyable and sessionable.

Best by date on bottle is 4/11/2005. Pours golden orange with a snow white head. The aroma is very yeasty, rich malt shows through, but its also definitely showing its age. There is an odd fruitiness and some dried bananas. Medium body with fairly soft carbonation. The flavor starts like the aroma, but on the dry side with quite a bit of phenolic spice. The finish has a lot of the fruitiness and sour traits. For the age this was pretty decent.

The aroma was rich with honey, dark fermented fruit and caramel/molasses notes. The beer poured a cloudy golden copper color with a lot of sediment and thin lasting head. The flavor was slightly yeasty and nice malt notes. The mouthfeel was light to medium bodied with a good amount of carbonation.

Golden with very much sediment and a huge, nice and creamy head. The aroma is fruity with notes of yeast, and the same goes for the flavour, that also has sweetness and a light citrussy bitternes and is a bit dry.

24th July 2019, Shrewsbury CAMRA Beer Festival in St Mary's Church. Cask. Golden pour, weak white head. Light aroma of maltiness and woody hops. Taste is also light malts, but with a citrus like leaning from the hop content, decent enough.

Cask at PoW, Farnborough. Floral aroma, which had to be strained for. Copper. Very thin bubbly white head. Medium bitter with a core of eggy malt. The former was initially most evident but the latter then gains prominence. Light-medium bodied. Slick. Flat carbonation. Long astringent finish. Alright gold undone by the eggyness.

Sample@GBBF2018, London, with the MalmÃ¶ crew - pours golden yellow with a white head. Sweet pale bready malty, light doughy yeast, with some citrus fruity notes, hay, straw, medium to light body, fruity and grassy hoppy finish.
Cask at GBBF. Pours clear golden with a white head. Aroma of malt with fruit. Bittersweet taste and finish.
Cask at GBBF 2018. Clear golden. Bready, fruity, floral hops. Dry, medium bitterness.
Pours a clear gold colour with a small frothy white head. Aroma is light biscuity malt, straw and lemon. A moderately sweet buttery malt taste, some citrus flavours and a decent hop bitterness.

Hand-pulled cask ale, half pint, outside at Dragon Inn, Worcester. Misty warm golden body, filmy layer, crocheted lacing. Ripe, sweet fruity aromas. Dried fruity flavours, jam-like, moments of lactose sweetness. Dry ending, lightly bittersweet. Satisfying. (Sunday pub crawl with TheCellarer and Snegurochka 08.07.2018).
Cask at the Bear, Stratford upon Avon. Pours gold with a large head. Aroma is straw and lemon. Taste has straw throughout with some light lemon on the finish.

(Cask at Akkurat, Stockholm, 11 May 2018) Golden colour with frothy, white head. Fruity, hoppy nose with notes of citrus, lemon, grass and biscuits. Malty, hoppy taste with bread, citrus, lemon peel, biscuity malt and a balanced citric bitterness in the finish. Light body, with a slight sweetness. Tasty and refreshing. Quite nice.
Draft - pale yellow with medium white head - clear. Thin aroma, good mouthfeel. Decent tasting, bitter finish - ok beer.
* Old rating, 0,5l swing-top bottle, best before 10.02. Malzig-rÃ¶tliches Bier. Leicht sÃ¼ÃŸliche TÃ¶ne, rÃ¶stmalzig-herbe EinschÃ¼be. Interessant.
(Bottle 50 cl) Amber golden with a reddish hue and a fat, creamy head. Rather light-bodied and dry but still quite aromatic. Atypical German, but quite interesting. 150503

Rich bronze copper colour. Malty aroma and taste with some bitterness and a sour edge at the end. Lightish body. A perfectly reasonable beer, but nothing to rave about. 500ml bottle (not bottle conditioned) from beersofeurope.co.uk
Tan colour. This is a light, malty beer with a burnt bitterness. Thinner in character than others in the Bolten range of beers.
This one was one of my favorites back in the days. It could stand to have a bit more flavor, but it's still enjoyable and easily drinkable as it is.
Helle trÃ¼be Farbe. Die Schaumkrone ist klein uns auch schnell wieder verschwunden. Eher wÃ¤ssriger Geschmack. Sehr leicht. Erinnert an ein amerikanisches Lager. Im Angang minimal fruchtig.

Bottle from Vinibudin, Hevregerdi. Appearance - golden with steady carbonation. Nose - sweetcorn, light lemongrass. Taste - mainly sweetcorn, some citrus. Palate - light bodied, creamy-ish middle, dry finish. Overall - a solid citizen.
Can shared with Ashton McCobb. Pours clear golden with a thin white head. Cooked corn aromas. Little else. Taste is astringent malt, caramel, grainy.
Not great. Slightly moldy straw aroma like spring on the Icelandic lowlands. Golden pour with ok head. Finish has long cloying aftertaste. Bottle.

330ml bottle from local alco store in Reykjavik. Pours clear pale yellow with small white head and it doesnâ€™t last. Almost no aroma, some corny syrup. Taste is corny sweet, and thatâ€™s it. Very watery, low body, average carbo. Are you sure itâ€™s a beer?
Can 500 ml. Pale golden color with weak foam. Aroma: malte, slightly fruity and soap. Taste: of malt and grain, slightly spicy hops.
Quite soft and very thin. A littl of honey hints from he hops used. Cold when drinking it as a normal lager.
This is the lamest lager Iâ€™ve seen. It looks like a champagne, almost see-through. The aroma was bad but the taste is even worse. Like lime water. Bad.
Can. Common lager you could swap with sample from another brewery and you do not notice it. Not bad, not good. A bit less than average
Een weinig uitgesproken biertje. Karamel, tamelijk waterig, doordrinkbaar. Mist body
Aroma: soy sauce & malt Appearance: hazy brown/amber with a small head Flavour: light malt Palate: thin and finishes fast

Bottle at Pivoteka. Dark coppery-bronze body, creamy off white head. Light, slightly biscuity malty aroma. Clean, light, malty taste, maybe slightly caramelly, bit dull but okay, apart from a vague herbal hoppy touch near the finish, literally nothing else. Drinkable, dull.

0.33 l bottle from Pivoteka. Thanks Marko. Shared with him and Anna God. Clear amber, small off-white head. Very light malty. Light herbal touch. No character. Light flavours, malty. Watery. Dry finish with a metallic touch.
Fles. Een redelijk bier om door te drinken, maar qua smaak aan de slappe kant.

0.3 l bottle from â€™Wijnhuis Blerickâ€™, best before May 2018, apparently with a nieuw recipe according to the label (now with four different malts). Clear, dark reddish amber with a medium large, frothy, almost stable, off-white head. Sweetish-malty, slightly fruity and a bit grassy-spicy aroma of caramel, red fruits, toasted nuts and hints of straw. Quite sweet, just slightly bitter, malty, moderately fruity and a little grassy-spicy taste of caramel, raisins, red fruits, some toasted nuts and a touch of straw, followed by a short, moderately bitter, slightly grassy-spicy finish. Medium body, slightly creamy and moderately effervescent mouthfeel, average carbonation. Quite nice, decent Alt!

On keg at De Hems, Soho, London, UK. It pours amber with a small white head. Aroma is malts and caramel mostly. Taste is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Body is medium, texture is watery, carbonation is soft. Overall terrible for me...

Bottle. Amber with a quickly fading head and no lacing. Aroma of nuts and caramell. Taste is the same plus some toffee and herbs/spices. Aftertaste is a little bit sour and herbal hoppy. Medium carbonation. A bir watery. Itâ€™s alright but I felt the addition of spices/herbs wasnâ€™t necessary.

Draft at Heffer, Amsterdam. Near clear dark amber with an off white head. Aroma of yeast, plastercine, caramel, malt and some dark fruit notes. Flavour is light moderate sweet and bitter. Light to medium bodied with light carbonation.

WEEKNLBIER festival. Last beer. Clear dark ruby, tanned lacing foam head. Light caramel aroma, light sweet taste. Bit watery, but then what to expect after first drinking 9 strong beers. (Den Haag 201605)

Smooth toasted maltiness, dried fruits, caramel, candy sugar, some ripe fruitiness, some floral hops. Moderate to intense sweetness with light bitterness and some tartness. Decent, but feels bit offbalanced.
Fles 33cl thuis. Vlak. Verder prima te drinken. Niet zoet voor een dubbel, krachtig. (2-2012).

0.33 l bottle shared with ViÅ¡nja 666 and Pilot Goran. Thanks! Dark amber to brown, small off-white head. Cocoa nibs, chocolate mÃ¼sli, dried fruits, fruit jam. Sweet. Medium body, abrupt finish. Good in style, but not spectacular.
Donkerbruin bier met weinig schuim. Smaak is licht bitter en licht zoet met iets van drop, donkere chokolade en karamel. Ietwat kruidig. Gewoon goed.
Lekkere simpele dubbel, als je hem niet te koud drinkt zelfs iets chocolade..

Bruin bier met donker karmijnrode gloed en crÃ¨mekleurige schuimkraag. Geur: mout, brood, licht hoppig. Smaak: moutzoetig, karamel, wat toffee, zeer licht bitter. Medium volmondig, romig. Medium koolzuurprikkel.
Recht toe recht aan dubbel. niet heel complex, iets meer bitter dan de gemiddelde dubbel.

Bottle. Clear mid brown with a beige thatâ€™s soon less than a coat. Aroma of toasted grain, dried banana, prunes, mild spices. Medium bodied, moderate carbonation. Not much in the way of a yeast presence and it seems a bit bald without it - prunes, some caramel, cloves and then off to a quite bitter finish. But its near-brusqueness has its charm too.

Backlog. Synchronizing with notes and Untappd. Amazing sweet cookie aroma, some raisins, prunes, rum, milk with honey, spices - yummy! Unfortunately the aroma is a false advertisement and the taste is not that complex or intense.
Bottle a dark brown colored beer with a white head aroma malts caramel dried fruits and hops flavor malts spicy caramel fruits and hops

Sample at the brewpub. Dark brown pour with a medium tan head. Heavily spiced aroma, which is a good thing, but the ratio seemed a bit off. This one was heavy on allspice and clove instead of balanced with the cinnamon. A bit of roasted malt in the nose as well. Spicy flavor with cinnamon and allspice with a bit of roast before a dank finish. Seems like the clean finish is the toughest thing to nail in a spiced beer and these guys definitely struggled with it.

Sampled on draft at the brewery this beer pours a black color with a small tan head. The aroma is light sweet malt with a spicy undertone predominantly of nutmeg. The flavor is moderately sweet with strong nutmeg and light cinnamon elements. The finish is a bit nutty. Not terrible but way too much nutmeg for my taste.

Draught @ Brew Pub: This was very good. This was the first time that I have someone take a seasonal pumpkin and make the base a porter. It pours an opaque brown with a small tan head. The nose is that of pumpkin spice. Also weak notes of roastiness and chocolate. Very robust malty beer, with taste of the pumpkin spices also. An excellent choice!

Golden with nice foamy white head. Malty, hay, sweet bread aroma. Crisp, malty, sweet grains, almost a touch of honey. Tastes great, no residual flavors. Better than many German lagers. Almost more of a Dortmunder than the Bavarian helles beers cause it's got almost no bitterness to it. Tasty.
Clear gold color with a thin white head. The aroma is malty and has grass, floral and citrus notes. The taste is slightly astringent.
Pours clear, bright golden with full, white head. Aroma is thin caramel. Taste is caramel, moving to light hops. Finish is thin hops.
Draught at a Burmese restaurant: pours gold with a white head. Aroma is grainy. Taste is lightly bitter, sort of sweet. Refreshing.

PKD 041019. From a can poured a slightly hazy yellow-gold with 2cm of white open foam that retained very well and laced very well. Carbonation high, lively and medium to coarse. Aroma of pale malts and grain. Taste of musty grain and quite sweet; graininess increases as it warms. Light body. Smooth, crisp and refreshing when cold with a short finish.
Yellowish gold pour, thin white head. Nose is sweet malt. Middle is sweet lightly kilned malt, some bread, touch of grass. Finish is malty and coats the tongue. Simple, but good.
Refreshing and crisp but came after a delicious APA, think my buds were spoilt
12 ounce can at Winking Lizard Copley Ohio. Smells sweet. Little bit hazy and yellow. Small white head. Tastes grainy. Light bodied with grainy aftertastes. Decent summer beer. Cheers!
Cans from Cask & Flask in San Jose, CA. Aroma is hay, wet malts. Taste is earthy wet malts with some vegetal hops. Boring and soggy

24-Nov-08 (12-oz can: Purchased 15-Oct-08 for $2.19 at South Bay Drugs and Liquor in Imperial Beach, CA) Pours a hazy, golden-yellow body and a small, white head that settles to a wide, bubbly ring. Aromas of sweet corn, cheesy grains, and faint hops are backed up on the palate, but the flavor of the mildly bitter Noble hops is much more apparent than in the nose. The beer is noticeably sweet too, so this isn't as dry as a true German Helles. This light-bodied and gently carbonated beer shows no off-flavors and is reasonably clean and refreshing on the palate. Overall, it's a very flavorful pale lager with nice weight and balance, a beer that would go down great on a warm, summer day.

column1: Maui Brewing Hemp Man Brown Ale
column5: On tap at the Maui Brewing Company Brew Pub. Poured a deeper copper / lighter brownish color with a small sized head. Aromas of caramel and nuts. Tastes of the same with some light toasted malts.

column1: Maui Brewing Hemp Man Brown Ale
column5: Draught. Body is medium brown. Aroma is lightly malty (nutty, light bread), lightly hoppy (flowers). Flavor is lightly sweet, lightly bitter, lightly acidic. Finish is lightly acidic, lightly bitter. Light to medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation.

Overall a great beer at a good price from Carlsberg. It is a darker and slightly heavier product from Carlsberg and I personally prefer Eriksberg to Carlsbergâ€™s flagship lighter beer. The malt comes on the nose and the taste in a almost sweet way. Color is a gold/amber and is a great beer to have on a warm or mild day.
Eriksberg 5.3%. Golden, pale malt aroma, light bodied, pale malt, sweet malt, corn. Swedish Pilsner made by Carlsberg.
Nice , refreshing lager beer. Overall a decent enjoyable beer , nothing special.
Can from bordershopen, puttgarten. Pours a golden colour beer with a medium head. Malty with notes of bread. Dry finish.

16-02-2019; bottle; at home (bought somewhere in Sweden). The looks of the beer are nice. It looks like a good Premium Lager. The colour of the beer is a lovely golden yellow. The beer is crystal clear. It bubbles lively, which looks really nice. On top of the beer a nice layer of foam was formed. Foam retention is average. The foam is a perfect crispy white. Noice. The aroma of the beer is nice. It is kinda refreshing. Malts give some bready notes, together with a very small touch of caramel. Very nice. Hops give some nice herbal notes, together with a touch of fruit. The aromas are kinda basic, but very nice and strong. Lovely. The taste of the beer is also nice. Kinda sweet malts and nice and strong bitter hops. The beer is well balanced. Some alcohol also gives some extra sweetness. Very nice actually. The palate of the beer is fine. Medium-light body, smooth texture and rather low carbonation compared to the looks (since it looked kinda gassy). The finish of the beer is kinda nice. It has sweet malts and some alcohol and after that some nice bitter hops. Very nice beer. It is refreshing and a good thirst quencher. Not bad.
Flaska pÃ¥ conventum Ã–rebro. Ljust bÃ¤rnstensfÃ¤rgad med vitt skum. Doft och smak av brÃ¶d och citrus.

Old rating rerated 03.04.2015, 0,5l bottle @ Arigato Sushi, Stockholm: Nice creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly dry grainy, hay, dried grain, grass, caramel malts, nuts, weeds. Taste is slightly sweet, grain, minerals, hay, grass, sugar, weeds, caramel. Medium bitterness, slightly dry mouthfeel. Fair enough.
Bottle at GammelgÃ¥rd, SÃ¤len. After a 6 hour drive, I loved it. After 15 mina, it was back to being Eriksberg.

Ã•lle on selline jook, et iga uus kord kui klaasi vÃµi pudeli suule tÃµstad, siis leiad midagi uut, sÃµltuvalt tuhandest-miljonist pisiasjast, mis hetke olukorda mÃµjutavad. Seega piirdun iga Ãµlle juures selle tekstiga.
From backlog. On Tap at Smidjegrav Arena, Mora. Clear Golden with white head. Malts, hops, grassy.
Svart med beige skum. Lukter maltekstrakt, havre og nÃ¸tter. Middels + i fylde. SÃ¸t maltig smak, nÃ¸tter, karamell og havre. Middels lang
Shared 500 ml bottle. Dark ruby colour, beige head. Aroma of malts, some caramel and distinct notes of smoke and old rope. Flavour with the same elements.
Shared bottle at RB/HD on board Fridtjofen 28.06.19. Clear reddish copper. Beige head. Aroma of dark malt, tar, old sea houses and dry sea grass. Similar taste.

Shared bottle at Joffen. Pours clear deep amber with a small head. Inviting aroma , old rope, seaweed, heather, tar and tobacco. Taste is light sweet malty, soon overpowered by dry herbs, liquorice, weak smoke and tar, nice

Endelig RBHD-samling igjen, og denne gangen ombord pÃ¥ Fridtjofen. 0,5 flaske fra Systembolaget Hansa (MalmÃ¶): klar, mÃ¸rk rÃ¸dgylden med kort skum. Krydret aroma og smak med kardemomme, muskat, mÃ¸rke karameller, urter og barskog. God maltkropp og fin bitterhet i ettersmaken. Hint av rÃ¸yk, gamle skipstrosser og tjÃ¦re.
Fat pÃ¥ fox and anchor. MÃ¶rkt brun vÃ¤tska med litet grÃ¤ddfÃ¤rgat fylligt skum. LÃ¤tt kryddig och rostad doft med mycket len och fin smak. Gott!!

Flaska 500 ml frÃ¥n Systembolaget. MÃ¶rkbrun med relativt lite skum. Maltig och rÃ¶kig doft. Maltig smak, med rÃ¶k, lakrits, julkryddor och torkad frukt. En helt ok Ã¶l, men passar nog bÃ¤st till mat.

Bottle from Systembolaget 6%. Color is black with a medium beige head. Aroma is hops bread and some smoke. Taste of some burned malt and smoke a little tasteless and watery. Aftertaste also a little smokey ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Flaska frÃ¥n SB. Klar, mÃ¶rkbrun kulÃ¶r med smutsvit skumkrona. Doft av rostad malt, rÃ¶kmalt och lite charketurier. SÃ¶t och lÃ¤tt rÃ¶kig kropp. Smak av mÃ¶rkt brÃ¶d, brÃ¤nt socker, rÃ¶kmalt, mÃ¶rk choklad och lite chark.
Aroma: roasted malt, caramel, salt, spices. Taste: roasted malt, spices. A little flat. 2019: Dark colour, ten head. Aroma: roasted malt spices, clove, salt. Taste: clove, spices, roasted malt.

On tap at The Crow restaurant in Seattle, WA. Came a clear amber. Big white head. Nose of sweet caramel malts. Medium body. Clean mouthfeel. Flavor is fruity and malty. Some bitterness in the finish. Nice.

Draft at WA Brewerâ€™s fest. Amber pour with a small fluffy head. Wasnâ€™t too big on this one. Smells and tastes bready, lightly grassy, with a cooked vegetable character that I get out of a lot of lagers. Kind of corny, vegetal, and off.

Maritime Pacific Brewing Company--May Bock--1999 22 oz. Bottle Release. 7.00% ABV. (4.75 / 5.0) Maibock--Special Release to The Ballard Market. Clear bright red color. Rich malty nose with herbal hints. Spicy front leads to rich malty body with smooth spicy cherry caramel notes. Wonderful. Sampled 5/28/1999.
On tap. Pours clear amber with a lacy white head. Sweet brown sugar aroma and taste. Fairly crisp noble hop finish.

Tap at Barking Dog. Nice sweet malty aroma, caramel mostly and some fruity/floral hops. Pours dark-ish amber with a nice fluffy head. Sweet flavors of caramel, honey, fruity notes followed by a floral clean bitterness. SOme residual sweetness choses to linger for a little while. Nice light bite in the finish from hop/carbonation mixture.

Deep honeyed-amber with crisp, 1" head. Honey malt wafts off the glass. Rather sweet and alcoholic body with some floral character. Sour grain and flowery, alcohol finish. Re-rated 4-25-10. Similar experience, but the sour -tannic graininess was even more harsh this time and worsened with each sip.

One of the last pours on draught at the Jolly Roger brewery/taproom grill in suburban Seattle, WA. Lucky to have visited before this beer ran out. Pours a dark copper amber brew with a thin off-white head that quickly dissipates to a fine film and off-white ring. Aroma of sweetened caramel malts, flowery hops, a touch of Yorkshire pudding with butter and some light spice. Taste is full bodied, a little sweet with flavors of sweetened caramel malt, a touch of apple and some mild fruit cake. Finish is sweet with small bit of citrus hop character that slowly disappears. This is a multi-personality maibock and willing to try this one again. Curious to see how next yearâ€™s batch turns out.

On tap at Maritime in Seattle. Red-gold in color. Slight maple/caramel aroma with just a whiff of hops. This is a sweet one, though perhaps less so than other maibocks that Iâ€™ve tried. Still, the sweetness seemed sticky, nearly overpowering some of the other characteristics of the brew. The alcohol shows up after a few sips, and its presence grows as the glass empties. Drinkable, but a wee bit out of balance.

2007 - Washington Brewers Festival â€“ Kenmore WA A deep golden amber color with a thin head. This had a deep sweet malty aroma with a flavor to match the floral notes also added to the flavors. This was a great beer and if this sits it get better with the warmth of the hand. Great beer for a cool day.
Light copper with small head. Very light all around...a bit of sweetness and some slight floral notes.
500ml can. Pours clear gold with a thin white head. Aroma is malt, hay. Taste is light bitter, malt. Simple mass market beer. No pilsner here.
Pilsen polaca. Muy Aguada. Amargor medio pero sin gusto a lupulo. Bastante mala.
Light golden color, quickly diminishing foam. Slight "Van Pur smell". Drinkable bitter beer, with a strange malty aftertaste. Too watery.
Initially medium bitterness and hops, later it more in aftertaste. Generally average macro lagerlike.
Zlatnozute boje, debela bijela pjena, srednje trajna. Blage citrusno-medene arome, kao i aroma vlage. Srednje gorÄine, blago gorak finiÅ¡. Vodene teksture, srednje prema jakoj karbonizaciji.
500ml can. Straight from the can. Seems to be not very malty beer by the aroma. Malty, bit sweet taste. Over carbonation. Fizzy. Sirupy sweetness. Typical and anonymus macro lager.
Clear pale golden with a thin head. Aroma of malts, cardboard, straw. Taste pretty much the same: malts and cardboard. Light bitter finish
Nez maltÃ© et cÃ©rÃ©alier. Robe blonde avec peu de bulles translucide. Mousse lÃ©gÃ¨re En bouche saveurs de cÃ©rÃ©ales et de malt.

Clear pale gold, white head. Nice fresh base malÈ› sweetness, traces of grass. No off-flavours to talk about. Smells like a good macro lager. Similar taste - clean malts and no much hops. Clean soft mouthfeel, that is still crisp because of the carbonation. A clean no complains pale macro lager. Good.
(nez pils (oeuf corse), bouche bien croustillante, un peu de fruit jaune et blanc, amertume ok, mieux que prÃ©vuâ€¦)

column1: Brew Brothers Reno Extra Pale Ale
column5: Poured golden with a nice hoppy aroma. Flavor was nice and hoppy, slightly metallic, with a little yeastiness.

column1: Brew Brothers Reno Extra Pale Ale
column5: On-Tap at the Eldorado Brewery Hotel Reno, NV Pours out a clear gold topped with a small head. light hop aroma and some malt. A little yeast and nice mouth full of hops.

column1: Brew Brothers Reno Extra Pale Ale
column5: Sampled draught at the brewpuThis was curiously similar to the Gold Dolar Pale Ale. Pale straw color, nice puffy rich head with lots of lacing and good retentiveness. Aroma is citrusy with light cascade type hops some husky malts. The flavor is tangy, mild body and chewy mouthfeel. Yeasty maybe but not bad.

column1: Brew Brothers Reno Extra Pale Ale
column5: More of a Honey Pale Ale. Medium gold, creamy lasting white head.Faint honey nose. Yeasty fatty off taste. Great lace

column1: Brew Brothers Reno Gold Dollar Pale Ale
column5: Citrus and some light green onion. Pours golden with ok head and lacing. Bitter end with a touch of booze. Tap at brewery.

column1: Brew Brothers Reno Gold Dollar Pale Ale
column5: Draft @ the brewery. Pours a golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty grassy citrus hoppy aroma. Fruity malty grassy citrus hoppy flavor. Has a fruity malty grassy citrus hoppy finish.

column1: Brew Brothers Reno Gold Dollar Pale Ale
column5: Draft at the source. Crystal clear bright yellow color. Fruity citrus aroma. Taste is peppery and fruity straw. Nice.

column1: Brew Brothers Reno Gold Dollar Pale Ale
column5: On tap at The brewery Pours clear golden with a medium sized white head, some lacing. Aroma of citrus and grains. Taste is grassy, grains and a mild bitterness Good

column1: Brew Brothers Reno Gold Dollar Pale Ale
column5: On tap at the Reno Brewpub. Light citrus and a hint of caramel. Weak with no body. A touch of bitterness on the finish.

column1: Brew Brothers Reno Gold Dollar Pale Ale
column5: "One of BBâ€™s better offerings. It was hoppy enough to make the two beer roookies in our group NOT like it...which was enough for me to give it a little respect. Pretty average/mellowish for a pale ale, but good enough to order."

column1: Brew Brothers Reno Gold Dollar Pale Ale
column5: Pours a beautiful clear amber with a thick off-white head. Malty aroma has a hoppy undertone and a hint of fruit. Malty flavor fills the mouth with fruit, hops and wood and is slightly bitter but has a hint of honey sweetness. Body is average, but it has plenty of fizz.

column1: Brew Brothers Reno Gold Dollar Pale Ale
column5: On tap at the brewpub. Clear yellow pour, white head. Caramel malt, citrus, light hoppiness, and some fruit. Pretty boring, but drinkable.

column1: Brew Brothers Reno Gold Dollar Pale Ale
column5: on tap-pours an off white head and gold color. Aroma is orange/pine, light malt-caramel. Taste is orange/pine hops, light/medium malt-sweet. Dryish finish.

column1: Brew Brothers Reno Gold Dollar Pale Ale
column5: From the Jug at the GABF Colorado Convention Center, Denver 11/10/2008 Small white head. Fruity hop aroma. Golden coloured and fruity with a crisp malt finish.

column1: Brew Brothers Reno Double Down Stout
column5: Roast and some musk. Pours dark brown with good head and lacing. Bitter end. Their best beer. Some light coffee. Tap at brewery.

column1: Brew Brothers Reno Double Down Stout
column5: Draft @ the brewery. Pours a black color with a small off-white head. Has a roasted malty caramel aroma. Roasted malty caramel flavor with hints of licorice. Has a roasted malty caramel and licorice finish.

column1: Brew Brothers Reno Double Down Stout
column5: On tap at the brewery Dark brown with a small beige head, good lacing. Aroma of toasted malts, caramel and chocolate. Taste of roasted malts, chocolate and ashy Good

column1: Brew Brothers Reno Double Down Stout
column5: Draft at the source. Clear brown color, tan head. Aroma has coffee and chocolate. Taste is bitter and earthy coffee grounds.

column1: Brew Brothers Reno Double Down Stout
column5: "OK, not nearly as bad as I remember from a few years back. One of two beers (out of 7) that iâ€™d bother to get again. A medium bodied dry stout, not on nitro, but still pretty smooth...but quite thin. Good roasted flavors and not much else."

column1: Brew Brothers Reno Double Down Stout
column5: Pours a deep sable just a whisker or two above black with a nice tan head. Smoky aroma demands a taste with tempting coffee, chocolate and molasses notes. Flavor has firm smoky, roast coffee and chocolate notes plus hints of molasses and licorice. Firm-bodied texture has some good fizz. Double down on this one!

column1: Brew Brothers Reno Double Down Stout
column5: On tap at the brewpub. Dark brown pour, tan head. Mostly roasted malt, earthy bitterness, light chocolate, and caramel sweetness. Okay, passable.

column1: Brew Brothers Reno Double Down Stout
column5: On Tap- Serve deep black color with a Thick head that that lasted quite well with some lacing. Had a roasted aroma with malt. Had a roasted and malt taste with a dry finish. Medium body with no strong alcohol presence and seems well balanced. Quite clean and smooth. Nice beer to relax with after running the Casino gauntlet.

column1: Brew Brothers Reno Double Down Stout
column5: on nitro-pours a creamy rich light brown head that laces and black color. Aroma is rich dark malt-roasty/chocolate. Taste is dark malt-roasty/bitter chocolate/molasses.

column1: Brew Brothers Reno Double Down Stout
column5: Draft @ Brew Brothers El Dorado, served on nitro. Pours a beautiful, pitch black color; huge light-tan head with perfect retention and lacing that coats the glass; a beautiful pour. Good amounts of roasted malts, dark chocolate, and hints of dark licorice in the aroma; creamy, if a touch hollow. Medium-to-full mouthfeel: creamy, vanilla-tinged presence upfront; roasted malts, milk chocolate, and touches of smoke; nicely roasted, highly drinkable. Well-done, lots of creamy stout character. Medium finish: toasty malts, roast, and lasting chocolate; well-balanced end. Seriously, is this a new brewer?
Bottled in 1998. Pear and sugar in the aroma. Syrupy, smokey, raisinny flavor with porto. The carbonation has almost disappeared.

column4: Port Brewing Company / The Lost Abbey
column5: One of the best stouts I've ever had. Can at home. It started of with coffee taste. It's dark toasty creamy molasses great beer

column4: Port Brewing Company / The Lost Abbey
column5: 56,78cl-blik van bij Bierhalle Deconinck te Vichte. U: Zwart met een licht bruine schuimkraag. G: Geroosterd, koffie, chicorei, pure chocolade en alcohol. S: Zoet met een ferme moutbitterheid. Geroosterd, cacao en koffie. M: Volmondig met een lichte carbonatie en licht sticky.

column4: Port Brewing Company / The Lost Abbey
column5: Aroma: roasted malt, chocolate, dried fruits Taste: woody sweet caramel, dried fruits, milk chocolate

column4: Port Brewing Company / The Lost Abbey
column5: ( bottle) Aroma: caramel, chocolate, malt. Taste: dry, flavour of coffee, roasted malt and chocolate, Palate: medium body, medium carbonation. Overall: Tasty old-school stout.

column4: Port Brewing Company / The Lost Abbey
column5: 568 ml can at home. Pours a very dark and nearly black chestnut brown with a tan colored head. The aroma is medium malty - roasted malt, burnt wood, dark chocolate, wet coffee grounds, firestone, tobacco, some fudge and hints of dark fruits. Medium-full body with a soft carbonation a light to medium sweetness and a medium roasty bitterness. The flavor is similar to the smell and very roasty with burnt wood, ash, bitter herbal notes, nearly astringent, coffee and licorice. Finishes medium roasty with a distinct bitterness and burnt wood. I liked the bitterness but is feels a little bit empty - wins upon warming. Aroma: 7 Appearance: 4 Taste: 8 Palate: 4 Overall: 14

column4: Port Brewing Company / The Lost Abbey
column5: (~peated, â€˜grosâ€™ malt (~indus), pleine, Ã¢pre-violente (graineuse), carbo-piquante (trop), beau fumÃ© â€˜engine-oilâ€™, > strong)

column4: Port Brewing Company / The Lost Abbey
column5: Full English pint can from ES shared with Andrey. Appearance: almost black with a beige head. Aroma: roasted malts and seeds. Taste: similar. Overall: good stuff.

column4: Port Brewing Company / The Lost Abbey
column5: Tall can that Matt bought back from Irvine! Pours a pitch black, not thick but completely opaque, with a tan fizzy head. Lightly smoky, dark roasted inky black malt, medium sharpness, quite boozy - bourbon, light sherry sweetness, some sticky marshmallow/vanilla, light spiced biscuit, light to moderate vegetal flavour. Nicely executed porter/stout style â€” body is very thin, which is surprising given the name â€” expected something sludgy and thick.

column4: Port Brewing Company / The Lost Abbey
column5: 19.2 oz can from Irvine Spectrum Whole Foods at home in HK. Somehow cans this size seem more enormous than 22 oz bottles. Dark dark cola brown pour with light tan head that dissipates relatively quickly. Very slight lacing. Aroma is roasted chocolate old coffee grounds, some licorice. Sort of straightforward stout. Taste is similar but more sweet, flavor is like straightforward American stout - roasted slightly smoky. Some bitterness. But the name is so misleading. Body is actually very light. More than youâ€™d expect for a big stout. Itâ€™s good, but not anything special about it I guess.

column4: Port Brewing Company / The Lost Abbey
column5: Comes in a 19.2 oz can????? Very drinkable. Actually body is a little thin on the mouth for the amount of alcohol. Tasty, improves with warming, can ride this can out all night.

column4: Le Sergent Recruteur - Pizzas & BiÃ¨res Artisanales
column5: First of all, this beer doesn''t have much in common with scotch ales and sure isn''t as good as Le dieu du ciel cornemuse. It has a dark brown colour with a small head. It has a bit of hop and a bit of grapefruit in the aroma. It has a taste of resinous hop sliding on a deceiving sugary note. Definitely not a scotch ale.

Pours muddy-pale brown with no noticeable head save for some bubble formations in the center. Hops, fish and oceanic-scents make up the aroma. A very well-rounded Pils, with light spicy hoppiness and moderate malt, with no *stand-outish* characteristics. Enjoyable!

Pours to a golden haze with a small amount of fish food. One fingers worth of big bubbled head. Light floral hoppy aroma. Dry almond flavors with a very effervescent feel. Touch of hops spiciness, and a slightly grassy finish. Not a classic, but certainly a respectable lager.
Medium brown. Smooth malt taste with mild alcohol heat......................

bottiglia 33 cl, schiuma beige media grana media persistenza, colore ambrato velato, al naso malto caramello zucchero di canna prugne secche leggero banana, in bocca frutta matura prugne sciroppate spezie, corpo roondo, carbonatazione moderata, amaro moderato. Una Belgian ale un po' anomala. Nel complesso si lascia bere. 18.10.19 c. calendario dellâ€™avvento 2018 COOP CH

Bottiglia. Il gusto al naso resta attratto dal fruttato e dallo speziato. La finezza olfattiva Ã¨ normale e la maniera in cui permane Ã¨ sufficiente. Il mantello birroso superiore resiste abbastanza. La grandezza delle bollicine Ã¨ medio-fine. Il liquido Ã¨ di aspetto velato. Bollicine medio-fini costituiscono la forma della frizzantezza. Il colore Ã¨ giallo dorato carico. Il corpo Ã¨ rotondo. L'amaro Ã¨ non invasivo. La forza gustativa Ã¨ normale e si prolunga in modo sufficiente. Il gusto Ã¨ piacevole. Le sensazioni boccali finali risultano di facile beva. Il finale Ã¨ semplice e dissetante. Il retrogusto Ã¨ di media intensitÃ . Al palato arrivano sentori di miele, nocciola, frutta secca, cotto di recente, un accenno di resinoso quasi balsamico, erba, agrumi e spezie.

Herber, trocken hefiger Beginn. Spritzig, minimal bananig, Nuancen von Alkohol. Leicht erhÃ¶hte Karbonisierung, harmonisch. Steigend hopfig im Mittelteil, geringe Bitterkeit, langer Nachgeschmack. GefÃ¤llt. 10/10/11/9/9/10

F: big, tan, average to poor retention. C: amber, hazy. A: malty, caramel, bit alcohol, fruity, molasses, bit yeasty. T: malty backbone, watery caramel, bit toffee, fruity, herbal, banana, medium to full body, low to medium carbonation, not good balanced for the style, 33cl bottle from Manor in GenÃ¨ve.
Many thanks to Beerhunter111 for sharing. Creamy malty beginning. Caramel, moderate bitter hops, round and smooth with a nice moderate bitter caramelly ending. Nice.

33cl bottle from a trade with anstei, thanks! A slighy hazy dark golden beer with a mid-szied most good lasting off-white head. Aroma of belgian yeast, mild rotten fruits, herbs and spices. Taste of spicy malt, herbs, belgian yeast, strong fruits, herbal bitter finish.

Bottle. Served pretty warm, solid amber hue, active and topped with a epic pile of foam. Wild, yeasty aroma. Drinks with a mild riff of wild fermentation, but is bouyed by a fairly malty base. (#7086, 5/2018)
Pours hazy gold with an off-white head. Aroma of mild fruit, Belgian yeast. Taste is mild fruit, Belgian yeast, banana notes, spice. Okay.
Belle robe rousse pour cette biÃ¨re bien charpentÃ©e et Ã  l'Ã©quilibre parfait entre douceur et amertume.
on tap at basler feinmesse. pours a hazy amber with a medium head. aroma of honey, candy, oranges. flavour of orange juice, candy, apricots.

(Keg at Au Coin Mousse, 20190914) The beer poured deep golden and clear. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had fruitiness, honey, Belgian style yeast and paper. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were fruitiness, honey, grass, malts, Belgian style yeast and bitterness. Aftertaste was fruity, sweet and bitter. A clean but too sweet brew.

opalescent pale yellow colour, moderate sized dense off-white head; aroma of grapeseeds, bread, biscuits, some dried apricot, chardonnay wine, earthy and grainy notes; typical tripel taste with apricot notes; great one!
Blonde un peu amÃ¨re avec un vrai caractÃ¨re. Un plaisir! (Mars 2019, bottle) ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Heller, sÃ¼ÃŸlich getreidig-alkoholischer Beginn, weiche Herbe. SÃ¼ffig, der alkoholische Anteil wÃ¤chst, wenig aber angenehm hopfig. Herb hopfiger, weniger sÃ¼ÃŸ-alkoholischer Nachgeschmack. 9/9/8/8/8/8

F: big, egg-white, good retention. C: shiny pale gold, hazy. A: grainy, yeasty, spicy, vaguely fruity, dough. T: malty, bit alcohol, fruity, grainy, grassy, light bitter finish, medium to full body and higher carbonation, nothing really interesting, drinkable, 33cl bottle from Manor in GenÃ¨ve.

Bottle from Mam and Dad's Holiday, Grenoble, France. Hazy straw coloured with a thick white head of foam. It has a toffee, dried fruit and spicy fruity flavour with a warming lemon and spiced fruity finish. Pretty good.

Bottle. Slightly hazy, medium yellow, with a head typical of the Belgique type. The aroma is very restrained, just slightly titled toward the wild side. This also drinks with a bit of a middling character, but hints at the core of the style ... frothy and well-bodied, full of sweet sugars and yeast. (#7082, 5/2018)
Bottle from store in Nendaz. Hazy golden with full head. Spicy aroma, some sourness. Malty taste, sweetness and bitterness. Alcohol well hidden.
Belle blonde assez douce en bouche. La petite couche de mousse reste longtemps.
8 mois avant DLC. Blonde petite mousse Ã  bonne tenue et carbo moyenne. MaltÃ©e et ronde en bouche. Pas mal mais sans plus pour une triple. Manque de cÃ´tÃ© fruitÃ©
A winter amber IPA-style beer from Watson Bros. Murky brown with little head and carbonation. Rich body and malty with plenty of citrus and pime hop flavors. Pretty good.

Had several cans of Lack of Control Lager, poured fizzy, gives head like a prozzie with no teeth, after 8 cans I was on top of tables bollock naked in local working menâ€™s club, resulting in night in cells, it was at this point Lack of Control Lager becomes Life Comes Later lager
I've fond memories of this, I guess it stopped being able to compete with Carling and Heineken. Has a very clean hoppy taste with soft malts. Decent for a lager.
Bottle railway ossett. Straw colour good white head. Aroma is pale malts grain taste same sweet not nice. Thin strong carbonation. Not good

had from the 16oz CaN .. had over at the Dowlings house after christmas dinner .. . pours a deep yellow .. . A+ lacing .. . solid bitterness .. . clean for the most part .. . a great simple lager .. . . hell, i donâ€™t know why they make new porn movies, they all end the same.
One of the best pils in the uk. It is not an ale but if you want a cold light lager nothing much gets close
Bottle in Queens Head pub near Newcastle, just after the Great North Run, Sept, 2011. Typical fizzy lager. Low hops. Crap really. But drinkable.

Can 50cl. @ home. Clear light to medium orange color with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate malty, toasted, moderate hoppy, flowers, citrus. Flavor is moderate sweet and bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is watery to oily, carbonation is soft. [20081206]

It is golden with a white head and a weak aroma with notes of flower and malt. The flavour is very mild with light notes of flower, malt and caramel. Even if it is rather weak in both aroma and flavour, it is quite tasty.
can - pale yellow beer with white head. Sweet fruity aroma. Flavour is sweet and malty. Not very much hops.
LCL IS BY FAR THE LARGER IN THE WORLD I HAVE TRIED MANY KINDS AND I STILL FIND THIS TO THE BEST !

Not the greatest beer in the world, in fact you wouldnâ€™t use it to unblock your drains, but even so it is a stalwart of Northern working mensâ€™ clubs and excellent for topping up your anti-freeze in winter. 9/10 wandering vagrants preferred Super Strength.

Can from Spar. Golden with a scummy foam white head. Aromas are sweet grain with extra sugar and alcohol. Flavours are Uuurrrrrrgghhhh! Sweet grain with chemicals, harsh alcohol yet thin in character - all in the same mouthful. Like the LCL Pils - this claims to be an "Award Winner". It is impossible taste how. Incredibly foul.

Can, from Rythym & Booze in Brigg, although the can showed signs of being destined for an importer in Singapore. Wish it had reached its destination. Gold, thin white head and low condition. Sweet apple and alcohol in the nose. Oversweet with hints of marzipan and chlorine in the mouth and a sticky alcoholic finish. Tramps deserve better than this.

This is a dark black/ruby beer with slight white foam at the edges. Smells sweet and syrupy, malty. Chocolate in the flavor, coffee, nice bitterness in the aftertaste. This has a really nice porter flavor, and so far none of the bad smells that some Kraftbrau beers have been found to contain.
Sour, dry, foaming, a nice heathery, leathery aroma. feels slightly slick and more alcoholic than 5.5% ABV. suspicious "malt liquor" metallic qualities. Muchas gracias, Psych_prof!

This one, probably unfairly, suffers because my own homebrewed alt this winter was the best brew I've ever made and I've been curious about other alts since. I don't get the "plastic" that seems to have turned off others, but do sense something odd - maybe an electrical fire whiff? I definitely do get that Kraftbrau sourish quality that seems to work well for some of their brews but intensified in this one, overcompensates the decenter malt action.

pours light brown, off white head. weird aroma, like an orange in a plastic bag. plasic is quite as apparent in the flavour, but it's still there, stealing the spotlight from the nice raisin and nutty flavours.
Cloudy reddish-amber; plasticy aroma overwhelms the malts. Malty, good earthiness but before I can get any further, the plastic comes back. What gives, Kraftbrau?

Bright copper, foamy light tan head. Big aroma of burning plastic with maybe a hint of raisins (and other dark fruit) poking through, touch of citrus. Body is full of light citrusy hops. Orange notes that dry towards the end. I got kind of hung up on the nose, couldn't get past it. It's a really good thing that the aspirations in the aroma don't materialize in the body though.

Huge, huge, huge head- should be like that? I mean this was explosion of foam ... Aroma of melted plastic, but when you go past that you can discover something a la Belgian east but a bit flatten and more bitter. You know, this one was hard to rate. I got some good and some bad in it. Ok in middle, dusty aftertaste.

A slightly hazy red/brown color. Nice pillowy head, some lace. Nose is subtle malt, mild coffee, hops and others. Smooth,lush feel, moderate carb, hint of metal, decent malt character, light yeasty fruitiness, cereal, nice hopping to round out a decent brew. Reminds me of an ESB? Thank you PsychProf.

I thank Psych Prof for this absolutely wonderful Christmas beer. The flavor reminds me of what I ahve encountered in really good coffee: a certain lively fruitniness underpinned by drying grains. The aroma is immense. Deep, complex fruit and dark grain. But the whole is light and drinkable, with a generous head lasting throughout. A master work.

Deep dark hazy amber color, small off white head, light smokey malt aroma, nice balanced malty sweetness. Medium body, has a very soft and creamy mouthfeel, some dryness in the finish, pretty good, thanks PsychProf for this pleasant winter brew.

15th January 2016 Thatâ€™ll be me 20K then @ ChrisOâ€™s. Clear deep red - amber beer, small cream colour head. Palate is airy and semi dry. Decent fine carbonation. Smooth caramel malts, touch of cream. Tangy fruits and very mild spice. Light semi dry finish. A fruity caramel beer showing some age, but not bad.

Bottle 12fl.oz. @ [ madmitch76 - 20K Tasting ] - chriso & Boudicca House, London. [ As New Glarus Unplugged Eisbock ]. [ Vintage ]. Murky matt medium amber brown color with virtually no off-white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, bread, oxidide, candy, light to moderate caramel, sweet malt. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet with a long duration, breat, oxidide, alcohol, light caramel, light fruit - dried fruit. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft to flat, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20160115]

Bottle shared at the Kenny 20K mega monster tasting. 14/01/2016. Huge thanks to Kenny for this one. Clear Carmel brown coloured pour with no head really. Aroma is sweet raisin, dried fruit, nutty caramel malts, some mint. Some age. Flavour is composed of meaty malty, brown malts, soy, sweet dried fruit. Palate is semi sweet, malty, low carbonation, syrupy. Lingering woody, caramel,, nutty malts.

Bottle share at Kenâ€™s 20K. Thanks to the man himself for providing this. Pours red/brown with a very thin head. Booze and fruit in the aroma, taste is subtle with fruits, bread and a hint of booze. Not overpowering and a good one to share.

Bottle at Kennyâ€™s 20K. It pours clear deep brown with pretty much no head. The nose is rich malty action, somewhat meaty, OXO cubes, oxidised, wood, earth and toasted brown bread. The taste is malt-driven, pretty sweet, brown sugars, meaty, caramel, light spice, fruit cake, old malt and dry wood with a dry finish. Medium - full body, fine carbonation and oily/chewy mouth-feel. Not a hug amount of depth going and it does taste a touch aged. OK.

Bottle split at Madmitch76 20K tasting, thanks to Kenny, 15/01/16. Chestnut brown with a moderate beige covering that quickly dissipates to nyadda. Nose is nutty, molasses, toffee, grain, airy malt. Taste packs more punch, dark fruit rinds, dates, caramel, malt loaf, toasted brown sugar. Full bodied, fine carbonation, warming alcohol in the close. Doesnâ€™t deliver a great deal on the ABV but has held together fairly well and is a drinkable enough sipper.

Bottle shared at Kennyâ€™s 20K tasting - London. Big thanks to Ken himself for this one. Pours clear russet with a light, bubbly head. Mild aroma, light earth, dried fruits. Medium sweet flavour with notes of toasted bread, dried berries, light alcohol. Medium to full bodied with fine carbonation. Warming finish with notes of ripe fruits, dried berries, some bitter earth. Fairly subdued. Not bad.

Bottle share at Chrisoâ€™s at Kennyâ€™s 20K. Many thanks to Ken for bringing this retired eisbock. As â€™New Glarus Unplugged Eisbockâ€™, 9.5%, red foil. Reddy brown, light sediment, small ring of tan head, dotted lacing. Aroma is oxidised, meaty, marmite, some sherry and on-the-turn fruits. Body is medium, smooth, soft carbonation. Taste is boozy, some chocolate, raisin, papery finish. Interesting to try.

33cl bottle shared at Kennyâ€™s 20K celebrations @Chrisoâ€™s, many thanks to Ken. It pours a dark copper color with no head. Aroma is sweet and quite flat and cardboard with some apricots jam and red berries. Taste is also sweet and lightly boozy and oxidised with some more red berries. Light bodied with soft carbonation. Overall, still decent
Bottle at Madmitch 20k tasting. Some oxidisation on aroma. Clear brown beer. Some light sherry character. Light cherry. Sweetish. OK.
Thin, watery, palid tripe. No "Eight Ace" for me, even at "Â£1.49". Avoid or wish you had.

Bloody awful stuff. As mentioned very cheap I think it was about 50p a can when I tried it from a local offie. Very weak watered down taste with some slight wheaty hoppy beer taste and smell. This lager is notorious in that a parody of it featured in Viz comic strip 8 Ace.
A lovely Summer drink, nice looking can, golden yellow colour, tastes great ice cold! Summer aromas and a gentle twang on the palet! Even better, itâ€™s Â£1.50 for 8 at Achmeds General Dealers.
Can 05/10/2003 Golden coloured and slightly sweet. Wheat flavour. Some dryness in a malt finish.
Yup - super rank. Comes in a can like the "generic beer" on Repo Man. Absolutely tasteless.
Must be the cheapest lager in the world. Â£2 ($3.50) for eight 500 ml cans. Not even worth that bargain price it''s so terrible. No flavour, no palete, nothing!

Used to drink this from 18 to 28 when it seemed to disappear locally. Many landlords couldnâ€™t serve a decent pint of it, very temperamental. Seems that change of maker has given it a new lease of life. Now being served at The Prosseco lounge South Shields and by god itâ€™s a great pint, well kept, good head, cool. Been dropping I. Here occasionally for past 2 years and never a bad pint.
3.6% amber with a good smooth head, it tastes the same as most of these smooth bitters, not a fan but they are very easy to drink.

Keg draught at The Duke of Northumberland, Newcastle upon Tyne. Served very cool. Large frothy off-white head. Clearly not nitrogenated. Very deep amber body. Mostly caramel, but also hoppy and spicy, mild malt and black malt, red fruit and kola nut. If this were on cask it would be quite good. Pretty mild on the taste front, not especially bitter, sort of bittersweet. Slightly oily on the palate. Low to moderate carbonation. Dry finish. Really not too bad. The debate continues: is this a mild or a bitter. I think itâ€™s a hybrid. Itâ€™s like a bitter with lots of caramel in it, and also mild malts. More of a mild I think.

Keg, The Plough, Ellington, Northumberland. Watery coffee and raisin aroma with nutty attempts. Dark ruby with a creamy white collar. Slightly meaty and gravyish with nuts, hint of dankness, butter, milky coffee, wisp of smoke and cocoa linger. Wishy-washy overchilled mild basically, but enjoyable enough.

Cask, swan-neck @ the Station, Whitely Bay. Deep, almost blackened chestnut body with a little residual cream to see me back to my table and nothing beyond that. Warming toasted and faintly woody, roasted malt nose. Wooded, peaty and earthy malts in the mouth, quite full and filling. Touch of plastic doesnâ€™t aid it much and some smoky phenols come into play late but remind me of a waterlogged ashtray. Light tannins show on the swallow before a firm grip of malts take hold in the peaty swallow. Rather dusty all up with too much smoke lingering in the mouth for it to come together. Blindly I could drink it all night, but with open eyes it does nothing for me (a metaphor!?!). Average.
Can. Sweetish, caramelly flavor. Thin. No specific bitterness or other characteristics. Maybe a bit of chichorei. Easy, inoffensive drinker.
(Draught). Debatable if this is a bitter or a Scottish ale. Copper coloured. Flavourful, rich malty taste. Low bitterness. Not bad.
Not that bad for the price. Strong malty taste. Will definatly sample again (but only if price is cheap).

Keg at Olde Ship Inn, Seahouses. Amber brown colour, creamy white foam head leaving lacing and malty cardboardy aroma. Taste is malty, chocolate hints, with slight fruitiness. Medium bodied, soft carbonation, semi-dry finish. OK, abit bland.

Draught at The Delaval Arms, Old Hartley, Northumberland. Orange amber with short white head. I hadnâ€™t seen this beer for years, must be very localised now. Thin, watery bitter with boiled caramel flavours. Boiled vegetable notes, musty CO2 hints. Not great.
Outstanding Full flavor and easy drink to drink. Dark in colour and easy poured.

Cask@The Kings Head, Lanchester, County Durham. Amber beer with a strong head. The aroma is lightly roasted, and the flavour is mildly toffee and bitter. Overall a reasonable hopped and gently roasted beer.

Keg draught at the Town Hall Hotel, Richmond, Yorks. Amber body with a thin white head. Nose is caramel and black malt initially. As it warms up from very cold you get spice, hops and fruit. Lightly bitter. Arid dry finish. Oily mouthfeel, which is unpleasant. A bit heavy. Surprisingly decent, like a John Smithâ€™s on steroids.

First tasted this in Leuchars in August 1994. Cask, handpump dispense. Clear pale amber in colour with a thin white head. Slight malt note in the short aroma. Thin mouthfeel and good lacing. Pale malt base gives digestive biscuit malt with sweet golden syrup notes. Hop resins give a dusty bitter aftertaste. Finish is rather weak with barley sugar notes dilute in the mouth. A rather insipid bitter.

Very smooth and easy to drink. Aroma was negligable , a thin head and some lacing. Bitter sweet taste with a light grain and caramel. Many below have argued it is watery and not strong enough. Iâ€™d argue the attraction is that itâ€™s easy to drink and good for sessioning. I really enjoyed this one.
10/2/10. On tap. Extremely mild and light aroma and flavor. Really tastes like nothing. Meh.

Draught, swan-neck @ a very small pub (sorry, not noted!!!), Newcastle-upon-Tyne. Shimmering, deep tawny gold with an inch thick pad of cream that lasted but didnâ€™t lace. Void of aroma, though the Geordieâ€™s had the bar well and truly smoked out by now. Thin, watery and soft in the mouth. Bitter, burnt caramel, sweet castor sugar, light toasted grain and plastic with an almost desperate challenging note of earth and ginger. Very little bitterness on the swallow and wishy washy in the finish. This was just another nitro beer in my opinion. Just who invented them. Not much here at all.
A great ale. In terms of having unique flavor, Newcastle is second to none. The aroma and aftertaste both are very sweet and almost make one think of taffee or maple.

Tasted this in the Salt Cot, Saltcoats (JDW) in April 2010. Cask, handpump dispense. Crystal clear pale copper in colour with a thin white head. Short sulphurous aroma which reminded me of Bass. Thin watery mouthfeel and good lacing. Pale malt gives a thin digestive biscuit base with a hint of raisin fruit. Sharp metallic tang of hop resins give a dusty dry flavour to the long aftertaste. A weak finish with a light hazelnut flavour which quickly runs out of legs. A poor session bitter lacking in conviction.

Cask (handpump) @ JDW - The Waterhouse, 67-71 Princess Street, Manchester, Greater Manchester, England M2 4EG. Clear medium orange amber color with a average, frothy to creamy, good lacing, fully lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate malty, toasted, dusty, light apple, light to moderate hoppy. Flavor is moderate sweet and bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is flat to soft. [20100425]
Cask Handpump at the Penny Black JDW, Northwich 09/04/2010 Floral aroma. Golden bronze coloured and floral with a slightly spicy flavour. Bitter and dry lasting malt finish.
[Gravity cask at the Back of Beyond, Reading] Amber. Tastes of green leaves and wee wee, with a fair amount of bitterness. Reminded me strongly of Wadworthâ€™s Henryâ€™s IPA, and just as unpleasant.

A Mes rate. Cask at Baker Street â€™Sporks. Slightly hazy golden brown with a good off white head. Thatâ€™s two beers in a day from this usually poorly cellared Spoons that are in tip top form. I like it when I time it right... Good rustic earthy snout with some faint barnyard character. Even better flavour. A good base formed by what was apparent in the nose but topped off really well with some perfumed and delightfully aromatic hoppage. Really good fruity finish. Bright, alive and very very drinkable. Very good indeed.

Cask at Pilgrimâ€™s Progress (JDW), Bedford, in Spoons Real Ale Festival â€™10. Fremlins: a name from the past, remembered from scores of tin advertisements in pubs with that rather mournful elephant. If I ever drank Fremlins Bitter before it would have been somewhere in East Sussex or West Kent in 1969-70, but in those days I was an uncritical beer drinker, just keen to neck as much of the stuff as possible. This incarnation of the beer is bright amber with a small white head. Rather nice musty sweet malt aroma. Slight sourness and a grainy aftertaste. Rather bland and watery to be honest, but agreeable in many ways.

Hand pulled cask at The Moon Uner Water (JDW) Watford. Amber with a small white head. This really does taste pretty much as I remember it back in the 80s. A well balanced session bitter with distinctive styrian goldings floral notes. A

Cask conditioned handpump Last Plantaganet Leicester. An amber coloured beer with a whitish lasting head. The aroma has a little citrus together with the house yeasty note. Itâ€™s the same in the mouth where there are earthy floral notes. Itâ€™s pretty reasonable.

Cask, Last Plantagenet, Leicester. Amber gold with an off-white foam. Aromas are biscuit and toffee malts with oranges and spices. Some grapefruit with floral aspects. Flavours are toffee malts with tea and light oranges. Sweet pineapple chewits sweets with hints of nuttiness. Traces of sulphur and some yeast. Dry on the finish. A tasty low alcohol beer.
Cask at the Regal (JDW), Cambridge. Amber with a ring of white head; straightforward fruity aroma; thin and watery with some sweet malts; and a light herbal bitter finish. Rather ordinary.
Cask @Sir John Oldcastle (JDW), Londres 01/12/2018 Color ambarino espuma blanca, aromas especiados, sabor maltoso, cuerpo medio.

On cask at the Standing Order. Appearance - golden with a light haze. White head. Nose - orange and malt notes. Taste - more orange barley water. Light pith finish. Palate - light bodied and dry through the end. Some creaminess in the middle. Overall - ok.

[Cask at the Old Manor (JDW), Bracknell] A hazy amber pour with a thin white head; slightly spicy aroma with perhaps a whiff of cinnamon; sweet in the mouth with a grainy taste and body; then a thin dry finish with a peppery bitterness. Rahter odd.

Cask Pint at Wibbas Down (JDW), Wimbledon, London in Dec 2012 - Amber in colour. Malty; sweet malts, caramel. Fruity; some citrus fruit, lemon. Hoppy; slight grassy hops. Sweet malty fruity throughout. OK. Drinkable. (2012-12-06)
Tried at the Felix Holt, Nuneaton. As Banks & Taylor Santaâ€™s Slayer. Golden colour with a thin white head. Aroma berries and light citrus, taste sweet, to mid bitter.
Cask @ a spoons. A low boost golde thatâ€™s anorexic on body or palate, and quite frankly not very festive. A gimmick name and concept. Flavours of bready malts, lemon hops, citrus. Really mundane.

Cask handpull at The Crosse Keys Bishopsgate as â€™Banks and Taylor Santaâ€™s Slayerâ€™. Golden yellow clear still foamy white head. Aroma is bready, light citrus. Body is smooth with soft carbonation. Taste is grainy, white bread, gluey, dusty, light bitterness. A nice and very drinkable balanced golden bitter. Looking through the ratings consistency might be a problem, but very good on this showing.
Bit bland. Grassy and mild malt. Hint of sulphur doesnâ€™t help. Really nothing special.

Cask at The Moon Under Water (JDW), Watford on 29 Nov 2012. Poured a clear copper, with a scummy white head. Aroma was very light; some malt, grass and berries. Caramel and dried fruit flavours, with a little spruce hop bitterness. Finish was honeycomb, straw and hop resin.

2nd January 2013 Market Porter. Clear amber beer, good cream coloured head. Light palate, softish with mild fine carbonation. Nice! Creamy malt. Mild tangy orange hops. Not bitter! Semi dry finish. Just a whisper of sulphur but otherwise a decent Christmas ale.
Handpull at the Greenhead Hotel. Fine as a weak-ish session bitter, nothing spectacular but nothing special.
Cask at ealing. Frothy white good mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. Moderate malty and light hoppy aroma. Light bitter flavor. Short light bitter finish. Watery palate.

Cask (handpump) @ GBBF 2012, Great British Beer Festival, London Olympia, Hammersmith Road, London, England W14 8UX. Clear medium yellow orange colour with a small, frothy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is light to moderate malty, toasted - caramel, butter. Flavor is moderate sweet and light bitter with a average duration, buttery, malty. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is flat. [20120807]
cask at GBBF 2012 ... golden amber ... soft sweet orange fruit nose .. soft sweet honey and orange ... soft fruits ... little custardy in finish.

Cask@GBBF2012. Golden colour with small white head. aRoma is butter, some tartness, mild sulphur and rubber with some floral notes. Flavour is sweet malts, rather butter and some toffee. How can this be served at GBBF? Need to taste again, when found.

Cask at GBBF 2012. Had to have a Northumberland beer to complete the English county set; wish I hadnâ€™t had this one. It may have been not quite in the best of nick. Aroma of stewed or tinned pineapple, some sweet cloying malt, hard to finish even a GBBF third! Give them the benefit of the doubt and say it was the barrel....
Cask conditioned at Harbury Beer Fest â€™07. Gold with white head, hazed. Smooth, caramel laced dullish bitter. Boiled malt flavours but not much bitterness. Nothing much to describe really.

A straightforward session bitter. Gold/amber colour. A touch of undeveloped malt in the aroma. Slightly grassy and a bit thin. Perfectly acceptable, but not a lot going on. Cask (handpump), Market Porter, February 2005.
Cask at the Market Porter, Borough Market, London. With Chris_o and joet. Golden, sparse head. Very light buttery aroma. Flavour is extremely bland with a touch of butter and a harsh edge.

7/6/2018. Bottle from CentrAle, Newcastle. Pours ruby brown with a small beige head. Aroma of sweet malt, fruit, prune, caramel and moderate roasting. Medium plus sweetness, light to moderate bitterness. Medium body, oily texture, average carbonation. Not bad, but not as good as the cask version I had yesterday.
Awesome color, no foam, malty body with initial sweet taste followed by slightly roasted notes.

Bottle from Aldi, Washington. Copper-ruby red coloured with a very thin white head. It has a dried fruit, malty and burnt toffee flavour followed by currants and a nutty, bitter-sweet finish. Not bad.
Bottle. Ruby Red in colour. Malty (toasted malts, caramel & toffee). Lightly fruity (apple). Thin. Sweet malty throughout. Easy drinking but bland. (2008)

500Ml bottle. Poured a crystal clear medium amber with a frothy white head. The aroma is sweet sugary malt, creamy caramel. The flavour is moderate sweet, light bitter with a smooth rich woody resin hop bitter palate. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Butelka 500ml. Ciemnobursztynowy kolor. Piana bezowa mala szybko redukuje sie do zera. Karbonacja srednia do wysokiej. Owoce.orzechy slaby posmak lukrecji. Carmel lub toffi. Przypomina troche rozgazowanego bocka. Daje rade MarcinG

500ml bottle from local Aldi - Clear deep red body, thick short-lasting white head. Nose is a bit half-hearted, some fruit, some caramel. Taste is more of a solid presence, buttery caramel, toffee, and red fruits. Not bad.

Bottle, from Aldi. Red brown, thin but lasting white head and good condition. Initial sweet toffee and caramel in the nose, with a hint of smokiness developing, some buttery notes and a hint of hops.
