In the mouth it is slightly metallic and fruity with a little raspberry and some gentle buttery toffee notes before developing a slight biscuit note and some earthiness. Finish has a little dry earthy hop bitterness and some fruity berry notes lingering.

Pours copper red colour, small yet lingering tan colour head. Aroma is slight berries, metalic, strong malt. Taste is medium sweet but not very bitter. Quite strong artificial carbonation present. Finish is mild. That sounds like a bad beer ut it isnâ€™t, just nothing special
A Toffee sweet aroma, and a sweet malt flavour . Finish is too sweet for me.

Rather boring looking fizzy drink. Oh, and head is already gone before even first sip. That was quick. Color is light. Look brings sima (mead) to my mind. Damp smell. I immediately remembered some earlier non alcoholic beer I had, which was dreadful. But this one has better, thou quite bad taste. This liquid is watery and tastes contaminated. Never the less this is not bad enough that I would pour glass away.
Bottle@Home. Rhubarbre aroma. Pale golden colour, white head, good lace. Very sweet, rhubarbre, bisquits, light bitter. Quite yuck!

(Bottled) Very pale yellow with a small, lightly lacy head. Aroma of corny malt, cardboard and plastic. Plasticky flavor with boiled corn and wet cardboard. Very light-bodied and watery with lemonadey, quite high carbonation. A true masterpiece in the noble art of brewing ... not! Donâ€™t take me wrong: I like organic and non-alcoholic products, but this is not what Iâ€™m searching for in beers.
Bottle. Pale yellow colour with absolutely no head. Bad grainy aroma and taste.
Bottle. This is probably the worst beer I have tasted besides chillibeer. Smells like rodent dong. Almost no head. Ugly.
Bottle. Small head with short duration. Color is pale yellow. Aroma is awful and smells like rabbit feed. Taste is not much different.
some colror, no head, seems to be a soda,...no beer hints at all.
Bottle at home. This tastes like less than 1 percent alchol. Sweet, like other weak ones, and way too corny.
(bottle) Clear deep yellow colour, short frothy white head. Sweet corny aroma with cooked carrots. Sweet carrot taste, light bodied, unpleasant harsh, slightly artificial finish.
Decent, frothy head. Worty and sugary aroma. Sweet, worty flavor. Watery. Drinkable when served very cold.
Bottle bought in Germany. Drunk a bit after Best before date. Some yeast aroma similar to Belgian beer. Light color. Not very special.

FÃ¼r den Sommer sicherlich ausreichend, aber eigentlich nur ein simples Helles, das nur aufgrund einer leichten SÃ¼ÃŸe und der dazugehÃ¶rigen Vanillenote von einem Pils abweicht. Getreidig, trinkbar, mittelmÃ¤ÃŸig.

Pours out of the bottle in a clelar golden colour with low airy head and medium body. Aroma of hops and straw. Taste of mild hops, light malt, straw, hay, milld fruits and grains. Refreshing and easy drinkable yet nothing special.
Ins Glas ergieÃŸt sich ein goldgelbes Bier mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Geruch malzig, getreidig, leicht herb. Geschmack malzig wÃ¼rzig, getreidig, minimale Bitterkeit.
0,5 l bottle BB 24. Jan. 14 pale yellow color, clear, minimal head, white foam, bread, Metallic, cereal, herbs, light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, soft carbonation,

Itâ€™s beautiful yellow golden with a white head. The aroma has notes of flower, fresh grain and fresh baked bread. The flavor has a light sweetness and notes of fresh grain, flowers, light straw and bread, and the finish is fairly dry. Itâ€™s very pleasant!
Clear golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and grainy. Flavor is medium sweet and light bitter.

Bottled, from biershop-bayern.de. Clear deep golden, mid-sized head. Fruity salty nose. Medium bodied with rounded mouthfeel. Solidly malty with creamy ripe fruits, mild salty spicy bitterness. Meaty malty helles.
Bottle. Blonde. Malty bready aroma with a hint of butter. Bready soft grassy hopbitter flavor. Hints of grass and malt in the aftertaste. Medium to full bodied.

Bottle. Golden, small to average and fully diminishing head. Light to moderate malty - grainy and sweetish aroma, light grassy hoppyness. Medium, malty - lightly grainy and sweetish flavor and light grassy hoppyness with light bread. Finish is short to average, malty and lightly sweetish, some herbal - grassy hoppyness, faint bread. Lightly sweetish helles - OK hoppyness, but really nothing special.
Bottled (thanks Bov!). Yellow colour, mediumsized foamy white head. Aroma is mainly corn and sweetness. Flavour is paper, hay, corn and slight malts. Almost no bitterness at all.
Blond color. Cheap aroma of corn beer. Useless taste, with a minimum structure, some sweetness, low bitterness.
Bottled. Pale golden with small head. Neutral, sweet and tasteless. Low bitterness.
golden-orange colour, few head, medium hoppiness, grainy, alochol, sweet and tart with a dry, grainy, plastic-like finish

Bottle 275ml. @ chriso Post-GBBF Tasting 2014. [ As Courage Ceremonial Ale ]. [ Vintage 1981 ]. Clear medium amber orange color with virtually no head. Aroma is light moderate malty, pale malt, oxidide, fruity malt, damp stain - fusty, raisin and plum notes. Flavor is moderate sweet with a average to long duration, sweet malt, old malt, oxidide, fruity. Body is light medium, texture is watery, carbonation is flat. [20140816]

Bottle shared at chrisoâ€™s Post-GBBF Shindig 2014 - London. Vintage 1981. Pours mostly clear, amber-gold with a creamy white head. Heavy oxidation on the aroma, with accents of ripe citrus, caramel and bread. Medium sweet flavor, lightly metallic, with some jammy fruits, orange, more bread. Medium bodied with fine carbonation and creamy texture; great condition for the age. Sweet finish with hints of earth and more sugary toffee. OK.

Bottle shared at Chrisoâ€™s post GBBF minidig, 16/08/14. Aroma is sweet raisin and dried fruit, carboard and nutty malts with some hot alcohol. Clear golden coloured pour with no head. flavour is pappery, oxidised, some ash, dull sweet malts, sugary. Probably was a little dull to begin with. Palate is medium sweet, very dull. .

Bottle shared at Chrisoâ€™s post GBBF minidig, 16/08/14. Clear rich golden with moderate off white spotting. Nose is oxidised, must, dark fruit, dates, raisens. Taste comprises light spice, oxidised notes, fruit cake, dates. Medium bodied, fine carbonation, tangy dark fruits and oxidised pangs in the close. Ok considering the age, 33 years!

Bottle at chrisoÂ´s shindig 2014. Vintage 1981. Clear golden/amber beer, no head. Malty vinous aroma, caramel, grapes, earthy notes. Vinous flavor, caramel, earthy, dust, hay, bread, earthy notes. Not totally undrinkable after all these years.

Bottle - Vintage 1981 - Long live the Queen....Light Apple vinegar and vinous. Cloudy orange and copper with a thin white head. Paper, cardboard and even some sweet notes. Not good, but not undrinkable.
1981 bottle, amber with a small head, nose has honey, toffee and a musty off note, overly sweet with marzipan notes and little hop character left, but still drinkable.

Bottle at the Shoulder of Mutton 21.06.12 shared by Peter Fowler, cheers Peter. Amber in colour, decent clarity with just maybe a touch of haze from the sediment. Suprisingly sweet, there is a touch of oxidisation. This seems a stronger beer than it is which with no abv listed on the bottle I assumed it would be 6-7% but a quick search I realised it was 4.8%. ithere was no A6 A3 T7 P3 Ov12 3.0

1981 vintage; courtesy of Thomas and Philipp - hazy amber colour; no foam; caramel and madeira in the nose, notes of marzipan; medium-bodied and with a moderate carbonation, decent bitterness; long malty, caramelish and portwine-like finish - impressive after all those years!

1981 Bottle from the Wedding of Charles and Di. Aroma was fruity and boozy, but the pour had me disappointed right away. It was a very viscous and cloudy brown. My suspicions were confirmed upon tasting; This has long gone bad. Total drain pour because it no longer tasted like beer. It just tasted, well, awful. Spoiled.

Tap at pub. Looks exactly like the ipa, orageish with no head or lace. Super flowery but in a fake, Glade or cleaner sort of way. Tastes like youâ€™re drinking a candle. Maybe too much heather? Donâ€™t remember this beer being so potent.

My Bottom Line: Flowery heather notes bloom throughout the humble blond ale base of this crisp and very drinkable session ale. Further Personal Perceptions: -A veil of foam tops the lightly hazy blond. -The body is lean and the carbonation rather prickly. -The heather flavor is well levelled; obvious but never bothersome. -Bitterness is very low, and this finish is even a tad watery at times. -This is somewhat reminiscent of Dieu du Cielâ€™s RosÃ©e dâ€™Hibiscus in its flavor profile and aroma, but the witbier base of the DDC beer is much more appropriate imho. On tap at the brewpub.

Draught pint at the brewpub, October 14 2007. It shows a clear, oily amber-gold with no head to speak of....the nose is faintly herbal, grassy and peppery, with perhaps a touch of diacetyl though not enough to totally ruin it....body is again herbal/bitter, sweet, somewhat syrupy, grassy and oily towards the finish....low carbonation and thick mouthfeel make it slightly tough to drink....not bad, I rather enjoyed it by the finish, but nothing Iâ€™m likely to drink again, either.

Poured with a nice initial head and good lacing rings. The aroma was of, surprise, heather, more than anything else. The flavor followed suit, but this thing had some sort of a sweet candy type influence, almost coming across soda-pop-like, heater soda or something. Very strongly carbonated, too sweet, and that heather stuff in there too (all too much).

Aroma is light tree bark, and although I smell mint, Mike the brewer says itâ€™s just heather and honey. The honey blossoms are really pronounced and come right up to the front. There is still the issue of spiciness what I am calling spearmint. So very well done, I am really impressed. By far the best heather ale Iâ€™ve had. Iâ€™d drink this often.
on tap at the brewpub. Clear amber pour with no head. Malty aroma, very faint. Light body, floral flavors, but not overpoweringly sweet. Easy drinking, low carbonation. An interesting change of pace.

3 ounce sample at the brewpub. Aroma is interesting...cant really put my finger on it...lots of floral, sweet, and fruity notes in the nose. Mildly hazy copper color with virtually no head--ugly beer. Floral berry-like aroma...perhaps juniper berries are present as well? Lots of this floral flavor to start, with a bit of licorice to follow. Finishes thin and pretty bland and flavorless.
Very interesting ale. Award-winner and probably deservedly. A bit too fizzy for me, but itâ€™s a very refreshing winter beer.

On draught Feb 2005 at the brewery. Copper colored beer, with a small off-white head, good retention. Mostly clear body. Aroma of leafy, fuzzy, dry, astringent heather and little else. Not a very intense aroma. Flavor is even worse, with a sharp, spritzy carbonation and a dry, almost meaty-like flavor. Soured and yet light, maibockaddict isnt offended, claiming it is a good summer ale. I agree, but I guess I was looking for something more substantial. Perhaps Iâ€™m ruined by Town Hallâ€™s version, but this one didnt cut it. Very oddly, it has a medium to medium-full body, with a chewy sweetness and lots to ponder as you drink it. It took me a while to finish, as I wasnt a big fan of the veggies and meat. Maybe Iâ€™m just crazy. . .

On tap: Hazy amber hue with orange tint. Small white head with almost no lace. Aroma was like a Witbier but got heather notes instead of wheat and not as spicy. Detected some earthy yeast, grain, banana, dust. Old school. Twangy and earthy taste up front with a smooth herbal dry finish. Light to medium-bodied with a creamy and lively mouthfeel. Damn, a near carbon copy of Fraoch Ale but even better, fresher makes it so. Don't let the appearance fool you, this beer rocks! Works great with clam chowder. Medal winner at the GABF.
WARNING, Not one of the 12 GREATEST BREW! I have to sample all 12, as my wife got this for me and with her not liking ratebeer as it is, I want her to think she did good. The thought counts. Drap

A novel idea. "12 greatest beers of the world". But, no let's make a batch of amber bottle it and put different labels on it. OK, not quite true, but The differences between these beers, even though said to be different style was scary. All would have done well in a amber ale competition.

Man.. I WANTED to like these beers. A great idea to do a multi pack with this theme. The packaging was nice and informative.. and I like for beer to come in pint bottles. ;) But the smell and taste is sour. All the beers in the pack taste alike and have some odd nuclear red/orange color. It smells and tastes foul. I will say that some are less foul than others in this pack... but this isn't one of them. I read here someone saying they would rather drink Budweiser and I scoffed... I no longer scoff.

Good Fucking Christ. That about sums it up, but I was acknowledged that there is a seventy five character minimum to a rating and therefore I will continue you writing this sentance until I reach seventy five. Some beers can be summed up in a few words, there is no need for more brutality.
As with the rest of the beers from this sampler pack - this was terrible. Orangeish pour with a decent head - but the taste is just plain bad or nonexistent - I can''t decide.

Part of the "12 Greatest Brews of the World" sampler pack found at my local Wal-Mart. If this is one of the "best beers", I would hate to try the worst. Actually this wasn''t awful, it just doesn''t really taste like anything. Pours an orange color with a thick foamy head and thin lacing. Aroma is indeed creamy. There was really nothing to the flavor at all, it was mostly sweet creamy carbonation. I guess no flavor is better than bad flavor.

Deep amber, looked like cinnamon, but holiday spice flavors are muted--perhaps I shouldn''t have been looking for them. Well rounded and smooth, showing its alcohol a bit more than other high-abv beers from Free State.

Really delicious stuff. Along the lines of Boulevard's Nutcracker Ale, but a lot more of everything. Less of a spiced beer than a strong ale. This is the hoppiest beer Free State offers. It is also very creamy, with a nice dry finish. This is a nice varied hoppy beer with plenty of malt to counterbalance the bitterness. RERATE, 12/15/02. I admit to rating this last night off of a few healthy sips. I liked it a lot, though, so we got a growler today. Even better than I remembered--a fiery orange red color with a smooth buttery texture. Very spicy. This is a unique beer; I've never had anything quite like it. You just have to try it to understand.

A blend of lightly citrusy fruit, pine, nut and light caramel in the aroma. Bright red color, clear with a short-lasting white head. A slight amount of candyish, berry-like fruity malt sweetness, followed by deep, earthy, hop flavors and on into the spicy, dry finish. Aftertaste holds some malt sweetness and piney hop. Medium body and rather light on the palate, not too carbonated. Tasty and flavorful.

I actually liked this one better than the Boulevard Nutcracker...it seemed to have more flavor to me or perhaps it just stood out more, as this was the first beer of the night. Fairly complex and I'll get this again before its gone.

Bottle at Beerdock Leek. Pours a clear golden colour with a medium white head. Aroma of bready malts, a little lemon and slight spicy, herbal hops. Taste of bready malts, grain, slight lemon and subtle spicy, herbal hops. Light bodied and moderate carbonation. A crisp and dry, spicy, herbal hop bitterness in the finish. Typically dank initially then German hops and malt. Decent Helles.
En udemÃ¦rket pilsner af lidt stÃ¦rkere karakter. Den har fin maltsÃ¸dme og en god smag af humle.

500ml bottle from beershop.bg, drunk at home on an icy January evening. Pours crystal clear with a finely fluffy head that lasted a minute before settling to a surface mist, heavy lacing and persistent rising carbonation. Straw in colour. On the nose, faint flowers, herbs and hay over a base of biscuity malt. In the mouth, high carbonation initially gives a frothy mouth feel that soon gives way to thin, dry bitterness, bread and biscuity malts predominate the flavours with hints of floral honey, before a short, metallic bitter finish. Overall, just another dull example of a dull style, but with no major flaws, it could be crisp and refreshing at the right time and place.

Clean lager smells over a malt vinegar tinge on the nose. Very enjoyable, mild lager to drink. I'd put this on a par with their Landbier and Kellerbier--big fan of this brewery--though not up there with their stellar MÃ¶nchshofs Original Pils. You get that lovely Bavarian malty flavour, some light ryebreadiness, and subtle hop notes round the sides of the palate. Slightly watery and innocuous, but I could drink this all day.

Bottle. Light to moderate grain and bread for the malt, light herbs for the hops, light dough and dried leaves for the yeast. Head is small, frothy, white, with a spot or two of lacing and is mostly diminishing. Color is sparkling clear gold. Flavor starts faintly sweet and slightly acidic, then finishes lightly acidic and faintly bitter. Palate is light, watery, with a lively to fizzy carbonation. Straight up Helles, that is in perfect balance and is real easy drinking.
Heller, trocken wÃ¼rziger Antrunk. Geringe IntensitÃ¤t, sÃ¼ÃŸlich, wenig herb. Langweilig. 10/6/5/6//6

Off white head, clear light golden body. Aroma of mild caramel, grass, mild grainy bread. Taste has mashy grainy caramel and strawy dry hops with a quite malty papery finish. Slightly thin on palate. Easy quaff - no diploma. [33cl.btl.BB17.06.16]
Below average Helles. in my opinion too low on hops and too sweet for my taste.

Bottle sample. Clear light yellow with medium white head. Floral aroma with some corn sugar and some graininess. Simple lager flavor with some graininess and corn sugar, light sweetness and sourness. Moderate carbonation, light-bodied.
Schuim snel weg, gebroken wit en gele kleur. Troebel. Weinig geur, ik ruik iets maar weet niet wat. Zoet en zacht begin, eindigt met een lichte bitter. Maar is over het overgrote gedeelte zacht.

column1: Big River Grille Disney World Gadzooks Pilsner
column2: Lake Buena Vista, Florida, United States
column4: Big River Grille & Brewing Works Lake Buena Vista (CraftWorks)
column5: 3-4 oz pour on draft at Big Riverâ€™s Disney World location. Clear straw yellow with off-white head. Aromas of lemon citrus, floral, wheat. Tastes of floral, wheat, a little butter. Light body with a dry finish.

column1: Big River Grille Disney World Gadzooks Pilsner
column2: Lake Buena Vista, Florida, United States
column4: Big River Grille & Brewing Works Lake Buena Vista (CraftWorks)
column5: Tap. Pours clear pale amber, medium white head, nice lacing. Aroma is grassy, grain, bit of citrus, breads. Light sweet, medium bitter, a bit harsh. Light body.

column1: Big River Grille Disney World Gadzooks Pilsner
column2: Lake Buena Vista, Florida, United States
column4: Big River Grille & Brewing Works Lake Buena Vista (CraftWorks)
column5: on tap at the Disney World brewpub (2013); gold color; malty aroma; slightly sweet, malty pilsner

column1: Big River Grille Disney World Gadzooks Pilsner
column2: Lake Buena Vista, Florida, United States
column4: Big River Grille & Brewing Works Lake Buena Vista (CraftWorks)
column5: Golden amber... Thin white lacing... Soft dry floral fruitz... Juicy citrus... Light dry orange peel

column1: Big River Grille Disney World Gadzooks Pilsner
column2: Lake Buena Vista, Florida, United States
column4: Big River Grille & Brewing Works Lake Buena Vista (CraftWorks)
column5: Poured a dark palm yellow color with aromas of light citrus, malt and a touch of floral notes. Flavors are the same floral hops a basic pilsner that is slightly better than a macro.

column1: Big River Grille Disney World Gadzooks Pilsner
column2: Lake Buena Vista, Florida, United States
column4: Big River Grille & Brewing Works Lake Buena Vista (CraftWorks)
column5: Golden with white head...decent lacing. Citrus, lemon, and mild floral aroma. Medium bodied, nice hop presence, medium bitterness with a dry finish. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

column1: Big River Grille Disney World Gadzooks Pilsner
column2: Lake Buena Vista, Florida, United States
column4: Big River Grille & Brewing Works Lake Buena Vista (CraftWorks)
column5: Tap at Big River. Crystal clear golden pour with a small white head. Slightly buttery, pils malt, fairly crisp. Okay for style.

column1: Big River Grille Disney World Gadzooks Pilsner
column2: Lake Buena Vista, Florida, United States
column4: Big River Grille & Brewing Works Lake Buena Vista (CraftWorks)
column5: Sampled on draft this beer poured a dark golden color with a large foamy off white head that faded quickly and left great lacing. The aroma was faint with touches of dry nuts, cardboard and a hint of perfume. The flavor was dryish and a bit nutty with faint perfume and vague fruits hops. The beer turned a bit sour and off on the long finish of cardboard, nut and perfume. Medium body. Disappointing.

column1: Big River Grille Disney World Gadzooks Pilsner
column2: Lake Buena Vista, Florida, United States
column4: Big River Grille & Brewing Works Lake Buena Vista (CraftWorks)
column5: Pours a light yellow. Taste is light malty with a German type of yeasty flavor. Crisp finish. Not bsd ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

column1: Big River Grille Disney World Gadzooks Pilsner
column2: Lake Buena Vista, Florida, United States
column4: Big River Grille & Brewing Works Lake Buena Vista (CraftWorks)
column5: Draft. Amber beer with a dark cream head. Light spice aroma. Mineral and spice flavor. Medium bodied. Spice and malt linger with light mineral notes.

column1: Big River Grille Winters Nip Winter Porter
column4: Big River Grille & Brewing Works Chattanooga (Craftworks)
column5: Draft. Pours a Dark brown color with an average fizzy tan head that was lasting and produced good lacing. Medium spice and toasted chocolate malt aroma. Medium body with a smooth texture and flat carbonation. Moderate spice sweet flavor with a medium sweet finish. Drinkable seasonal beer.

column1: Big River Grille Winters Nip Winter Porter
column4: Big River Grille & Brewing Works Chattanooga (Craftworks)
column5: strange Maine type gray mangled brew with metal and a sharp finish that is dry and tangy. lots of guys like this and i used to like it more before i found my favorites. some hop, some malt eehhh.

column1: Big River Grille Winters Nip Winter Porter
column4: Big River Grille & Brewing Works Chattanooga (Craftworks)
column5: Had this on tap at Urban Stack. Decent beer, did not seem much like a Porter but more like a bock.

column1: Big River Grille Winters Nip Winter Porter
column4: Big River Grille & Brewing Works Chattanooga (Craftworks)
column5: 11/14/12. On tap at Seven Bridges in Jacksonville, FL, thanks to Aaron the brewer! Cleer deep brown pour, plenty of red under the light, with a big creamy tan head that cuts but coats the glass fully. Light milk chocolate and sweet malt on the aroma. Creamy milk chocolate taste with some roasted bitterness, hop bitterness and character, and a touch of acidity. Light bodied, smooth, and easy drinking. Tasty stuff, actually!

column1: Big River Grille Winters Nip Winter Porter
column4: Big River Grille & Brewing Works Chattanooga (Craftworks)
column5: On draft at Seven Bridges. Pours an amber color with an off-white head. Nose is toffee, cherries, slight vanilla, and a hint of spices. Flavor is similar with hints of yeast and cherries in the finish. Nice, malty holiday beer.

column1: Big River Grille Winters Nip Winter Porter
column4: Big River Grille & Brewing Works Chattanooga (Craftworks)
column5: Iâ€™m guessing this was the holiday porter, since there werenâ€™t any descriptions and the waitress said it was their seasonal "dark". Whatever. Not bad, watery, decent roasted malt but too sweet with a very mild, forgettable finish. Better than my sandwich.

column1: Big River Grille Winters Nip Winter Porter
column4: Big River Grille & Brewing Works Chattanooga (Craftworks)
column5: Had on tap at the Nashville location as Winter Porter, given the new designation of a Winter Bock it seems like the Winters Nip designation isnâ€™t so much a beer of its own anymore, only a seasonal name. So Iâ€™m putting this here. Dark brown-red, dark tan head. Roast aroma, sweet and bitter chocolates, cocoa, caramel sweetness. Roasty, chocolate taste, full body. Light roasty bitter astringent finish.

column1: Big River Grille Winters Nip Winter Porter
column4: Big River Grille & Brewing Works Chattanooga (Craftworks)
column5: The aroma is a bit off but has all the basic elements of a porter, toasted malt, coffee, and chocolate (all be it very weak). The appearance is brown with a small head. The flavor is like the aroma but not yummy. The palate is thin. Overall not one of my favorites.

column1: Big River Grille Winters Nip Winter Porter
column4: Big River Grille & Brewing Works Chattanooga (Craftworks)
column5: Draught, Seven Bridges Dark brown. Nice chocolatey aroma. Lightish body is nonetheless fairly smooth. Chocolatey notes. Decent example.

column1: Big River Grille Winters Nip Winter Porter
column4: Big River Grille & Brewing Works Chattanooga (Craftworks)
column5: Opaque black with nice tan head and mine came with a horseshoe design for good luck. Very nice chocolate and charcoal aroma with lots of chocolate malt. Soft and creamy mouthfeel. Lots of smoke in the finish, adding to the nice flavor profile. Toasty too. Not complex but a solid brew.

resin, floral, grass, spruce, citrus, herbs, clear, hazy, cloudy, sparkling, rocky head, frothy, minimal head, white foam, tan foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, salty, medium sourness, medium bitterness, medium sweetness,

Goldgelb im Glas mit sehr kurzlebiger Schaumkrone. 40% weniger Alkohol als das Pils. Bitterer Antrunk, maischig wÃ¤ssriger KÃ¶rper mit fehlender WÃ¼rze, der Hopfenextrakt im Abgang macht dieses Bier fast untrinkbar.
For a low alcohol beer really good. Nice color, aroma and a balanced quite pleasant taste.
Ins Glas ergieÃŸt sich ein goldgelbes Bier mit ordentlicher Schaumkrone. Geruch leicht malzig, getreidig. Geschmack leicht malzig, getreidig, leichte Bitterkeit.
bottle, kindly sent by kappldav123. Clear pale yellow, small white head. Shy and timid malty base with some quite aromatic hops, grassy and resiny. Due to that quite nice!

(bottle) pours a clear golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of grass, herbal hops and cardboard, with a hint of white bread. flavour is mostly straw and herbal hops, very meaty, with some heavy popcorn in the light-bitter finish. light to medium-bodied with average carbonation.
WÃ¤ssriger Start, gefolgt von einer bissigen, leicht scharfen WÃ¼rze, die unangenehm ist. Der trockene, bittere Hopfenabgang ist metallisch, nicht gut.
Bottle. Pale gold with a thin head. Aroma of grain and malt. Flavour is watery grain with a light bitter finish
Yellow colour with a white head. A bit sweet malty and grassy nose. Light waterish and grassy flavour.
light dry hoppy aroma,pale, clear, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, fizzy, dry finish.

A glass from my neighburgs bottle BiÃ¨re ambrÃ©e au style Old fashioned. La mienne est pÃ©rimÃ©e depuis 5 ans. Son nez restÃ© puissant exhale de fortes senteurs caramÃ©lisÃ©es de malts pales, avec un bouquet Ã©picÃ© dominÃ© par la cannelle . En bouche le caramel moyennement sirupeux bien lourd rend la langue collant au palais accompagnÃ© dâ€™un fort goÃ»t dâ€™oxydation aigrelet voire acerbe. Ce maltage encore vigoureux net et de bon aloi, se finit sur une sensation sÃ¨che quasi rapeuse laissant un grain sur la langue Ã©picÃ©e et argileux. Presque pas dâ€™amertume: quelques notes herbacÃ©es fluettes mais agrÃ©ables

Bottle sampled at Essen Winterbier festival 2015. Appears very hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma of perfume, sweat, urinal cakes and yeast. Flavour is moderate sweet and light moderate bitter. Medium bodied with light carbonation.

Sampled @ Kerstbierfestival Essen 2015. Hazy yellow color, small white head. Aroma is malts, a bit sweaty. Taste malts, again a bit weird, in between perfumy and sweaty somehow, weird. Donâ€™t like it. Not very nice.

Bottle at the Essen Winter Beer Festival, 2015. Poured a hazy straw colour with a round bubbly white head. The aroma is yeast, light perfume, light fresh fruit. The flavour is moderate sweet with a yeasty, pear, sweet malt, sugar palate. Medium bodied with average carbonation and a bubbly mouthfeel.

75cl bottle. Clear light amber colour with a small white head, that quickly vanishes. Fruity - mostly grapes - yeasty and vinous aroma. Soft to average carbonation and medium to light body. Taste is more sweet at start, then after and with some sourness in the aftertaste. Overall, a strange beer with some strange aftertaste, but drinkable.

Little-known Belgian Christmas ale of limited production. Irregular, off-white head on a deeply peach blonde-coloured, cloudy beer; nose gets banana, floral hops, vanilla, caramel, pear brandy, whisky; taste fruity and yeasty with a light hop bitterness and warming alcohol in the end. The low ratings here surprise me a bit, but then I tasted it many years ago when it had just come onto the market and possibly the quality has declined since then - in other words, time for a re-rating when I find another bottle.

75 cl. bottle sampled @ Kerstbierfestival Essen 2013. Limited to 900 litres, brewed in Feb in 2013. Yet another new BE brewery for me, I thought that I had done at least one beer from the majority of BE breweries, Essen proved me very wrong by presenting me lots of beers from breweries I had never heard of before. Clear orange / golden with no head. Smells of sweet oranges, carries an infection, slightly boozy, fruity, something off courtesy of what appears to be an infection. Taste is bitter & infected, sour tang, bitter spices, hay, berries & flat. Questionable whether or not this should be even sold but so are things with beer.
Pours clear blonde no head at all Smells grainy malts , bit floral good carbo Bit medicinal , sweet . Some grains
Golden brown with a white head. The aroma is full of wheat and apples. Flavor is wheat, apples, honey and assorted Christmas-time spices. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation.
Bottle thanks to bu11zeye. Dull orange with a ring of white head. Aromas of Belgian yeast, fruit, and alcohol. Incredibly hot for 7% - thin as well.
Bottle SB Torslanda 2019-11-22 GÃ¶teborg AR: sweet yeasty, sponge AP: amber hazy, frothy beige deminishing head F: rich carbonated, dry, wee banana, flour, Belgian yeasty,
Mahogany colored, large beige head. Aromas of yeast, bananas, alcohol and brown sugar. Taste of yeast, bananas, brown sugar and spices.
Aroma is caramel, peppermint candycane, â€tutti fruttiâ€, and some sour notes. Taste is sour, toast, caramel, spices, and heavy on marshmallows.

Kryddig doft, lÃ¤tt syrlig. MÃ¶rkt bÃ¤rnstensfÃ¤rgad. Karamell, lite torkad mÃ¶rk frukt med kryddig syrlighet. FÃ¶rsiktig, avslutande beska. Ser ut som en dubbel men med sin lÃ¤ttare kropp grÃ¤nsar smaken till kategorin tripel. Gott!
Bottle 75cl label "winter beer", a dark amber beer with good head. Nose on caramel and sugar, aroma is very nice on dark candy sugar, toasted caramel.
Ambar limpia de espuma blanquecina. Aroma a pasas y bizcocho. Ligera en boca, de poco cuerpo y gas. Tono dulce. Muy malteada, acaramelada con contrapunto seco, frutos secos.

75cl bottle at home, bought at Van Erp, Groningen. Appearance: clear dark brown with medium sized off-white head. Aroma: caramel, soy sauce, sweet malts, rose water, red fruits.Taste: high sweetness and medium bitterness. Notes of brown sugar, bready, sweet malts and some dried fruits. Palate: medium bodied, oily to sticky texture and medium carbonation. Overall: meh. Wouldnâ€™t see myself buy it again
Nice strong belgain tripel, tastes a bit more like a dubbel to me with its caramel malts so forward. Some slight spice that makes it nice for the winter. D&S Dresden
Muy similar a su cerveza brune, no tiene sabor a belga y predomina la madera.

[Thank you for sharing!][750 ml. bottle sampled @ O.B.E.R. Kerstbierfestival 2016] Dark amber, little tanned head. Nose is cooked vegetables, green vegetable with some cough syrup. Taste is thin fizzy sugar, herbal, soap, vegetable, grain, bread, herbal. Body is fizzy, thin, grainy, vegetable. Not very pleasant.

22 dec 2013, bottle. Dark orange, clear, some steady bubbles. Nose is sweet bread and white grapes. Thin body and fizzy. Tastes like white grape juice and sweet strong ale. No yeast bite. Very good. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Hazy amber with a thick white head.Spicy and fruity notes. High carbonation, malt, spices and a metallic taste. Medium body with a short, bittersweet finish
Hazy amber with a thick white head.Spicy and fruity notes. High carbonation, malt, spices and a metallic taste. Medium body with a short, bittersweet finish.

Bottle. [vintage 2002]. Bought @ Kulminator, Antwerp.Pours a light hazy red copper. A small, light creamy white head. Aroma is round, a little sweet, some caramel. Quite high carbonation. Just a slight touch metallic at first, but then a good dose of sweet caramel, lightly vinious flavours appear. Very well-balanced.

A Sim rate (Bottle from the Kulminator): Peach and honey in the aroma. Very full flavoured. Tastes very fruity... like a good beer version of summer fruit squash. Finish is all sweetness with a slight hit of red grape. Appearance rate would be higher but lacing does not stick at all. Malt, hops and alcohol in the nose too. Obvious strong ginger in the flavour.

At Kulminator, best before 2004. Amber coloured with a small white head. Light caramel yeasty aroma with some smaller older madeira touches. Full palate. Finish is smouth, light sweet, just a little bitter, ending shorter. Lost just a bit of its body, but is still enjoyable.
Every year I taste this. (en note my taste) Amber colour and a creamy head. Malty yeasty aroma with a hint of caramel. Fairly carbonated. Slightly bitter finish. Brewed to the end of the year.

Very flowery aroma indeed, quite sweet and fruity (apple). Cloudy, amber-orange coloured with a nice lasting frothy head. Taste is flowery and sweet, a little sour and some fruits (apple). Quite okay.

Orange color, huge frothy head. Fresh, hoppy, somewhat flowery aroma with a hint of vanilla. Hoppy vanilla flavor with just a bit of the typical Flemish sourness. Orange, even some milk. Well carbonated. Maybe a bit thin, but a complex beer, full of surprises.
Amber coloured, nice lasting head. Malty and quite fruity aroma and flavour. OK brew. Damn, i cannot remember very good, only that it was quite ok, but not brilliant.

Very unusual winter beer since it comes from a very low-profile brewery which otherwise produces only table beers. Vinous, spicy, sweet and honeyish, light acidity; unlike most other Belgian Christmas ales, but I liked it. Not sure if they still do this every year, though.

Bottle in an ancient 75 cl swing top bottle, this beer from one if the very few relics left of ancient Wallon brewing. Golden color. Yeasty, vegetable and musty aroma. Dusty, slightly grassy and musty flavor with melon. Hints of caramel. Dirty mouthfeel. Too bad. I wanted to rate this beer higher but I simply couldnâ€™t. Maybe it doesnâ€™t travel well.

Bottle @ Kerstbierfestival 2006 in Essen, BE. Light amber color witn no head. Aroma of malt, hops and apple (honey ?). Flavor is sweet like cider / honey, with a short finish. Freesh but special taste.
Bottle at Kerstbierfestival, Essen. Clear. Red copper, no head to speak of. Malty aroma. Fruity flavours, some apple, quite refreshing, though on the sweet and spicy side.

Bottled (as Gigi La 1900 SpÃ©ciale). Clear pale amber, less head than on a glass of Coca Cola. Aroma of butterscotch and honey. Sweet with clean, hard mouthfeel. Interesting dicrete notes of tobacco, peach and roasty malt. No bitterness. Very unual with itâ€™s complete lack of head and hard mouthfeel, but only halfway succesful.

Bottled, at Essen Kerstbierfestival 2004. Amber, thin white head and moderate condition. Low caramel and gentle hoppiness in the nose, Soft sweet and understated in the mouth with touches of honey, a slight fruitiness and some grain. Low sweet honey notes in the finish.
Amber coloured. Oranges in the aroma. The flavour is very strange, harsh and earthy. It leaves a bad taste in your throat.
Cloudy, amber coloured beer. Sour, slightly rotten taste. Bitter finish. Not my cup of tea.
very strange beer, sourish aroma, a litlle bit of diacetyl,, also hints of freshly baked bread. taste as of none-beery drink, flavours of spices, especially sweet woodruff and honey.

Deep copper coloured Christmas beer, unspiced contrary to many of its congeners, dried fruits, caramel, some roasted bitterness, smooth mouthfeel, subdued sweetishness and hop bitterish finish. Good but somewhat forgettable - which is too bad, since it is apparently not made anymore.

Draft at Farmers Cabinet. Billed as "Noel de Coeur" but a bit suspicious as this supposedly retired a few years ago. Dark orange red pour with a frothy head. Lots of lace. Sugar plums. Candied ginger. Fig neutons. Merlot. Celery seed. Rasin pie. Gently sweet but mostly dry. Complex subtle flavors. Thankfully missing many of the overpowering spice flavors of most Christmas beers. Very nice!
On tap at Moeder Lambik. Dark amber body with puffy head. Nose is quite bitter. Flavour of malts, caramel. Bitter in the finish. Quite good.
Lightly sweet malty aroma, like a dubbel. Deep brown in color with a nice soft off-white head. A soft medium bodied beer. Lightly sweet taste with a touch of earthy hoppiness. A nice beer.

Dark maroon color with a small white head and delicate lacing. Aroma of caramel, prunes and light spice. Flavor of dark winter fruits, malt and caramel. Good body. Interesting example of the style, worth trying.
Dark brown with red accent, nice light beige foam. fine and fruity aroma with hints of caramel chocolat and coffee. Taste is smooth, slight sweet with fruity and toasted notes.

It poured a avery dark amber liquid with a small dirty white foam. Smell an dtaste of wood, nuts, red wine, grapes, dried fruit and yeast. Sweet with a medium smooth mouthfeel, a bit dry at the finish. Nice and interesting.

Draught at Akkurat, Stockholm. ABV 7.5%. Dark hazy reddish brown with a firm beige head. Spicy and rather vinous aroma of cardamom, orange-peels, dark chocolate, yeast and almonds. Medium to full-bodied with notes of nuts, cardamonn, muscat, sweet anise and roasted malts. Dryish, compact finish of almonds, orange-peels, roasted malts and cardamom.
Draught at Plan B. Clear red/brown - offwhite head. Sweetness, high sweetness, light spicy, caramel, berries, light nutty, raisins, high malty, ligh hoppy. Too sweet...
Draught. Medium high creamy off-white lasting head. Hazy dark red brown caramel nut berries vineous aroma. Vineous spicy plum raislin flavor. Little carbonation. Long aftertaste.
Smooth malty beginning. Mild with yeasty beginning and cake hints. Nice with smooth sweetish hints.
Bottle shared with Erzengel! A hazy orange brown beer with a small beige head. Aroma of herbs, spices, dark medium sweet malt. Taste of sweet caramelish malt, ginger, herbs.

330 ml brown bottle. Some sediment left in the bottle. Pours with a clear copper body topped by a respectable off-white head. Medicinal aroma with a hint of fruit vinegar. The very tart flavor carries some of this but is a bit better than the aroma suggests.

Bottle sampled at Essen Christmas Beer Festival â€™16. Listed as â€œWinterbierâ€ but described as being a rebranded version of â€œKerstbierâ€. Cloudy golden with an off white head. Aroma big herbal notes, veggies. Flavour is moderate sweet and bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

This rating concerns the original version of this beer, tasted at 8 months of age in 2005, when the brewery was still run by Eric Ameye. The bottle did not have a label... Pretty firm, yellowish white, moussy, regular head and dark burgundy colour, cloudy. Weird aroma of tomato, meat broth, brown sugar, cloves, liquorice, balsamic vinegar, sherry, dough. Sweetish taste, fruity esters, tomato, yeasty, dark malts, something â€™umamiâ€™ and meaty, smooth, with low hop bitterness. Very strange but not really that bad - compared with the other original Gaverhopkes, at least.
Voor een kerstbier te zijn vond ik het net iets te weinig smaak hebben. Spijtig maar net niet
Dark orange with almost no head. Very tart with lots of sediment. Dark fruits, light malt. Not sure whether I got a bad one, or if it just sat too long.
Amber and clear. Aroma of apples. Slightly carbonated. Tastes cider like. Dry finish. Would prob go well with sausage thatâ€™s spicy.

330 ml bottle at home (taken from notes 25/03/2011) - pours cloudy orange with a fizzy off-white head. Aroma of sweet malts, honey, and some citrus. Taste is a strange mix of malts and spices, and a tad too sweet for my taste. Weird beer.
Bottle @ bandlys blÃ¥lys. Clear amber body with a small white head. Aroma is bay leave, potroast and spices. Flavour is bay leave and spices. This is quite weird.
Pleasant best bitter. Pours clear darkish golden. Very thin head and little aroma. Malty and hoppy.

Pours a clear golden coloration with a large, creamy head and visible carbonation clinging to the glass. Smells of doughy, grainy malt and hints of grassy hops. Taste follows the nose, being dominated by doughy, grainy malt and hints of grassy, herbal hops, with a slight mineral note as well. Finishes with a medium bitterness and some grains lingering in the aftertaste. Smooth mouthfeel with a light body and medium carbonation. A decent Golden Ale that is crisp, easy drinking and refreshing, with a good bitterness, but slightly unpleasant mineral note.

500ml bottle into pint glass. From ALDI, Riverwood. Pours a clear bronze colour with fine carbonation. Large crown of foam on top. Faint aroma of grassy hops, a little smoky. Surprisingly effervescent with some herbal bitterness then finishing with dark caramel. Easy-drinking thirst smasher. Very much a Northern English beer.

F: medium, bit tan, not long lasting. C: amber, light hazy. A: malty, sweet cereals, grassy, fruity, biscuits. T: malty, fruity, bit soapy, grassy, bit biscuits, peach, floral, medium body and soft carbonation, dry on the palate, ok for the style, not bad and not great, enjoyed, 0,5l bottle (4,5%) as â€œBlack Sheep Golden Sheep Aleâ€ from â€œ't Iengels Wienkeltjeâ€ food store in Ostende.

24Aug2018 Sweet grain and cereal malts, caramel, hay, straw, biscuit. Slightly hazy gold, medium, creamy, white head. Light bitter. More grain and cereal malts, caramel, more straw, grass, soft carbonation, medium bodied. Alright but boring. Bottle from Tesco, Amersham.
4.7%, gold colour with a thin head, sweet citrus hop aroma, slight fruit and bitter hop taste, nice beer.
Fruity hop aroma. Malty taste, slightly sickly sweer finish. Good malty aftertaste. Nice enough
very nice golden colour , with malty caramel aroma . tastes nice . well balanced beer

Pours golden amber, light carbonation with a small white head. Nose is biscuit, grass, sweet and slight lemon zest. Light and sweet in the mouth. Malty, biscuity taste with a buttery sweet toffee and slight copper coin finish. Ok.

Bottle. Pale Amber in colour. Malty; biscuity malts & caramel. Hoppy, grassy and spicy hops. Fruity; citrus hints. Good balance. Sweetish malty with mildly bitter, dry, finish. Easy drinking. Sessionable. (2009-03)

Deca Services brews this beer for the dutch brewery-hirer ''Rotterdamsche Bierbrouwerij''. Though it is an ale, it has been given the character of a dark bock: sweet and spicey. Overall, it gives an impression of "speculaas", a Flemish spiced cake speciality, in a rather bland, liquid version.

Cans from Belgium. Wet and gold. Nose of chlorine, match boxes, freshly polished tables, some grass and sweet corn relish. Somehow sappy and not bad but with meaty sweet refuse notes. And chlorine. Corn and crackers. Sulphurous. Vile. Quite nice.
Can from Lidl. Pours straw yellow, quite bitter just a tad too sharp. Of course watery but no off flavours. Standard but not really premium

Zeker niet verkeerd voor de prijs maar ook niet de beste pils wat je aan kan treffen. Moutig redelijk bitter, maar kon voor een pilsje wel iets bitterder zijn. Goed doordrinkbaar en op de kleur en schuimkraag valt niks op aan te merken. Helder geel met een witte top erop. Maar smaakt overall gewoon minder, mis gewoon het vreugdes component waarvoor je deze op een feestje zou uit schenken. Aan de andere wie heeft na het derde biertje nog door dat je bij de Lidl shopt. ;-) Proefglas
Viel Pappe, eine ganz dumpfe, aufdringliche Bitterkeit gepaart ohne positives zu hinterlassen. Besonders der Abgang ist grenzwertig.
33cl bottle. A clear pale golen beer with a huge most good lasting white head. aroma of moderate sweet grainy malt, cereals, old hops. Taste of metallic bitter hops, cereals, grains, meh...
Simple fresh pils style beer from Lidl, brewed in Netherlands. Plain, no big expectations.
De geur valt goed mee. Niet heel veel schuim. De smaak valt mee voor een supermarktpils.
Clear as day. Nuclear yellow with a somewhat puffy head. Aroma is very faint but it has some grain. Taste is a bit metallic and has a lot of vegetables.
3 3 3 2 6 Bottle shared at home. Clear golden with a white head. Aroma of grain, light malt and metallic notes. Flavour is light sweet and bitter. Light bodied with light carbonation.
Bottle shared at kermis's, kind courtesy of Maakun. Clear golden with white head. Sweet malts, glue, butter, beans, cardboard. Moderate sweet and light bitter. Thin body and average carbonation.
From old tasting notes. Auburn liquid topped by a foamy beige head. Sweet toasted malt aroma remiscent of baked bread. Tangy sweet malt flavor has decent balance from a spicy hop finish.
WARNING, Not one of the 12 GREATEST BREW! I have to sample all 12, as my wife got this for me and with her not liking ratebeer as it is, I want her to think she did good. The thought counts.

A novel idea. "12 greatest beers of the world". But, no, let's make a batch of amber, bottle it and put different labels on it. OK, not quite true, but The differences between these beers, even though said to be different styles was scary. All would have done well in a amber ale competition.

I detected alcohol in this one!!!! Yes, hidden behind wet dog aromas, dumpster juice palate, and incredibly bad looking glass full of urine-yellow "beer". I drank my glass full. You should all be proud of me. We passed a sample of this down to the end of the bar (we took our twelve pack to the bar for kicks- and sample with the bartender) and the sucker who tried it said, "this tastes like Guinness". He obviously works for the piss poor brewers at Gluek.
Well, after tasting this I would have named it american brown shit. Shameless. This is yet another of the so called twelve greatest beers.

As with the rest of the beers from this sampler pack - this was terrible. A bright orange nut brown. Unbelievable. Tastes the same as all the other beers from this pack. It is very hard to discern between the scottish ale, the stout, the porter and the nut brown. They taste and look like almost the same beer. Crazy.

Part of the "12 Greatest Brews of the World" sampler pack found at my local Wal-Mart. I really wasn''t surprised that this beer was not brown after trying their Scottish Red Ale which was orange. This was orange too, with a thin off-white head. Barely any malt aroma. Flavor was nothing to write home about either, alternating between sour and lightly malty. Faintly nutty dry finish. Another loser.

(Draught) Pours a hazy golden body with a medium off-white head. Aroma of florals, plastic, dried apricot, citrus, and Peeps Easter candy. Flavor of Peeps Easter candy, herbs, light citrus, and florals.
Clear amber color/ ivory head. Nice pale malt, light fruit, dry spice aromas. Medium body. Decent, but too sweet flavors of light fruits, pale malt, spices, nice hoppy twang to finish--

On tap at CB Potts Fort Collins poured a clear tarnished gold with a lasting ivory head. Aromas of wheat, yeast, orange zest, ginger and a hint of coriander. Palate was light to medium bodied and crisp with a smooth dry finish. Flavors of wheat, orange zest, ginger and a hint of coriander with a smooth dry lingering spiced finish.

On tap at Northgate RAAM. Hazy yellow colored beer with a thin lasting head. A little spicy tart wheat in the aroma. Tart dry flavors of citrus, wheat, spice with some yeasty esters in the finish. Dry finish with a moderate tartness.

Draft at the WABL 3rd anniversary party. Brewed by the Northgate Ram. Cloudy medium yellow. Slim white rim. Big sharply sweet green apple nose. Watery body. Green apple mid-palate. Slightly fruit sour finish. More like a bad wit than a bad saison...very frustrating and disappointing. Didnâ€™t expect to try something from the Northgate Ram that was this far off the mark.

Pint - Ram Big Horn - Kent, WA Aroma â€“ Nice earthy floral malt aroma with a lingering of hops. Appearance â€“ Straw gold in color, clear, with a thin head. Flavor â€“ Great malt flavors with some nice spices and added floral hops to add to the flavor. Palate â€“ Great Mouthfeel, Good texture with a dry finish. Overall â€“ This was a very nice Saison beer. It is a hard beer to brew and not over power with hops and they did a great job.

Draught @ Brouwerâ€™s CafÃ©: Dark straw, somewhat hazy, large foamy white head, moderate carbonation, fairly nice lacing. &nbsp Tart floral nose, a little smidgen of straw or grass. &nbsp Soft tart grassiness on the tongue, has an airy floralness, a little musty. &nbsp Had you given me this and said it was an American brew, I would have said get outta here! &nbsp More tart/floral than bready, which I seem to find with most American examples, but not this one. &nbsp Fairly dry as well. Dave, yer doing one hell of a job over there!

Multiple samples, GABF 2006 (as South Hill Saison, made at the Puyallup, WA location). Body is medium to dark yellow. Aroma is lightly to moderately malty (toasted grain), lightly to moderately yeasty (cobwebs, mold), with notes of clove, lemon, plastic, and dried apricot. Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly to moderately bitter. Finish is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly acidic, moderately bitter. Medium body, watery/velvety texture, lively carbonation. Pretty good, and from Big Horn even.

(Westminster, CO, C.B.& Potts) Clean, fresh, yeasty nose. Moderately carbonated. Subtle spices with hints of banana and clove; big bubblegum flavors too. Finishes bitterish and a little dry. Warming alcohol sensation. Nice lace patterns. Not the best malt flavors; kind of light. Overall, extremely drinkable, but not enough "Belgian" ooomphh.
From old tasting notes. Amber orang color topped by a creamy beige head. Faint sweet malt aroma. Tangy fruity malt flavor. Faint hoppy finish.
WARNING, Not one of the 12 GREATEST BREW! I have to sample all 12, as my wife got this for me and with her not liking ratebeer as it is, I want her to think she did good. The thought counts.

A novel idea. "12 greatest beers of the world". But, no, let's make a batch of amber, bottle it and put different labels on it. OK, not quite true, but The differences between these beers, even though said to be different style was scary. All would have done well in a amber ale competition.

Banana Republic label, stale Coors Light with cigar tobacco, vegetable oil, and recyled newspaper additives. The sad thing about this whole rating is the fact that I will end up in the top fifty raters becuase of this twelve pack. Guilt builds, but I'm downthing them (at least my taster glass full)!!

I am not sure how to differentiate this from the rest of the carbonated vomit in this twelve pack... wait wait.. I will not just cut and paste.. I will mention that this is the least offensive of the swill-medley. But to call it a pale ale is like calling a sheetrock screw a watermelon.
All I can say is that there was a cool elephant on the cover ..............
As with the rest of the beers from this sampler pack - this was terrible. Fizzy golden orangish slightly hoppy - and I mean SLIGHTLY. By far the worst IPA ever.

Part of the "12 Greatest Brews of the World" sampler pack found at my local Wal-Mart. I have to give credit to the labels of these beers because they are actually quite informative. You can learn a lot about how particular beers are made and how they get their names. Unfortunately, the knowledge to glean only serves to make you realize how horribly wrong these beers are compared to what they should be. Case in point: This beer pours a dark yellow color with a thick white head. Slight floral hops aroma. Probably the least hops bite in any IPA I have ever had. This is still one of the better Old European brews I have had though, because it is not as sour and dry as the others. Still a pathetic rendition of an IPA though.

Sampled cask conditioned at Oliver Twist, Stockholm, Sweden. Black with beige head. Really roasty. Surprising sweet creaminess. Am I imagining the wheat malt flavour? Medium body with a short blast of salt and a lingering licorice flavour. Pleasant dry bitter finish. Yummy!!

Bottle at Benâ€™s over christmas. What a drink! Garvie just kind of grabbed it and started opening it. I though he was joking until it was clear that he wasnâ€™t. A totally wonderful cider with a pure undistilled apple flavour. So delicious and festive on a cold evening. Cheers Ben.

Bottle at bens... Oh wow... Massive thanks... Light copper red... Massive dry apple pie nose... Dry apple fruit... Light apple skin tanins... Juicy apples.. Light tanins... Light dry apple.. Light spiced apple

Bottle @ tasting. Aroma is malty apples with caramel, toffee and more apple. Flavour is huge sugary apple caramel alcohol tangy fruity zesty madness. Wow. Not sure if I like this, but definitely special.

On tap at Dieu du ciel. The color is a hazy gold with a thick beige head.The aroma is of herbs and fruits.The taste also of herbs like anis,nutmeg and others as for fruits it was mostly bananas.The finish in the mouth was bitter but not to much.

Un verre Ã  MontrÃ©al. 5.3%. Une robe jaunÃ¢tre et opaque. Un col mousseux modÃ©rÃ©ment gÃ©nÃ©reux. Une dentelle. Un nez bien occupÃ© par les Ã©pices. Un doux parfum de blÃ© acidulÃ©. Une banane Ã©crasÃ©e, des herbes et du citron. Une fois bien tempÃ©rÃ©, lâ€™anis se dÃ©voile davantage que la muscade. Des saveurs a priori fortes en muscade et pratiquement mentholÃ©es par la prÃ©sence de lâ€™anis. Des houblons qui surprennent et toujours cette banane qui traverse le chemin de mes papilles. Post-goÃ»t moyen et aux notes sÃ¨ches, composÃ© de notes amÃ¨res de levures fruitÃ©es (zest dâ€™agrumes) et Ã©picÃ©es avec quelques traces dâ€™alcool. (automne 2006)

Aroma as mentioned has anise, some bitters and gin, (didnâ€™t get nutmeg) hazy yellow, tiny white head, lace. Flavour of wheat is overwhelmed by anise and nutmeg mix, seems like lemon gin, a bit unusual, for my taste, but I applaud the novelty here. Another unique offering.

Tap at the Brewpub: Pours cloudy light yellow with minimal white head. Zesty wheat dominates the nose, with a touch of old lemon peel and dusty phenols. Crispy feel with a perfumy/citric flavor. Touch of lemon peel here as well, with a anisette suggestion and a white pepper presence as well. Pretty good, not great.

Lightly hazy golden yellow body with a creamy white head (3+). Moderate licorice and anise notes in the aroma, tough to tease apart spices. Stronger anise in the flavour, with a milder nutmeg partners, and light bitterness in the finish lingers in to the aftertaste along with the anise. (8+) Average palate is pleasantly effervescent. I very much liked this one, but I donâ€™t know that I could consume more than a glass or two in a sitting.

Cask at Tap & Barrel, Olympic Village Near black, with generous compact head. The aroma is mild, lightly sour. Lean body, soft, lowly carbonated; the flavor is very chocolatey, much better than ash-forward sister beers. Correct bitterness. Light lactose feeling, light residual sweetness. On cask, very enjoyable!

2008-10-15. Very dark brown black body, nice beige head fades. (3+) Aroma of tangy acidic roast. Flavour has tangy acidic overtones, mild roast, some interesting highlights. Average to thin bodied palate is rather light for a porter. More acidity than I would like to see, and I suspect more than was intended by the brewer as well.

9/7/08 On draught at Las Maragaritas, Vancouver, BC. Aroma is quite chocolatey, somewhat smoky with a light creamy sweetness. Appearance is dark brown with a moderate maintained cream colored head. Flavor is sweet, slightly sour malt forward with medium sweet roast bittering. Mouthfeel is medium-full bodied with a moderate carb texture. Overall, this is a great porter for people that like malty sweet beers.
Roast sour nose. Fairly dark, creamy brown head. Chocolaty notes on a honey malt base. Earthy, infected ? lightbodied, mellow moutfeel.

Donâ€™t know if this is still available but used to drink it often. A decent, quaffable beer that is, as other raters have noted, under-carbonated and a tad sweet. However, the mild palate is a nice change of pace from the overcarbonated microbrews usually available in Vancouver.

Draught, drank at Chambar in a container akin to a glass of Coke and way too cold but I am too thirsty to wait for the beer to warm up, in fact, I have to keep my hand on the glass to get its temperature up and my hand is freezing!, savoured on February 8 2007; eye: black, opaque, creamy beige head, no effervescence; nose: odour reminding me of Cheetos, slight roasting, a bit of caramel; mouth: rather faint taste profile, a hint of acidity, silky, creamy, really short finale with a taste reminding me of cheese, fizzy, medium body, a bit thin, the cheese feeling remains even as the beer warms up; overall: disappointing, all about the look but not much in terms of nose or mouth FRANÃ‡AIS En fÃ»t, bue chez Chambar dans un contenant ressemblant Ã  un verre Ã  Coke et bien trop froide mais jâ€™ai trop soif pour attendre quâ€™elle rÃ©chauffe, je suis obligÃ© de garder une main sur le verre pour rÃ©chauffer la biÃ¨re et ma main est en train de geler!, savourÃ©e le 8 fÃ©vrier 2007; oeil : noire, opaque, mousse beige crÃ©meuse, pas dâ€™effervescence; nez : odeur me rappelant les Cheetos, trÃ¨s lÃ©gÃ¨re torrÃ©faction, un peu de caramel; bouche : profil de saveurs plutÃ´t faibles, petite pointe acide, soyeuse, crÃ©meuse, finale trÃ¨s courte avec une pointe de saveur me rappelant un peu le fromage, pÃ©tillante, corps moyen, un peu mince, impression fromagÃ¨re se maintient mÃªme lorsque la biÃ¨re gagne en tempÃ©rature; en rÃ©sumÃ© : dÃ©cevant, tout en apparence mais pas grand-chose au nez ou en bouche

Pours a dark purple-black with virtually no head. Strong aroma of blackberries, maybe some dark cherry in there somewhere, too. Tastes of dark and amber malt (not particularly roasty) with slight hopping, and a sweet blackberry & plum taste, aftertaste of pumpkin seed. Body is thin and water, low in carbonation (from the tap at Dentryâ€™s!) Nice tasting beer, but a bit too sweet, thin, and under-carbonated.

(Bottle) Shared at the PNW Christmas 2006 party at Oakes on December 9th. Thin white head with a deep brown body. Nose of sweet coffee. Flavour is smooth with a bitter cocoa and leafy undertone. Somewhat uninspired.
Dark brown appearance with a thin tan head. Odd sort of fermented smell. The taste was definetly off I donâ€™t know how to decribe it other than "fishy". I may have to try it again.
Dark amber brown colour. Slightly spicy, coffeeish, almondy aroma. Slight, thin body is toasty with a bit of coffee.

Hard Liver 08. Too bad this one was obviously bad because it seems as if it was one a nice brew. Dark amber pour with a nice head. The aroma has notes of cinnamon, pumpkin spice, pickles, medicine. The flavor is vinegar, sour, spicy like lotion, soap or cologne. Pretty much god awful.
had at hardliver fest at brouwerâ€™s in fremont. tasted a bit syrupy like cough medicine.

snifter @ beverage place barleywine bacchanal - 2006 vintage; clear and ark copper; aromas of stale malts and sour juice; drinks like bad ginger ale; maybe past its prime and i couldnâ€™t finish even the small glass

Dark cherry red. Flat w/ no head at all. Minty floral aroma...smells like this Czech liquor called Becherovka(floral with a bit of anise). First impression of the taste is a bit of chocolate mint! Slight alcohol kick...almost a medicinal taste, but not in a bad way. Very different, but I love it.

Tap: Light head and lacing. Amber color. Nose of fruit and esters, strong grape and raspberry notes along with the citrusy hops and caramel malts. Sweet and strong, syruppy. Finishes strong. Good and fairly smooth.

Draught Chestnut-amber, no head. Very hoppy & portwine aroma; alcoholic nose, fruity & grapey. Lots of ethanol and higher alcohols. Cardemom. Quite bitter taste, with sweet, fruity, vinous and foremost alcoholic undertones, cakey. Chewy mouthfeel, very full bodied. Definitely good, but it seems a bit just want too much to BE a barley wine "If we donâ€™t meet al 35 style requirements plus American hops, weâ€™re not gonna make it"...
Bright amber...pretty beer. Curranty, soapy aroma. Big, sweet, chewy barley wine with a lot of toffee and earthy hops. Assertive bitterness...you could mistake this for Big Foot.

2006 Vintage - This is a fine example of what the NW is doing with its Barleywines. A sweet malty aroma, along with a hop aroma that is somewhat musky and resiny, and some caramalized brown sugar, vanill frosting notes in the flavor, with a very well balanced malt character. Very nice.

Tap at the 2006 Hard Liver Festival. 2006 vintage. Rich garnet colour, thin white head. Aroma is of sweet chewy malts, subtle cascade hop aroma, brown sugar. Malts are clean and well balanced. A fairly typical PNW barleywine. Good body. Some light anise notes and peppery alcohol.

An alluring amber appearance with a creamyish amber head. This beer was almost cloyingly sweet of cherries. However, the flavor is a bit unbalancedly sweet. I anticipate that this beer would age well and better reconcile the disparate elements. A barleywine with potential, but did not strike me well with this particular tasting.
Canned. Very pale, very thin. A wonder that they can make such claims on the can and then deliver sucha a sad product. No bad taste, just nobody home!

Can, 2007. Very clean, clear golden with a medium, foamy head. Sweet malts, and starch complete the aroma, oh boy... Sharp, thin mouth. I was hoping for something special in this seasonal, but isâ€™s just another tasteless macro from Japan. Theyâ€™re all the same.
2006; reads "rich taste" than "winter is wonderful" / not offensive, and quite quaffable, but i canâ€™t see myself sucking down a pitcher; fizzy and grainy, generic tea, light yet noticeable.

Of the four new Japanese Macro's I tasted in this sitting,this one was the least offensive. A typical "yellow fizzy" beer with Rice and Corn starch adjuncts (There's your bad smell Nesta). The Japanese always like to try new things, be they electronic gadjets or beers. These are all pretty much the same bland beers in new eye-catching packaging with slick campaign ads to capture the young new beer drinker. No talking frogs though.

Winter might be wonderful but this is absolute rubbish. Really stinks. Easily the worst smelling beer I''ve encoutered. The only thing I can say for it is that it tastes better than it smells - but not by a great deal.

Butterscotch Scents dominate the aroma of this fine seasonal brew. The tasting yields both the butterscotch flavoring as well as vanilla overtones. Smooth finish ends clean without too much sweetness. Overall an great seasonal beer!

Draft before Christmas: Poured a reddish amber with a nice head. The aroma was Christmas in a bottle, lots of spices. The flavor was nutmeg, cinnamon, clove, and sweet malts. Overall, it was a just that, a holiday cheer.

Reddish-amber color with a very spicy aroma that features some sugar & cinnamon. Flavor is sweet, bready and spicy with Nutmeg, allspice, and some cinnamon. OK. but toning down the spices would improve this one.

On tap at the brewery. Sour vinegar and tart fruity nose on this, with some soy sauce. Odd tangy quality to this one for sure. Smells like a sour ale more than anything, with some woody presence. Dark cloudy amber-brown, with thin off-white head. Medium watery body with medium carbonation. Quite an interesting mix of flavors - reminding me of the fruitcake taste from an early-90s Amry MRE. Cranberry and orange peels, cinammon and a nutty bitter quality, clove, and sweet short bread. Very interesting and Iâ€™m not sure if I could drink a lot of this. Mild fruity tart finish with little bitterness. Not bad, but not a fave.

Transparent dark copper amber with ruby hues and a nicely-lacing off-white froth of head. Aroma of sweet ginger and clove with some caramel malt and a touch of nutmeg. Body starts thick and well-spiced with a good bit of earthy dark caramel and some lightly tart cranberries. A good holiday ale with nice complexity of flavors and balance.

On draft at the brewery: pours a dark reddish brown with a bit of a spicy aroma but I didnâ€™t pick up much more than that, taste was nutmeg with a cinnamon lingering aftertaste - but not very strong. I actually thought this was pretty good.
On draft at the Inn. Poured reddish brown with minimal head (as usual) that left the slightest of lacings. Flavor consisted of malts with some spices, nutmeg, cinnamon and cloves.

This years batch was brewed w/ the second runnings of a 275th anniversary brew that will be released in 2007. The abv is bumped up from the posted amount(now 8 %)...man that anniversary brew must be potent as heck. I canâ€™t wait! Appears a murky, reddish brown, with a 2 finger, tan head that slowly fades out. Lots of lacing is scattered around the pint glass. Smell is of the anticipated cinnamon, cloves, nutmeg, allspice, highligted by cranberries. I was also getting a whiff of juniper berries in there but all those mulling spices may just be playing tricks on my mind before the holidays arrive. Taste is of the mentioned aromas in a slightly fruity, malty, brown sugar infused flavor that seems to be what they were shooting for. Mouthfeel is medium bodied, spicy, smooth, with decent CO2 levels that lead to a semi-dry finish of cinnamon and nutmeg.

On tap at the GLI. Poured a medium, cloudy reddish-brown color with a smaller off white head. Aromas and tastes of malts, fruits and spices. Nutmeg the stronger spice with cinnamon. The body was a little thin. Tasted on 11/20 (the 2nd runnings tastings). Cinnamon definitely stronger this time around. 8% very well hidden. My ratings on my notes were close enough that Iâ€™m not changing it...

Spices galore in this one. Unlike many spiced holiday brews that taste like a lager with pumpkin spice thrown in, this beer all the spices compliment and blend perfectly. Nice light malt, and the cinnamon finish lingers well after the glass is empty.
Clear deep golden with a pretty white head. Aroma: pilsner malt, spicy and vegetal hop. A bit dusty. Similar taste. Clean. Light plus bitterness. Ok.
Botella 500ml Dorada con espuma blanca,fina,cremosa,alta,bastante resistente.Aroma malta,herbal.Sabor malta, suave dulzor y amargor que se abre luego bastante intenso,herbal
500ml bottle from Bliznetsy in Moscow. Pours dark gold with a small white head. Aroma is sweetish, honey, stale malt. Taste is metallic and papery. Light hoppy finish.

[Thanks to Cuso]. Bottled. Golden colour with an average formation of a white head with short duration. Aroma is a little sweet with mild notes of malts. Flavor is grassy, notes of hay and sweet maltiness. Final slightly bittery.

30/07 0.5 l bottle brought from Bratislava. It poured a golden body with quite big head. Decent honey and fruity malt aroma, a bit dusty. Unfortunately, flavor didnâ€™t follow it, it was still sweet malty, but far from elegant with very pronounced metallic note. Some hops, but only a little bit. Medium to thinner body with shorter, a bit papery and honey finish. Wouldnâ€™t be so bad without these unpleasant components, but this way is far from a decent Bohemian pils, not even mentioning too few hops.

Tesco, Bratislava. Golden body, white head. Dusty, yeasty sweetish nose, a bit stale. Ok slightly heavy maltiness with a herbal hoppy flavour thatâ€™s lovely until it turns into light metal. Dusty. Meh, succeeds at some points, fails at others. Messy... not bad, not good.
fÄ¾aÅ¡a from Cuso - dâ€™akujem! Clear golden yelow, mid-sized white head. Fruity nose. Medium-bodied, malty, slightly grainy with some shy, dry hops in the finish. Fruity touch throughout.

(bottle) Slightly unclear, pale golden colour with a medium-sized foamy white head. Sweet and perfumed malty aroma with shy hints of butter. Sweet flavour, light to medium body with a slightly stale carbonation. Mildly buttery malt-character with a tinge of cardboard and a shy hoppy touch; sweet and slightly bitter hopper finish with a buttery malty touch. Drinkable but not great. 09.11.11

500 ml bottle. Trade with Cuso. ÄŽakujem vÃ¡m! Clear pale golden colour with small white head. Sweet fruity aroma with some malt and tiny of hints of metal in aroma. Flavour is mild malty with weak notes of grassy bitterness and dry hay. Short aftertaste. Drinkable.

Bottle (Obchod s Cusem!): Golden, a bit unclear, mid-sized pretty stable and lacy white head, perfumed nose, also bready and buttery notes and some lonely hops underneath; moderate sweet-bitter flavour, light to medium bodied, soft; short perfumed and buttery-papery finish. O.K. .....
I drank this beer some time ago. Adding rating now from what I remember the taste of this beer was â€“ light, nothing specific.
Ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnieÅ„ z degustacji w ramach uzupeÅ‚nienia profilu.
Wpis archiwalny. Oceny sprzed zalozenia konta na ratebeer. Diacetyl, karton. Wodnisty, przegazowany. Fuj.

Jak siÄ™ byÅ‚o gÃ³wniarzem, to siÄ™ go ciÄ…gle piÅ‚o. W aromacie mokry karton, trochÄ™ sÅ‚odu. W smaku mocno nagazowany wodnisty koncerniak z lekkim diacetylem. Wtedy uszÅ‚o, dziÅ› nie wziÄ…Å‚bym do ust zapewne.
Just found some ancient incomplete notes only with numerical values.Drunk during a visit to Krakow .
Clear, golden color. Short lasting white head. Aroma is lightly malty. Light body, watery. High carbonation.

500ml can (24hr store, Warsaw) - Online Shitty Beer Night 2 WTF? - brussel sprouts! And some hits of perfume. 2 Pale ,brief head 2 Utterly vile retronasals. I just canâ€™t describe half of them, but later I get recognisable enemies like chalk and old dishcloth. Taste does hint towards having some yeast-induced esters, but they come over as unpleasantly chemical and industrial. OK, thatâ€™s mold in the retronasals, Iâ€™ve got it now. And thatâ€™s spring onions in the taste - nice! (not) 1 Typical strong lager body, carbonated sweet water. Rough as fuck. Acidic. Post-vomit levels in fact. 3 I hate myself. But at least I can piss away the guilt in the morning.
Bottle. Pours clear light golden with airy white head. Clear aroma of grass and booze. Watery, slightly bitter taste with no remarkable finish. Just boring.

50cl bottle from a Polish shop in Andover. Pale straw with a thick white head; the aroma has some faint grassy hops and some sweet cereal grains; the flavour is surprisingly fruity, unmistakeably pineapple, and rather full bodied, although soapy; the finish has some warmth from the alcohol, and is rather sticky from the sweet fruit; but overall this is a pleasant surprise.
Lightly watered taste of bitterness. Some weird sour and hoppy nutes in palate. White foam, disappearing very fast. Golden colour. Not too good beer
Ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnieÅ„ z degustacji w ramach uzupeÅ‚nienia profilu.
Ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnieÅ„ z wczeÅ›niejszej degutacji tego piwa.
Wypite przed kilkoma laty, nie jest juÅ¼ produkowaneâ€¦ Ocena przepisana z notatek.
Just found some ancient incomplete notes only with numerical values. Drunk during a trip to Krakow.

Can 500ml. [ As Wojak Mocny ]. Clear medium orange yellow color with a small to average, frothy - fizzy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, white to off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, grain, sweet malt. Flavour is moderate sweet with a average duration, sweet malt, marzipan malt. Body is light to medium, texture is watery - oily, carbonation is soft. [20140222]
Bottle@PapsÃ¸ - yellow to gold pour with a thin white head. Aroma and taste is sweet bready malty, grassy, corn cardboad, metallic, medicinal, bit basic.
Can. Pours a clear golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty grainy aroma. Fruity malty grainy dry flavor with weak grassy hints. Has a fruity malty grainy dry finish.
Can at PapsÃ¸. Clear golden coloured with a medium sized white head. Sweet and malty aroma of alcohol. Sweet and malty flavour of caramel and alcohol. Alcoholic finish.
Canned. Golden coloured. Unclear. Fluffy light beige head. Aroma. Grains, sweetness, light grass. Flavour. Grains, sweetness, grass, herbs. thin bodied ends grainy bitter.
50 cl can. Pours clear and golden yellow with a small white head. Aroma is toasted malty and mild metallic. Toasted malty and metallic. Dry, bitter and toasted finish.

This is supposed to be a raspberry version of their Wits End. Hazy reddish yellow. Very sharp raspberry/alcohol aroma, almost a little whiskeylike. Crisp, slightly effervescent, with raspberry turning into wheat as you go from aroma to beginning to finish. Seems to be a very inspired beer; the raspberry and wheat go together quite well. The amount of raspberry perfectly asserts its presence without degrading any of the beer qualities. I can see how this would be a hit-or-miss, but it was definitely a hit with me.

[Tap] Golden colored pour with some haze to it. A small white head on top. Nose is of crisp and spicy malt alongside floral hops. Rye bread, pale malts and fleeting hints of juniper berries round out the taste. Prickly carbonation. Could have used more juniper actually. Tasting notes from 12/2011.

On tap at the brewpub... Pours a completely transparent amber brown hue , homogenous throughout, and topped with a thin wispy soapy barely off-white head... Aroma of fruity pears and banana yeasty esthers. Fairly subdued on the spice front actually and was expecting more in that regard... Dark and mild fruits throughout, generally sweet with caramels and soft grain that gives it some texture. A touch more than full in body with decent level of lively carbonation. Lacking some complexity and spice nature that usually is offered up by the style.
December 28, 2011, tap at Clybourn. Translucent copper with minimal head. Aroma was fruity, spicy and maybe some rye. Taste was similar, slight carbonation but very east to drink.
Pours hazy yellow with notes of fruit and dried tea leaves. The flavor shows off some lighter malts with a bit of the rye near the end of the finish.

Draft on tap at the brewpub (Chicago, IL). Pours a glowing golden pour, light haze, small offwhite frothy head laces small, dies into a film. Aromas are light pine, touches of sweet toffee, caramel, bready malts. Some tea, light florals, some light grass. Initial is lighter bodied, touches of piney bitterness move into sweet bready malts, juniper berries, light bitterness, touches of honey and toffee, light bodied overall, easily quaffable. Quite clean, a backend that busts some ass with sweet honey, wet bread, and some piney juniper. Light overall, easily drinkable. The pine fades out a bit much for my liking, sweet rye and oats with a touch of toastiness. Bitter pine tries itâ€™s best to balance, but canâ€™t. A sweeter beer, ok overall. Interesting.

In tap at GI into a tasting glass, recommendation by the bar tender...Pours a yellowish gold, pretty clear, watery lacing...The aroma is pretty good, a nice mixture of fruit and tea. Tea does dominate mostly but the pears and lemon help to balance this a little...The balance on the nose is undone the taste as its mostly tea with aloe and other herbal notes. Still some fruity notes just not enough. To much tea for me to make it drinkable. What some would find refreshing I find as medicinal.

Draught at Wrigleyville BrewPub: Aroma of malt caramel, light rye, and a hint of juniper. Poured amber in color with no head. Hazy. Not sparkling. Flavor is lightly sweet. Tastes of malt, Belgian yeast, light candi sugar, slight rye, and slight juniper. Medium body. Thin texture. Average carbonation. Medium sweet, malt slight rye, and slight candi sugar finish. Not all that much flavor.

draft at clybourn brewpub. aroma is pale malts, undefined spice, sand, big florals. appearance is lightly caramelized brown, crystal clear, super polished. flavor is sweet malty, light herbs, big floral fresh nectar, big sandy flavor returns. mouthfeel is mealy, lightly gritty. quite complex but difficult to imagine even a second glass of this.
On tap at clybourn brewpub. Weak pleasant grainy aroma. Pours golden. Flavor is complex maltiness with slight sweet undertones of rich fruityness. Finish is clean and sweet. I liked it.

On tap at the brewpub. Pours a golden brown with a small white froth. Aroma is surprisingly basic, mostly just a soft candy caramel malt and some light fruity and floral notes. Just very simple, a touch of bread and biscuit. Flavor starts with some basic bready sweet notes before a slightly stronger floral and citrusy fruit notes. Finishes lightly bitter and sweet with some doughy notes. Medium body and a softer carbonation. Eh, kinda boring, nothing standing out here.

Draft: Sticky frothed tan foam. Beautiful porter aroma of abundant hop character, caramel, cappuccino, cocoa, concord grape, light smoke, blackberry, and a hint of licorice. Soft and powdery palate. The wonderful flavors show huge roastiness, lots of coffee and cocoa, and a touch of charred malt. Finishes chewy and bitterly hoppy. A mild mannered, yet extremely impressive and tasteful rendition.
Bottled(1500ml). -very disappointed product bottled in plastic brown bottles, strange unpleasant aroma, too sweet, no head
Bottled. Pale golden and full of floaters, old USSR Zhiguleskoye style. Yeasty honey melon aroma. Sweet, fruity, funky and ashy.

column4: TvÃ¥ Bryggare / Ã–sterlenbryggarna / Bryggeriet i Ystad
column5: Bottle 50 cl from Systembolaget. Clearish golden with a nice white head. Light malt and hops aroma. Slight fruityness, light malts, very slight bitterness, hint of citrus. Light body, well carbonated, slightly malty finish. Quite balanced and refreshing, could have used a bit more bitterness and hops aroma for my taste.

column4: TvÃ¥ Bryggare / Ã–sterlenbryggarna / Bryggeriet i Ystad
column5: Bottled Golden with a medium white head. Sweet, bready maltiness in both aroma and flavour. A bit stale. Notes of Green apples in the flavour.
