column5: Apr 27, tap @ Goose Island, Clyborn. Pours dark copper with a small tanned head leaving nice lace. Fruitu, roasted, smokey and tary aroma. Flavor is sweet, fruity, tary, alcohol; excellent. Finish is very nice longlived tary and tart.

column1: Goose Island Lake Effect Winter Ale (2002-2013)
column5: On Tap at goose island cly... Pours very similar to broad shoulders with a deep clear copper pour and topped with a thin to medium soapy barely off-white head... Mild citrus and light yeasty nose where the latter takes precedence. Subdued, earthy almost saison like yeasty nose... Flavors Carry forward with the same yeasty profile upfront, some banana and citrus coinciding with one another while finishing with a tame yet somewhat assertive bitterness that lingers to some degree. Smooth medium bodies with adequate carbonation. Finish was a little too bitter for me but still not that bad.

column1: Goose Island Lake Effect Winter Ale (2002-2013)
column5: 9% draft at clybourn brewpub. aroma is giant lemon/lime, pseudo rocky belgian yeast, meaty malt backdrop. appearance is great legs, copper translucence, medium carb. flavor is grapefruit bitterness, silky malts, warming yet hidden booze. mouthfeel borders on hot at times, overall oily palate.

column1: Goose Island Lake Effect Winter Ale (2002-2013)
column5: Tap at Blind Tiger. Deep ruddy-amber pour. A bit of soft hoppiness. Light pine and fruity hoppiness. Rich and pretty tasty.

column1: Goose Island Lake Effect Winter Ale (2002-2013)
column5: Tap @ BT, GI event. Red pour. Very sweet, orange citrus, candy arouma. Sweet caramel malts and nicely bitter. A bit of a cotton candy aftertaste. Nice citrus and piney notes and hints of fruity sourness.

column1: Goose Island Lake Effect Winter Ale (2002-2013)
column5: Draft. Pours an amber crimson body with an off white head. Hoppy as hell. Awesome hop accents of pine, grapefruit rinds light citrus, a bit of grass and some fresh cut herbs. Maybe a bit green even on the hop tones but nevertheless a flavorful explosion with a full body to back it up. This was great stuff.

No smell at all, taste is ginger spicy off the bat, gingerbread taste is medium mild...beer overall is one dimentional with a base of generic malt and gingerbread flavor...meh...gets a bit better flavor with time but not my type

Pour looks like honey with a small white head. Aroma is well..honey with some cinnamon. Flavor is a bit thin and watery with some honey sweetness and a very minor spice. Finish leaves a bit of wet paper bag. This is a spice ale that could actually use a bit more spice.

It pours amber with an off white head that is very light tan. The initial aromas are strong in ginger and cinnamon. There are also notes of honey and a bit of orange. The ginger comes out the strong in the flavor with the addition of cinnamon. There is a bit of spiciness to it with a slight bit of orange and honey. There is a very low background note of caramel. It has a moderate body with moderate carbonation and a sweet and spicy finish. Overall, a good spiced beer with the ginger being a bit more dominate in the elements with cinnamon and then other notes.
Draft at Sticks & Stones. Hazy golden amber color, off white head. Aroma of toffee and light spice. Taste has caramel laced with cinnamon, orange, clove, vanilla. Tasty.
Tap. Amber with small head. Medium body with quite a bit of ginger. Thereâ€™s some other spice there but itâ€™s buried by the ginger.

Bomber from Bruisin Ales. Pours a hazy red color with a thin frothy tan head. Decent head retention. Aroma of toasted malts, ginger, honey. The taste is toasted malts, cherries, honey, citrus, ginger. Thin-medium bodied, slightly warming in feel, not in a boozy way. Maybe not the best beer, but Iâ€™m really liking it.
On tap at Olde Hickory. Pours a copper color with white head. Spice, nutmeg, malty flavors. Not too bad Christmas beer.

Draft at the brewery taproom. Pours clear, rich gold with a fine, creamy head. Wintery spices on the snout, fine toasted sugars, bread, citrus. Light to medium sweet flavor, plenty of holiday spices, creamy caramel, faint pine. Medium bodied with fine carbonation. Sweet finish with lingering spices and bready malts. A nice wintery, spiced beer.

On tap @ Olde Hickory. Pours a clear copper appearance with a thin tan head. Mint, ginger, citrus / orange, and spices in the nose. Carbonation a bit thin. Ginger ale flavor. Orange peel and maybe some herbal / spruce / mint notes as well. Moderately sweet. Low bitterness. OK.

22oz bottle from Brewmasterâ€™s in Wilson. Orange-brown hue, murky clarity with mostly diminishing head. No lacing. You can smell the spice, orange & cinammon. As it warms you get a hint of honey aroma. Strong spice on the initial taste with a long spice finish. Not much different then some pumpkin brews that I have tried, I liked this and will look for it next year.
Draft @ the brew pub. Pours a pale yellow color with a small white head. Has a malty grainy aroma. Fruity malty grainy flavor with weak hints of hops. Has a fruity malty grainy finish.

Draft. Poured a clear gold color with a tall fluffy white head with good retention and lacing. Nice aroma of yeasty bread dough and bready malt. There were also whiffs of grass and noble hop. Light bodied and delicately sweet with minimal bitterness. Tasted of cereal grain and bready malt with a distinct noble hop accent.

Loved this... served in a cool german mug... golden color with a little haze and tons of spritzy carbonation. Nice white head, and a good noble hop aroma... little bit of spice or pepper in the flavor, but was mostly malty with a little hint of hop bitterness. Really good

aroma is hops that begin floral and end with a subtle â€™americanâ€™ kick. translucent yellow with fine head. good bitterness with wet cardboard end. very light fruit note late. slightly gritty/grainy.
draft at piece. piss yellow. super easy drinking. would like this way better in the summer and seems a bit of a strange brew choice for January. Good way to rope in those fans of the "lites"

Swung by the brew put today, the pils was th only one left that I havenâ€™t had. Poured into a nice mug. Crystal clear with a fluffy white head that goes away. It always amazes me when I have a German Pils because of how different it is from a Bohemian or even a Dortmunder. Clear yellowy gold. Nose is bread and spice with some nice noble hop character. Distinct bitterness as I drink, obvious for the style, finish is pretty dry, not sure why others felt it sweet at all. Very clean and easy drinking lager. Nice!

Not bad considoring its not the most exciting style out there. Its got some good malt backbone but it starts and finishes too sweet for me. A good way to get miller lite fans into the resturant, but if I am there and spending the money I will pick something else.

I canâ€™t believe they didnâ€™t have this on tap for almost 3 years. Pours a clear gold with a large white head. Mild aroma, just a little bit of hops to it. Very easy to drink, nice to have a pils with some actual flavor and punch to it. Worth a try.

on tap at piec.e pours very clear straw color with white head. nose has a nice saaz hoppy and grainy aroma. flavor is grainy with saaz hop character. pretty hoppy but resembles a macro lager at times too. really tasty pils that iâ€™d love to drink a lot of.
Pour is clear golden with a thin white head...smell is lightly crisp and has a grainy sweet note...taste is lightly sweet at first and only for a second, then a lot of sharp hoppiness...

Originally rated on 9/19/08. I sure am glad i dont have to drink this stuff anymore. Watery flavor and mouthfeel, faint aroma of old grain. There are plenty of other more deserving light beers out there.

Looking at old high school photos from the 80â€™s and I came across several photos of parties. This jogged my memory so I shall do a retro review of a "quarters" beer from my past. Aroma- not much memory of this, I do remember that we made fun of this and the other cheap beers that we played quarters with (Hammâ€™s, Fischerâ€™s, Strohâ€™s, Falstaff and PBR Light) for smelling and tasting like the cans they came in. Appearance- this is a very pale yellow brew. Taste- the high school kidâ€™s dream, very little beer taste but has alcohol in it. Palate- Very watery with mild carbonation and a semi-dry finish. Overall- This was not a good beer, but it was invaluable in my development. I miss the fact that Schlitz is gone.
Can (Old Notes)-Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of corn, grains, and slight sweetness. Taste of the same. This light bodied brew I snot bad tasting.
Probably as good as any of the cheap, high volume light beers. Chill it to the point of freezing and it is ok.

This is a typical light beer. Pale golden yellow body with white head that disappears. Smells like a macro lager. Taste isnâ€™t too bad. It has a hint of sweet to it. Its just as good (if not better) than most light lagers and its MUCH cheaper. This is a value beer (less than $10 a case) and it somewhat pays off. Serving type: can Reviewed on: 03-19-2007 18:22:40
Delicious from top to bottom of can. I even drank the spit that came with the final drop of Schlitz Light while I tipped the can over my face for 3 whole minutes. Donâ€™t waste a drop.

Thanks to my father in law for supplying this one. Sampled from a 12 oz can this beer poured a medium golden color with a large soapy white head. The aroma is sour, tangy and corny indusrial brew. The flavor was dry, tangy and a bit corny. Pretty darn good for a maco light beer.

Well, this stuff is better than Buttmonkey. Nice silver can and it is rather clean smelling with a little sweet corn in there. Has enough personality to be a regular pale lager instead of light. Does taste a little different than the regular schlitz. Only 33 cents per can, good lawnmower beer. Probably decent for a session too if money is an issue. Ubiquitous pale yellow american lager, not bad. Has manners and can be appreciated by a frugal spender.
Can. Pours yellow with a white head. Aroma of corn, grain, and slight hops. Flavor is watered down completely, corn, metal, slight bitterness. Thin, cheap, it only looked like beer.
Pours a light golden yellow. Aroma of corn, grains and some hops with a watery flavor muddled with some hops.
This was an excellent beer at one point in time. If you can find it somewhere stored in the back room, snatch it up.

Bottle from batch #062. This brewery is now defunct, but I found a bottle at a local store the other day. A golden color with a laced white head. An impressive aroma with caramel and malts. The flavor is better than a typical pilsner. Too bad this place went under. "The aroma of the Golden Pilsner is a refreshing blast of hop fragrances blended from Tettnanger, Saaz, Willamette, Liberty, Cascade and Mt. Hood." Fuel my pils, please!

Although the brewery is gone, I thought I would add this. The beer was decent when it came out. If you can find some of this still left over like the other person did, it is worth getting. I wish you luck!

Bottle from batch 056. Although the brewery is now defunct, I still found a dusty six pack at a local liquor store. Imagine my surprise to find they were pretty good. A reddish brown color with a foamy tan head. A nice caramel and malt nose and flavor. A nice crisp aroma and an easy drinking body. A solid beer, too bad the brewery is no longer around.

Tap at the source. Pours dark golden. Aroma is sweet, caramel, malt, some hops. Flavor is sweet and bitter, caramel, malt, fruits, mint, grains. Finish is sweet and bitter. Body is watery. Carbonation is high. Overall: okish

Sampled a 25cl draft at the brewery. Pours nice blond with a big creamy white head. Nose: very malty with notes of caramel, hops and fruity touches of oranges. Taste: medium carbonation. Firm bitter with lots of malts, yeast, grains and hay. The fruity sweetness is very hard to notice. The aftertaste is rather dry and fresh thirst-quenching. I did not enjoy this beer a lot to be honest.
Tap @ brewery. Not a special blond. Nice sweet notes and smooth finish. Nothing special but okay!

One of the Pakhuis house beers, tasted there years ago. Peach blonde beer with medium, snow white head and estery and yeasty profile, malt sweetness, something phenolic and a light sourishness; thin body and (too) little hops in the finish to my taste but quenching alright.
A pretty weak blonde beer. Light and fizzy with a stale aftertaste and a watery body.
Geruch fruchtig bis sÃ¤uerlich, sehr unerwartet fÃ¼r ein Pils. Geschmack geht eher in Richtung helles mit deutlichen Malznoten.
Fruchtiger Geruch mit Estern. Im Geschmack das absolute Gegenteil. Recht vollmundig, Bitterkeit anstÃ¤ndig (>30 IBU geschÃ¤tzt)
On tap @ the brewpub. thin creamy white head. Cloudy golden blond pour. A reasonable blond.

Draft Pours fuzzy blonde Fast fading white small foam Smell is sweaty malts . Low carbo ( like it hasnt been done refermenting ) Taste is grainy , watery , not so fresh hoppyness . Bit bitter , instantly gone though . Aftertaste has some malts . Way to weak , and not refreshing at all . That combo doesnt work for me ..

Draught @ â€™t Pakhuis. Bright orange with little white head. Nose is rotting oranges & spices, mouldy plaster, stagnant yeast & some malts. Taste is mouldy plaster, spices, old stale dusty yeast, paint, mushroom, malts, light white pepper. Stale old yeast body. Comparable to their Lente bier but even below. Another one I would say has very clear flaws. Gave it to a less picky friend to finish â€“ first time I saw his struggling with a beer. Hard to compliment.

Tap st the source. Pours dark brown-black with beige head. Aroma is sweet, caramel, roast. Flavor is sweet and bitter, malt roast, some dishrag. Finish is roast bitter. Overall: okish, but feels bit dirty.

Sampled 25cl draft at the brewery. Pours dark brown with a rather small beige head. Nose: roasted malts, caramel, roasted coffee beans, liquorice, cloves. Taste: medium carbonation. Starts creamy (milk, coffee) with a sweet touch. The roasted coffee is also strong present and leaves a strong bitterness behind. Hints of chocolate. The liquorice is surprisingly hard to taste. The aftertaste is a little bitter with slightly soft notes of sweetness and a low dry feeling.
Tap @ brewery. Nice brown pour. Dark fruits. Again, not that amazed. Okay brown/abbey double.

â€™Dubbelâ€™ (though hardly worthy of the name) from Pakhuis, tasted there from tap years ago. Clear mahogany clour under a thin off-white head; caramelly, candi syrup, walnuts, dried fruits, yeasty spicy notes, thin mouthfeel (even on the watery side) and, like the blonde, not enough hops to balance. Disappointing.
Not the best brown but this one is better than their other offerings. Caramel and brown sugar with weak finish.
Geruch nach Malz und ZuckerrÃ¼benkraut. Geschmack relativ flach und leicht wÃ¤ssrig mit einem angemessen bitteren Nachgeschmack.

Tap @ pakhuis . Pours full , bit clear , dark brown & small white head . Smell is sweet , malty , chocolaty . Taste is bit bitter , some sweetness ( very light though ) and a sharp malty taste . Good carbonation . Too rhin for my taste for sure . Yet again , 5,5 is low abv for this kind of beer . It has got a nice tastepallate as well , subtile and elegant . Aftertaste is dark , sweet ( sugar or malts ? Thin line here ) and actually very good . One of the better ones i tasted from them . Would love a full bodied, 10 % - ish version of this one though cause this is simply to watery for my taste .
Geruch unauffÃ¤llig. Kakaonoten, ein Tick Erdbeere. Seltsamer, nicht unangenehmer Nachgeschmack.
On tap @ the brewpub. thin creamy off white head. Burg6ndy pour. Malty taste. A little sour maybe.Not a great bruin beer
Backlog. Enjoyed at the brewery in 2008. Brown color. Aromaâ€™s: sweet malts, caramel, roasted malts. Flavor is moderate sweet, caramellish. Body is light to medium. Not much of an aftertaste.

Tap @ KafÃ© BelgiÃ«, Utrecht. Pours clear golden color with a large white head. Yeasty and a bit grainy aroma, apricot and caramel notes, subtle malty tones. Flavor is malty with caramel notes, some toffee, distant yeast and hay. Okay. 4324
Draught @ Kafe BelgiÃ« as "Bangelijke Tripel" Aroma has some odd sour tones and vinegar. Flavour has caramel, some cereal, ripe fruits and biscuity malt in the finish. Decent tripel.
Tripel zou ik het niet noemen, dit bier is een bier dat niet blijft hangen omdat er zo 1000 in een dozijn zijn, ik zou dit bier eerder willen zetten op een plaats voor de recente bierproever
Goudgeel bier, helder met witte schuimkraag. Licht bitter, beetje vlak en waterig. Kruidig, gist en mout. Mwah.

(Draught at Antwaerps Bierhuyske, Antwerpen, 18 May 2017) Golden colour with frothy, white head. Malty, fruity nose with notes of bread, tropical fruit, coriander and spicy hops. Malty, fruity taste with bread, mango, grass, coriander, soft bready malt and a fairly dry finish with a gentle spicy bitterness. Almost full body, with a light sweetness. Tasty and well balanced tripel. Nice one.
Heel behoorlijke tripel. Bijna amberkleurig, mooi schuim, ietwat droog met een zacht zoetje. Lekker.

Encore une triple classÃ©e en belgian strong .. et pourtant câ€™est mis sur la face avant de lâ€™Ã©tiquette, sous le nom, mais en plus petit, câ€™est vrai. Je vais demander au brasseur de mettre des caractÃ¨res de 2 cm de hautÂ !! Niveau abv de 8,3 %Â . Mon exemplaire Ã©tait Ã  9 mois aprÃ¨s sa date. Couleur dorÃ© soutenu, lÃ©gÃ¨rement ambrÃ©, avec de la levure en suspension. Bulles fines, partout, trÃ¨s vives. Mousse blanche, crÃ©meuse, stable Ã  3 mm. ArÃ´mes de malt, babeurre, geniÃ¨vre, pointe de girofle. 1Ã¨re bouche trÃ¨s souple Ã  la belle entame malt/levure/coriandre. ArriÃ¨re-bouche bien maltÃ©e, assez riche. 2Ã¨me Ã  la belle texture, mais Ã  lâ€™harmonie trÃ¨s alÃ©atoire. ArriÃ¨re-bouche Ã  la girofle prÃ©dominante. 3Ã¨me qui perd complÃ¨tement le style pour arriver Ã  un patchwork dÃ©cevant. ArriÃ¨re-bouche vague, trÃ¨s faible. Longueur qui ne peut redresser la barre. Jambes fines, serrÃ©es, collantes. Levure douce, un peu Ã©picÃ©e, ligne correcte. Alcool correct, mais il ne parvient pas Ã  tenir le bateau sur la longueur. Finale banale. CONCLUSIONÂ : triple oui, peut-Ãªtre, Ã  la belle texture, mais aux saveurs qui partent trÃ¨s vite en vrille, pour ne plus rien offrir au final. DÃ©cevant .. et pas du tout surprenant (bangelijk..).
Wonderful longer lastning form. Lovely Fruity smelt. Full bodied tripel. Nice lunchbeer.

F: big, off-white, good retention. C: dark amber, hazy, opaque. A: malt, molasses, banana, spicy, peach, flower honey, hint of yeast. T: malt, dusty, molasses, banana, spicy, floral, caramel, honey, full body, good carbonation, good triple but nothing exceptional, 0,33l bottle from Delhaize in Antwerpen.

Bottle at the August THT, Den Haag. Poured a murky medium brown with a frothy white head. The aroma is woody hop. The flavour is moderate bitter with a citrus yeast floral hop palate. Medium bodied with average carbonation.
Classic golden with a typical belgian yeasty background and some vanilla. Very dry still easily drinkable with a surprising bitter finish.
Prettig blondje dag aardig in de buurt komt van Leffe. Misschien net iets te chemisch maar verder zeker prima. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Fruitig, citrus achtige smaak, blond biertje, iets bitter in de nasmaak wat wel even blijft hangen, al met al fris biertje.
Fles 30cl thuis. Krachtige, stevige, haast scherpe smaak. Hoppig. (5-2012).
Color oro limpida, Sottile schiuma bianca. Al naso poco da dire, al palato ï¿½ dolce con amarognolo in retrogusto. Leggera.
Flesje gedeeld met familie bij de Bomkelder. Geel-roodachtig troebel bier. Aroma van citrusvruchten en appel. Smaak is fruitig en hoppig. Nasmaak is iets bitter.
Fles gedeeld door JoepvW. Geprobeerd met Inoven en JoepvW. Het is een lekker fris blond bier.

Draft @ Barre Hond. Pours a regular blonde, slightly unclear beer with a big white head on top. Aroma is bready, slight raisins, yeasty and pears. Flavor is rather dull, light sweet, typical style example. Light touch of some fruits in the back, but furthermore not much special. Meh.
bottle bb 24/1/17 oro carico velata schiuma media discreta persistenza filo speziato erbaceo leggero erbaceo corpo medio amaro contenuto

33cl bottle, thanks to Rob. Appearance: slightly hazy pale straw with medium white head. Aroma: spices, sweet malts, some harsh wine note. Taste: medium sweetness and medium bitterness. Notes of sweet malts, peach and that same white wine character. Palate: medium bodied, oily texture and medium carbonation.

30cl bottle as Â« Lindeboom Gouverneur Dubbel Â» from Beerwulf webshop. F: big, tanned, good retention. C: brown with coppery hue against the light, almost clear. A: sweet malty, mellow fruity, caramel, bit chocolate T: sweet medium malty base, mellow fruity, bit bready, caramel, more on the dry side, leaves, medium carbonation, bit oily mouthfeel, letÂ´s say ok.

A bit disappointing for me. Itâ€™s a little too bitter relative to the backing malt. which results in the beer coming across a little thin and harsh. Missing my favourite raisin characteristics of the style. Belgian beer factory online bottle
brune con dubbel besta plaza forra winterus derra kolla zundarus van der dicka
Roodbruin bier, licht koolzuur. Aroma gebrande mout zurig. Smaak mout, vanille, pruim ( lijkt wel mango), water. Medium mondgevoel. Nasmaak zoet met wat koffie, zurig. Saai. Paar maanden over datum.

As Gouverneur Dubbel. Thanks to Erzengel for sharing! Bottle looks simple but good. Roasty- malty aroma. Starts strong malty, roasty, dry. Some metallical notes. Fruity hints of plum. Finish rusty-malty. Not bad.
Trockener, blechern rÃ¶stiger Antrunk. Blechern bleibend, geringe Malzigkeit, minimal herb, wenig aromatisch. Unrund, kurzer Nachgeschmack. 10/7/6/6/5/6
FLes 30cl thuis. Zoet, rood fruit, licht kruidig, caramel, korte nadronk. (1-2016).

Rated as Gouverneur Dubbel. Fruity mild beginning. Easy to drink, refreshing with a mild malty body. Caramel, a bit thin, not much bitterness. Nice smooth "brown" malty aftertaste with a fast disappearing character. Sessionable but not as deep as it could be.
Dubbel dal colore rosso con schiuma biancastra, al naso abbastanza anonima, al palato maltata e caramellata con buona speziatura. Carbonazione media. Corpo medio.
Flesje thuis gedronken. Roodbruin helder bier met stevig schuim. Geur van overrijp fruit. Smaak is houtig en zoet. Nasmaak is iets bitter.
Very watery. Not a ton of aroma. Pours lehigh brown from cask. Not memorable.
on cask-pours a tan head and bronze color. Aroma is medium malt, alcohol. Taste is medium malt-slightly sweet, alcohol, secondary hops bitterness. Mild carbonation.
On tap at the Ship. Deep dark copper in color with a nice tan head. Malty and hoppy aroma. Medium bodied. Roasty. Malty and hoppy flavor. Light tasting. Slight chocolate, caramel notes. Decent beer.
Toasted malt nose, dark clear brown color, low scumy head. Dry, late arriving woody bitter after a weak malt front. Watery and thin. Not quite sure what they were aiming for here.
Nice read color, no head. Kind of stale hops taste, but long lasting bitterness. Malty undertones.
Tap at the Ship. Dark broan and clear. Slight cooked cabbage aroma with the dominant malt. Flavor is bigg and malty. Some roasty notes but not overpowering. Slight chocolate and low hop.
molasses very dominant, little hop bitterness, base malt in finish..........
Half at Hopbunker. Clear golden, fine carbonation, small fluffy head. Light grainy aroma. Taste fills out with huge bready flavors , light sweetness and the faintest trace of hops. Smooth and tasty.

Draught @ Hopbunker, Northgate House, Kingsway, CF10 3FD Cardiff, Wales. [ As Felinfoel Celtic Gold ]. ABV: 4.8%. Clear medium yellow colour with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, straw, pale malt, light to moderate hoppy, grass, fruity hops. Flavor is moderate sweet with a average duration, pale malt, sweet malt, fruity malt, straw. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20190722] 5-3-6-3-11

Felinfoel obviously were not sure of this one as their nane only appears in small print on the bottle. Considering they produce the superb Double Dragon ale this in comparison is a bit poor. More like a lager than a pale ale it has no outstanding points. A rather bland golden coloured ale that has nothing to stand out from the crowd. No wonder the brewery only half owned it.

Bottled. Straw with moderate head and condition. Not wishing to disparage the Welsh, but if someone asked me to taste this blind and guess its source I would say it was a third world country, maybe the Indian subcontinent. It has a sickly sweet and slightly fruity nose, hints of really cheap asian whiskey and aftershave and a nasty lingering finish. Is the correct pronunciation of the brewery "feeling foul"?

A half and half mix of light and dark beer. Pours a dark copper color, topped with almost completely white head, small and non-lasting. Grassy and flowery aroma, some minimal roasty presence. Taste starts sweet, some caramel in there, as well as slightly herbal. A bit metallic in aftertaste. Not bad, but better stick to original ones.
Average aroma, appearance, taste and palate. Decent, somewhat memorable. Rated in the past from the bottle.
Sampled draught at Pivovarna Adam Ravbar, Domzale, Slovenia. -this beer is made by mixing Svetlo and Temno, dark amber colored, not so good like other two because it`s very watery

Cask (gravity dispense) at the Pigs Ear Beer Festival, London on 6 December 2006. Noted at 5.0%. Ridiculously bright red colour - looks rather like Ribena. Must be some food colouring in use here surely? Very little aroma -certainly little fruit in evidence. Comes over as a softish, standard bitter. Gimmicky and not very interesting.

Cask@Pigs Ear BF 06. This was dissapointing, given that i have had good experiences with this brewers beer. Not much in the aroma or the flavour. Mouthfeel is quite grainy and dry, but completely empty.
Cask conditioned - gravity dispense - Pigs Ear BF. Clear red colour. some yeast on aroma. Itâ€™s a not very good bitter that is red. Flat, dull and boring.

1. Cask Handpump at the Devonshire Cat, Sheffield 22/12/2001 Iâ€™ve noticed this beer sometimes appears without the red colouring as â€™Unred Rudolph Rides Againâ€™ Golden coloured slightly fruity cherry flavour. Powerful hop finish. 2. Cask Stillage at the Fat Cat, Sheffield 22/12/2002 Clear golden coloured and hoppy. Some dryness in the finish.

A surprise this one. Basically this is a re-release of the seasonal Red Rudolph beer (hence "Rides Again"). Held up to the light this is the brightest red beer I have seen. Flavours consist of fruity, biscuit malts. A long dry finish completes this very good Xmas ale.

Cask (backlog). Golden colour with a small white head. Aroma is wood, some floral and grassy notes along with mild nutty and caramel notes. Flavour is quite similar, with some slight toasted malty notes to it as well. Easy session beer.

Bottle, backlog rating, bought at a pub close to Gatwick Airport, pre flight. Poured clear amber with an average sized off-white head. Aroma of malt, caramel, bread, with smoky and fruity notes. Moderate sweetness and bitterness. Medium to thin body, texture a bit watery, soft to average carbonation.
0,5l bottle @ Migration 2013. Pours clear brown with a low head. Aroma and flavor are mostly rich malts. Decent.

Cask at the Bell, Banbury, 15/02/13. Lightly hazed dark amber with a thin off white head formed of bubbles. Nose is malt, spice, hops, toffee. Taste comprises toffee, biscuit, malt, fruits. Medium in body, moderate carbonation, some bitterness in the finish. Ok.
Bottle from Beermerchants.com. Pours unclear dark amber with a small head. Aroma of caramel and burnt plastic. Taste is moderate sweet, waterry mouthfeel without any traces of hop. Sorry, drainpour.
Cask at the White Hart, Stopham, Malty, great balance, good solid body, malt and caramel in the aftertaste.
pours cloudy amber with a white head. sweet aroma, with some caramel. fruit and chocolate maltyness in the taste, some smokyness, but its quite thin, and not too exciting. pretty average.
Bottle. Deep golden colour with a white head. Aroma is dust, hop, malt. flavour is dust, hop, malt, caramel, grain. Medium body. Ordinary beer.

Bottle 500ml. Clear medium orange color with a average to small large, frothy to creamy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, moderate yeasty, leather, smoke notes. Flavor is moderate sweet and light moderate bitter with a average duration, eathy. Body is medium, texture is watery, carbonation is soft. [20110415]

Cask at the Crosse Keys, JDW. Clear yellow pour with a weak head. Hay aroma. Pretty sweet with more hay, bit of dough and mild bitterness. Light bodied with fine carbonation. Reasonably well balanced to finish, more dough and crackers, hints of dandelion ans straw. Alright.

12 ounce can into lager glass, best before 8/11/2019. Pours slightly hazy pale golden yellow color with a 1 finger dense and rocky off white head with fantastic retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers. Nice dense foamy lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Fantastic appearance. Aromas of big lemon, cracker, corn, white bread dough, and lightly toasted biscuit; with lighter notes of wood, peppercorn, and herbal/floral/grassy earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance of pale malt/grains and light-moderate earthy hop notes; with great strength. Taste of big lemon, cracker, corn, white bread dough, and lightly toasted biscuit; with lighter notes of wood, peppercorn, and herbal/floral/grassy earthiness. Light-moderate herbal, floral, woody, grassy, peppery bitterness on the finish. Lingering notes of lemon, cracker, corn, white bread dough, lightly toasted biscuit, wood, peppercorn, and herbal/floral/grassy earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Great robustness and balance of pale malt/grains and light-moderate earthy hop flavors; with an awesome malt/bitterness balance, and no astringent hop flavors after the finish. Moderately crisp/clean finishing. Perfectly clean on lager flavors, with no fruity/yeasty notes present. Moderate increasing dryness from lingering bitterness and carbonation. Medium-plus carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth and moderately bready/grainy/sticky balanced mouthfeel that is great. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 5.2%. Overall this is an excellent pale lager. All around great robustness and balance of pale malt/grains and light-moderate earthy hop flavors; very smooth, crisp, clean, and refreshing to drink with the modestly bitter/drying finish. Very flavorful and not watery for the ABV. Great clean pils malt/grain showcase, with nice noble hop presence/balance for the style. Not overdone on adjuncts. A very enjoyable offering, and outstanding style example.
Can pour. Nice basic lager, crisp clean with light toast and biscuit notes.

Pours a clear straw yellow on tap with bubbly white head that dissipates to leave light lace. Aroma of light corn and bready grain, a slight earthy undertone, a musty skunked yeast on the back end. Taste follows, light and easy, definitely hits the marks for style, and is great garnished with a lime. Not bad for what it is, and could crush a few of these for sure.

Aroma: Can - initially the aroma is yeast, bread and then it quickly fades and a faint amount of citrus remains. The malt aroma is light almost cracker. The Hop Aroma is very faint and communicates a light lemon citrus and there might be a touch of cilantro in the back of the nose as well. The only other or aromatic I'm getting its a little bit of a soapy smell. Appearance: the body is crystal clear and a golden pale yellow is the color. The head is white with a mixture of medium and small bubbles and it lingers on top of the beer but thins to about a centimeter. Flavor: Slightly toasted malts making the flavor impression more like a Saltine cracker. There's not a lot of hop flavor but there's a slight touch of a lemon rind citrus, but the Hops communicate a bitterness that lingers on the back of the tongue. Balance is toward the bitter side. The finish is bitter and a flavor that is distinctly a lager. Mouthfeel: the carbonation of this beer is high making the mouth feel and seem thin but really it's more of a medium consistency. There is no alcohol warmth that I can detect and there's no creaminess due to the high level of carbonation and there's definitely some astringency from the Carbonic bite associate with this level of carbonation. Overall: on a hot summer day after mowing a lawn this is a great Mexican laher to just sit back and relax and enjoy it's not too hoppy not to malty or too sweet has a nice balance of bitterness and it's refreshing.

Sample at the Feast of Saint Arnold. Pours a clear, yellow color, with a fairly big, foamy, white head. The aroma is wet grass, corn, white bread, pine, and honeysuckle. Sweet, with a light bitterness. Light body, with a crisp mouthfeel. This is a simple and mellow lager, and surprisingly well made.
This beer is terrible. The aroma is gross and cheap. The flavor is one dimensional and the aftertaste is disgusting. Fuck this shit
Draft from Criollo in Flagstaff. Clean tasting, fairly crisp lager - nothing exciting but certainly very drinkable and enjoyable enough with food.
Draft compliments of Zac while dodging a hail/rain storm at Purgatory. Really a nice lager that seemed to have hints of lime plus light bitterness. Enjoyable.
Draft at Purgatory. Pale yellow with white head. Grainy with a wheaty, full finish for such a light beer. Not a Corona clone. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pretty good. Easy drinking. Certainly not a favorite Mexican lager. Worth a try if you like trying different lagers.
very watery. a bit sourish, as if its slightly infected or something too...Not very good at all.

On tap at Steelhead brewing co in Burlingame station. Pours a brown red with a tan head and aroma of roasted malt. Taste is of chocolate, roasted malt, and fruity raisin notes while light with a medium finish.
On tap at Steelhead Brewery in Burlingame, California, pours a dark black pour. Flat nose. Taste is light chocolate and malty. Far better stouts abound. quaff score 5 / 10

On tap @ Steelhead Burlingame. Black pour with a tan head. Roasted malt, coffee, and dark chocolate. A touch acidic. Some earthy hops, molasses, and a lot of licorice. Not bad on the palate, but a touch acidic. Lots of roasted malt bitterness. Dark chocolate, coffee, and earthy hops. Light molasses sweetness, burnt sugar, and licorice.
very dark and somewhat more drinkable than a normal stout which means it was slightly thin. sampled from brewpub in burlingame.

Sampled at the Burlingame brewpub. Had a stout appearance but not nitro like guinness, much more of a thin head than i am used to. Flavors were sweet but not too smooth. Overall, not one of their better brews.
Had this as part of an 8 beer flight. Very flavorful stout. Just enough of a chocolate-y flavor to let you know itâ€™s there. Great texture and hop-y finish.
Burlingame. Very fruity aroma, which is somewhat odd for a stout. Very pleasant with chocolate notes in the nose. Opaque appearance. Tastes like a nut brown Guineess. Creamy. Butter scotch.
Burlingame tap. Black, lower carb level. Roasty and sweet in aroma and flavor. Full bodied with caramel aftertaste. Clean mocha finish.
Red, brown color, medium carbonation. Clean. Hidden alcohol and hidden wheat flavor. Sweet with chocolate and roast notes. Beats aventinus IMO.

column2: San Luis Obispo, California, United States
column5: Tap, gold pour, white head, nose and taste are both citrus, hoppy, piney, decent

column2: San Luis Obispo, California, United States
column5: Keg at the SLO brewpub in SLO, 30/04/14. Hazed orange amber with a moderate off white swirl atop the glass trying its best to swim to the edge. Nose is orange squash, grass, pink grapefruit, juicy hop resonance. Taste comprises

column2: San Luis Obispo, California, United States
column5: A hazy golden pour with a white head. Floral and citrus hop aromas. Nice pine and perfume. Fairly dry with just a touch of bread and cracker malt notes. The flavor is very bright and hoppy. Nice dry and moderately bitter finish. Grapefruit, tangerine, flower, and pine hop flavors with just a light cracker malt character.

column2: San Luis Obispo, California, United States
column5: This is really a fantastic smelling beer, and anything less than a 8 is wrong. Tons of hops with floral notes mixed in. The flavor is good but not as hoppy as the aroma. The finish is surprisngly unbitter, too much so actually. A fantastic start that fades too much.

column2: San Luis Obispo, California, United States
column5: Draught at the brewpub. Lightly hazy nut brown, small head. Rich citric nose. Mid sweet with cleanm, rounded but unfirm mouthfeel. Heavily hopy, which covers the shortcomings in the malt depatrment well. Marked resiny bitterness.

column2: San Luis Obispo, California, United States
column5: Draft at SLO. Nose was nice with lots of pine and ivy hops. Hazy orange gold with a medium off white head. Flavor is nicely bitter with some lighter caramel. Long lasting bitter finish.

column2: San Luis Obispo, California, United States
column5: OK. I cut and pasted this part from my other ratings at SLO brewing: "Tried at the brewpub in downtown Paso Robles after a day of visiting wineries. Man, the wineries ROCK here. What an awesome day. What a better way to finish off the day than to sit down with a sampler platter of ice cold uber-crappy beer." On to the beer: Light hop bitterness. very low hop aroma. Maybe a bit of dishrag. Amber color. Lots of carbonation to replace the waning hops.

column2: San Luis Obispo, California, United States
column5: On tap at the SLO location. Nice west coast IPA. Strong aromas/flavors of citrus and a light fruity sweetness. Solid bitterness with a good body make this beer finish smoothly. Nice.

column2: San Luis Obispo, California, United States
column5: Draught at the Santa Barbara location. Clear ruddy amber color with a creamy head. Herbal, piney hops in the aroma. Basic Cali IPA flavor profile, with piney and grapefruit peel hop flavors with a light toasted malt base that gives a little grain sweetness. All the flavors seem pretty light and watered down though. Makes for a sessionable and balanced beer, though for the strength, this should pack some more in there. Finishes bitter, with a medium-light body and crisp carbonation. Alright for a lighter flavored IPA.

column2: San Luis Obispo, California, United States
column5: Sampled on draught: medium bodied brew, porus a clear amber colour with a big white head. lots of classic citrusy character in the taste. Hops are noticeable, not overly strong but pleasent and well integrated.

column2: San Luis Obispo, California, United States
column5: Paso Robles location. Nice red amber color with little head. I canâ€™t recall the nose or the taste (donâ€™t have notes on it) but I do rememeber enjoying it.

column2: San Luis Obispo, California, United States
column5: Flavor was 1/2 IPA 1/2 Xtra Pale with a rye crispness. Heavier bodied. Great, smooth finish.

column2: San Luis Obispo, California, United States
column5: great ale with a disguised high alcohol content i was very pleased, especially because im the size of an elephant

column2: San Luis Obispo, California, United States
column5: This pale ale poured with a short white head. The initial flavor was slightly sweet and very malty, with a hoppy finish.

column2: San Luis Obispo, California, United States
column5: Like an imperial blonde ale. Bland flavor and aroma with well masked alcohol. Probably gets people really drunk cause they think they are drinking a blond. Imperial Blonde Ale.

column2: San Luis Obispo, California, United States
column5: Stout like appearance but with minimal head. Slight Smokey aroma with hints of treacle. Slight fizz malty taste nice, light stout. (K)

column2: San Luis Obispo, California, United States
column5: Tap, brown pour, tan head, nose and taste are both coffee, vanilla, chocolate

column2: San Luis Obispo, California, United States
column5: Draft at the brewpub. Nose is chocolate, light smokiness, and steel cut oatmeal with no adulterations. Pitch black with a medium, heavy lacing, long lasting, tan head. Flavor is lightly bitter, smoky, chocolate. Excellent stout.

column2: San Luis Obispo, California, United States
column5: Keg at the brewpub in SLO, 30/04/14. Pitch black with a dirty tan covering. Nose is bitter roast, coco powder, dark toffee, liqourice. Taste comprises rich malt roastings, dark chocolate, mineral bite, toffee fudge. Medium bodied, fine carbonation, dry roasty close. Solid stout.

column2: San Luis Obispo, California, United States
column5: A dark brown pour with an off-white head. Roasted malt, coffee, and dark chocolate on the nose. Somewhat acidic, watery, and a mild molasses sweetness. Strong roasted malt flavor, some coffee, and dark chocolate. Mild sweetness, a hint of licorice, fair amount of acidity, and a bit of water.

column2: San Luis Obispo, California, United States
column5: A slight grainy aroma. looks great. this is not that heavy for an oatmeal stout, which is fine by me. A bit of sweetness. Not bad.

column2: San Luis Obispo, California, United States
column5: On tap at the brewery: pours a thick black opaque colour with a full tan head. Aroma is sweet, remiscent of fresh oatmel cookies. Taste is sweet also, creamy and light and chocolatey in the finish.

column2: San Luis Obispo, California, United States
column5: Tap @ brewery. Opaque, with a black body underneath a creamy tan head. Chocolate, caramel and turtle fudge chocolates combine with fudge brownies, mild EKG accents and lactic dark chocolate to create a delectable nose. Sweet chocolatey entities form a flavor enhanced by semi sweet chocolate morsels and moderate baking bricks. Cocoa patties and a soggy fudgie pull. Caramel courses through the latent brownie batter to help reunite it with the turtle candy parallels. Medium-to-fuller bodied, with a flavor and substance akin to a room temp mocha macchiato. Definitely this breweryâ€™s best foot forward.

column2: San Luis Obispo, California, United States
column5: this is one great oatmeal stout.one of my favorite brews for sure.i just wish they bottled it!

column2: San Luis Obispo, California, United States
column5: Cask at the RAF 2003: Dark brown, fairly opaque. . . burnt roasted aroma, great flavours: tasty chocolate, barley, oats and burnt embers. Good stout.

33 cL bottle. Pours clear and golden orange to red with a fizzy tan head. Thin aroma yet with berry notes. Thin bodied. Flavour is thin too with a light bitterness, mild metallic malt note and berry fruity. Ends with a mild bitterness and somewhat dry.
Aarhus, DK. Bottled. Fruity and champagne like. High carbination and alomost no malt and hops
[Sampled in 2003.] Hmmm, whatâ€™s this??? Trying to make something fruity belgo-like??? Forget it. Leave it to the belgians!
Not a good beer! Reddish/pinkish colour. Thin, fizzy and nasty. Light alcoholic touch.
Bottle, at No. 5 (030506). Red (like Lambrusco), no head. Aroma and flavor light sweet (elderberry) and bitter. Light to medium body, lively carbonated. The alcohol is felt.

(Bottle 33 cl) Clear, reddish colour (like strawberry champagne), no head whatsoever but lots of carbonation. Slightly sweetish from the added elderberry juice with only a vague hint of bitterness. Unpleasant tang of brewing syrup. More soda pop than beer. 190103
Bottle. Pink-red color, light strawberry aroma, wine taste, light body watery sweet finish.
33 cl. bottle. Served (although I wish I hadnâ€™t...) in generic lager glass. Pink; poor head. Remarkably thin-tasting. Utterly anonymous. 7.7%?
What where they thinking... The colour is almost pink, and the taste is like the italian Wine "Lambrusco"
This is more like an alcopop than a beer. Light red colour, very sweet and watery. If you're 15 years old you will love this beer: taste like soda and makes you drunk in no time....!!
Draft. Pours gold with a white head. Grainy and sweet, a little corn, and a kinda grainy finish. Fine.
Draft. Very light aroma and flavor. No off-flavors, so thatâ€™s a plus. Goes well with food, but not a primary drinking beer.

On-tap at the brewpub on 15th July 2014 during my Orange County coastal pub crawl. Not overly impressed, light golden in colour, no head, fizzy and bland. Straw, grass and corn all came to mind as I tried to drink this while sat at the bar looking at the kettles that brewed it. Cows like straw, grass and corn, I do not.

On tap at the brewery. It pours bright yellow with no foam. Streaming bubbles look nice in the glass. The aroma is grainy with some popcorn. The flavor is grainy and watery with some very light hints of spicy noble hops. Not bad for a pale lager/blonde/golden ale whatever you want to call it. Not much flavor good or bad. Decently refreshing.
I had this on tap at Huntington Beach Beer Company. It pours golden with no head, very little carbonation. The taste is moderately sweet. There isnâ€™t a whole lot going on here

A: Pours a nearly flat, pale straw color with no head. But at least itâ€™s clear. S: Cooked corn and other vegetables, especially celery. A burnt grain aroma as well as straw and grass. Thereâ€™s a strange fruit juice sort of sweetness, too. T: More bitterness than I had anticipated, but there is a lot of cooked grain, corn, and mixed vegetable flavor here. Slightly sweet, but just very corny overall. M: Light in body with very low carbonation. O: Donâ€™t bother. Donâ€™t waste your money.
Draught sample at the restaurant. Fine golden ale but nothing exciting...of course Iâ€™m never truly excited about this style. Nice malt character but very light flavouring. Refreshing on a hot day.
Clear yellow color/ white head. Mild honey biscuit aromas. Light/ medium body. Lightly sweet honey biscuit flavors with a crisp, dry finish.

~Light malty aroma, Bready ~Pours a pale light gold with small white head. ~Bready malt flavor, woody yeast character. ~Light body, med carb, bitter malt finish. ~Decent "Kolsh". Light and refreshing.

Solid for its style. Clear light golden/hay color with small white head. Aroma of clean malts and light hint of fruity hops. Flavor is much of the same. It drinks crisp and refreshing, a nice session brew.
On tap at the brewpub. It pours brown with no head. The aroma has some dark fruit and toast. The flavor is lightly toasted with hints of fruit. Nothing special.

A: Pours a very dark amber color, not quite brown, with a small/thin off-white head. S: Chocolate is the first thing I get when lifting the glass to my nose. Plenty of toffee and nuttiness with a moderate roast. Maybe a touch of vanilla on the nose as well. T: Much more roasty on the palate with a bigger toast and coffee flavor. Dark chocolate and toffee provide some sweetness, but there is also a prune flavor that becomes sweeter and sweeter as you drink more of the beer. M: Medium in body with a moderate level of carbonation. O: I liked this one, but I donâ€™t know if Iâ€™d want to take down more than the sample glass of it.

On draft in Huntington Beach - Main Street. Bongwater??? Haha. OK - my first bong water brown ale. Sounds tasty. This was your standard brew pub - low alcohol - little flavor english brown. Thinner and less malth than I would like. The night was quite foggy at this point though...
Has a nice nutty aroma. Flavor is a little sweet, a little smokey, with an odd spice like characteristic in the finish. Bongwater? Hmmm...

OK, so itâ€™s not a sweet and smooth malt monster...seems a tad lacking in some areas, but is rater Eyedrinkale accurate in saying beer bongwater...hummm... brown, minimal head, some malt sweetness, significant bitterness, quite similar to the lager and 15th anniversary in flavor. Some mineral/metallic flavors, a tad cloying at the end...not the best but beer bongwater...hummm...who makes beer bongwater!!
Dark brown with a nice sized head. Light, sweer and hoppy aroma. Tastes like some shitty ass home brew. For all home brewers reading this, please do not take offense. Tastes like Beer Bongwater.
Light brown color. Small head. Light malt aroma. Slight hop bitterness. Some caramel flavor. Clean.

column1: Titletown Winter Gale Spiced Brown Ale
column5: A lovely holiday beer, with just the right amount of spicing. Quite impressive.

Review from old notes of a trip to Bavaria. It seems I liked this one, nicely balanced dunkelweizen with a malty but not cloying note.

On tap at Kuchlbauer Brewery after a short cycle ride from CampingplÃ¤tz FelbermÃ¼hle, weather has been shocking but brewery architecture and beer is great. Pours conker brown but cloudy, taste is wheat, a little nutty and with a hint of chocolate lovely soft mouthfeel, very nice beer.
Bottle from bier-kaufen.de. Hazy murky brown colour, beige foam. Nose of banana, light roasted malts. Taste is malty, light sweet, quiet watery.

Bottle at home thanks to SinH4!! A bit hazy dark brown with fluffy dark beige head. Sweet plums, caramel, fresh bread, banana, light green leaves, cream, stroopsoldaatjes, sweet brown beer sugar syrup, fried banana in dough, pancakes. All the above sounds very sweet, but the beer itself is actually just about medium sweet, it just has sugary aromas. Under medium bitter too. Medium bodied with doughy feel. Quite enjoyable.

Die Alte Liebe ist eigentlich ein tolles dunkles Weizenbier. Es verfÃ¼gt Ã¼ber alle feinen Geschmacknuancen, die ich mir erwarte und diese harmonieren auch passabel miteinander, aber wenn ich es im Vergeleich mit der Turmweisse sehe, dann finde ich, dass da mehr drinnen wÃ¤re: mehr Frucht, mehr Hefe, mehr Kraft...es ist wohl gut erfrischend und als Erfrischungsbier sicher zu empfehlen, aber bayrische WeiÃŸbiere schaffen eine bessere KomplexitÃ¤t.

Dark amber-brown color, hazy body, good carbonation, two fingers white-brown head. Aroma of malt, freshly baked bread, spicy, cloves, grapes, raisins, a bit of caramel, red wine, wheat, freshly cut grass, banana. Sweet taste, balanced, good carbonation, a bit creamy, caramel malt, sweet fruits, yeast, cloves, banana, nuts. Soft and drinkable. Aftertaste is sweet with a slight hint of sour, baked bread, yeast, red wine, a bit of caramel, coffee, nuts.

SchÃ¶n dunkle Farbe. Herb, leicht malzig, bittersÃ¼ÃŸ im Abgang. Typisch Kuchlbauer: Extrem feinperlige KohlensÃ¤ure. Insgesamt sperrig und nicht gut trinkbar. Das normale helle WeiÃŸbier ist nur recht durchschnittlich, das dunkle WeiÃŸbier sogar recht enttÃ¤uschend.

Flasche 0,5l: Kastanienbraun, schwarz, krÃ¤ftige TrÃ¼bung, krÃ¤ftiger stabiler feinporiger Schaum; frische + krÃ¤ftig malzige Nase, Malzzucker, Getreide, dunkles Karamell, Bananen, dunkle Fruchtigkeit, getrocknete FrÃ¼chte, RÃ¶staromen, Kaffee, etwas Schokolade; eher trockener KÃ¶rper, krÃ¤ftige Hefearomen, krÃ¤ftig malzig, Getreide, dunkles Karamell, cremig, krÃ¤ftige KohlensÃ¤ure, leichte RÃ¶staromen, dezente Hopfennoten, leichte fruchtige SÃ¤ure; angenehmer malzig-trockener Nachgang mit Hefearomen
Bottle from Delhaize. Golden colour, white foam. Medium carbonation. Sweet aroma of banana and citrus. Alcoholic. Not very well balanced.

Foam: nice white quick diminishing. Colour: a little hazy golden yellow. Aroma: very light, hops, malt, some like orange peels, a hints of alcohol and honey. Taste: sweet with slight hints of hops, malt, fruity, yeast, some banana, light spicy /cloves, coriander/ fruitiness also and some metal, medium carbonation and low to medium body, not bat Belgian triple but made for Delhaize chain supermarkets and this influence the quality I think.

Bottle @ Home. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of malt, yeast, honey, light sourness, sweet fruity. Flavor is light sweet, malt, honey, sweet fruity, sweet pears, light alcohol. Medium body, lively carbonation, warming alcoholic finish. 090415
Bottle - golden coloured pour with white head. Aroma and taste is sweet fruity and yeasty, citrus, spices, floral and herbal notes, nice.
33 cl. bottle. Clear golden colour with a huge white head. Aroma and flavour of yeast, spice, alcohol, fruit, malt, caramel and hops.

33 cl bottle. Pours clear and golden yellow with a huge white head. Aroma is mild fruity and light phenolic. Mild toasted and light sweet. Medium dry and slight phenolic. Medium dry and phenolic finish.
Bottle at Borup. Clear golden colored with a huge white head. Fruity aroma of caramel and spices. Fruity flavor of caramel and spices with notes of hops and alcohol. Spicy finish.
*Old rating, best before 03.07.09. Frisch-rauher, leicht alkoholischer Grundton. Mild weiche gelbe FrÃ¼chte auf rauhem KÃ¶rper, Leicht herb-metallisch, leicht unrund.
Light amber hazy with medium fastly disappearing head. Nice sweet honey citrusy aroma. Fruity (orange) sour biter taste surrounded by some sweetness. Mild sweet-bitter aftertaste.

The tripel in this commissioned abbey beer series, since 1994 and originally the same beer as Affligem Tripel; I think it deserves investigation to find out if this is still the case today or not. Anyway, revisited today for the sake of finding this out, but I stupidly forgot to put an Affligem Tripel next to it so I still canâ€™t be sure. Pours a clear â€™old goldâ€™ colour with low fizz under a lacing, snow white, medium thick, moussy head. Aroma does not invite me to have a sip: tons of iron probably hailing from foam stabilizing agents, caramel syrup, cooked corn, cookie dough, sweaty grains, cooked cauliflower, melting plastic, badly hidden, wodka-like alcohol and honeyish cane sugar - this is so low in â€™esterinessâ€™ that I take the liberty to doubt whether this is even top-fermented (a remark I made with Affligem Tripel already some months ago)! Sugary sweet onset, honeyish and even a bit sticky, pineapple and banana but in an artificial kind of way, medium carbo; metallic middle phase, low and thin in maltiness but something caramelly comes up, phenolic finish with lingering sugary sweetness and lingering iron, next to warming, old â€™jeneverâ€™-like alcohol and a touch of earthy and grassy hop bitterishness, though insufficient to counter the initial sweetness. An artificial, iron-laden and overly sweet concoction, clearly made the cheapest way, including malt adjuncts. Not acceptable as a tripel and to add insult to injury, I remain convinced this is an alias of Affligem Tripel, which has suffered as much from its restyling as this one has. I have a lot of sympathy for this style, but it has been hollowed out by either amateur failures or industrialized, chemical clones like this. Do not buy this, no matter how much youâ€™re into tripels. Used to be better a decade ago - when it was already an alias of Affligem Tripel - but apparently making it cheaper in production has gained Delhaize more profits. Conclusion: this is exactly the same as Affligem Tripel, with exactly the same history (which nobody else cares about, probably)...

Geruch wie Apfelsaft aber ehr etwas kÃ¼nstlicher, so wie Haribo mit Apfelgeschmack. Zumindest im Antrunk und im Mittelteil schmeckt dieses Zeug auch nach Apfelsaft, im Abgang im Prinzip auch, allerdings hier eher nach Apfelschorle. Bier ist absolut nicht zuschmecken. Es ist ein leckeres alkoholisches ErfrischungsgetrÃ¤nk, aber mit Sicherheit hat es nichts mit Bier zu tun. Schwer zu bewerten.... Test vom 3.6.2006, Gebinde: Glasflasche Noten: 7,7,7,7,12,7 - 7,25

Bottle: Pale yellow, quickly collapsing white layer, distinctive aromas of artificially sweetened apple-juice; sweet-sourish flavour, very light bodied; some beery - e.g. grainy/bitter - traces in the sweet-bitter finish. Too sweet, too artificial..........

(33cl bottle) Clear, yellow colour with a diminishing foamy white head. Sweet, slightly artificial apple-fruity nose. Sweet and slightly sour flavour, the apple-fruitiness is dominating the taste, shy malty notes in the background. Moderately sweet, slightly tart fruity finish. Can be refreshing on a hot summer day.

Bottle, 2.7%. Sweet, soapy apple aroma, not too strong. Clear pale yellow colour, stable white head. Sweet apple flavour, but not too sweet and OK balanced by apple acidity. Beer mouthfeel. A lot better than most lemon radlers.

(Bottle 33 cl) Pours a clear, pale golden with a bubbly, dissipating, white head. Lightly tart apple aroma. Light body with sweetâ€™nâ€™sour apple notes - not unlike one of the thin Scandinavian soda pop ciders. But quite drinkable and not too bad for a fruit beer. 231206
A light yellow beer with no head. The aroma is extremely of apples. The flavor is malty and with very strong notes of apples - almost like a cider. The body is thin.
Clear very pale colour with a fast disappearing white head. Sweet apple aroma and flavor.
Bottle. Pale golden colour with a fast dissapering white head. Apple aroma and taste. Light body and a sweet dry finish.
Pours very light yellow with no head. Almost no aroma. Bad taste of apples. Very watery "beer".
Bottled. Extremely pale coloured. Very nice apple aroma. Apfelschorle flavour. Very refreshing and pleasant.

so watery.. weak taste with weak aroma. better keep icey-cold before u drink.

Bottle 25cl. Smell is malty, the beginning is a bit sweet as the finish is dry and bitter. No real hops flavor. Quite watery anyway.
Bottle, 4.5%. Citric aroma. Golden colour, small white head. Rather standard lager, not bad tasting, not good either.
Bottle. Golden colour with a small white head. Sweet malty herbal aroma and taste. Light body and a thin finish.
clear golden-yellow colour, few head, herbal, plastic and paperboard in the nose, sweet and slightly tart with an unpleasant carton-like finish

column5: Bottle at home, from old notes. Golden color, white head. Mild malt, sweet litgh hops, not interesting

column5: 65cl BÃ¼gelflasche. Dunkelgelbes Bier, wenig Schaum. Getreide etwas Frucht und Alkohol in der Nase. Geschmack wÃ¤sserig sÃ¼ss mit herbem Abgang.

column1: Kronenbourg La RÃ©serve de MaÃ®tre Kanter
column5: Bottle. Pours a light orange colour with a thin white head. Has a moderate yeasty and fruity aroma. Tastes like a well-balanced golden strong lager, pleasant sweetness, tolerable hops.

Sweetish flavour, medium bodied with a soft carbonation. Malt-accented, perfumed grainy taste; sweetish and perfumed finish with a faint level of bitterness (02.05.08).

column1: Kronenbourg La RÃ©serve de MaÃ®tre Kanter
column5: Bottle, Thx to thewolf. Golden colour with an off-white head. Aroma is fruit, hop, malt. Flavour is fruit, hop, malt, sweet. Pleasent easy drinkable beer.

column1: Kronenbourg La RÃ©serve de MaÃ®tre Kanter
column5: 750 ml bottle/corked not a swing cap...Poured an nice orange color w/ a fizzy head that was quick to diminish. The aromas were very malty, grains, hay, and some sweet fruits. Flavor was very bland toffee, malt, tobacco, white raisins, grains. Palate was dominated by the carbonation and the long bitter finish. Not great, not bad...

column1: Kronenbourg La RÃ©serve de MaÃ®tre Kanter
column5: Bottle, thx to thewolf. A clear, golden beer with an off-white head. Fruity nose with some sweetness and some grains. Lightly fruity and sweet flavor with a little grainy touch. Medium to full body. Fruity and slightly finish. Far from a great beer, maybe I rated it too high, but at least it felt right at the moment I was drinking it. It is quite easy to drink and sure not bad. (080301)

column1: Kronenbourg La RÃ©serve de MaÃ®tre Kanter
column5: (on bottle, thanx to thewolf) Light orange, soft malt nose. Mellow smooth taste of nothing but barley, quite simple. Gets too sweet in finish.

column1: Kronenbourg La RÃ©serve de MaÃ®tre Kanter
column5: BottleSlig. htly pale deep golden, short head. Weak malty and grainy aroma and flavour. Thin mouthfeel. Boring.
This was a cast beer that was dark brown with a tan head. It was served at room temperature as a good cast beer should be. This was one of the best that they had.
This beer was served to me dark brown with a very thick offwhite head, it seemed to be nitrogenated. Beer had nice mouthfeel, very creamy and smooth. Very mellow flavor, even with the warmer temp.
Decent body. Served at warmer temperature. Bitter notes at start and finish, slightly fruity. ok.
Gold,creamy lasting off white head.Fresh hop nose. Unripe hop flavor. Softly carbonated. Rather bland
Generic cask english pale ale. Warmer temperature. Slightly fruity with bitter start and finish. More body than the rest of their beers.

Serving type: on-tap Appearance- A Nice Hefe cloudy golden orange yellow with a white head that disappeared very quickly, almost no lacing. Aroma- A typical hefe smell of citrus, wheat and clove T/P- The Taste is very light for a Hefe. There were no real strong flavers that came out of it. It was well balanced of wheat and clove, with a nice citrus undertone. Overall- This was a typical standard Hefe. It was very tasting and I would defiantly get it again, so On that not the drink ability was high. There is just nothing remarkable about it, but if you like wheat beers than defiantly do not pass this one up.

Tap, as Hue Hefeweizen. Pours cloudy yellow amber with a medium off-white head and good lacing. Aroma is lemon, wheat, clove and banana. Perhaps a bit too much clove and not enough banana Flavor is about the same, medium sweet, no bitterness at all. Medium bodied and creamy. Not a bad effort.

Turbid orange pour with a white head. Light banana sweetness, some mild clove, some cinnamon, and a little bit of nutmeg. A nice malty bread aroma, some wheat, and a hint of citrus. Sweet bready malt, wheat, banana, lots of spices. Tons of clove, some nutmeg, and even a bit of cinnamon.

From sampler at the brewpub, Los Gatos, CA, 17/08/12 (as "Hue Hefe"). Rabbit piss looks with a white disc of head. Good banana shrimp, clove and candy aroma. Spicy and biscuity with banana and clove notes. Almost still; faintly tingling. Pick of the samplers.
Very hazy golden yeast color. Strong banana aroma with a hint of clove. Banana predominates in the flavor, with strong spice and a carbonated mouth feel. An unusually strong-flavored hefe.

Draft @ LGB at San Pedro Square, San Jose, CA. Pours a slightly hazy yellow color with a small white head. Has a fruity wheat malty banana and clove aroma. Fruity wheat malty spicy banana flavor. Has a fruity wheat malty spicy banana finish.

(on tap) Opaque dark amber. Nice aroma; mainly bananas. Soft pleasant mouthfeel from plentiful gentle carbonation. Flavour starts with citrus notes and develops through a richer banana phase and finishes with some spicy bitterness. Overall a great hefe.

From the Jug at the GABF, Colorado Convention Center Denver 18/09/2010 Hoppy aroma. Golden coloured hazy in appearance and smooth on the palate with some banana fruit flavour. A hint of dryness in the finish.
Samples at Los Gatos Brewery. Hazy orange hue with a nice lacy head. Aroma of bubble gum and banana. Medium, crisp body. Banana, bubble gum and brown sugar fill the mouth. Very tasty heffe.

Draft at the brewpub. Hazy yellow with a nice white froth. No lacing. Aroma is bubblegum, banana oil, and light cloves. Flavor is just about identical. Too much bubblegum for me, tastes kinda like artificially flavored banana candy. Medium-thin body, nice effervescence.

Serving type: on-tap Appearance- Very dark brown almost black with a tan head that lingered for a while. Nice sticky lacing. Aroma- A smell of roasted malt, with a hint of chocolate. T/P- Taste was very much like the smell, but the roasted malt defiantly came out more in the taste. The mouth Feel was nice and clean carbonation was spot on and the beer finished with a nice sweet taste. Overall- This was a nice beer, a bit heavy so not one that could drink a lot on in a night. Would have been very good with a steak.
Medium carbonation. Aroma is sweet,and the flavors that stand out are the malty molasses notes.
Brown with tan head. Good sweet malt nose. Cloyingly sweet, with misplaced hops. Poorly balanced
Dark brown/red with little head and medium carbonation. Sweet aroma with a malty molasses flavor. Full bodied.

Backlog. Cask @ Beach Chalet, 2007. Aromaâ€™s of fruit and sweet malts. Retronasal itâ€™s sweet, fruity, a bit herbal/spicy. Flavor is moderate bitter with a malty sweet backbone. Light bodied, on the thin side. Long moderate bitter finish, some malty sweetness as well. Quite good.

On cask. Pours with a hazed yellow, yeast particle filled yellow body with a thick, foamy white head. Aromas are very fruity, bready, estery, woodsy hops, lemon and tangerine zest, over ripe pear. Flavors: a bit of diacetyl and a bit of a slick mouthfeel. Medium bitter, lemon squares (the pasty), bready. Lasting bitterness. Thick and a bit oily on the mouth (odd), medium to light bubbles. So-so.
Cask. A hazy amber beer with a thin beige head. The aroma has notes of spicy hops and elderflowers. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, caramel, hops, and citrusy fruits.
Clear orange with a fizzy white head. Orange and lemon aroma and taste with some nice caramel notes.
Cask at the brewpub. Nose of floral, caramel, and some vanilla. Amber with a small off white head. Flavor is light bitterness, vanilla, and a hint of butterscotch.

on hand pump-pours a retaing bubbly off white head and hazy gold color. Aroma is orange/herbal, some light/medium malt. Taste is orange/herbal-tea hops, light/medium malt. True to the style. 110323 improved from last visit
Cask. Slightly hazy amber golden with a small rough head. Aroma of nuts and a little burned caramel. Light-bodied, flat with nut and caramel flavours. Lightly hoppy finish. 120709

From tap at the brewpub. Pours almost clear and golde orange with a small bubbly white head. Solid hoppy fruity aroma. Mild wooden vanilla flavour to a light mango and orange fruity flavour. Light malt sweetness. Subdued bitterness into a medium dry finish.

Cask at the brewpub: Slightly hazy copper with a lacing off white head. British yeast aroma- some estery fruity notes meshing with a golding/fuggle note along with some American hops as well. Light fluffy feel. Some biscuity malt backs the flowery British hop flavors, meshing with some citrusy American hop notes. A touch of plasticy phenols are there as well. Huskier toward the back. Decent interpretation of a British bitter.

Cask @ the brewpub. Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a longlasting off-white head. Has a malty hoppy aroma with some hints of grapefruit and caramel. Slightly sweetish malty hoppy caramel flavor. Has a malty hoppy finish with a slightly bitter aftertaste.

I must first say that if you go to Maxwell's try their home brewed Ginger Blackberry ale (non-alcoholic)--not only is it incredibly tasty, but it was the best of the selections I sampled. In any cae, the dunkelweizen is of a lovely, hazy orange color topped with a dollop of cream. The aroma is of a heavy musk aroma from which banana can eventually be identified. Well balanced with some banana flavor as well. Despite the name, this seems no more than a typical german wheat to me.
Amber with light tan head.No noticeable aroma.Light wheat malt flavor is quite antiseptic

Had on tap at the brewpub in Port Townsend. Nothing really jumps out at me about this one - just a solid brewpub amber. Hoppy aroma - dark copper appearance. Decent mix of hops and malt with a bit of a nutty undertone. Good way to finish the evening at a great little brewpub.
Not sure of what to stylistically make of this beer. Appealing maroon color with a light roast in the aroma though i could not coax more. An easy, lightly malty beer that is blandish.
Cloudy brown with tan head. Light malt nose.Light malty rather bland flavor. Gassy
Cloudy brown with small tan head.Malt nose. Light sweet and malty flavor. Great lace
Bronze with a rapidly fading head and appearance and taste that is too close to an Am. standard. Dank hop flavor also fades quickly into mouthwashing blandness.
Hazy amber,lasting off white head.Fresh hop nose. Light hop flavor throughout

Had on tap at the brewpub in Port Townsend. Decent brewpub porter. Has subtle chocolate notes in the aroma and a dark red appearance. Sweet hoppy flavor underiding the chocolate is prominent throughout. Does not really feel like a porter.
English style working man's porter. Black with a healthy cream head. Low, but semi-sweet roast notes in the aroma and a flavor reflective. A below par porter.
Deep brown with lasting tan head. Good sweet toasty nose. Lighty roasted chocolate malt palate. By far the best product from this brewery
Bottle in Baku ðŸ‡¦ðŸ‡¿. Smooth grainy beginning. Refreshing with lemonade touch. Lots of grain and water. Easy to drink, refreshing with a watery grainy back.

355ml green embossed pull tab bottle as "Efes Zero Classic Premium". Pours clear gold with large bubbles and struggles to form a head. Aroma is toasted malt, flavor is candy and malt, little sign of hops.

Decided to grab some low alcohols this weekend just to mix em in. Hopefully the other two better than this. Cleanish amber kinda watery no fiz. Nose is sour wet cardboard. Tastes of dirty water, old caramel, pale malt, wet paper bags, weird soda. Barrel carbonated.
Sweet aroma, golden with a fast dispersing head. For a na beer has a pleasant taste one of the better na beers Iâ€™ve had in saudi.
This one is good! Really liked it! One of the finest quality and taste.
Can. Refreshing drink but not so good. Its Blonde enough, little bit Malty but not too much. It â€™d be better to drink colder if you want to get more taste.
Small Can. Golden with a decent head to begin with that soon disappears. It has an odd graininess to it that provides a full aroma but also gives it a â€™teaâ€™ like flavour, but obviously cold.

Bottle from local vegtables shop cons 2013-02-03 GÃ¶teborg AR: soaked dark bread, pear, citrus, AP: copper clear, frothy transparent white quickly disappearing head F: fizzy, bready, peach, sweet, watery, sugar grainy feeling

The alcoholic variety of this beer gets an undeservedly bad name. This, however deserves all the opprobrium that can possibly be heaped on it... I had it in the 50cl can form, and it was nigh on undrinkable it was so sour...
Can. Golden colour with a white head. Aroma is malt, wort, bread, fruit. Flavour is malt, wort, bread, fruit. Boring beer.

Aroma; pale malt, grain, grass. Look; offwhite head, golden-yellow clear body. Taste; pale malt, pale caramel, grain, herbs, and finishes pale lager. Feel; ok body n coÂ². Overall; closer to lager than pilsner. [can @im hauslicher Umgebung] 43437

Drinking this bottle, at the Stuttgart main station, waiting my train to Munich, coming from Heinrich 3000, picking up this beer, in a supermarket, in the station with some strange people, in the area. The body is gold, clear, average carbonation, thin and white foam. It was not my favourite pils, cheap version of what you can get, in Bavaria, crispy, grassy, dry malt, cheap hop, not subtle, ok for refreshment, nothing more, it was during my trip, at November 2018.

Appearance: Light golden, clear. Nice amount of creamy, white head. Aroma: Pale malt, light fruits, some hops. Taste: Light malt, light hops. Some bitterness in aftertaste. Some harshness. Bought: Hotel restaurant (Stuttgart), 300 ml tap, â‚¬4.00 Info: 31/5-2019
Ljusgul med fint vitt skum. Doftar grÃ¤sigt och maltigt. Smaken fyllig, besk, lite sÃ¶t. Eftersmaken hyggligt lÃ¥ng, tÃ¤mligen besk, nÃ¥got sÃ¶t.
500 ml can from Lidl. Pour is bright yellow with a nice white head. Good carbonation. Very little aroma and very light in taste.
Pivo iz baÄve od 5l... dobro, tamno zlatne boje, puno pjene.... okus sladak, niÅ¡ta posebno... onako...

"Stuttgarter HofbrÃ¤u Pilsner", Flasche von REWE, Mergentheim. - Goldgelb, blank filtriert. - In der Nase mild sÃ¼ÃŸliches, etwas mattes helles Malz und nur zarte, blasse Hopfenherbe, wenig pilstypisch. - Antrunk weich und rund hellmalzig aber etwas leer. Die Hopfenherbe hÃ¤lt sich mit matter Zitrusfrucht sehr im Hintergrund. Milder rezent, nicht so schlank wie ein klassisches Pils. Im Abgang leicht trocken und hintergrÃ¼ndig herb aber ohne ausgeprÃ¤gte Hopfenaromen. - Sehr gedÃ¤mpftes Pilsener, gar nicht unangenehm, da ohne die derbe HÃ¤rte vieler Industriepilsener, aber etwas zu weich und malzbetont. Dennoch mehr als trinkbar.

Ã•lle on selline jook, et iga uus kord kui klaasi vÃµi pudeli suule tÃµstad, siis leiad midagi uut, sÃµltuvalt tuhandest-miljonist pisiasjast, mis hetke olukorda mÃµjutavad. Seega piirdun iga Ãµlle juures selle tekstiga.

Bottle. Pours clear pale golden with stable white head. Clear aroma of yeast and malt, with mild hoppy touches. Bitter, hoppy flavour with sweetish notes of yeast and malt. Estery aftertaste with hoppy notes. Well, a standard German macro pilsener. Drinkable. Mot that bad.
malty beer with a slight hop flavour. quite sweet and light. Drinkable, medium saturation, bitterness low.
Couleur jaune dorÃ©e, lÃ©gÃ¨re mousse. Nez maltÃ© doux, gras. Gout bien maltÃ©, un peux doux avec bon corps et fin sur des notes ameres houblonnÃ©e bien grasses. Bien pour le style

(Flasche) Es hat eine sehr helle, gelbe Farbe, ist klar filtriert mit einer weiÃŸen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist sÃ¼ÃŸlich, leicht getreidig mit etwas wÃ¼rzigem Hopfen. Der Geschmack ist primÃ¤r bitter. Diese Bittere ist grÃ¼n und harzig, beginnt stark und bleibt dann schwach auf der Zunge kleben. Im Rachen ist dieses Getreidesilo zu schmecken und eine leicht metallische Note begleitet das ganze.
Goldgelb Schaum ok, Geruch malzig getreidig, Geschmack getreidig herb, ein unterdurchschnittliches Pils
Vom Fass und aus der Flasche. Goldgelbe Farbe und fester weisser Schaum. Grassig und strohig in der Nase. Geschmack herb mit metallischer Note. FÃ¼r mich ist das Bier hier deutlich Ã¼berbewertet.

Ojciec wÅ‚aÅ›nie wrÃ³ciÅ‚ z Niemiec i przywiÃ³zÅ‚ trochÄ™ piwek. Herrenpils jest piwem niemal bezzapachowym. W smaku niemal klasycznie (korporacyjnie) neutralne, z przewagÄ… sÅ‚odu nad Å›redniÄ… goryczkÄ…. Nieco wodniste.
Draft. Clear yellow color, medium white head. Aroma of paper. Taste is subtle white pepper.
*Old rating. Best before 07.10. Nice fresh and crisp Pils. Floral-grassy, hints of grain, slightly dry, very nice.
Bottle 50cl, a yellow beer with medium head. Nose is very grassy like. Aroma is slightly malty, grassy and bitter, bit thin, finish is on hay, classic.
Ins Glas ergieÃŸt sich ein goldgelbes Pils mit schÃ¶ner Schaumkrone. Geruch hopfig, grasig. Geschmack herb, grasig, minimal wÃ¼rzig.

Oh man, I just like Stuttgarter beers. They are like home but also so far, far away. And I am really happy that Iâ€™ve got some more beers of this brewery in our "cellar" left.... This one has got a clear deep golden colour with steady head and crisp body. Nose of malt. Taste of medium bitter ripe hops, ripe grains, oatmeal cookies, straw and roses. Very easy and nice to drink, enjoyed it a lot.
Leicht sÃ¼ÃŸ, etwas dÃ¼nn, dazu etwas Vanille und Gras im Aroma. Teilweise erfrisched knackig, durchaus wÃ¼rzig. Etwas untypisch, aber gut.
Kristallklares goldfarben mit reichlich CO2 und Ã¼ppiger Schaumkrone. Malzig, sÃ¼ÃŸlich, fruchtig, etwas Zitrone, hefig, sehr spritzig.
The beer has got a clear golden colour with a steady head and medium body. Aroma of flowers and yeats. Taste of yeast, citrus, hops, malt and flowers. Refreshing.

Bottle in my hotel room. Pours clear gold with a medium, fizzy white head, medium retention with light lacing. Aroma is bananas, earthy wheat malt and bubble gum. Flavor is spicy hops and wheat malt, light bitterness, bananas, bubble gum and a dry finish. Light body and medium carbonation.

Many thanks for this beer to kevnic2008. Piwo jasne klarowne wiadomo to oczyszczone pszenica. Piana spora ale bardzo malo trwala. Smak i zapach o podobnych wrazeniach czyli nieco bananow jablka i gruszki. Lekko goryczkowe jak na pszenice to i tak wiele. Ogolnie srednie

(bottle) clear deep golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of canned peaches, some campfire embers and wheat, with a light touch of vanilla and barnyard. flavor is mostly wheat and powdered sugar, slightly belgian, with a light touch of tangerines, some grass and vanilla. medium-bodied with average carbonation.

(Flasche) Es hat ein dunkelgelbe Farbe,ist klar filtriert mit einer fast weiÃŸen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist getreidig, blumig und nach Dosenpfirsich. Der Geschmack ist wÃ¤ssrig, prickelnd, etwas harzig mit dem Pfirsich in der Kopfnote.
Klare dunkel goldene Farbe, fingerbreite weiÃŸe Schaumkrone. Geruch gering floral hopfig, grasig, leicht hefig. Geschmack sehr malzig, leicht floral hopfig, grasig, geringe Bitterkeit, ganz ok!

Bottle at Air By Wollhaf, Stuttgart Flughafen, 08/02/15. Clear golden with a decent off white cap, carbonation well evident. Nose is caramel, vanilla, toffee, straw, citric peel, pale malts. Taste comprises lemon rind, pale malts, straw, light caramel. Medium bodied, spritzy carbonation, semi drying close. Ok for style.

Bottle at the Dubliner in the Dormero, Stuttgart. Crystal clear golden yellow color, big fluffy white head with good retention. Aroma of black pepper, citrus bubblegum. Taste has peppery bubblegum, slight herbal or medicinal character at the finish. Nice to see this style, as I rarely see it in the US.
Bottled(330ml). -golden coloured, little soapy head, aroma of malt and hop with hoppy nose, dry finish
Nice lager , pours in golden in colour with little head retention. Malty a bit sweet in taste which then goes into a dry finish
Klares goldgelb mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Malzig, etwas sÃ¼ÃŸlich, leicht wÃ¼rzig, getreidig, sÃ¼ffig.
Bottle 50cl, a clear yellow beer with medium head. Nose is on grassy hops. Aroma is on dry malt, light cereal touch, light blond caramel, low bitterness, basic even if correct.
Meh. Yellow with a white head. Straw aroma. Reminded me of an American macro lager. Goes down easy and made for drinking by the liter. Would be better on a learn day under the sun at a Biergarten
* Old rating, many thanks to kevnic2008 for this beer, rated as Stuttgarter FrÃ¼hlingsfest-Bier. Best before 12.10. Mild-weiches, leicht sÃ¼ÃŸliches Bier. Getreidig-malzig, nett.
Itâ€™s golden with a white head. The aroma has notes of malt, straw and light bread. The flavor has a light sweetness and notes just like the aroma. The finish is slightly dry..

Clear golden colour with low steady head and medium body. Nose of sweet hops. Taste of medium bitter hops, bitter barley, straw, hay, leaves and malt. Easy to drink and quite nice but its just quite characterless and boring.

Fuer ein Pokalfinale beinahe perfekt. Beginnt im bitteren Bereich mit etwas Gerste und geht dann ueber ins sueffig-klebrig mit einer dezenten Malzsuesse und etwas Brot. Nett zu trinken, recht ausgewogen, gut.

Thank you, Kyle Durham (always number 1 son), for bringing this back from Stuttgart last week. Clear light golden amber with a white foamy hrad that reduces to a head cover; speckled lace. This is a solid pilsner - malt with sweetgrass and biscuit, joined midway through the palate by clean european hops, flowery with a polite edge, only to allow more sweet in the finish. Aroma matches taste precisely. Particularly drinkable, would be a shoo-in for sessions. As good a pilsner as Iâ€™ve ever enjoyed.
