The aroma is dominated by bubblegum, the banana is left in the background along with some lemon and a faint hint of cloves. Thereâ€™s a very faint bitterness in the flavor, not much sweetness either, and thereâ€™s both bubblegum, banana, citrus and wheat. The cloves more or less gone. A bit thin on the palate, and with a quite low level of carbonation, at least considering the style. Anyway, itâ€™s a decent, drinkable beer, but itâ€™s nothing impressive going on here. 130903

Horrible example of a hefe. Not enough carbonation, no real flavor except the lemon they serve in it ( if its a "California" hefe, shouldnâ€™t they put avocado in it?), only slightly cloudy. Donâ€™t bother.
On tap at the brewpub Appearance: Hazy orange with a small white head and spotty, with a wedge of lemon IN the glass Aroma: Banana esters and citrus Taste: Clove, banana, grainy and spices Ok

Sample at the brewery. Rating #21. Cloudy and dense yellow pour and a tight bubbled head. Light banana and lemon aroma, pretty nice. Flavor is more on the citrus side, more lemon with a light aftertaste. Pretty good. (1794)

A: As a hefeweizen should, this one pours a cloudy golden orange with a creamy white head. S: Amazingly, I get banana as the initial aroma. However, there is still the good olâ€™ lemon zest/peel that shouldnâ€™t really be there. Lots of pepper and an overcooked grain smell. Mild cloves give it a tad more authenticity. T: Though the aroma had some high points, the flavor is not very good. Light and watery to start with. Thereâ€™s a decent spiciness with some pepper and mild clove. A bit of banana and citrus peel. Itâ€™s also pretty bitter. M: Medium bodied with a medium level of carbonation. O: I got my hopes up after the first sniff, but I was let down.
Caught between being a scotch ale (as it is categorized) and a Scottish ale (as it is named). Definitely has the scotch taste but not the nice smooth maltiness.

This is the second offering from these folks that I must assume is spoiled. The pour is dark with minimal head. Aroma is vinous with a strong peat pretense. Flavor is that of red wine thatâ€™s opened too long - slightly vinegar, and sour grape. The fizziness of carbonation just make this seem like a bad wine cooler. Really a shame, as Scottish ales are one of my favorite styles, and I had big hope. But between this and the Real Ale, Iâ€™m thinking either they have serious quality control issue, or just make really awful beer.

Bottle into glass. Opaque dark brown. Sweet malt with a touch of hops on the nose, in the mouth very full. A bit sweet, almost cloying. Moderate finish, leaves a bit if stickiness. Ok, comes scoffs as a higher ABV red, and I want it to be easier going.
Attractive w/ very nice aroma. The taste is just a touch underwhelming. It has that boozy Scottish feel but is lacking in the caramel that makes scots great. Still a sold beer as a whole tho!
Bien maltÃ©. On sent un petit cÃ´tÃ© fumÃ©. Assez douce en bouche et un goÃ»t de cafÃ© sâ€™installe en finale

Bottle. Sweet light molasses aroma with a fruity and herbal floral character. Opaque dark, ruddy brown under a quickly dropping off-white sheet. Sweet brown sugar flavour with low bitterness and very faint fruitiness. Medium body, low to moderate carbonation, sweet finish.

Pours dark brown with a frothy tan khaki head. Light aromas of smoked peat, toffee and caramel. Tastes more of the same with the caramel sweetness a little more pronounced. Good thick body. Overall a good solid beer but not spectacular.

650ml bottle. Dark brown colour, thin tan head. Not a strong aroma, faint smoked peat, spring water. Taste is very mild, brown ale malt, kind of. Thick and creamy body. Overall, I didnâ€™t get much from this, but what there was wasnâ€™t bad.

Reviewed from notes. The appearance was a dark brown body with a finger of tan foamy head, no lacing. The smell was smoky/ roasty through light coffee, light chocolate, and malts. The taste was mostly sweet, eventually gets some bitter qualities through previously mentioned flavors. On the palate, it sat about a medium on the body, was pretty smooth, sessionable, bitter yet somewhat sweet aftertaste and finish. Overall, this was a pretty good Scottish ale Id probably have again.
On draft at City Swiggers. A malty, lightly smoky & bitter Scot, pretty dry for the style. Solid, but unspectacular.
Pours copper with a thin white head. Smells and tastes of light malt with some peppery hints. Straight forward version of the style.

Bomber consumed on 8/24/07, purchased fresh from the cooler at Downeast Beverage. Medium-sized white head rises up initially and falls down to cover, leaving little/no lace. Drab golden colored body is awash in carbonation. Clarity is high. Stale hops, that this brewer seems to love (see their stout) give a papery/musty/earthy touch as plentiful minerals and definite flaws make themselves known (acetyldehyde, vanillin, waxines, heavy mineral notes). Some pale malts add a touch of honey but are at extreme odds with the "hard water" smell and overpowering blandness/mustiness here. Vegetal, musty flavors at work in the beer mostly hide the underattenuated, mushy pale malt sweetness as acetyldehyde and stale, musty hop notes go nowhere. Not oxidized, just not well-lagered, it seems, nor is there any malt or yeast crispness that Iâ€™d expect out of a low gravity golden ale. Seems rather filtered as well, leading to some thinning on the end and no bottled yeast to uptake the diacetyl that this yeast pumps out. Hopefully these beers are much better on draught, because thereâ€™s no excuse for this low level of quality in bottles. Love the guyâ€™s obviously biased rating of this (honestbrewer) who rags on other people for being biased in their ratings.

(22oz bottle) Fine particulate in cloudy apple juice body, topped by large off-white head that mostly diminishes. Aroma is medium sweet, spice, some bread, lemon, light herbal. Taste is medium sweet, lemon, some bread, spice, light herbal. Light-medium body. I have little doubt that this is infected -- the lemon is uncharacteristic of the style, and make this seem much more like a golden ale. In this case, Iâ€™m guessing this is a good thing.

Finest example of this style found to date. Light clean and refreshing. YOu should try it on tap and the rating only goes up. You should see the lines for this companyâ€™s beers at any brewfest!! 10x longer than ony other. He must be doing it right!! All others are just jealous! DOnâ€™t be fooled by oxidized bottles that idiot storeowners leave out of the cooler. This goes for all beers from any brewery!

Pours a two-finger white head that fades quickly to a thin layer leaving traces of lace. Almost clear pale amber color. Slight hoppy nose. Light-medium carbonation and medium bodied. Flavor is balanced, fruity? hoppy finish. $3.50 for a 22oz bottle from Tullyâ€™s Beer & Wine Wells, Me.

Nice light orange pour with at first a big white foam head. Smells like biscuits and 2 row pale malt. Mouthfeel is bad, pretty much water. Iâ€™d heard this was the brewers staple beer, i think their ESB is much better and this is pretty much one I could have gone without.

(22 oz. bottle) Hazy yellow-gold pour, big foamy white head. Aroma nicely bready at first, but then later starts smelling like old laundry or something. Poor lacing. Very dry mouthfeel, watery, prickly. Tastes cheap, sour. Like a really bad pale lager. Oh well.

Excellent beer. Again, I may be accused of being biased, but this is probably the best ale Iâ€™ve had. Iâ€™m not much of an ale person, but this is one Iâ€™ll be drinking more often. Slightly sweet, kind of creamy taste with a hint of fruit, good smelling. Goes down easy. Excellent beer. Better than the stout even (which I also reccomend)

From a 22oz bottle. Pours hazy pale orange with an off-white creamy head. Smells of citrus and spice. Orange and lemon aromas. Sweet malt. Tastes of sweet pale malt with the orange and lemon undertones. Lightly spicy with a light airy hops finish. Smooth and creamy. Love me some cream ale... Crisp and sweet. Very drinkable. A very good cream ale.

Creamy but not quite creamy enough (body was just a tad too light). I did love the underlying flavor though, subtly sweet malts with little need for balancing, which was nonetheless accomplished with a perfect proportion of hops.

"A little too light alaround for my taste. The look was in between what you usually see in the style and a standard yellow lager. Aroma was nice but you had to work for it...subtle caramel and toasty malt. Flavor and feel pretty light as well. More a summer beer than a fall seasonal. Kind of a miss."

Not up to par with their imperial stout. A decent Octoberfest but not best of show. There was nothing wrong with this, but it lacked anything truly distinctive to make it ''great.'' On par for the course.

Not so much ''light'', I think the name distinguishes it from their dunkel weizen. This is basically a regular American wheat. Fairly well done, not over-hopped as many are, nice cloudy beer with medium-bodied mouthfeel, citrusy flavor with a nice yeasty aftertaste. Not bad at all.

Old notes. This is not this yearâ€™s edition (2012 edition), sorry for only finding the notes now. At the brewpub in South Portland, Maine. This was poured into a snifter, uh...ok, I guess Iâ€™m not going to argue but itâ€™s just a fruit beer, well hereâ€™s the rest. The appearance was a nice hazy dark brown close to light purple tinges along the sides of the glass. Thereâ€™s a decent light sliding lacing trickling down the sides of the glass. The smell had the blueberry obviously up front. It comes in fairly hard with a nice drive of some light malts to back it all up. The taste was mainly sweet through the blueberry and the malts. It leaves a decent sweet sticky blueberry aftertaste and a super refreshing finish. On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium on the body with a fairly decent sessionability about it. The carbonation was mainly subdued and lets the blueberry just coat my mouth and tongue. Overall, this was a pretty good beer to have as a dessert on late Summer in the evening. I actually remember buying at least 3 bombers of this to have on Sebago Lake just to watch the Sun go down with my olâ€™ hound dog curled up by ma feet at the olâ€™ lake house.

Dark orange-brown color with a white head. Hazy. Aroma is sweet blueberries with some strawberry and toffee notes. Flavor is blueberry, toffee and some light smoke. Not too sweet. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation.
22 oz bottle-shared by hbmason-pours red/pink with a big foamy pink head. Aroma is some berry, light malt/grain. Aroma is some berry, light malt/grain. Thin.
22 ounce bomber pour. Amber color with a red hue. Blueberry and malt aroma. Flavor is the same. More malt than blueberries.

Poured from a 750ml. bottle into a Budweiser pint glass. The color is hazy maroon/amber with a slight wisp of head and no lacing left on the glass. There a slight blueberry aroma in the nose but the malts tend to play a little difficult game of cat and mouse. It is hard to really place the just about all the aromas but it is a bit spicy. The taste is has a bit of berry but there is something that hold off identifying things a bit. There is a slight bit of juicy flavor that has some blueberry muffin flavor and a malt bready flavor. There is a sugary flavor as it goes down and it has total attention till the end where is some slight bitterness. The feel of this beer is as expected. A beer that is a little hard to cover at first but them is all about making things right. It goes from too sweet to just right and really goes down without a thought.

22oz bottle pours a translucent, ruby amber with a thin, creamy white head. Nose is nice, berry, sweet, jammy. Flavor is nice too, berry, light vanilla, lightly malty, candy. Medium bodied. Lots of good, fresh blueberry flavor.

On tap at Sebago Portland , ME location. Pours out dark amber topped with a small head. Aroma was of very light blueberries and sweet malts. Taste was just a hint of blueberries and to think that Maine is the larges producing state for blueberries they should have been over flowing in this beer. Better luck on the next batch maybe double the blue berries.

Draught at the brewpub as Blueberry Single Batch Series. Weak fruity aroma, hint of butter. Almost clear deep red colour. Small white head. The flavour is fruity, but not with a great amount of berry. Not that sweet either.

En fÃ»t. Verre de dÃ©gustation directement Ã  la brasserie. ArÃ´me: LÃ©gÃ¨re odeur de cÃ©rÃ©ales et de bleuets. Apparence: La couleur est rougÃ¢tre. PrÃ©sence dâ€™un mince col mousseux avec une fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: LÃ©ger goÃ»t de bleuets et de cÃ©rÃ©ales avec une pointe de caramel. Courte durÃ©e de lâ€™arriÃ¨re goÃ»t. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture lÃ©gÃ¨rement huileuse. Faible effervescence en bouche. LÃ©gÃ¨re prÃ©sence de bleuets en arriÃ¨re goÃ»t. (Rating #3186)
Light malt aroma with a noticeable amount of fruit. Dark orange color with a small white head. Light bitter beginning fading to a light sweet finish.
Roasted nuts and bittersweet chocolate nose. Herbal and earthy palate with notes of tobacco, leather and spiced cocoa. Very creamy mouthfeel with a very nice mocha finish.
Black..creamy tan head..big creamy coffee aroma with hints of chocolate..strong coffee flavor with a hint of bitterness at the end..creamy mouthfeel..

Another award winner by Vinnie...i swear this thing was hopped up on nitro and a few of my tablemates agreed. This one poured a glacial black with absolutely no hints of any other color to be found when held up to the light. This was just about the only Vinnie beer to have a head...beige and tan colored, BEYOND CREAMY and INVITING...good lacing and excellent head retention throughout. The aroma is purely coffee, vanilla, smokiness, and alcohol. The taste is that of coffee and roastiness with a very slight hint to the alcohol that lies within. It ends very smoothly with a mildly malty finish. Also during this aftertaste something to effects of mocha and aged wood come into the tasting...just superb. The carbonation is just excellent here...nice bubbles accumulating at the bottom of the pint glass only to assault the palate and leave a foamy creaminess of roast and smokey wood. I cant help it...i''m just stunned..that is one DAM good STOUT!!!
The foam stability is good. The Aroma is hoparomatic, fruity, a bit malty, only light bitter. The taste is hoppy, fruity, mostly citrussy, a bit green apple, some bitterness, and a bit malty. Nice!
VEry pale golden color. Frothy white head. Fairly aromatic dry hoppy nose with some fruity and grassiness. Light, dry modest bitterness, but not too aggressive. Very quaffable. Pretty Decent stuff.

Frischer, hopfig herber Beginn. Die Herbe nimmt schnell zu, hell wÃ¼rzig, die Malznoten sind fÃ¼r ein Pils intensiv. Die Hopfennoten gefallen und bleibend bis zum Ende erhalten, geringe Bitterkeit. Spritzig, gut. 9/10/10/10/9/10
SchÃ¶ner frischer Duft leichter Hopfen wÃ¼rzig, Geschmack sÃ¼ffig wÃ¼rzig mit schÃ¶n herbem Abgang, gutes Pils
0,33l Flasche beim Football in Rothenburg. KrÃ¤ftig herber Hopfenduft. Geschmack getreidig herb mit bitterem krÃ¤uterigem Abgang. Gutes Pils.

Golden color with a nice white head. Aroma is malty and sweet, notes of yeast and grass. Flavor is pretty much the same with some bitterness, low to medium carbonation and light body with a light bitter finish.

0,33 Mini-NRW-Flasche aus einem lokalen GetrÃ¤nkemarkt. Hellgoldenes Pils mit reichlich KohlensÃ¤ure und einer kleinen cremigen Schaumkrone. Die KohlensÃ¤ure strÃ¶mt am Rand der Tulpe nach oben. Riecht hopfig, wÃ¼rzig, leichte Zitrusnoten. Im Geschmack Hopfen, WÃ¼rze, leichte Zitrusnoten, Weizen

Bottled, from Biershop Bayern. Clear golden, rich head. Discrete but elegant floral spicy hop aroma. Mid dry with light-medium body and rounded mouthfeel, Lightly fruity with mild spicy hops bready malt. Mid bitter finish. Indistinct and restrained, but pleasant.

Vom FaÃŸ im Goldenen Adler, WeiÃŸenburg i.Bay. (17.4.2015). - Helles Goldgelb, klar. - In der Nase recht krÃ¤ftige Hopfenaromen, Zitrone und etwas Gras, die zunÃ¤chst ansprechend wirken, auf Dauer aber recht einseitig. - Im Antrunk eintÃ¶nige, etwas chemisch anmutende zitronige Aromen. Leicht sÃ¼ÃŸliches helles Malz. Mild rezent, weiches MundgefÃ¼hl. Im Abgang noch mehr Zitronenschale und nur wenig Hopfenherbe, entschieden zu wenig fÃ¼r ein ordentliches Pilsener. Beim WÃ¤rmerwerden kommen AnflÃ¼ge von Zahnkrem und Putzmittel zum Vorschein. - Ziemlich einseitiges, zu wenig herbes Pils. Schwach.
*Old rating, best before 14.12.10. Leicht getreidig-wÃ¼rziges Bier. Leicht sÃ¼ÃŸlich, schÃ¶n frisch, SÃ¼ffig, rund, nett.
*Old rating, best before 23.02.2003. WÃ¼rzig-sÃ¼ffiges Bier. Milde Hefenote, feinherb-getreidiger Nachgeschmack, nett.
(Bottle 50 cl) Hazy, orangey golden beer with a dense head and floating impurities. Very fresh and hoppy with a solid bitter touch. 070601

Bottle, Delerium CafÃ©, Brussel, March 2005. Muddy orange gold, good white head and gentle condition.Good mix of sweet yeast and grainy malt in the nose, much the same in the mouth but more intense and lingering long in the finish. Its yeasty and malty and good.
Bottled. Pale ornage, hazy. Obvious cellary aroma. Soft and medium bodied. Dryish with long grassy bitter finish.
Large white head. A little cloudy, golden colour. Nice lace. Hoppy aroma (citrus, grass). Smooth, lacking in taste (a little milky?).

i was excited to try an obscure kellerbier but it certainly wasn't up to bamberg standard. quite pale with yeast at the bottom of the bottle. mild vanilla almond aroma. moist, floral metallic. quite bland for a kellerbier. oh well
Hoppy gras aroma. Yellow and cloudy, nice head. Bitter and yeasty taste. Relatively lightbodied.

column1: Pacific Rim Ring of Fire Pepper Ale
column5: For a pepper beer this one is pretty good. Clear maber with a dense manilla head. Straight up jalapeno aroma. the flavor is not so over the top like some other pepper beers. The heat is just enought i be felt and the pepper flavor is not overdone. Slight burning of the palate. Not bad but it is still a pepper beer, More novelty than anything.

column1: Pacific Rim Ring of Fire Pepper Ale
column5: Finally a pepper beer I like! Clear amber body with retentive off-white head. Aroma is medium sweet, jalapeno. Taste is medium sweet, jalapeno, light caramel. Very drinkable stylewise -- yes itâ€™s pepper, but not overwhelming, just there to provide flavor. No attempt to blow you out of the water, only a mild burn in the swallow. Rated more to style, as this is the best chili beer Iâ€™ve ever had.

column1: Pacific Rim Ring of Fire Pepper Ale
column5: The wonderful smell of fresh Jalapenos in that regard this is very well crafted beer. But this baby is unpleasant and harsh and while this may well be as good a fresh pepper beer as can be make itâ€™s just not good beer. Just give up on the idea and eat your peppers on the side. Try this beer if you must.

column1: Pacific Rim Ring of Fire Pepper Ale
column5: Decent amber color--I could tell from the first sniff that this would exhibit better craftmanship than the godawful Cave Creek Chili beer. Though not listed in the commercial description, I sensed Green bell peppers in the aroma--reminding me of a nice bisque enjoyed in Port Angeles. Unfortunately, the flavor was rather harsh--not so bad as the aforementioned Cave Creek beer, but bad enough for me to pour most of it out. I suppose if I were to like pepper beer, I would like this one??

column1: Pacific Rim Ring of Fire Pepper Ale
column5: They have this every year at the Washington Summer Microbrew Festival in Kirkland. Be sure to try it at the end of the session because the hot pepper will destroy your palate for an hour or sr

Black coloured beer with limited carbonation and a short off-white head. Coffee hinted roasted and malty aroma. Medium to full palate. Finish is light bitter roasted, malty with a sharper bitter ending. Medium stout.
On tap at the brewery. Pours black with a decent tan head, and a light chocolate and coffee aroma. There is a bit of chocolate along with a roasted malt flavor with a chalky dry finish.

Pours a deep dark near black color with a thin tan head. Nice aroma, light on the roast, but has a nice light piney hop presence. The taste follows suit, with the hop character overshadowing the roast component. Kind of like a dark pale ale.

On tap, Pours with a logn lasting, large, light brown head that leaves good lacing, covering an ultra dark brown body. Aroma of coffee, vanilla, chocolate, oak and a bit of burboun. Taste is smooth and malty (burnt and toasted). Creamy mouthfeel, some alcohol and light bubbles.

On tap at brewery. Near black; big amber head. Dark roasted malt aroma and flavor - quite stout and bitter with some sour notes but overall so-so...I"m thinking infected lines or something. Wouldnâ€™t finish a pint.
Lots goinâ€™ on in this. Very roastey very chewey, very cofeeee very good! Glas they had the fire place going cuz I was warm on the outside from the fire and warm on inside from malty Stout.
Dark black beer with thin brown head. Heavy on coffee aromas and flavors. A very tastey beer, will look for again.

Aroma: smoke, roasted coffee beans, cream Appearance: dark brown, off-white head, lacing Flavor: smoke, cream, roasted malts, roasted dark coffee beans Palate: slightly watery, very smooth, almost too carbonated, roasted coffee aftertaste
Dark brown, burgundy light at the edges... roasted chocolate malts and coffee in the nose, medium thick texture, but very robust, typical coffee and light hops in a stout, but still tasty.
Has a very dark brown color and a roasted malt smell. Taste was of the roasted malts and finishes with a good bitterness. Overall the best beer they make, but not a smooth enough stout for me...

0,33 l bottle. "Garantierte Frische" (guaranteed freshness) is written on the label. IÂ´ll hope so! Pours out in a copper with a very fast fading head. Little bit licorice on the nose. Taste starts sweet malty, only a short dry bitter sequence. A little more bitterness to the end. But all on a restrained level. Inconspicuous and thin. [Test 4. April 2013]

From the tap at the taphouse. Off white head. Nose is rosted malts and earthy notes. Taste is metallic and... Earthy muddy some grassy hops in the back. Carbonation is high. Finish is long lasting with Same as starting taste. Not my Type... Meh...
Bottle from Prima Beer. Clear amber with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and light hoppy - herbal. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 190515
Bottle.Dark golden colour with small off-white head.Aroma is malty and slight grainy has some caramel flavor,but feels overall a bit watery and thin nots of hops and mild bready.
0,3l Flache. RÃ¶tlichbraunes Bier mit relativ kleiner Schaumkrone. Riecht malzig.herb. Schmeckt erst herb, fast wie ein Pils wird aber schnell vom RÃ¶stmalz Ã¼bertÃ¼ncht ohne sÃ¼ÃŸ zu werden.
Bernsteinfarbenes Bier mit wenig Schaum. Geruch malzig, getreidig, grasig. Geschmack malzig, getreidig, leicht wÃ¼rzig.
Bottle 33cl, a clear amber beer with low head. Nose is low, aroma is quite low too, slightly toasted, some bitterness, slightly grainy, nutty, noch much flavors here.

Bottle looks simple but good. Beer in the glass copper-brownish, small head. Starts mild, modest malty-dry, quite metallically. Finish a bit unbalanced, so not too drinkable. There are better Dunkels out there.

330 ml bottle. Pours a copper colour with a small white head. Aroma of toasted malts, nuts and grains. Flavour of strong grains, toasted malts, grassy bitterness and some weak sweetness. Light bodied, slick mouthfeel and soft carbonation. Finishes sweet and grainy. Decent.

33 cl bottle. Pours clear orange color with a small head. Aroma of clove, sweet caramel malts, some hay and yeast. Flavor of malts, bread, some caramel, mild toffee and hay. Mild bitter palate with a dry bready finish. 3313

cloudy dark brown colour, few head, nice lace, hay and buttery aroma with notes of blood, tart and astringent with a thin malt body, dry unpleasant finish - what''s up here ? Is it so difficult to bring a beer at maturation ?

dark red amber colour, fine head and a nice lace, deep and balanced aroma of mango and litchies, smooth and slightly tart with a decent bitterness, dry finish - another marvellous creation of Markus. Can''t this guy make something wrong ?
Another laher in Bolivia and another one like this form this brewery. Nice shape and colour a little strange in foam considering the style.
Big Bottle. Yellow colour. Weak malty aroma. Mild flavour of malt with an ok mouthfeel. When cooled a bit its an allright beer with an easy-to-drink taste.
A palatable lager. yellow, sweet and slightly corny, yet it doesn''t make you want to throw up as it goes down.

Looks good with decent head and clear yellow body. Very dry aroma of cardboard. Flavour is a muddy lager with hints of swamp and rotting garbage. This ainâ€™t right. It may look just okay, but the flavour is way off. Can found in Sucre.
Nice and refreshing, a little graspy but well brewed. NIce surprise to find so many beer sin Sucre but in a bad day for that.

Called "Sesqui" by the locals, this is one of the better beers from Sucre. Big bottle. Straw colour. Short head. Sweet, bit malty aroma. The flavour is a bit malty with some sweetness and a dry aftertaste. Good when cooled a bit.
Sugary sweet aroma. The taste of alcohol lingers on after the flavour of rancid honey has disappeared.
Bottle. Clear gold color with a white head and nice lacing. The aroma is a but farmhouse with a note of clove. It is malty. Enjoyable.
Nice wheat ale, pours a hazy yellow with a small head. Just a nice beer taste with a hint if bread and spice. You could easily drink one too many of this brew.
Cloudy thin foamy lacy white head Aroma is spicy coriander Flava is wheaty dry Feels light with little fizz Finishes mildly tangy and bitter
Pours deep golden with a thick white head. Clove, pepper and slight nutmeg spice. Malty warmth and hint of grapefruit A top notch wheat ale.
on tap at The Hulmeville Inn - cloudy light gold color. Aroma and flavor of a wheat beer. Refreshing and light.

Bottle. Spicy Belgian yeast aroma with notes of clove, black pepper, wheat malt and orange citrus. Pours cloudy golden colored with half a finger of off white head that has excellent retention and some lacing. Starts with wheat malt, orange and black pepper flavors. Finishes smooth and a bit dry with spicy Belgian yeast and clove flavors that linger on the palate after each sip. Pretty nice Belgian wit.
I had it from the bottle. The taste is orange, raisins, Belgian yeast, and spices. This was flavorful but not a spice bomb. It was filling but smooth. I enjoyed this.

Cloudy deep golden with a thick white pillowy head. Nice fluffy wheaty aroma with light tones of vanilla and bread. Smooth soft flavor thatâ€™s the same as the nose; white bread, light vanilla, a kiss of clove. Pretty standard but smooth and nice.

Can. Clouded orange hue, decent head formation. Aroma of shortbread, white peach, clove, coriander. Fruity up front, sweet peach, turning citrussy and bitter in the finish. Some clove spice but more in the aroma,

16 oz can. Smells of orange and coriander. Very clear, pale straw color with lively carbonation coming up the glass. Medium sweetness, lightly bitter, can taste the wheat malts. Lingering wheaty sweetness.

4th February 2010 Chelmsford Winter Fest. Clear and very dark brown beer. No head but has nice moderate carbonation. Quite a sharp orange cherry fruitiness on top of mild dark malt. Nicely joined up, decent, tasty and a bit of a palate cleanser.
Botella. Sweet bready roasty aroma. Thin mouthfeel. Flavour of dark malts and dark bread, caramel, some spice. Sweet dark bready malty roastish like finish.
Bottle at PapsÃ¸ tasting. It pours a light brown colour with a off white head. Aroma is light roasted and honey. Flavour is similar with notes of cereals as well. Rather thin mouthful.
Bottle at PapsÃ¸â€™s - Thanks. Clear dark brown - white head. Candy, sweetness, bolcher, barley, ryebread, Ã¸llebrÃ¸d, berries, light spicy, cookies. Tjaaa....

Bottle at PapsÃ¸. Clear red brown coloured with a small off-white head. Fruity aroma of caramel, dried fruits and overriped fruits. Sweet favour of caramel, cookies, dried fruits and overriped fruits. Fruity finish.
Clear mahogany with a small off white head. Sweet aroma with roasted malt and caramel. Sweet flavor with roasted malt, caramel and toffee. Finished sweet.

50 cL bottle. Pours dark brown with a small tan head. Aroma is roasted and light fruity to caramelish. Bitter, malty and slight breadish. Lingering malty and slight roasted malty. Ends dry and bitter finish.
clear dark amber, smooth brown head. nutty aroma, sweet malty, quite roasted malty and caramelly for a bw. flavor is caramel, fait roasted stuff, faint flowery note probably hops.

Bottle 50 cl. Courtesy of tdtm82. Pours a clear and warm reddish with a tiny beige head. Lots of dark dried fruits in the nose with a little phenols. Medium body, again dark fruits, low carbonation, lots of phenols. Hardly any bitterness. Hardly a Barley Wine. 180311

Cask, gravity at Merton Winter Beer Festival 05-01-10 Pours conker brown with a light beige head. Touch of tangy fruit on the nose, like sour sharp summmer berries. This is also quite tangy in the mouth, with the aforementioned berries showing again there is a bit of fluffy marshmellow and vanilla to temper the fruit tang, Its fine but maybe not the beer that I wanted at that time. A6 A4 F6 P3 Ov12 3.1

Poured into a pint glass, the appearance was a semi-burnt orange close to light muddy brown color. Slim cap of a white foamy head. Slow dissipation. No lacing. The aroma smells like pine nuts and dried grass with sweet booze. Dried dark fruits, brown sugar, and subtle light wood. The flavor steers to the sweet side through a blend of the previously mentioned aromas. Sly dark fruity/boozy aftertaste and finish. On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium on the body with a fair sessionability about it. Carbonation runs fair with a sly accepatable sticikiness to it. Overall, an ESB that wants to be an English Strong ale. Does it? Sligtly, well, in VPBâ€™s fun and creative sort of way. Good for what it is.

on tap-pours a tight light tan head that laces and hazy amber color. Aroma is sweet light malt/grain, some earthy hops. Taste is sweet light malt/grain, secondry earthy hops, with the hops carrying through on the after taste. More SB/Bitter than ESB.

On tap. Similar to the cask-conditioned version of the regular Dogbite, this Special Reserve has a slightly stronger alcohol profile, more vanilla nd plum notes in the (superb) flavor and is more complex and multifaceted than its cousin. Super-smooth, creamy, medium-bodied start, strong piney hop profile in the middle and an amazing long dry champagny finish; aroma probably deserves better but will have to wait until I can get a less smoke-influenced sample. Just great.
Draught at the brewpub Golden to amber color. Strangely the main flavor of this beer is oxidisation; poorish malt flavor, very light aroma, lowish bitterness. Forgettable.

(Draught) Sampled at the brewpub on June 5, 2010. Astringent. Soapy water nose, somewhat lactic again â€“ as was the NGD. Sweet corn body. Honey? Well â€“ watery though. Reminds me of some of SKâ€™s less desirable brewpubs. 3/2/3/2/6
Golden body with no head. Aroma is light malts and honey. Flavour is light with a creamy honey feel. Quick finish. A decent honey beer but nothing overly special.
Golden ale with sweetish palate of creamed honey, clover. Crisp finish. Light, straighforward, pleasurable - it''s not great beer by any stretch but it does what it wants to do.
Nitrogenated. Near black, rich foam. Light Irish-style body - creamy but not watery. Decent roast and malt development for a nitro, with a dry, hop and coffee finish.
Rich, full bodied, and dark. strong nose. Malty middle and an odd aftertaste. Needs some work. Might have aged well if they hadnâ€™t taken this one out of the Phillips roster.
Brassin 2002. Robe brune lÃ©gÃ¨rement voilÃ©e surmontÃ©e dâ€™une mousse beige timide. ArÃ´mes de scotch, de malt et de levure. Saveurs de bois, de malt, de sucre et dâ€™alcool.

Bouteille verte de 375 ml avec bouchon de liÃ¨ge 22 oz partagÃ©e avec MartinT, Beerbuzzmontreal et M_Heine. Brassin 2002. ArÃ´me: Odeur de cerises, de prunes et de raisins. Apparence: La couleur est brune-ambrÃ©e. PrÃ©sence dâ€™un mince col beige et dâ€™une fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: GoÃ»t de caramel fruitÃ©. La durÃ©e de lâ€™arriÃ¨re goÃ»t est moyenne. Palette: Le corps est plein avec une texture huileuse. Lâ€™effervescence en bouche est moyenne. PrÃ©sence de caramel en arriÃ¨re goÃ»t. (Rating #381)
Pours a brown color with a small head. Great aromas of caramel, candy and spices. Sweet, spicy and slightly hoppy flavors. Interesting but too short and subtle.

Caramel figures prominently in very fruity (plum), cookie-like aroma. Dark amber-brown with off-white head that recedes to decent cover. Marginal lace. Silky smooth mouthfeel. Slips down without a thought. Some sherry-like tones to a fruity caramel flavour. Does not deliver all the aroma promises but is rather enjoyable all the same. Complex aroma never quite materialize in the flavour or perhaps just donâ€™t marry well. Bottle (enjoyed with beerbuzzmontreal, MartinT and Rastacouere).

Humid caramel nose hiding earthy yeastiness and grassy hops...Toffee candy smothers the tired mouthfeel but struggles to survive the big-bubbled carbonation...Not enough of a chatty malt to make pleasure last, but nonetheless interesting as a 3-year-old barley wine...

Copper clear body with a short-lasting off-white head. Aroma is moderately alcoholic (serious rhum aspects), but also got interesting peat aspects, scotch ale caramelic. Palate also has those characteristics to which are added vinous grapes and butterscotch (and very buttery one at that). Were the carbonation a little lower, this would seem like a typical english barley wine, although a little astringent and thin-bodied.

A deep mahagony color, a full nose of hazelnuts, dark rum, apples, raisins. The medium body, has brown sugar, raisins, dark rum and slightly syrupy while ending moderately bitter and rich. Very succulent and hides the 10.5% alcohol very well.

Dark red/brown body with a massive rocky head that never fell. Aroma was malty and sweet with a presence of cherries. Flavour was sweet but overly alcoholic for my liking. The finish was long and smooth. Probably needs more time to develop.

huge rocky off white head. lasts and lasts. Dark reddish hues. nice maltiness with some molasses and sweetness. goo barley wine aromas.taste was a bit too much for ne. long long finish which was warming and i thought quite alcoholic.
Bottle from Appellation Wines. Pours clear golden with a thin white head. Aromas of cooked corn, green beans, light malt. Taste is creamy malt, more vegetal notes. Light spice on the finish.
Clear golden, white head. Malty, hoppy aroma, slightly doughy. Bready flavour, mild, spice. Decent quencher.

Bottle from Appellation Wines. Appearance - golden with gentle carbonation. Decent proportionate head. Nose - sweetcorn, green beans, brown bread. Taste - creamy malt, tomato plant and hop spice. Palate - light bodied, creamy Helles type middle. Gently dry finish. Overall - nice.

Aroma is medium malty. It smells like grain. Clear, light yellow to golden color with a medium sized, white head. Flavor is medium sweet, light bitter. It tastes like grain and honey. Body is medium, mouthfeel is thin. Finish is short and medium bitter. Very nice Helles.
Very drinkeable beer. Looks good. Nothing special but also nothing bad.Not sure why this is called dortmunder style but I like it

Hm, dziwne piwo. Takie zwykÅ‚e, niechlujne powiedziaÅ‚bym. SkÅ‚ad - niemieckie prawo czystoÅ›ci, klasyka. Barwa zÅ‚ocista, biaÅ‚a piana, klarowne. SÅ‚odowe, Å›cierkowe, no sÅ‚abe, niepijalne wrÄ™cz. Jestem na nie.
Schmeckt mir am besten aus der Flasche; Im Glas verliert es ein bisschen seine Kraft.
Pretty standard lighter lager, nothing that makes it stand out. Itâ€™s clean with a little bit of body, but not mych else. Dresden getrankmarkt
Pretty dull, bread, grain, cereal flavours, little malt, slight bitterness on the finish. Clear, beautiful gold, fine white and lacy head.

Bottle courtesy of our log cabin landlord in Dachau, Bavaria, Germany. We're listening to the great Bicep album, Tuesday 15th January 2019. Pours gold, superb clarity, small white head. I was expecting a touch of cereal on the aroma but it's subtle to the point of very little at all on the nose. It's fine if a touch plain and unexciting, a mild bitterness runs through but it's a little thin and doesn't really do much for me. That said it's fine enough and a happy glugger if drinking and not rating. A5 A4 T6 P3 Ov12. 3.0

This is one of the great ciders of the US. It is keeping with the great artisinal ciders of the UKâ€™s West Country. White Oak Ciders are in the Slow Foods Movement Ark of Regional Foods, one of the few American craft products to be included.

This was unfortunately another one of those ciders which tasted more like a white wine than a cider. Not that it was bad by any means, but not what I was expecting. It had a soft amber color with a minimum amount of fizz. Its nose was very much like a white wine, as well as was its aftertaste. Very dry.

Hmmm. Had at the Strong Ale Fest in AZ. Nitro, Incredibly creamy almost to the detriment of the beer. Obvious chocolate flavor up front.The almond was noticeable but not overwhelming on the finish. A truly unique stout. One that will make me hit the pub for the 1st time.

Almost black, creamy (nitro) tan head. Malt, chocolate, and alcohol in the aroma. Slightly sweet flavor of roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, and a perfect subtle hint of almonds. Full mouthfeel, very smooth. Not as complex as other imperials, but the almond is a very nice touch.

On tap at the brewpub, pours a hazy orange with some lacing white head. Nose has lemon, orange, soap, some wet paper bag, soggy grist. Flavor has mild honey and caramel, wet crackers, soap, pine, some citrus peel. Finishes dry, bitter a touch tannic.

Second beer over dinner. Slightly hazy with a thin bubbly head. As the Czechs say... You know a great beer at the first sip, but you should really finish it to make sure. This beer falls into that category. Piney and sweet hops encompass malts for nose. Full and rich body that is sturdy and robust. Balanced malts and hops...which says a lot since this has a heap of both. A tasty beer with crab cakes.

4 oz pour on draft at Franklins. Clear orange with off-white head. Aromas of citrus, floral notes, light pine. Tastes of floral, spices, citrus and tropical fruit. Medium body with a dry finish. Really liked this one.
Citrus and pine with some grass. Light hint of anise. Pours gold with OK head. Medium bitter finish. Pretty fresh hops here. Tap at brewpub.

Pours copper with off white head. Aroma is citrus and pine. Flavor is sweet citrus with a grapefruit, and pine finish. I think So Long and Thanks for All the Hops ruined all the other IPAâ€™s for me on this day.
Draft at source. Golden with white head. Aroma is grassy lemon citrus hop. Medium malty with lots of grassy piney hop flavors and pleasant bitterness. Classic fresh IPA, very nice.

On tap at Franklinâ€™s Restaurant, Brewery & General Store in Hyattsville, MD, part of a flight of 10. Appearance is an orange-amber color with an off-white head. Aroma is some citrus and orange peel plus a bit of malt. Taste is similar but with some nice citrus hop character. Palate is medium body and a slight bitterness. This is one of Franklins better beers. MORE please.
On tap at the brewery. Pours a hazed amber with a small white head. Bold citrus on the nose. Medium bodied, pungent and spicy hops. Earthy malt into the finish with a bit of grapefruit and quinine.
On draft at the brewery. Pours a cloudy copper with an off white head. Citrus nose. Flavors of orange, grass and pine resin. Bitter finish.
Pours rather unclear amber . Smell is sweether side of grassy . Taste is bitter, oranges , citrussy . Bitter finish .
Slightly mango flavored hoppy taste. Ice cold very refreshing on a hot day in Santa Cruz.
Butelka 0,5l wypite w Boliwii. Barwa jasnozÅ‚ota, klarowne, piana Å›rednia. Aromat metaliczo-sÅ‚odowy. Smak sÅ‚odowy, metaliczny.Nagazowanie duÅ¼e ale niekorzystne dla piwa. Gorzkawe, do wypicia.
Quite incipit. NOt much to say about, quite almost white and some foam too.
Inoffensive South American lager. Light and bubbly with little character or anything else to set it apart from any other beer. Refreshing and light for hot days and nights in the south of Bolivia.
Quantum Of Solace motivated me to drink this beer. Not bad, but not good either. Nasty bitter aftertaste, and some metal were what I tasted. Not going to have this again, thats for sure

Crystal clear yellow coloured body with a light white head and tons of bubbles that rise from the bottom. Aroma of metal, fruits and blood. Light to Medium-bodied; Tastes of malt, wheat and metal dominate the taste. Aftertaste is very bitter, showing pale malt and very little else. Overall, not pleasant at all, but yet another Bolivian beer to sample. This is the first time I saw this beer, on the last day of the trip. I sampled this 250 cm3 bottle purchased at a Supermercado on Monsenor Rivero (road) in Santa Cruz, Bolivia on 17 August 2006.

Weak straw colour. Weak maltish aroma. The flavou is quite weak but the maltiness is there. Average aftertaste with a touch of bitterness. Ducal Pilsener is the local beer of Santa Cruz and has more than 30% of the beer market in the Santa Cruz region.

Santa Cruzâ€™s beer, and the last new beer for me to try in Bolivia. Pours like ginger ale, yellow with tons of bubbles, rising, and stuck on glass. Head is big, uneven, and foamy white. Aroma is big, strong for 5%, packing lots of malt, corn and rice. Taste actually begins remniscent of ginger ale, sweet, then some apple and banana malts, along with tons of burpy carbonation (read soda water), white grapes, and sweetness rounding out the unexciting palate. Tropically distinguishable from the rest of Bolivian beers, but not great by any means. Think of a malted ginger ale with a little alcohol. Sampled from a 8oz small bottle purchased from a grocery in steamy, palm covered, Santa Cruz.

"Twist off" top. Pale yellow colour with an "unclean" appearance. Unpleasant hay-like aroma, bland flavour, and a weakly bitter finish. Certainly not my favourite Bolivian beer (yes, I have tried others!). Local price: 4,20.
Passable, reasonably dry and clean, you can''t really taste the adjuncts, but then again, you can''t taste much at all.

Ein tolles WeiÃŸbier. Bei uns in der Gegend (zu Recht) eine Institution und eine Legende. Typischer, ganz eigener, krÃ¤ftig hefig und getreidiger Geschmack. Recht weich. Sehr viel Hefe die durchs Glas wabbert. Toll anzusehen. Herausragend aus der Masse. Not everybodys darling. Irgendwie schmeckt man sofort, dass das aus ner kleinen Klitsche kommt und nicht in einer GroÃŸbrauerei fÃ¼r den Massengeschmack "entwickelt" wurde. Nachtrag: Ende 2015 wurde ein GroÃŸteil der Produktion an die Passauer LÃ¶wenbrauerei ausgelagert. Hat sich das Bier dadurch verÃ¤ndert (immerhin haben der Andorfer und LÃ¶wenbrauerei Braumeister den Brauprozess/Rezeptur extra auf die neue Brauanlage zugeschnitten)? NatÃ¼rlich ja. Aber nicht negativ. Ich finde es ist noch etwas weicher, vielschichtiger und ausgewogener geworden. Das getreidige ist leicht reduziert, dafÃ¼r sind mehr blumige Noten dazugekommen. Auch die Farbe kommt mir minimal dunkler vor. Super. Andorfer war frÃ¼her ein Weltklasse-WeiÃŸbier, ist es heute immer noch und hat sich sogar noch mal leicht gesteigert.

Optisch sieht das Bier dunkelbernsteinfarben aus. Am Glasboden sammelt sich die Ã¼brige Hefe. Der Antrunk ist sÃ¼sslich, fruchtig, malzig und wÃ¼rzig. Zwischendurch prickelnd und wÃ¼rzig. Im Abgang markant sÃ¤uerlich, aber noch angenehm. Das Etikett, in silber und golden gehalten sieht gewÃ¶hnungsbedÃ¼rftig aus.
Bottle: Dark yellow, hazy color, white foamy head. Aroma is wheat, yeast, citrus and cloves. Flavor is wheat, yeast, banana, cloves. Quite ok.

[2017-07-02, Weizenbierbrauerei W. Andorfer, Passau-Ries] Hyvin samea, hieman kultaa tummempi vÃ¤ri. Tuoksu hyvin hiivainen ja hbanaaniakin lÃ¶ytyy. Maku hiivainen, purukumia ja banaania lÃ¶ytyy myÃ¶s. Keskiasteisen hiilihappoinen, keskitÃ¤ytelÃ¤inen. Ei kovin raikas, vehnÃ¤oluiden heikommasta pÃ¤Ã¤stÃ¤ liiallisen hiivaisuutensa vuoksi.
Sampled at the brew pub. OK fluffy white head. Cloudy solid yellow color. Big banana aroma. The banana also dominate the taste. A bit to much sweetness and not enough bitterness.

(bottle) very hazy golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of peanuts, cheesecake and vanilla, quite grassy, with some notes of brown sugar and grass. flavour is mostly salted popcorn and wheat, with a touch of floral hops, some banana skins and a minerally finish. medium-bodied with lively carbonation.
Bottle. Grey amber, low off white head. Clove, somewhat dead yeast nose, minerals, perfumed, bready, light orange peel. Muddled.
Bottle. Nose hits the weizen notes well, banana, bubblegum, floral. Palate is a bit watery, bitter, not that much banana. Average weizen
Clear golden with little white head. Aroma is banana, mealy stuff, and peas, some leek. Taste is also pretty green, a bit sweet and a bit bitter. Medium drinkable, not so full bodied. Ok.
Bottle. Hazy golden color with white head. Aroma is bananas, cheesecake, a bit vegetal. Taste is bananas, cheesecake. Quite refreshing.
Heller und hefiger, plÃ¶rrig sÃ¼ÃŸer Antrunk. Etwas herb, die SÃ¼ÃŸe bleibt zu stark. Wenig aromatisch. 11/7/8//7

On tap at the brewpub. TrÃ¼bes dunkel goldenes Bier mit einer schÃ¶nen weiÃŸen schaumkrone. Geruch leicht wÃ¼rzig, Nelke, hefig, wenig phenolisch. Geschmack schwach fruchtig, leicht hefig, gering wÃ¼rzig, insgesamt wÃ¤ssrig und schwach.

On tap at the brewpub. Says "gegrÃ¼ndet im HofbrÃ¤u Traunstein". So is this really brewed on site? Murky golden amber cour, white head. Aroma of clove, phenols, banana, hint of caramel, CO2. Flavour is light, banana, wheat tartness, CO2, caramel, tiny hint of toast, light-bitter finish. Light-bodied. Decent Weizen.

Draught Good amberish head over shiny, but cloudy orange-foxy beer. Banana! Banana!! Banana!!! Plus wheat & some orangearoma. Orangey, near-phenolic, banana and cloves in the mouth. Perfect sweet-sour balance. Medium bodied, well-filled, aromatic palate. Nice Weisse, that makes the trainpassage out to Feldkirchen well-worth.

(Bottle, 2 litres, at One Pint Pub, Helsinki, on 2008-11-10) Brownish orange. Cloudy. Dense long lasting medium sized white head. Medium bodied palate with lot of carbonation. Some butter and cowhouse in nose. Sourness, banana, bitterness, butter and fruitiness in taste. Fruity and lightly bitter aftertaste. The beer in the bottle may have gone a little bit stale during transportation from the South of Germany to Finland.

Dark red brown colored with medium sized yellow head. Hazy appearance. Fruity banana aroma with fine grainy hints, yeast also present. Medium bodied. Flavor is even richer with grains and some sweet caramel. Aftertaste has some bubblegum and yeast. Excellent, specially after long walk from underground.

Draught at the brewpub. Sweet and sugary aroma. Cloudy dark brown colour, small creamy tan head. Citric and slightly buttery flavour. Sugary aftertaste. Not undrinkable, but there are plenty of better beers out there.

On tap at Flieger. Dark brown colour with generous head. Orange and peachy. Alcohol content of 8.1% very well masked. Butterscotch aftertaste. Very enjoyable, one of my favourite beers at the Oktoberfest.

Cloudy orange-amber color; rocky head. Quite malty and spicy aroma. Ordinary taste, spicy, a bit sweet, malty, chewy, candies, a bit too much carbonic-aggressive. Ordinary palate with some light fruitness (bananaâ€¦).

Tap at FliegerbrÃ¤u. The place reopened under new management, the beer seems to have improved. Cloudy tanned orange, offwhite head. Clove banana and vanilla on solid bread. Spice and vanilla finish. Exemplary south Bavarian weissbier. Old rating: 4 4 6 2 9 Slight ester & banana aroma. Murky orange brown, finely carbonated nice creamy head. Estery yeasty banana taste. Dust aftertaste. Lightbodied. They could have done better.
Pours murky orange with a thin white head and some sediment that quickly settles. Aroma is mostly hops, flavor is very soapy, some hop bitterness, sticky and syrupy. Meh.

On tap at the brewpub on 12/6/07: Transparent dark copper amber pour has a nicely-lacing frothy light tan head. Aroma of lightly sweet caramel malt with some fresh grapefruity and orange hoppy notes. Body starts pretty viscous with sweet caramely character and some astringent bitterness toward a slightly earthy, bittersweet finish. I noticed the same strange bitter off-flavor in their coffee stout.

Unfiltered and hazy dark amber and copper colored body with a frothy, thick head. Very strange nose of faint wet cardboard (again), some mineral and vegetable notes, but altogether it doesnâ€™t smell very strong at all, itâ€™s a very mild, almost nonexistent smell. The flavor consists of some light cherry and crystal malt qualities, and it sits thick and vinuous on the palate, but itâ€™s under-carbonated and without any dominant malt body to play on, the most striking feature is the wet cardboard that Franklinâ€™s seems to have in a lot of their beer. In the finish I get a turnip note, which I donâ€™t think Iâ€™ve ever tasted in beer before.
Tasted at brewery. Hazy orange with a white head. Sweet caramel malty aroma and taste with a good hoppy profile.
Draught. Murky brown, small lacy head. Aroma is very hoppy, citrusy, and malty. Flavor is similar, nice bitter finish, alcohol in aftertaste. More like an imperial IPA than barleywine.

Pours a murky amber orange with a wisp of an off white head. Fruity aroma with some caramelized sugar in the background. Nice full mouthfeel and medium soft carbonation. Flavor has a nice amout of fruity hops balanced by some toffee and caramel. Nice bitter finish. Based on previous beers tonight, Its obvious that this brewer like hops. Nothing overly complex, but solid and enjoyable.

Cloudy opaque amber body with a small, off-white head. The aroma is grapefruit, tangereine, fairly hoppy for barley wine with some caramel and toffee. The flavor is caramel, herbal, citrus and moderately sweet. Medium/full body with a sticky texture and soft carbonation.

I love Franklins but this was a failure. No head, transparent brown. Almost no aroma but I guess if you search you can smell some malt. Flavor was apple at first but finishes with a toxic, industrial taste. I admire a craft brewer for trying it, but Iâ€™d tinker with the recipe next time.

Draft, at Franklins; listed as 9.5%. Cloudy, dark reddish-orange appearance; off-white head with good retention and lacing. Plenty of maply syrup and floral / citrus hops in the aroma; oddly, Iâ€™m getting hints of plastic and a slightly lactic quality. Medium-to-full, balanced mouthfeel: plenty of sugar and maple syrup maltiness backing things up, with generous amounts of chewy, citrus hops upfront; good levels of carbonation, very tasty young, though this would age well. Slightly bitter finish, showing citrus and floral hops.

On tap. Served in a snifter glass. A hazy brownish-red pour with a thick khaki head that lingers. Not a whole lot going on aroma-wise. Fairly sweet and malty aroma with some pears in there. Medium-bodied. A very balanced taste. An ample amount of sweet caramel and malts with a dry, bitter grapefruit finish. The alcohol is slightly noticeable, but I definitely didnâ€™t think this was near 10%. Pretty good.

Pours a dark cloudy amber. Gentle aroma of citrus hops. Flavor is a solid malt backbone, with some malty sweetness and strong complex hops flavors - citrus, grapefruit, grassy, floral. Hoppy yet not too bitter. Tasty ESB.

On nitro: Pours a hazy dark copper amber with a well-lacing frothy off-white head. Aroma of sweet toasty caramel malt and fresh resiny piny hops. Starts with good fullness and rich malty sweetness balanced with a pretty assertive grapefruity hoppiness for the style before a crisp bittersweet finish. A nice and very drinkable ESB.

Cask and force-carbonated tap at the brewpub. Red-brown colored. Light malt and english hops in the aroma, with a powerful honey sweetness in the cask version. The flavor is clean and relatively dry caramel malt with a firm hoppy bitterness. The cask version has a sweet honey component adding to this, along with a more grassy aromatic hop character. medium bodied, with lower carbonation in the cask, but not too low. I preferred the regular version and will score according to that, as the cask had too much residual honey for my taste, though some might like the component that it adds.

Nitro pour at the brew pub. Came to the table a hazy, slightly translucent, orangey brown with zero head. Malty aroma, crackers and biscuit with some slight citrus hops lurking. Flavor was well balanced, sweet malts, sort of that chewy, bready, grainy flavor profile with citrus hops, oranges and lemons, coming in on the end. Crisp finish with some lasting bitterness. Very drinkable and enjoyable. Earlier Rating: 10/28/2006 Total Score: 3.7 This beer looks phenomenal. Murky brown with an orange tint to it with a off white frothy, creamy head. Malty aroma with a hint of hops. Malty flavor, only slightly roasted but bitter at the start and finish. Full bodied and sweet as well. I really liked this.
I miss this! When I lived in DC I think this was may favorite local brew! Nice hops and a crisp finish! The malts are complex without being over the top. A well crafted ESB
On tap at the brewpub. cloudy dark amber with hop aroma. good esb - finish is bitter on sides of tongue. good palate.
Dark amber body, lots of off white lacing. A good amount of caramel toffee malt aroma and flavor backed up with a generously juicy hop profile. Very easy drinking.

On tap. Hazy, leathery light-brown pour with a very small light-tan head that leaves webs of lace. Aroma is quite faintly of nuts, sweet malts and some hops. Medium-bodied. BIG tastes to this one. Some chocolate, nuts and caramel are present along with more hops than usual for this style. The tongue-stripping, hoppy finish is quite bitter and lingers forever. A unique and extremely flavorful ESB.

Hazy crimson amberish, thin fizzy white head. Nose held notes of citrus, caramel, and hints of toffee. It certainly was well balanced with citrus hops up front and sweetened caramel malt lying just below the surface. Medium bodied, soft carbonation, drying fruity hop finish. Good session beer if 6.5% fits in your definition of "session beer"...
Draft, refreshing aroma lotâ€™s of hops. Taste is very sweet, a little too sweet...but has a bite to it as well, kind of like rusting lead pipes. Donâ€™t like this one too much.
Bottle 0.5l at home, Oulu. Originally rated 10072012. Colour is cloudy golden with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, banana, wheat and malts.
TrÃ¼bes goldgelbes Bier mit schÃ¶ner Schaumkrone. Geruch hefig, fruchtig. Geschmack hefig, fruchtig, minimale WÃ¼rzigkeit.

Appearance: Cloudy murky brown golden color with a small white head that fast vanish. Aroma: Wehat and some banana. Palate: Medium body. Moderate sweet and a light bitterness. Soft carbonation. Taste: Wheat, light fruity and some banana. Deep malty and slightly sweet background. Overall impression: Swing top bottle. Some carbonation had probably left the bottle before I had the chance to drink it. A bit to flat. Otherwise I think this would have been a nice beer. Personal stats: Bottle from a trade with Grima.

bottle from Bierzwerg. Cloudy pale yellow, large and creamy white head. Wheaty and yeasty with a pleasant malty character, slightly fruity (banana, mainly). Overall, this is a very nice example of the style.

(bottle) pours a murky golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of banana, peanuts and light earth, slightly toasty, with a hint of vanilla. flavour is mostly caramel, floral hops and popcorn, with a hint of alcohol and a pronouncedly tart lemony finish. medium-bodied with quite soft carbonation.
500 ml bottle a orange yellow colored beer with a white head aroma wheat banana and yeast flavor wheat yeast fruits spicy and some hops

Bottled 500ml (BZ, BB 11/2012) Bright orange color, vanishing head. Aroma has banana and yeast but also tart and glueish notes. Medium-bodied. Citrusy, long tart and acidic aftertaste with light cellary notes. Flip-top bottle said "pop!" but this feels infected.

500 ml bottle. From bierzwerg.de. Hazy dark golden colour with average size off-white head. Yeast, rubber, banana, mild caramel and mild wheat in aroma. Flavour is yeast, caramel, floury wheat and mild banana. Quite alright Weizen.
50 cl bottle. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is dry estery, light phenolic and light banana. Fruity, light estery. Mild malty and vague citric into a smooth fruity finish.
Swing top bottle from bierzwerg.de. Hazy golden color with small white head. Yeast, banana in aroma. Taste, wheat, yeast, banana, clove. Fruity finish. Drinkable.

On tap at Big Ridge, pours a clear dull copper with a small white head. Aroma brings out vegetal and herbal notes, like a typical cream ale. Flavour follows suit, with a quite unpleasant metallic tinge. Not very good at all - too many off-notes.

Name: #17 Cream Ale Date: September 06, 2009 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub Appearance: pale yellow, fine white head, drippy lace Aroma: sweet malt aroma, light floral hops Body: sweet creamy body Flavor: sweet malt flavor, touch of vanilla and corn sweetness, just a touch of bitterness Aroma: 4/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 7/10; Overall: 9/20 Rating: 2.6/5.0 Drinkability: 6/10 Score: ** /4
Golden and slight haze. Aroma is thin and slightly sour. A little sweetness in the flavour but otherwise light malty and pretty simple.

Pale goldne colour, thin white head. A touch of honey and caramel in the nose. Flavour is really sweet. Light diacetyl and lacking in both hop aroma and the bitterness they give you. It gets cloying pretty quickly.
Light amber colour. Light, slightly malt-accented aroma and flavour. Not much going on, just knock it back I guess.
Gold with off white head.Light creamy malt flavor with mild hopping and a cigar butt finish
Sparkling brown,huge lasting off white head.Malt nose. Great sweet malt profile, but drink very cold as some unpleasant flaws come out after it warms

Date: September 06, 2009 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub Appearance: clear dark amber, fine tan head, drippy lace Aroma: light sweet malt aroma, hint of chocolate, hint of dark caramel Flavor: sweet malt flavor, dark caramel sweetness, nice chocolate, light bitterness Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 7/10; Overall: 11/20 Rating: 3/5.0 Drinkability: 7/10 Score: ** /4
Brown with lasting tan head. Lightly roasted coffee nose.Mostly coffee malt flavor with note of chocolate. Rich and full bodied

Had this one on bottle many years ago. NordsjÃ¶ was located close to my hometown Motala and I think it was distributed both on Systembolaget and on local pubs. Back then this was a big surprise, I was thrilled to find a beer with blueberries. As I recall it, I found it nice by then, but not really what I was used to. I used to drink macro lagers and had a favorite in John L:s GuldÃ¶l. Things do change...

Bottled, backlog from around 2000. The brewery was first located in GÃ¶tarsvik, before relocating to NordsjÃ¶. A blue-red coloured (what else?) blueberry lager with blueish head that I found quite interresting since this is, to the best of my knowledge, the first fruit- or berry flavoured commercial beer in Sweden. The blueberry taste is accompanied by a well brewed lager, but after a while it gets overwhelmingly sweet. I think itâ€™s a mistake to sell it only in 500ml bottles. Behind the massive blueberry taste there is just a hint of bitterness.
Tasted at Kansas City Beerfest at Union Station October, 2015. I had so many that this rating might be a bit off. ;)

big 22 oz bottle. not sure how old it is, either. anyway, smells like a belgian strong, spiciness. but if itâ€™s supposed to be an APA then itâ€™s probably oxidized. slightly cidery flavor, which means it probably IS oxidized, but oh well...aside from resembling old stale centennial hops, itâ€™s not actually that bad.

Bottle. I found this bottle in a corner store in the Mission. A nice surprise. A medium golden color with a laced off-white head. A strong malt flavor with a little citrus and hops in the aroma. Somewhat soft on the palate.

12 oz bottle at the Javelina Cantina in Sedona, Arizona. The pour is a cloudy golden copper with a small white head with lace. The aroma is wheat grain, clove and a bit of lemon. The taste has the wheat grain upfront with clove yeast, mineral and lemon citrus. Hits all the Hefe notes nicely. The palate is medium bodied, unfiltered mouthfeel and a cleanish finish.
Draft sample at the source. The beer is a hazy yellow with a white head of foam. Lots of sweet banana character. Finishes a bit doughy. Lighter body and medium carbonation.

4 oz. taster at the source.Poured a golden straw color with white head. Nice juicy and banana, wheat nose. Taste is banana, clove and wheat. Nicely brewed, people must have tried old bootles. Draft is great!

12 oz bottle as Oak Creek Hefeweizen. (Sun Devil Liquors) Mesa, AZ. Hazy mid-brown color with a small off-white head. Yeast, rubber, mild bitterness and banana in the aroma. The flavor is yeast, yeasty bitterness, dryness, wheat and malt.

Tap. Poured a hazy golden yellow color with an average frothy white head that mostly lasted with good lacing. Moderate wheat, clove, banana aroma. Medium body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium sweet flavor with a medium spice sweet finish of moderate duration. Soft drinkable beer.
On draft at the brewpub. Hazy yellow pour, with a white head. Wheat, banana, yeast, watery, and easy drinking.

12 oz single bottle from Total Wine & More - Gilbert, AZ. Yellow to orange and light hazy appearance with a fully dissipating head. Aroma of banana, esters, clove, light toasted grain and light peppery spices. Similar flavor, adding a lingering syrupy sweetness. Light body with a watery feel. Pretty meh overall.
Poured from a tap. Hazy orange color, small white head. Medium wheat and citrus aroma. Medium body with a traditional wheat flavor and a medium finish. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle to glass in Tucson for lunch. The only craft option at the lunch spot. Generally bright and effervescent. Solid banana, but only faint clove.
Draft @ the brewpub. Pours cloudy pale straw color with white head. Aromas of clove, banana, yeast, and wheat. Similar flavors. Medium body with moderate carbonation.
On tap at the brewpub. Straw yellow in colour, white foam, deceptively fizzy. Some bready malt, a spicy hop note, light bitterness. Fine but not exciting.
On Tap @Zwoelf Apostel, Frankfurt am Main 15/12/2018 Color amarillo corona de espuma blanca, aromas levadura notas a cereal, sabor maltosa, cuerpo medio.

24 oct 2018, tap at ZwÃ¶lf Apostel. Light yellow, clear, no bubbles. Nose is mildly sweet with mild lemon citrus. Thin body and mostly flat. Reminds me of a cask lager. Not fizzy and slightly heavier than a normal lager. Lightly sweet, some grass and straw. Not bitter at all. Decent.

Draught at The Zwoelf Apostel, Frankfurt, Hesse, Germany. Hazy pale gold with white head. This proved to be a really thin beer, light and malty, watery then a slight tang. A little underwhelming for me.
02-03-18 // tap at the brewpub. Unfiltered yellow golden. Small head. Grainy malty body with a mild bitter finish. Smooth. Solid.

On tap at the brewpub. Klare hell goldgelbe Farbe, mittelgroÃŸe weiÃŸe schaumkrone, hohe Karbonisation. Geruch ist hell malzig, leicht sÃ¤uerlich getreidig. Geschmack ist getreidig hell malzig, etwas metallisch, naja.

On tap at the brewpub. Poured a cloudy yellow/gold with an average sized white head. Aroma is of straw, citrus, hops, yeast and light malt. Medium sweetness and light bitterness. Dry, bitter and slightly chalky finish. Texture is a bit watery. Itâ€™s ok, no more than that.
Frisch gezapft. TrÃ¼b und hell. MittelgroÃŸe Schaumkrone. Erst sÃ¼sslich, dann leicht herb. Insgesamt etwas wÃ¤ssrig.
Pours a golden color with small off-white head. Flavour is malt, fruit, hay. Watery.

Sehr hellgelb im Glas, leicht trÃ¼b, weiÃŸer Schaum. Der Antrunk ist herb-sÃ¤uerlich, schÃ¶n mild & sehr sÃ¼ffig. Diese mild-sÃ¤uerliche Note breitet sich zum Hauptteil weiter aus. Leichte HefetÃ¶ne spÃ¼rbar. Der Nachgeschmack ist mild-sÃ¤uerlich, mittellang anhaltend. Hinzu kommt eine ganz leicht herb-muffige Note, die sich zwar auf der Zunge hÃ¤lt, aver nicht weiter stÃ¶rt. SchÃ¶n sÃ¼ffig. --> Gutes Brauhaus-Helles. Nicht sonderlich Aromentief, aber sehr sÃ¼ffig und angenehm. 10/12/8/9

10th Aug 2018; on tap at the Leverkusen BierbÃ¶rse (had their Dunkel too). Poured a cloudy orange, full and lasting white crown. The nose and taste had a yeast base with some floral/grassy hop action balanced by a mild malty sweetness. Thought this was interesting rather than 'good'.
Leider waren Wunsch und Wirklichkeit hier keine Partner. Laff und duenn mit einem bisschen an Getreide und einem Schuss Butter nebst Vanille. Geht so.

Bottle from IxI GetrÃ¤nkemarkt in Frankfurt. The beer has got a hazy yellow-golden colour with a small head and medium to thin body. Aroma of hops and straw. Taste of hops, straw, grains, white bread, citrus fruits. Light acid hints. Nothing good.
Ins Glas ergieÃŸt sich ein trÃ¼bes goldgelbes Bier mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch malzig herb, grasig. Geschmack herb, malzig, grasig.

Im Glas ist es sehr hell - sieht aus wie ein hollÃ¤ndisches Witbier. Der Geruch ist sehr hopfenfrisch. Der Antrunk ist leicht sÃ¼ÃŸlich und etwas laff. Im Hauptteil entfaltet sich eine wunderschÃ¶ne, leicht sÃ¼ÃŸliche, hopfige Grasigkeit, aber Herbe ist nicht zu spÃ¼ren. Der Nachgeschmack hingegen wird etwas laff-muffig und nur ganz leicht herb. Insgesamt ist dieses Bier sehr sÃ¼ffig. Mir gefÃ¤llt die leicht sÃ¼ÃŸlich-hefig-grasige Gesamtnote. Sehr empfehlenswert! (Test vom 24.5.2008) --> 12,10,13,9,12,11 - 11,00

Bottled 330ml. -Slight hazy yellow coloured, medium sized white head that went away slowly, subdued grain in the nose. Pretty dry sweet malty and grainy taste with notes of cereals and hay. Some notes of hops in the finish. Average.

#860 Keine Ahnung was das fÃ¼r eine Biersorte sein soll, aber ein Pils ist es definitiv nicht! Leicht trÃ¼b und hellgelb. Der Schaum sagt schnell servus. Das Aroma ist leicht hefig-sÃ¤uerlich. Der Antrunk zeigt ebenfalls einen sÃ¤uerlichen Grundton und ist darÃ¼ber hinaus leider auch wÃ¤ssrig. Geschmacklich weder Ungespundetes noch Zwickl. Leicht sÃ¤uerlich-hefig-a bisserl Malz und viel zu wenig Hopfen. Der Abgang ist gar leicht plÃ¶rrig. Nee, ziemlich enttÃ¤uschend dieses GebrÃ¤u. Test vom 7.3.2010, Gebinde: Glasflasche Noten: 8,8,9,7,9,8 - 8,05

Bottled (from bierzwerg.de, found in an old box).Yellowish golden colour, small white head that leaves some lace. Aroma is sweet malts, bread, some earth as well as mild grassy and grainy notes. Flavour is sweet malts, with some grass, herbs and some mild earthyness as well. Mild floral notes as well.
Pale golden color with a small off white head. Nose of caramel, wheat toast, and light sweetness. Flavor of caramel, and very light bitterness.
330 bottle in Germany. Pours clear pale yellow with a small white head. Aroma is a bland grain and hay. Taste is the same but dusty. Pretty clean but watery palate. so-so

[on tap in Marburg] Bright clear brown-amber with a dense, creme-coloured shaving foam top that lasted eternally. Musty crystal malt and dried fruit aroma with prominent German hops and a touch of banana. Nutty and quite watery flavour with uncomplimented bitterness and pronounced ethanol. I would call this a cross between Molson Dry and a cask English mild (weird). Light body with low carbonation and lasting ethanol feel.
Cloudy copper-amber color. Light but nice hop aroma. More round taste than their Helles, some more malt and caramel, a pretty stronger final. Good but without a real character.

Cloudy medium-dark amber color. Light malt aroma. Smooth, dry but round malty sensation, quite strong caramel character, prtty strong final but not really hop aromatic. A pleasant note of roasted barley. Good, but not impressive.

Von Fass at Dauth-Scheider. Hazy gold with a tall, foamy head. Rich malt nose, bread and biscuit. Creamy, full malt flavor, yeasty and biscuity, herbal hops with some lemon. Pretty decent though a bit too sweet.
24-09-17 // as Yok-Yok beer. labeled especially for the shop whihc is Close to the main staition and a locally famous spot for cheap beers late night. Smooth drinking, grainy bitter. Solid.

Bottle from Yok-Yok on MÃ¼nchener Str, Frankfurt branded as Yok-Yok but seems to be the same as this, just branded for the store. Pours slightly hazy pale gold with an amber tint and a lasting white head. Aroam of hop, citrus, yeast and malt. Toward medium sweetness, light to moderate bitterness. Medium body, oily texture, average to soft carbonation. Finish is bittersweet with a slightly salty and acidic fruity edge. But quite enjoyable overall.
Cloudy pale yellow colour with fluffy head. Aroma and flavour have plenty of malts and also a light yeasty, herbal taste. Very smooth.

Vom FaÃŸ in der Apfelweinwirtschaft Dauth-Schneider, Frankfurt-Sachsenhausen. - Goldgelb, leicht ins Goldbraune spielend, gut trÃ¼b. - In der Nase Hefe, Karamel, leichte â€žgrÃ¼neâ€œ Noten. - Antrunk fÃ¼llig hellmalzig mit milder MalzsÃ¼ÃŸe und zarter Karamelnote. Deutliche grasige Hopfenherbe. Mild rezent, schÃ¶n vollmundig. - SchÃ¶nes Zwickel, angenehm malzig und aromatisch gehopft.
On tap at Zur Mainkur, Frankfurt. Served clear with a slight haze and a good head. Has a fruity taste with grass and hay like spicy hints. Has a strong herbal and spicy bitter finish. Excellent

Slightly hazy yellow color with white head. Aroma has grains but not much else. Taste is also grainy, with bread crust and a bit of honey. Quite bitter on the finish. Medium body and carbonation. Quite boring overall.
Vom Fass im Dauth-Schneider in Frankfurt. Goldene Farbe, hoher KohlensÃ¤uregehalt. Leicht hopfig.
Bottle. Hazy gold with a thin head. Aroma is hay and grain. Flavour is citrus, bread, a little spice, fresh hoppy pine finish
Leicht trÃ¼bes goldgelbes Bier mit einer groÃŸen weiÃŸen schaumkrone. Geruch getreidig malzig, floral hopfig. Geschmack sÃ¼ÃŸ malzig, floral hopfig, trocken, leicht getreidig.

28-11-18 // 300ml on tap at Apfelweinwirtschaft Dauth-Schneider. at Apfelweinwirtschaft Dauth-Schneider Murky brownish. Small minimal beige head. Brauhaussmoothness, not clean, roasted malt aromas woth a slightly sour touch. Solid.
Good, fresh, tasty brown ale with a gentle bitterness. Goes well with a savory meal.
Red brown colour with fluffy head. Aroma has some toasted malt. Flavour has light caramel sweetness. Bitterness grows in the finish.
Vom Fass im Dauth-Schneider in Frankfurt. Angenehm malzig, sÃ¼ffig, Geschmack nach Karamell und Toffee. Leicht wÃ¤ssrig, sÃ¼ÃŸlich. Gut.
Klares bernsteinfarbenes Bier, starke Karbonistation, groÃŸe leicht beige Schaumkrone. Geruch leicht nussig, sehr malzig, wÃ¼rzig. Geschmack sehr malzig, getreidig, leicht nussig, Karamell.
Auf der einen Seite recht knackig und sueffig, auf der anderen eher eintoenig und getreidig. Dahinter etwas Karamell und Malz. Ganz nett.

Bottle from Bier-Hannes GetrÃ¤nkeabholmarkt in Frankfurt. The beer has got a deep dark brown colour with a steady low head and medium body. Aroma of dark bread and malt. Taste of roasted malt, dark fruits, bread, dust, nuts and light chooclate. Easy drinkable and solid.

Bottle: very foamy and stable head. Dark brown color with red shining. Smell has caramel and roasty taste. Taste is malty with roasted caramel. Very high carbonation. Refreshing but a little bit flat.

Der Geruch im Glas ist sÃ¼ÃŸlich-malzig; der Schaum ist dunkel, cremig und schÃ¶n rÃ¶stmalzig-herb. Im Antrunk ist das Bier doch etwas wÃ¤ssrig, aber sehr sehr sÃ¼ffig (14 Punkte fÃ¼r SÃ¼ffigkeit hab' ich schon lange nicht mehr verteilt). Im Hauptteil wird das Bier vollmundiger und etwas sÃ¼ÃŸer mit sehr schÃ¶nen RÃ¶stmalzaromen. Der Nachgeschmack ist sehr RÃ¶stmalz-dominiert und schÃ¶n trocken, dabei im Hintergrund auch leicht herb. Tap @ brewpub 30/01/13. Pours a translucent dark auburn with a large, beige head. Surprisingly light color. Aroma is dark bread, even some caramel as well as fruitiness. Taste is light with fruitiness and dark malt breadiness along with a touch of apple. Not sweet, but not exactly dry either. Light, not much carbonation. A bit of a disappointment really. Couldâ€™ve been drier and used more of a malt base.
Sehr trÃ¼bes orangegelbes Weizen mit einer mittelgroÃŸen weiÃŸen Schaumkrone. Geruch angenehm fruchtig, trocken, leicht hefig. Geschmack nach reifen FrÃ¼chten, wÃ¼rzig, leicht phenolisch, hefig, ok!
Tap @ brewpub. Color dark orange with large white head. Aroma banana, orange, wheat. Taste wheat, some banana, dry.

FÃ¼r ein Weizen recht trinkbar mit seiner leichten Fruchtigkeit und gewissem Ansatz von Blumigkeit. Getreide, natÃ¼rlich Weizen, dahinter und ebenfalls ein StÃ¼ckchen Hefe, wenn auch recht wenig davon, Trinkbar.

Bottle from Bier-Hannes GetrÃ¤nkeabholmarkt. The beer has got a hazy golden colour with a big head and medium body. Aroma of wheat and yeast. Taste of yeast, bread, wheat, mild fruit salad and flowers. Mild finish. Easy drinkable and refreshing.

Nice red shining color, weak head. Smell is sour with some fruits. Taste is primarily sour. Sourness is so strong that it overlaps all taste. I tried two bottles as I thought the beer had some failure, but both bottles tasted the same. Couldn't drink it to the end.

Also richtig hell ist das Weizen nicht - schÃ¶n Bernsteinfarben und richtig stark trÃ¼b. Der Antrunk ist frisch-sÃ¤uerlich und etwas wÃ¤ssrig.
